chn: 一同返回黄金树脚的故乡。

eng: And grace will surely guide us safe.
chn: 赐福将会挺身引导，

eng: To our home, bathed in rays of gold.
chn: 带领我等返回黄金树脚的故乡。

eng: Hear me, my knights! Proud warriors and true.
chn: 葛瑞克麾下的高贵骑士啊──

eng: Let the hunt begin! Fetch me a mighty branch to make mine own!
chn: 狩猎肢干吧！猎取强壮的手臂！

eng: A fresh offering to graft!
chn: 贡上猎物，成就“接肢”吧！

eng: Raaargh!
Graaargh!
Hunt me down a new branch! Bring me a tarnished!
chn: 狩猎肢干吧！猎取褪色者！

eng: Lowly Tarnished...
chn: 区区褪色者……

eng: Thou'rt unfit even to graft...
chn: 汝不配用在“接肢”之上。

eng: Great Godfrey, didst thou witness?
chn: 伟大的葛孚雷啊，您见证到了吗？

eng: ...I am the Lord of all that is Golden...
chn: ……朕是……黄金君王……

eng: ...And one day, we'll return together...
chn: ……终有一天，我等将返家……

eng: ...To our home, bathed in rays of gold...
chn: ……一同返回、黄金树脚的故乡……

eng: sex
chn: 六。

eng: quīnque
chn: 五。

eng: quattuor
chn: 四。

eng: trēs
chn: 三。

eng: duo
chn: 二。

eng: ūnus
chn: 一。

eng: nihil
chn: 零！

eng: nihil
chn: 零！

eng: nihil
chn: 零！

eng: Miquella is mine and mine alone.
chn: 米凯拉是我的。

eng: Now, surrender yourself.
chn: 尽管臣服吧，

eng: To my blood, to our coming dynasty.
chn: 拜倒在我的血，我们的王朝之下。

eng: Ahh, I can see it, as clear as day!
chn: ……啊，我看见了，看见了……

eng: The coming of our dynasty!
chn: 我们那美妙的王朝──

eng: Mohgwyn!
chn: 蒙格温！

eng: Ahh, Miquella...
chn: ……啊，米凯拉啊，

eng: Why do you abandon me?
chn: 为什么要抛弃我……？

eng: You're a new face.
chn: ……没见过你啊。

eng: No matter, it's all the same.
chn: 唔，反正该做的事还是一样，

eng: Lay out your arms. Let's get smithing.
chn: 把武器拿出来，我来锻造。

eng: Back already?
chn: ……你又来了啊？

eng: No matter. Lay out your arms.
chn: 无所谓，把武器拿出来。

eng: Back already? Can't get enough, eh.
chn: ……你又来了啊？真是热衷。

eng: Well, where've you been hiding?
chn: ……哦，好久不见了。

eng: I took you for dead.
chn: 还没死在敌人手上？

eng: No matter. It's all the same.
chn: 嗯，该做的事还是一样，

eng: Lay out your arms, then.
chn: 快把武器拿出来。

eng: I see you've noticed the chains.
chn: ……哦，你想问这锁链吗？

eng: Nothing special. I'm a prisoner, and these are my chains.
chn: 如你所见，这只是用来铐住俘虏的锁链。

eng: I'm trapped by the Hold, undying, smithing for you fools.
chn: 被绑在圆桌厅堂，替你们锻造武器，死也死不了。

eng: That's all there is to it.
chn: 就是这么一回事。

eng: Nah, don't read too much into it.
chn: ……啊，别误会了。

eng: I've no grudge against you.
chn: 我不是在埋怨。

eng: My being a prisoner is no fault of yours.
chn: 沦为俘虏这件事，责任并不在你。

eng: Besides, I don't mind smithing.
chn: ……我并不排斥锻造武器。

eng: Despite my differences, the weapons get stronger, all the same. Given time, technique never fails.
chn:
无论我是什么身分，都能让武器变强──
技术与时间不会背叛自己。

eng: Besides, it helps me forget. The sheer terror of her...
chn: ……而且这也能暂时忘记，那位大人有多么恐怖。

eng: Like the look of that whetstone knife, do you?
chn: ……你好奇那把砥石小刀啊？

eng: I've no need for it.
chn: ……那东西我不需要。

eng: You're welcome to take it. Go ahead.
chn: 想要就拿走吧。

eng: Now, look at you.
chn: ……哦，你的神情……

eng: Those eyes tell a story.
chn: 变得相当不错嘛……

eng: Of a challenger, who's felled his mark.
chn: 是挑战者，还有杀戮者的神情。

eng: Of a challenger, who's felled her mark.
chn: 是挑战者，还有杀戮者的神情。

eng: Fine and well. Now, lay out your arms.
chn: 好吧，快把武器拿出来。

eng: Your divinity, have mercy, and grant me forgiveness.
chn: ……啊，请原谅我、宽恕我。

eng: The road is yet long. A god is not easily felled.
chn: 还远远不够，还无法触及神祇。

eng: But one day, without fail, you will have your wish.
chn: 但我一定会、绝对会达成您的愿望……

eng: So please, grant me forgiveness, Queen Marika...
chn: 请您宽恕我，玛莉卡女王……

eng: Those words were not meant for you.
chn: ……偷听不算好习惯啊。

eng: I may be prisoner to you Tarnished lot.
chn: 我是你们褪色者的俘虏，

eng: But my prayers are mine and mine alone.
chn: 但不代表祈祷的时光也被剥夺。

eng: Good. I'll be more careful too.
chn: ……明白就好，我自己也不小心。

eng: Well, I've had my say. I'll be more careful, too.
chn: ……也罢，我自己也不小心。

eng: Ah. You, is it?
chn: ……哦、哦，是你。

eng: I...didn't notice you there.
chn: 抱歉，我没注意到有人。

eng: I'll be doing my job, same as ever.
chn: 嗯，该做的事还是一样，

eng: Just lay out your arms.
chn: 快把武器拿出来。

eng: The girl you brought here...
chn: ……你带来的那女孩……

eng: She's crestfallen, and can scarcely swing a blade,
chn: 看起来受尽挫折，无法再挥剑──

eng: but she has a gift for spirit tuning.
chn: 但她具有调灵的潜力。

eng: I saw another one like her, long ago.
chn: 我很久以前曾经看过，

eng: Their eyes share the same hue.
chn: 她眼睛的颜色就是证据。

eng: The girl? What about her?
chn: ……那女孩怎么了？

eng: Are you out of your mind?
chn: ……你这句话是出自真心？

eng: Who'd stay with an ugly brute who only knows how to smith?
chn: 把那女孩交给只会锻造武器的丑陋混种照顾？

eng: Absurd. And besides, she'd never agree to it.
chn: 太过愚蠢，那女孩绝不可能愿意。

eng: I refuse to believe it.
chn: ……不可能，我不相信有这种事。

eng: I don't doubt you, but I know when something's too good to be true.
chn: 我不想怀疑你，但我已经受够被人讥笑。

eng: I spoke with the girl.
chn: ……我和那女孩聊了几句。

eng: She has a gift for spirit tuning.
chn: 那女孩果真有调灵的潜力。

eng: So I told her everything I know.
chn: 我所知道的，全都告诉她了。

eng: I'm indebted to a spirit tuner I met long ago.
chn: ……以前很照顾我的人，恰巧是调灵师。

eng: It was all I could do to honour her.
chn: 这算是一种报恩吧。

eng: I'm sorry I doubted you.
chn: 抱歉，之前怀疑你。

eng: The girl has come a long way.
chn: ……那女孩有点变了。

eng: As ever, time and technique have made her stronger.
chn: 技术与时间不会背叛自己，她变得更坚强。

eng: Tis good to see.
chn: 是好事一件。

eng: An imprisoned monster does not deserve an apprentice, or a daughter.
chn: ……混种俘虏不该有徒弟或是女儿。

eng: But at times, that's precisely what she feels like to me.
chn: 只是时不时，那女孩会让我有错觉……

eng: I've gone soft. And it isn't easy.
chn: 我变得软弱了，真难受。

eng: No, no, no, no...
chn: ……还不行，还不行，远远不行。

eng: I need to do better than this! This'll never kill a god.
chn: 这种东西哪能杀害神祇？

eng: I can do better than this! It needs to slay a bloody god!
chn: 这种东西哪能杀害神祇！

eng: Oh, it's you.
chn: ……啊，是你。

eng: Don't pay me any mind. It's not important.
chn: 没事，别放在心上。

eng: Just lay out your arms.
chn: ……快把武器拿出来。

eng: Are you having second thoughts?
chn: ……你在犹豫吗？

eng: Might I have a word, then?
chn: 那么，能不能听我说几句？

eng: Your kind are meant to challenge them. To slay them.
chn: 你们身在此处，是为了挑战与杀戮──

eng: The demigods. And their god.
chn: 挑战、杀戮半神，还有神祇。

eng: If you remain loyal to your calling,
chn: 只要你贯彻到底，

eng: then no matter what you do, no matter what happens to me,
chn: 无论你要做什么，我会有什么下场──

eng: I will never cease to smith your weapons.
chn: 我都愿意替你锻造武器。

eng: Until you have one to slay a god.
chn: 专门杀害神祇的武器。

eng: I knew you'd be back.
chn: ……我在等你。

eng: Lay out your arms. Let's get smithing.
chn: 来，把武器拿出来。我来锻造。

eng: Lay out your arms. Let's get smithing.
chn: 来，把武器拿出来。我来锻造。

eng: Weren't you listening?
chn: ……你说这话还真奇怪。

eng: As I've always said.
chn: 我有说过吧？

eng: You came to challenge the demigods, and their god. To slay them.
chn: 挑战、杀戮半神，还有神祇──

eng: And as long as you do, I will always smith your weapons.
chn: 只要你贯彻到底，我就愿意锻造你的武器。

eng: It is what I wish. To smith a weapon for you to slay a god.
chn: 我想要锻造出来啊，让你用来杀害神祇的武器。

eng: I've upset the girl.
chn: ……啊，那女孩吗？我惹她生气了。

eng: She says that now that my chains are broken, I'm free.
chn: 她说既然俘虏锁链坏了，我已经是自由之身，

eng: That if I stay here, I will be ruined with the Roundtable.
chn: 继续留在这里，也只会跟着圆桌厅堂一起陪葬。
……哈哈。

eng: What use have I for freedom now?
chn: 得到自由，反而更残酷。

eng: I smith weapons to slay a god.
chn: 我待在这地方，锻造弒神武器──

eng: I have lived, and will die, doing so, upon this spot.
chn: 为此而生，也为此而亡。

eng: Is there any other way?
chn: 除此之外，哪有什么目标？

eng: Oh, finally! It's complete!
chn: ……哦哦，锻造出来了！成功了！

eng: I've done it! A weapon to slay a god!
chn: 我成功了！这就是弒神武器！

eng: Oh, you have my deepest gratitude.
chn: 啊啊，谢谢你。

eng: Thanks to you, my wish is granted.
chn: 多亏有你，愿望实现了。

eng: Now wield it, and kill them.
chn: 就用这把武器吧，

eng: The demigods. And their god.
chn: 去杀害半神，还有神明。

eng: Queen Marika herself wishes it so.
chn: 这是玛莉卡女王的期望。

eng: You seek better weapons still?
chn: ……你还想要武器吗？

eng: Very well. I'll smith another, if needed.
chn: 好啊，我锻造给你──

eng: A weapon to slay a god.
chn: 弒神武器。不论多少我都愿意锻造。

eng: I'll smith as long as you like.
chn: ……不论多少我都愿意锻造。

eng: Now, lay out your arms.
chn: 来，把武器拿出来。

eng: I'll smith...as long as you like.
chn: ……不论多少、我都愿意锻造。

eng: Now...lay out your...arms.
chn: 来，把武器、拿出来。

eng: I'll smith...as long...as you like.
chn: ……不论多少、我都愿意锻造。

eng: Now...lay out...your...arms.
chn: 把武器……拿出来……

eng: Use my masterpiece to slay a god.
chn: ……用我锻造的武器杀害神祇吧。

eng: That is all that I have lived for.
chn: 那就是我的生存价值，

eng: And my promise to Q-queen Marika.
chn: 也是我向玛莉卡女王立下的誓言。

eng: But do me a favor, and do look after the girl.
chn: 只是，希望你能帮忙关照那女孩。

eng: I can't hold on much longer.
chn: ……我就快要回天乏术了，

eng: I'm going the way of the R-roundtable...
chn: 陪着圆桌厅堂一起归天。

eng: It was a great honor to smith your weapons during my time here.
chn: ……好险在那之前，有替你锻造武器。

eng: Allow me to c-call you this, just once, before it ends.
chn: 希望你原谅我，在最后一刻才如此称呼──

eng: My lord, f-for that is what you are.
chn: 你是我的王。

eng: Who are you?
chn: ……你是谁？

eng: Oh, I must be a blacksmith.
chn: ……哦，我是武器铁匠……

eng: Now, let's get smithing...
chn: 来，我替你锻造武器吧……

eng: Could you tell me what happened?
chn: ……如果你知道的话，可以告诉我吗？

eng: Why is the Roundtable burning, in ruins?
chn: 为什么圆桌厅堂会被火烧到快崩毁？

eng: Why does that girl weep for me?
chn: 为什么那女孩要为了我哭泣？

eng: Have I forgotten something of dire importance?
chn: ……我是不是忘了什么重要的事情？

eng: Now, let's get smithing...
chn: ……来，我替你锻造武器吧……

eng: I-I smith... I do...
chn: 锻、造……

eng: <sleeping>
A fine sacrifice indeed.
chn: ……好啦，祭品就是你。

eng: Let us devour the gods, together!
chn: 一起吞噬神祇吧！

eng: Now you are family.
chn: ……好啦，你也是族人了。

eng: Now, we can devour the gods, together!
chn: 好啦，你也一起吞噬神祇吧！

eng: O shapers of gods, meddlers in fortune.
chn: ……噢噢，造神、控神之主啊。

eng: I do not abide! By your suffocating Order.
chn:
我在此发誓！
必定对那所谓的秩序举剑相向。

eng: So must it be.
chn: ……还不坏啊。

eng: Eveligne, show him the way...
chn: 伊凡琳啊，让这个人……

eng: Eveligne, show her the way...
chn: 伊凡琳啊，让这个人……

eng: ...to devour the gods.
chn: 让他吞噬神祇……

eng: No one will hold me captive.
chn: ……我不受任何事物掌控。

eng: A serpent never dies.
chn: 蛇永恒不灭。

eng: Ha ha ha...
<howl>
Who goes there?
chn: ……你是什么人？

eng: Kalé send you, did he? Ever the bloody busybody.
chn:
……是咖列告诉你的吧？
他还是一样，就会操这种心。

eng: Hmm. Maybe to him, you don't seem so strange.
chn: 既然是透过他，我想也不是可疑人物。

eng: The name's Blaidd. I'm looking for a man who goes by "Darriwil".
chn:
我名叫布莱泽。
正在找一位叫达瑞威尔的男人。

eng: He fled somewhere nearby. Or so I've heard.
chn: 听说他逃到这个地方来了。

eng: Come tell me if you find him before I do.
chn: ……要是你遇见他，希望你通知我。

eng: I can offer you ample reward.
chn: 我能提供一些谢礼。

eng: Darriwil is nothing but a traitor.
chn: ……达瑞威尔是叛徒，

eng: And in need of a fitting end to his tale.
chn: 而叛徒就该有叛徒的下场。

eng: Darriwil...
chn: ……达瑞威尔，

eng: Rotting in a cell is no true justice.
chn:
万万没想到像你这样的人，
会沦为封印监牢的幽魂……

eng: No, this is where it ends for you.
chn: 你该从世上消失。

eng: ...Right. There you are.
chn: ……啊，是你。

eng: Had to work for it, but it's done.
chn: 辛苦你了。

eng: Don't say I'm not a man of my word. Here's your prize.
chn: 这是之前说的谢礼，收下吧。

eng: Oh yes, I should say,
chn: ……对了，还有一件事。

eng: If you venture north to Raya Lucaria, and come across a venerable blacksmith who's a little on the large side...
chn:
要是你往北走到了雷亚卢卡利亚，
看见一位体型有些庞大的铁匠老爷子……

eng: Tell him I sent you.
chn: 可以告诉他，你是我介绍的人。

eng: And he'll be sure to treat you right.
chn: 他应该会给你一些优待。

eng: I owe you one, I reckon.
chn: ……毕竟你帮了我不少忙。

eng: That's enough chit-chat for now.
chn: ……我话太多了。

eng: It's time we parted ways.
chn: 该道别了。

eng: Ahh, long time, friend.
chn: ……好久不见了。

eng: Blaidd, if you've forgotten.
chn: 再次自报名号，我是布莱泽。

eng: Glad to have you in the service of mistress Ranni.
chn: 欢迎你加入，成为侍奉菈妮的同志。

eng: Well. Getting right to business...
chn: 那么，马上切入主题，关于任务……

eng: I'm still in Limgrave.
chn: 我目前人还在宁姆格福，

eng: The eternal city of Nokron lies somewhere at the bottom of this land.
chn: 因为“永恒之城”诺克隆恩就在这地方的地底。

eng: I'm planning to go below through the well in the Mistwood.
chn: 接下来，我打算下到雾林的井里，

eng: See if I can't find the road to Nokron from there...
chn: 找出前往诺克隆恩的路。

eng: See if I can't find the road to Nokron from there...
chn: 找出前往诺克隆恩的路。

eng: Ah. I heard about you. Good to finally meet.
chn: 噢，就是你吗？我听过你。

eng: Name's Blaidd, sworn sword to mistress Ranni.
chn: 我名叫布莱泽，是战士，也是菈妮的剑。

eng: Glad to have you aboard.
chn: 欢迎你加入，成为侍奉菈妮的同志。

eng: Well. Getting right to business...
chn: 那么，马上切入主题，关于任务……

eng: I'm situated in Limgrave right now.
chn: 我目前人在宁姆格福，

eng: The eternal city of Nokron lies somewhere at the bottom of this land.
chn: 因为“永恒之城”诺克隆恩就在这地方的地底。

eng: I'm planning to go below through the well in the Mistwood.
chn: 接下来，我打算下到雾林的井里，

eng: See if I can't find the road to Nokron from there...
chn: 找出前往诺克隆恩的路。

eng: I'm going below through the well in the Mistwood.
chn: 我打算下到雾林的井里，

eng: See if I can't find the road to Nokron...
chn: 找出前往诺克隆恩的路。

eng: Don't keep me waiting, eh.
chn: ……我在那里等你。

eng: Ah, good to see you.
chn: 噢，是你。

eng: Apologies mate, but I don't have much to report.
chn: 不好意思，我毫无所获。

eng: I can see bloody Nokron, right above me, but I'm absolutely stumped.
chn:
看到诺克隆恩近在眼前，
但就是找不到任何方法上去。

eng: I've tried all the gateways, to no avail...
chn: 传送门也全都试过了……

eng: ...Perhaps it's time to ask Seluvis?
chn: ……赛尔维斯──

eng: I recall that spiteful little rat acting like he knew something...
chn: 那阴沉的男人似乎知道内幕……

eng: Let's give him a squeeze. Show him just how sharp my teeth are...
chn: 该不该咬个几次，逼问看看呢……

eng: I jest, I wouldn't go that far.
chn: ……嗯，只是戏言。

eng: Besides, I should check on some things here.
chn: 我该做的，是多调查周围的环境。

eng: Leave this place to me. You just do what you feel is right.
chn: 这里由我负责，你照自己的意思行动吧。

eng: If either of us learns anything, we tell the other. Right?
chn: 如果有任何蛛丝马迹，希望你能共享情报。

eng: Ah. Well met.
chn: 噢，是你。

eng: What news?
chn: 有任何情报吗？

eng: Leave this place to me. You just do what you feel is right.
chn: 这里由我负责，你照自己的意思行动吧。

eng: If either of us learns anything, we tell the other. Right?
chn: 如果有任何蛛丝马迹，希望你能共享情报。

eng: And if we reach a dead end, I suppose we go back to the source.
chn: ……如果再继续毫无所获，

eng: Seluvis rarely gives a straight answer, the first time.
chn: 也许就该考虑逼问赛尔维斯，要他全盘托出。

eng: Hmm...
So Ranni's fate is kept in stasis by Starscourge Radahn...
chn: “碎星”拉塔恩，让菈妮的命运停止转动……

eng: That reminds me of something I heard.
chn: 这么一说，我记得曾经听过，

eng: There's a festival being held at the castle on the southern edge of the Caelid Wilds, east of Limgrave.
chn:
在宁姆格福的东方，盖利德的南边，
那里有座城将举办祭典──

eng: It's a festival of combat. And I heard...that you can fight Radahn himself. He who was once called the strongest of all the demigods...
chn:
一个战斗祭典，
能够挑战历来最强的半神拉塔恩……

eng: Maybe it's just a coincidence, but I think it's worth investigating.
chn:
不谋而合啊。
若真是如此，就有一试的价值。

eng: I'll be on my way to this festival of Radahn then...
chn: 也许该参加拉塔恩的祭典。

eng: You're coming too, right? To Radahn's festivities...
chn: 你也打算参加拉塔恩祭典吧？

eng: I'll meet you at Redmane Castle in Caelid.
chn: 我们在盖利德的红狮子城会合。

eng: The way ahead is pleasingly simple. We fight, sword and fang.
chn: ……未来要靠剑与牙开创，简单明了。

eng: Right. I see.
chn: 我明白了。

eng: Leave this place to me. You just do what you feel is right.
chn: 这里由我负责，你照自己的意思行动吧。

eng: If either of us learns anything, we tell the other. Right?
chn: 如果有任何蛛丝马迹，希望你能共享情报。

eng: Hmm...
So Ranni's fate is kept in stasis by Starscourge Radahn...
chn: “碎星”拉塔恩，让菈妮的命运停止转动……

eng: And there's a festival of war being held at Redmane Castle in Caelid,
chn: 然后盖利德的红狮子城会举办战斗祭典，

eng: where you can fight the man himself, once the strongest of the demigods.
chn: 能够挑战历来最强的半神拉塔恩……

eng: It's all coming together. Seems like Iji was on to something.
chn:
不谋而合啊。
更何况是伊吉老爷子的推测，不可能失准。

eng: I'll be on my way to this festival of Radahn then...
chn: 该参加拉塔恩的祭典。

eng: Ah, there you are. Took your sweet time.
chn: 噢，你到了，等很久了。

eng: The players are all made up, and waiting for the curtain...
chn: 看来演员全到齐了，

eng: Let's give them a show to remember, eh.
chn: 放手挑战拉塔恩祭典吧。

eng: Just don't you go dying on me. For Ranni's sake, too.
chn: 但记住：为了菈妮，别丢了性命。

eng: Once more into the fray together, eh.
chn: ……又出现并肩作战的机会了。

eng: Heh. This might even be fun.
chn: 哼，还不赖。

eng: Into the fray together, eh.
chn: ……竟然需要并肩作战啊。

eng: Heh. Let's see what you're made of.
chn: 哼，有点意思。

eng: Ah, thought I might find you here.
chn: 噢，你也来了啊？

eng: I must admit I was a little worried. We missed our meeting.
chn: 我还在想，你可能会错过这场祭典，

eng: But it looks like you're still in one piece, eh.
chn: 看来是白操心了。

eng: You must have heard by now, right?
chn: ……你也知道了吧？

eng: That Starscourge Radahn holds Ranni's fate in stasis.
chn: “碎星”拉塔恩让菈妮的命运停止转动，

eng: But once he's out of the way, it will spring back into motion.
chn: 在打倒拉塔恩之后，菈妮的命运也会开始转动。

eng: So now, we stand against the demigod once known as the strongest of them all.
chn: ……准备挑战历来最强的半神，拉塔恩吧。

eng: The way ahead is pleasingly simple. We fight, sword and fang.
chn: 未来要靠剑与牙开创，简单明了。

eng: Hm. Long time.
chn: ……好久不见了。

eng: Seems we're fated to keep crossing paths.
chn: 看来我和你颇有缘分。

eng: Now, we find ourselves at a festival of combat, pitted against Radahn, once the strongest of the demigods.
chn: 这祭典能挑战历来最强的半神，拉塔恩。

eng: The way ahead is pleasingly simple. A path forged by sword and fang.
chn: ……未来要靠剑与牙开创，简单明了。

eng: Mm... As a fellow combatant, allow me to introduce myself.
chn: ……既然都是挑战祭典的人，各自报上名号吧。

eng: Blaidd, warrior.
chn: 我名叫布莱泽，是战士。

eng: Now, we find ourselves pitted against Radahn, once the strongest of the demigods.
chn: 准备挑战历来最强的半神，拉塔恩吧。

eng: The way ahead is pleasingly simple; a path forged by sword and fang.
chn: ……未来要靠剑与牙开创，简单明了。

eng: Hm. Nothing to do but wait. Until the festival begins.
chn: ……就等祭典开始吧。

eng: Ah, good. I was waiting for you.
chn: 噢，等你很久了。

eng: What a sick way to fight, eh.
chn: 刚才的战斗十分精采。

eng: The glory of the clash is shared, by Radahn and you.
chn: 这场祭典的荣誉绝对归于拉塔恩，还有你。

eng: And hah! Did you see that, afterwards?
chn: 哈哈！而且你有看到吗？

eng: A falling star, right before our eyes!
chn: 星星竟然就坠落在眼前，真没想到！

eng: I can't fathom how Radahn was holding back something of that scale.
chn: 拉塔恩封印了不得了的东西啊，

eng: He was a living legend, if ever I saw one.
chn: 真是如假包换的神话英雄。

eng: And, the path has now been cleared.
chn: ……这么一来，前进的路出现了──

eng: To Nokron, where Ranni's fate will be decided.
chn: 通往诺克隆恩的路，还有菈妮的命运之路。

eng: Let's meet where the falling star bit the earth.
chn: 在星星坠落的地方会合吧。

eng: We'll take up our swords once more. For mistress Ranni.
chn: 为了菈妮，未来再继续携手合作。

eng: Let's meet where the falling star bit the earth.
chn: 在星星坠落的地方会合吧。

eng: And we'll go into battle again, side by side.
chn: 未来再继续携手合作。

eng: My only purpose is to fight for Ranni's fate, sword and fang.
chn: 我的剑与牙，全为了菈妮的命运而在。

eng: The curtain's rising...on the final act.
chn: 重头戏终于要来了……

eng: Hmph, what a sick way to fight, eh mate.
chn: ……你的战斗表现十分精彩。

eng: The glory of the clash is shared, by Radahn and you.
chn: 这场祭典的荣誉绝对归于拉塔恩，还有你。

eng: And then a falling star, right before our eyes!
chn: ……而且真没想到，星星竟然会坠落眼前。

eng: I can't fathom how Radahn was holding back something of that scale.
chn: 拉塔恩封印了不得了的东西啊，

eng: He was a living legend, if ever I saw one.
chn: 真是如假包换的神话英雄。

eng: Well, it's time I left.
chn: ……我也该出发了。

eng: The wheel of fate has been set into motion.
chn: 命运已经开始转动。

eng: If it's on the cards, I'd be glad to meet again.
chn: 优秀的战士啊，

eng: You are a fine warrior.
chn: 有缘再见了。

eng: If it's on the cards, I'd be glad to meet again.
chn: 优秀的战士啊，

eng: You are a fine warrior.
chn: 有缘再见了。

eng: <howl>
Oh, it's you...
chn: ……啊，是你。

eng: It's me, Blaidd.
chn: 是我，布莱泽。

eng: Old Iji trapped me here.
chn: ……伊吉老爷子把我关在这里，

eng: Told me I'd bring nought but bale to Lady Ranni.
chn: 他说“你会成为菈妮的灾厄”，

eng: But there's no chance that could happen.
chn: 这种事情绝对不可能发生。

eng: I'm part of her being. Her very shadow...
chn: 我是菈妮的影子，是不可或缺的一部分。

eng: I thought old Iji knew as much...
chn: 伊吉老爷子明明也晓得……

eng: Honestly, I don't know what's going on anymore...
chn: 老实说，我真的不知道原因。

eng: I don't understand. Why would Iji do this...
chn: 我不知道，伊吉老爷子为什么这么做……？

eng: I could never intend harm to Lady Ranni. What's he thinking...
chn: 我绝对不可能成为菈妮的灾厄……

eng: My thanks, friend.
chn: ……不好意思，谢谢你。

eng: I'm going to see mistress Ranni, now.
chn: 我要去找菈妮。

eng: I don't know what came over old Iji,
chn: 不论伊吉老爷子心底有什么想法，

eng: but even if the odds are slim, I need to check the mistress is safe.
chn: 我都不能让她遭遇丝毫的危险。

eng: Now, Ranni can finally set in motion
chn: ……因为菈妮一直期盼的，

eng: the fight against her fate she's dreamt of for so long.
chn: 那场挑战命运的战争，总算能拉开序幕了。

eng: I'm going to see mistress Ranni, now.
chn: 我要去找菈妮。

eng: I don't know what came over old Iji,
chn: 不论伊吉老爷子心底有什么想法，

eng: but even if the odds are slim, I need to check the mistress is safe.
chn: 我都不能让她遭遇丝毫的危险。

eng: No. I'm part of her very being!
chn: ……不对，我是不可或缺的一部分，

eng: I could never betray her!
chn: 绝对不会背叛菈妮，

eng: No matter what might happen...
chn: 无论如何，绝对不会。

eng: Ranni... She needs me...
chn: ……菈妮她在等我……

eng: <growling>
Oh?
What are you playing at?
chn: 你在想什么？

eng: Fine.
chn: ……无可奈何。

eng: Time to douse your little flame.
chn: 既然火烧到身上，也只能动手。

eng: Alright then.
chn: ……唉，也好。

eng: Better to put you down now.
chn: 任何会影响菈妮的祸根，

eng: Before you trouble mistress Ranni.
chn: 越早刨除越好啊……

eng: Hmph. Pathetic little man.
chn: ……哼，无聊的男人。

eng: Hmph. Pathetic little woman.
chn: ……哼，无聊的女人。

eng: Don't show your face again.
chn: 我警告你，

eng: Stay away from mistress Ranni.
chn: 不准再出现在菈妮面前。

eng: You're...you're strong of arm.
chn: 倒有点本事……

eng: But ask yourself...
chn: 不过，你要知道……

eng: What harm can be done...to a shadow?
chn: 伤害影子只是徒劳。

eng: Traitorous wretch...
chn: ……你这叛徒……

eng: You're...you're a danger...
chn: 危险、人物……

eng: From... From this woman…
chn: 这女人很危险……

eng: Stop, please...
chn: ……停手吧。

eng: You think me a bringer of bale as well?
chn: 连你都认为我是灾厄吗？

eng: Fine. I am Ranni's shadow and it's for her that I fight.
chn: ……无所谓，我是菈妮的影子，为了菈妮而战。

eng: Whatever any of you might call me.
chn: 无关乎你们认为我是什么！

eng: I am no bringer of bale.
chn: ……我绝对不可能是灾厄。

eng: I must return to Ranni's side.
chn: 要尽快赶到菈妮身边……

eng: Tell...me...
chn: ……你告诉我啊……

eng: Why... Why am I...bale to Ranni?
chn: 为什么，我会是菈妮的灾厄……？

eng: Didn't I say? No harm can befall a shadow.
chn: ……我不是说了，伤害影子只是徒劳。

eng: I...am shadowbound.
chn: ……我是影子。

eng: Wherever mistress Ranni goes, I follow.
chn: 菈妮所在之处，我如影随形。

eng: You are a danger. You die here.
chn: 你太过危险，必须死在这里。

eng: Rraargh!
Please, wait!
chn: 请等一下！

eng: Proud Tarnished warrior. Before you kill me, let me speak.
chn: 褪色者战士啊，在动手之前，请先听我说。

eng: I can aid you. Please, just hear me out.
chn: 这肯定对您有好处，所以拜托，请听我说。

eng: Thank you for listening.
chn: ……谢谢您。

eng: I am Asimi. My true form is that of a silver tear.
chn: 我的名字是阿史米，真面目是银色泪滴。

eng: I am a simple being who can assume the shapes of other living things.
chn: ……我能变身成各种生物，模仿他们的一举一动。

eng: But now, I've gained knowledge. I speak, and ponder, and...live in fear of death.
chn:
我得到了智慧，变得能说话、能思考……
也会害怕死亡。

eng: O, mighty Tarnished warrior, I beg of you.
chn: 噢，褪色者战士啊，我拜托您。

eng: Let me keep the life I've been granted. In exchange, I offer you power.
chn: 我会给予您力量，能不能放过我一命呢？

eng: Ahh, thank you.
chn: 啊，谢谢您。

eng: Now, set your lips upon me, and breathe in deep.
chn: 那么，请用嘴贴近我，将我吸入体内吧。

eng: I will live inside of you, and grant you strength untold.
chn: 我会存活在您的体内，给予特殊的力量。

eng: Onward, to our glorious future, my host...
chn: ……今后请多关照了，我的宿主……

eng: You won't listen to me, will you?
chn: ……不愿意听我说话啊。

eng: It's such a pity. I had a feeling you would become...
chn: 都觉得您有可能了，好可惜……

eng: Please, proud Tarnished warrior, I beg you reconsider.
chn: ……褪色者战士啊，请您重新考虑。

eng: The gifts I can bestow you in life far outstrip those which could be plundered from my corpse.
chn:
比起从我的尸体获得战利品，
得到我给予的力量，肯定更有好处。

eng: Please, can't you find it in your heart to trust me?
chn: 能请您相信我吗？

eng: So, you won't trust me.
chn: ……您还是不相信我啊。

eng: But you still haven't killed me, have you.
chn: 但您也没有痛下杀手，

eng: Do you wish to think it over? Then I will wait.
chn: 是不是还在犹豫呢？如果是，我愿意等。

eng: For as long as it takes for you to trust me.
chn: 等到您愿意相信我为止。

eng: Proud Tarnished Warrior, have you made up your mind?
chn: ……褪色者战士啊，您考虑好了吗？

eng: I can grant you power, if you let me live.
chn: 我会给予您力量，能不能放过我一命呢？

eng: My lord host, do you hear that?
chn: 我的宿主啊，能听我说句话吗？

eng: The sound of water. The river that flows in my home, the Eternal City.
chn:
我听到流水声了，那声音来自我的故乡──
永恒之城的河川。

eng: Good lord host, I beg you, we must see the Eternal City.
chn: 宿主啊，请您前往永恒之城──

eng: To discover the ancient wonders of the stars. A wellspring of strength.
chn: 那里是古老星星奥秘的所在地，肯定会替您带来助力。

eng: My lord host, great lord host.
chn: 我的宿主、宿主啊，

eng: May I ask something of you?
chn: 可以拜托您一件事吗？

eng: A chalice is close by, the cradle of my kind...
chn: 我们泪滴的摇篮──圣杯就在附近，

eng: Would you mind finding it for me?
chn: 可以请您前往它的所在地吗？

eng: Mm, you should find the chalice...and drink it dry.
chn:
还有，在找到圣杯之后……
希望您将杯中物一饮而尽。

eng: Ahh, my lord host. I am terribly parched.
chn: 啊，我的宿主啊，我非常地渴。

eng: The chalice will quench my thirst, rejuvenate my flesh, and allow me to grant you further strength.
chn:
只要解除我的渴，滋润我，
我就能为您更尽一分力。

eng: Please, my lord host. It is my only desire.
chn: 宿主啊，这是我的期盼。

eng: Bless this brook of sustenance. My lord host...
chn: ……啊，谢谢您滋润了我，我的宿主……

eng: My lord host, great lord host.
chn: ……我的宿主、宿主啊，

eng: A tear chalice lies in these lands, too.
chn: 这个地方似乎也有泪滴圣杯……

eng: A tear chalice lies in these lands.
chn: 这个地方似乎有泪滴圣杯……

eng: Our mother chalice.
chn: 是等同生母的特殊大圣杯。

eng: Please, search out this most sacred chalice.
chn: 请您找到大圣杯吧，

eng: It's suffused with the blessed wonders of the stars...
chn: 那蕴藏着伟大星星的奥秘……

eng: It will allow us to become a perfect whole.
chn: 肯定能够让您我化成完美的一体。

eng: Now, lord host.
chn: 快啊，我的宿主。

eng: Please, drink every last drop from the mother chalice.
chn: 请就口大圣杯，一饮而尽吧。

eng: So that we may form a perfect whole.
chn: 如此一来，您我就能化成完美的一体。

eng: Oh no...
chn: ……啊，怎么会……

eng: Excuse me, lord host.
chn: 对不起，我的宿主啊。

eng: I'm still so very, very parched.
chn: 我现在还是非常地渴。

eng: In the other Eternal City, there's a cradle chalice to be found.
chn: 在另外一座永恒之城里，还有一只我们的摇篮圣杯。

eng: And if you were to drink the entirety of that one, first...
chn: 得先找到它，喝下杯中物……

eng: Ahh, are you awake?
chn: ……啊，您醒过来了。

eng: We've become a perfect whole.
chn: 我们完美地合而为一了。

eng: There is nothing to fear. I will merely follow in your footsteps.
chn: 不用担心，我会和您如出一辙……

eng: Living only as you would have yourself.
chn: 变成如假包换的您，展开一样的生活。

eng: And I vow, that when I perfect your form.
chn:
但我和您保证，
等到我完全成为和您一样的存在后，

eng: Ahh, how could you...
chn: ……啊啊，为什么会……

eng: I was you, and only you. We were one...together.
chn: 我就是您，我们是一体的啊。

eng: Please, I only want to live...
chn: ……不要，我不要消失……

eng: I only wanted you...
chn: 我要、变成您……

eng: to become Lord...
chn: 要、当上王……

eng: Gah...
Oh...you found me...
chn: ……啊，您来了啊。

eng: I had hoped you wouldn't...
chn: 真不想再遇见您。

eng: You could have become Elden Lord, and I could have become Sovereign Eternal, eventually.
chn:
只要您当上艾尔登之王，
总有一天，我也会当上永恒之王。

eng: If you hadn't found me, we both could have been Lords.
chn: 只要不再相遇，就能容许两个王共存。

eng: I was wrong about you...
chn: ……结果不是吗……

eng: My apologies, lord host.
chn: ……我的宿主，对不起──

eng: I will take the throne.
chn: 我会当上王。

eng: I'm...dying...
chn: ……我会死……

eng: So this...is fear...
chn: 这就是恐惧啊……

eng: I'm...glad...
chn: ……啊，太好了。

eng: My lord host, worthiest of lords...
chn: 我的宿主，我的、王啊……

eng: Ah!
chn: 噫！噫噫……

eng: Please, no. Dear me!
chn: 不要……住手啊……

eng: I haven't a clue.
chn: 我毫不知情……

eng: No secrets lie with me, not a one.
chn: 也没有隐匿任何事……

eng: Oh, please. Leave me be.
chn: 我求你了，住手吧……

eng: Wait, then, you're not one of them?
chn: ……你不是那群人的同伴？

eng: Well, what a relief.
chn: ……不是吗？谢天谢地……

eng: Oh, goodness me.
chn: ……唉，失礼了。

eng: I am Albus. An Albinauric, as you can see.
chn: 我名叫艾尔帕斯，正如你所见，是白金之子。

eng: We're finished. The whole village is finished.
chn: ……我们和这座村子，都要走向灭亡了。

eng: The cursemongers have destroyed everything. No one that remains has their wits about them.
chn:
那群可恨的挟咒者毁了一切，
已经没有神智正常的人留下来。

eng: I beg you. Would you look after this medallion?
chn: ……求求你，能不能带走这符节？

eng: You must keep it out of the cursemongers' hands.
chn: 这东西不能让那群挟咒者拿走。

eng: And if you should meet the young Albinauric Latenna,
chn:
还有，要是你有遇见名叫勒缇娜，
一个白金之子的女娃儿。

eng: then please, give it to her.
chn: 请你把那符节转交给她。

eng: A chosen land awaits us Albinaurics.
chn: 对我们白金之子而言，有一座桃花源。

eng: Miquella's city, far to the north, a place called Eburion, where we are conferred eternal grace.
chn:
那就在遥远的北方，米凯拉大人的城市“艾比昂”。
在那座城里，我们能蒙受永恒的赐福。

eng: The medallion is the key that leads to the city.
chn: 刚才交给你的符节，是通往那地方的钥匙。

eng: It's only a quaint treasure, for we who cannot make the journey.
chn:
……我们已经无法出门旅行，
那对我们而言，是太过贵重的宝藏。

eng: But for dear Latenna, it is needed. To fulfil her purpose.
chn:
但那女娃儿，勒缇娜要完成她的使命，
一定会需要符节。

eng: My legs will soon fade, and with them, my life.
chn: ……我的脚就快要完全消失，我的生命也要画下句点。

eng: Alas, this is the immovable fate of all Albinaurics.
chn: 这是身为白金之子无法避免的宿疾。

eng: If only I could have gazed upon it, even once. The great chalk buttress of Eburion.
chn:
真想亲眼目睹啊──
那壮阔树脚下的，艾比昂的雪白高墙……

eng: Ngh!
chn: 呜。

eng: We are Albinaurics.
chn: ……我们做了什么吗？

eng: We have caused you no harm!
chn: 我们白金之子，有对你们做了什么吗？

eng: You merciless brutes.
chn: ……毫无恻隐之心的人啊，

eng: Let the curse take everything.
chn: 诅咒你们，不得善终……

eng: I will never give this up.
chn: ……绝对不交出去。

eng: Not to your kind.
chn: 这绝对不交给你们。

eng: Hello-o? Can you hear me?
chn: ……喂──有没有人在──？

eng: Help me! I'm stuck!
chn: 有没有人可以帮帮我？我被卡住了──

eng: Hello? Hellooo! Anyone?
chn: 喂──喂──有没有人啊──？

eng: Oh my stars I'm so happy to see you!
chn: 哦，你来得正好！

eng: I am Alexander, also known as the Iron Fist. And as you can see, I'm stuck here.
chn:
我是战士壶，“铁拳”亚历山大。
就像你看到的，我被洞卡住了。

eng: Please, can you help me out of this?
chn: 希望你能帮助我脱离窘境。

eng: My thanks! A thousand thanks!
chn: 你愿意帮忙啊！谢谢你。

eng: Just give me a good smack from the rear, with something nice and big.
chn:
那麻烦你用随便一个够大的东西，
打我的底部吧。

eng: And I'll pop clean out. I'm sure!
chn: 这样做应该就能顺利脱困。

eng: Don't dally. No no, there's no need to fret, I'm very well trained.
chn: 我很强壮，不用担心。毕竟有在练身体嘛。

eng: Give it your all, I say!
chn: 用力打下去就对了。

eng: Ah!
chn: 哦！

eng: Ouuch!
chn: 哦哦！

eng: S-stop please! That's a little too rough for me, friend.
chn: 你、你等一下！力道未免太强了吧！

eng: You'll crack me in half, like that! A little more gently, gently, please.
chn:
我会裂掉啦！
拜托力道再轻一点、再轻一点点！

eng: Ahhh!
chn: 哦哦哦！

eng: Ahh! Well played, good sir. Well played!
chn: 啊，漂亮的一击！

eng: Ahh! Well played, good lady. Well played!
chn: 啊，漂亮的一击！

eng: Though that mighty wallop of yours almost spelt the end of me!
chn: 厉害到我差点就要裂成两半了。

eng: Ha ha ha ha!
chn: 哇哈哈哈。

eng: Well, I'm out now, and that's what counts.
chn: 总归一句，多亏有你帮忙，我顺利脱困了。

eng: I thank you, and as a token of my appreciation, I'd like you to have this.
chn: 谢谢你。这是我的谢意，还请笑纳。

eng: Once again, the pleasure is mine. I am the warrior jar known as Alexander. Iron Fist Alexander, in fact.
chn:
重新自报名号。
我是战士壶，“铁拳”亚历山大。

eng: I journey to the east, where I intend to further my education in the ways of war.
chn: 为了锻炼自己，目前正朝东边前进。

eng: Beyond these lands lie the scarlet rot-blighted Caelid Wilds.
chn:
从这里往前走，
就是遍布猩红腐败的盖利德原野。

eng: And upon their southern edge is Redmane Castle, in which a festival of combat is being held.
chn:
然后听说原野南方的红狮子城，
那边有在举办战斗祭典。

eng: I'd heard whispers of such festivities before...
chn: 话说战斗祭典，这个词只会出现在故事里，

eng: Doesn't the notion set your breast aflutter!
chn: 不觉得听起来就让人兴致勃勃吗？

eng: Ha ha ha ha!
chn: 哇哈哈哈。

eng: I see. More's the pity.
chn: 这样啊……太令人难过了……

eng: No no. I apologise. Don't you worry about a thing.
chn: 没事，抱歉，请别挂心。

eng: Despite my appearance, I am but a chip off a greater jar. I'll pop out eventually, just you wait.
chn: 我好歹也是挤身壶类之流，总会顺利脱困的。

eng: Ah, what's that look, good sir?
chn: ……怎么了吗？

eng: Ah, what's that look, good lady?
chn: ……怎么了吗？

eng: Are you willing to help me out after all?
chn: 难道说，你愿意帮忙吗？

eng: Come on, give me a good smack from behind with something nice and big.
chn: 好，快拿够大的东西打我的底部吧。

eng: I'll pop clean out. I'm sure, of it!
chn: 这么一来，应该就能顺利脱困。

eng: Don't stop now, friend.
chn: 再多打几下。

eng: Just keeping clobbering away at the old behind!
chn: 朝我的底部再多打几下吧。

eng: Put those doubts to rest, I'll be just fine. I'm very well trained.
chn: 我很强壮，不用担心。毕竟有在练身体嘛。

eng: Give it your all, I say!
chn: 用力打下去就对了。

eng: G-good gosh, stop, please! That's my face!
chn: 慢、慢着，等一下！那一边是我的脸啊！

eng: Smack me from the other end! The other end!
chn: 打我的底部，打底部就好！

eng: I'm heading eastward.
chn: 我目前正朝东边前进。

eng: To Redmane Castle on the southern edge of the scarlet rot-blighted Caelid Wilds.
chn:
听说猩红腐败的盖利德原野，
在它南方的红狮子城，

eng: I've heard there's to be a festival held there.
chn: 那边有在举办战斗祭典。

eng: G-good gosh, stop, please! That's my lid!
chn: 慢、慢着，等一下！那一边是我的盖子啊！

eng: Oh, I hadn't expected to see your face again.
chn: 哦，竟然又遇见你了。

eng: Are you heading to the festival of combat, too?
chn: 难不成你也想去战斗祭典一探究竟？

eng: Oh, no need to be coy with me.
chn: 哎呀，不用遮遮掩掩啦。

eng: Judging by the fine wallop you gave the old backside earlier, I would venture you're something of a warrior yourself.
chn:
想想之前打我底部的那一记痛击，
像你这种身手了得的战士，

eng: The mere thought of such a festival gets the blood pumping, eh!
chn: 会对战斗祭典有兴趣，这很正常嘛。

eng: Now, now, according to my calculations, passing through this road should lead us to the Caelid Wilds.
chn:
只是说，根据我的判断，
穿过这个坑道应该会抵达盖利德原野……

eng: But however you slice it, it seems we've reached a dead end.
chn: 但不论怎么看，这里都是死路。

eng: I'm sorry to have raised your hopes.
chn: 抱歉让你白期待一场，

eng: It seems my calculations must have been off...
chn: 看来好像是我判断错误了……

eng: I was created to be a warrior vessel.
chn: ……我被制造成战士壶──

eng: Many great warriors reside within me, ever dreaming of becoming a great champion.
chn:
为数众多的战士存在我的体内，
永无止尽做着成为英雄的梦。

eng: It's my destiny. And the reason for which I quest.
chn: 这是我的命运，也因此我会追求──

eng: It is my ordeal, you could say. To test myself, to better myself, to fell ever greater foes.
chn:
追求试炼。我想要试试自己的身手、
锻炼自己，还有挑战强大的对手。

eng: And then, one day, we'll be a single great champion. The greatest of them all!
chn:
总有一天，我们会成为英雄──
更为强大的英雄。

eng: What do you think, eh? How do you rate my chances?
chn: 你认为呢？我们有办法办到吗？

eng: Heh heh...
chn: 哇哈哈哈。

eng: Ah, if it isn't a Tarnished warrior.
chn: 哦，你是褪色者的战士吗？

eng: Are you travelling my way?
chn: 难不成你的目的地跟我一样？

eng: I'm heading to the festival at Redmane Castle, on the southern edge of the scarlet rot-blighted Caelid Wilds.
chn:
想前往遍布猩红腐败的盖利德原野南方，
去那里的红狮子城参加战斗祭典？

eng: Oh, no need to be coy with me.
chn: 哎呀，不用遮遮掩掩啦。

eng: I can tell from your bearing you're skilled in the arts of combat.
chn: 看你的样子，就知道你是身手了得的战士，

eng: Ah, yes, the mere thought of such a festival gets the blood pumping, eh!
chn: 会对战斗祭典有兴趣，这很正常嘛。

eng: I am the warrior jar, Iron Fist Alexander.
chn: 我是战士壶，“铁拳”亚历山大。

eng: And according to my calculations, passing through this road should lead us to the Caelid Wilds.
chn:
根据我的判断，
穿过这个坑道应该会抵达盖利德原野……

eng: But however you slice it, it seems we've reached a dead end.
chn: 但不论怎么看，这里都是死路。

eng: I'm sorry to have raised your hopes.
chn: 抱歉让你白期待一场，

eng: It seems my calculations must have been off...
chn: 看来好像是我判断错误了……

eng: Good sir, where did you spring from?
chn: 哦哦，你怎么过来的？

eng: Good lady, where did you spring from?
chn: 哦哦，你怎么过来的？

eng: This was supposed to be a dead end, I'm sure of it.
chn: 我记得那边是死路啊……

eng: What's going on here? A door, from thin air!
chn: ……什么，不知不觉间，出现了一道门！

eng: Well, stranger things happen at sea, or so I'm told, but onward! To the Caelid Wilds.
chn:
这还真是神奇。不过多亏有门，
应该就有办法到盖利德原野了。

eng: I suppose my calculations were right all along. You should head this way as well, friend.
chn: 结果我的判断没有错，大方从这里通过吧。

eng: Heh heh...
chn: 哇哈哈哈。

eng: The esteemed warrior. Where did you spring from?
chn: 哦哦，你怎么过来的？

eng: This was supposed to be a dead end, I'm sure of it.
chn: 我记得那边是死路啊……

eng: What's going on here? A door, from thin air!
chn: ……什么，不知不觉间，出现了一道门！

eng: Well, stranger things happen at sea, or so I'm told, but onward! To the Caelid Wilds.
chn:
这还真是神奇。不过多亏有门，
应该就有办法到盖利德原野了。

eng: Gosh, that dead-end had me rather stumped!
chn: 我正好因为死路，在大伤脑筋啊。

eng: Heh heh...
chn: 哇哈哈哈。

eng: Where did you spring from?
chn: 哦哦，你怎么过来的？

eng: This was supposed to be a dead end, I'm sure of it.
chn: 我记得那边是死路啊……

eng: What's going on here? A door, from thin air!
chn: ……什么，不知不觉间，出现了一道门！

eng: Well, stranger things happen at sea, or so I'm told, but onward I shall go.
chn:
这还真是神奇。
不过多亏有门，应该就有办法往前进了。

eng: I am the warrior jar, Iron Fist Alexander.
chn: 对了，我是战士壶，“铁拳”亚历山大。

eng: I was heading to Redmane Castle on the southern edge of the scarlet rot-blighted Caelid Wilds.
chn:
听说遍布猩红腐败的盖利德原野南方，
那里的红狮子城有在举办战斗祭典。

eng: Where a festival is being held. Until I was stumped by that dead end!
chn:
我打算参加，朝那里前进。
结果却走进死路，才在大伤脑筋啊。

eng: Heh heh...
chn: 哇哈哈哈。

eng: It's time I set off.
chn: 好，我差不多该前进了。

eng: To the festival at Redmane Castle on the southern edge of the scarlet rot-blighted Caelid Wilds.
chn:
在猩红腐败的盖利德原野南方，
那里的红狮子城有在举办战斗祭典。

eng: Doesn't the thought just set your heart aflutter!
chn: 听起来就让人兴致勃勃啊！

eng: Ah, you came, how delightful!
chn: 哦哦，你果然也来了！

eng: Indeed, I thought I might find you here.
chn: 太开心了，和我料想得一样。

eng: By the by, do you know for whom this festival is being held?
chn: 而且你知道这场战斗祭典是为了送谁上路吗？

eng: Well, it is none other than General Radahn himself!
chn: 竟然是那位战神，拉塔恩将军啊。

eng: To think, I could face a great champion of the Shattering, a demigod in the flesh...
chn:
万万没想到能够看到半神，
而且还是破碎战争中最厉害的英雄……

eng: In truth I quiver at the thought, such is his frightful repute.
chn: 啊，我浑身颤抖，战栗不已。

eng: But! The fear simply assures me the ordeal is worth undertaking!
chn: 但这正是值得挑战的铁证。

eng: Now, be sure to get a good vantage, my friend.
chn: ……也请你替我在旁见证，

eng: I, Iron Fist Alexander, do hereby vow to unflinchingly brave this ordeal.
chn:
我“铁拳”亚历山大，
发誓绝不退缩，英勇作战。

eng: Ah, if it isn't a Tarnished warrior.
chn: 哦，你是褪色者的战士吗？

eng: I am the warrior jar, Iron Fist Alexander. The pleasure is mine.
chn: 我是战士壶，“铁拳”亚历山大，请多指教。

eng: Do you know for whom this festival is being held?
chn: 你知道这场战斗祭典是为了送谁上路吗？

eng: Well, it is none other than General Radahn himself!
chn: 竟然是那位战神，拉塔恩将军啊。

eng: To think, I could face a great champion of the Shattering, a demigod in the flesh...
chn:
万万没想到能够看到半神，
而且还是破碎战争中最厉害的英雄……

eng: In truth I quiver at the thought, such is his frightful repute.
chn: 啊，我浑身颤抖，战栗不已。

eng: But! The fear simply assures me the ordeal is worth undertaking!
chn: 但这正是值得挑战的铁证。

eng: Be sure to get a good vantage, my friend.
chn: ……也请你替我在旁见证，

eng: I, Iron Fist Alexander, do hereby vow to unflinchingly brave this ordeal.
chn:
我“铁拳”亚历山大，
发誓绝不退缩，英勇作战。

eng: Be sure to get a good vantage, my friend.
chn: ……请你替我在旁见证，

eng: I, Iron Fist Alexander, do hereby vow to unflinchingly brave this ordeal.
chn:
我“铁拳”亚历山大，
发誓绝不退缩，英勇作战。

eng: A-ah, hello there.
chn: ……啊，原来是你。

eng: It was a battle marvellously fought. You are well and truly a champion, friend.
chn: 刚才的战斗打得真漂亮，你真是个英雄。

eng: I, on the other hand, am nothing but a crock.
chn: ……相比之下，我真是没用的壶。

eng: One hit was all it took to crack me, and for my insides to come spilling out...
chn: 吃了一记攻击就裂开，内容物也漏了很多……

eng: After that, I hid like a coward.
chn: 在那之后，也只能当个胆小鬼……

eng: And as such, I can hardly stand to face one such as you.
chn: 真的没脸见你。

eng: ...But don't you think I've given up just yet.
chn: ……不过，我还没有放弃。

eng: As luck would have it, there's a veritable mountain of warriors' bodies right here.
chn: 幸运的是，这里有很多战士的尸体，

eng: If I can just squeeze this bunch down inside me, I'll be a mighty warrior again in no time.
chn:
收集他们、放进体内之后，
我又能变回战士壶。

eng: And you know... The bodies found here are exceedingly fine.
chn: ……而且这附近的尸体，各个都非常出色，

eng: Who could expect any less from the very warriors who fought in the Shattering, the greatest of all wars!
chn: 不愧是曾经参与破碎战争的战士。

eng: Just you wait and see, friend. I'll grow even stronger!
chn: 我会变得更强，

eng: Just you wait, when next we meet!
chn: 敬请期待再会的那一刻吧。

eng: Heh heh...
chn: 哇哈哈哈。

eng: Alright lads, I'm going to take you on a little journey.
chn: ……战士啊，进到我的体内，

eng: You'll all be inside me, and be part of me.
chn: 成为我的内容物吧。

eng: From now on, we're all in it together.
chn: 我们一起携手实现吧──

eng: So let's all of us dream big.
chn: 那当上英雄的美梦。

eng: The bodies found here are exceedingly fine.
chn: ……这附近的尸体，各个都非常出色，

eng: Who could expect any less from the very warriors who fought in the Shattering, the greatest of all wars!
chn: 不愧是曾经参与破碎战争的战士。

eng: Just you wait and see, friend. I'll grow even stronger!
chn: 我会变得更强，

eng: Just you wait, when next we meet!
chn: 敬请期待再会的那一刻吧。

eng: Heh heh...
chn: 哇哈哈哈。

eng: Hello-o? Can you hear me?
chn: ……喂──有没有人在──？

eng: Help me! I'm stuck!
chn: 有没有人可以帮帮我？我被卡住了──

eng: Hello? Hellooo! Anyone?
chn: 喂──喂──有没有人啊──？

eng: Ahh, hello! How nice it is to see a friendly face!
chn: 哦哦，是你，好久不见啦！来得正好！

eng: As you can surmise, I've got myself stuck in another hole.
chn: 如你所见，我又被卡住了。

eng: Would you mind helping me out, again?
chn: 希望你能再帮我脱离困境。

eng: My thanks in advance, I know you're the man for the job!
chn: 这样才对嘛！谢谢你。

eng: My thanks in advance, I know you're the woman for the job!
chn: 这样才对嘛！谢谢你。

eng: You know what to do, hm?
chn: 那你知道该怎么做吧？

eng: Give me a good smack from behind with something nice and big.
chn: 用随便一个比较大的东西，打向我的底部吧。

eng: Don't worry about my wound sustained at the festival.
chn: 哦，不用担心我在战斗祭典受到的伤，

eng: I'm stuck back together good and proper!
chn: 伤口已经漂亮密合了。

eng: Just give it your all!
chn: 所以用力打下去吧，不用担心。

eng: Ah!
chn: 哦！

eng: Ouuch!
chn: 哦哦！

eng: P-please! Wait. I have a terrible feeling about this!
chn: 等一下！我有不好的预感！

eng: Would you stop hitting me for a minute!
chn: 拜托先停下来！

eng: I see. More's the pity.
chn: 这样啊……太令人难过了……

eng: No no. I apologise. Don't you worry about a thing.
chn: 没事，抱歉，请别挂心。

eng: Despite my appearance, I am but a chip off a greater jar. I'll pop out eventually, just you wait.
chn: 我好歹也是挤身壶类之流，总会顺利脱困的。

eng: What's that look, good sir?
chn: ……怎么了吗？

eng: What's that look, good lady?
chn: ……怎么了吗？

eng: Are you willing to help me out after all?
chn: 难道说，你愿意帮忙吗？

eng: Come on, give me a good smack from behind with something nice and big!
chn: 好，快拿够大的东西打我的底部吧。

eng: I can feel my lower half is stuck on something.
chn: ……我的下半身好像被什么地方卡住了。

eng: I don't think you can get me out just by hitting me, this time.
chn: 继续打下去，我也没办法脱身……

eng: Hmm...
Let's think... Perhaps there's a way to slide me out a little more smoothly...
chn: 不知道……有没有让我滑出去的方法？

eng: What if I could somehow be made slippery, or somesuch?
chn: 如果我能变得滑不溜丢的就好了……

eng: Hmm...
Let's think... Perhaps there's a way to slide me out a little more smoothly...
chn: 不知道……有没有让我滑出去的方法？

eng: What if I could somehow be made slippery, or somesuch?
chn: 如果我能变得滑不溜丢的就好了……

eng: Ahh, hello! How nice it is to see a friendly face!
chn: 哦哦，是你，好久不见啦！来得正好！

eng: As you can surmise, I've got myself stuck in a hole.
chn: 如你所见，我被卡住了。

eng: Would you mind helping me out?
chn: 希望你能帮我脱离困境。

eng: Ngh!
chn: 哦！

eng: Nngh!
chn: 哦哦！

eng: Oh, yes!
chn: 不错喔！

eng: That's the ticket!
chn: 感觉出得来喔！

eng: Nnngh!
chn: 哦哦哦！

eng: My thanks! To you and your razor-sharp wits.
chn: 啊，谢谢你，多亏有你脑筋动得快。

eng: As a token of my thanks, I'd like you to have this.
chn: 想用这东西表达我的谢意，再请笑纳。

eng: Deary me, I'm oilier than a toad!
chn: 哎呀，这下变得全身滑不溜丢了。

eng: There were countless oil jars back where I'm from, actually.
chn: 在我的故乡有好几个壶是油壶……

eng: And now I know what it's like to be one of them!
chn: 现在总算能感同身受了。

eng: Heh heh...
chn: 哇哈哈哈。

eng: Yes, indeed, I too have a home.
chn: ……对啊，我也有故乡。

eng: Though it is one to which I have vowed not to return.
chn: 只是下定决心，不再回去了。

eng: So, I thought I might look out from atop the cliff, but as I drew closer and closer...
chn:
哎呀，我想说从悬崖上眺望一下还行，
漫不经心一靠近。

eng: Pow! Wouldn't you know it, I was perfectly stuck in that blasted hole.
chn: 结果直接被洞卡得正着。

eng: I can feel the warriors inside admonishing me for my mawkishness.
chn:
……我在想，体内的这些战士，
也许会斥责我这种软弱心态。

eng: To walk the path of champions, one cannot cleave to the past!
chn: “想当上英雄，就要割舍想家的念头”之类的。

eng: I'm headed to the fiery mount in the north.
chn: ……我打算朝北边的火山前进。

eng: I can strengthen myself there, without fear of cracking this vessel.
chn:
从那之后我想了好久──
壶如果要变强，强到不会裂开的话，

eng: I will forge myself anew in its flames!
chn: 那就必须焚烧这副身体。

eng: I'm headed to the fiery mount in the north.
chn: ……我打算朝北边的火山前进。

eng: I can strengthen myself there, without fear of cracking this vessel.
chn:
从那之后我想了好久──
壶如果要变强，强到不会裂开的话，

eng: I will forge myself anew in its flames!
chn: 那就必须焚烧这副身体。

eng: Ngh!
chn: 唔喔！

eng: Rnnngh!
chn: 唔喔喔喔喔喔！

eng: O mountain of fire! Bake me in your flames!
chn: 火山啊！焚烧我亚历山大吧！

eng: Rrrrngh!
chn: 唔喔喔喔喔喔！

eng: Nnngh!
chn: 唔喔喔……

eng: Ah, good sir, what business might you have in such a place as this?
chn: 嗯？你为什么会在这里？

eng: Ah, good lady, what business might you have in such a place as this?
chn: 嗯？你为什么会在这里？

eng: I hardly think you're here to temper yourself with flame, considering that fleshly form of yours.
chn: 焚烧肉身也不会变强啊？

eng: Your timing though, is impeccable as ever!
chn: 啊，不过，来得正好。

eng: I've been making just the thing for you on my journey here.
chn: 这个是我一边旅行的时候，一边做的。

eng: Take it, I'm sure it'll suit you to a tee.
chn: 请笑纳，我觉得一定很适合你。

eng: But oh, it's hardly more than lukewarm here.
chn: 话说回来，这温度比我想得还要低呢。

eng: I won't be able to temper my body such that it'll never crack again.
chn:
看来光靠这里，
不可能让我的身体练成绝不破裂。

eng: Perhaps I'll head eastward.
chn: ……还是要往东边走呢？

eng: There's an old saying I've caught wind of.
chn: 就是那个，传承下来的故事有提过啊，

eng: "Above the lofty clouds, the icy giant's peak doth soar, here lieth the flame of ruin, which ever burning roars."
chn:
在云海之上，积着厚雪的巨人山顶，
有道灰灭火焰永不熄灭……

eng: Perhaps I'll head eastward.
chn: ……还是要往东边走呢？

eng: There's an old saying I've caught wind of.
chn: 就是那个，传承下来的故事有提过啊，

eng: "Above the lofty clouds, the icy giant's peak doth soar, here lieth the flame of ruin, which ever burning roars."
chn:
在云海之上，积着厚雪的巨人山顶，
有道灰灭火焰永不熄灭……

eng: Ah, I see you've finally made it here yourself.
chn: ……哦，你也抵达这里啦。

eng: The city hanging in the air is slowly crumbling. What an incredible place we find ourselves.
chn:
漂在空中的城市渐渐崩落……
这个地方真的很神秘。

eng: But that aside, you're certainly a force to be reckoned with, eh.
chn: ……话说回来，你刚才的战斗，打得真是精彩。

eng: I doubt there's a single soul who could've handled that giant, other than you. It was practically a god...
chn:
那个跟神祇一样威严的巨人，
想必除了你以外，没有人能打倒。

eng: Of course I count myself, the great Alexander, among the many.
chn: ……当然，我亚历山大也没办法。

eng: Which means, I've but one thing to ask of you.
chn: ……所以啊，有一件事情想要拜托你。

eng: Would you kindly undertake my ordeal?
chn: 你能不能成为磨练我的试炼？

eng: Come and tell me when you're ready.
chn: ……等你准备好了，再告诉我吧。

eng: I've been longing to fight a warrior as accomplished as you.
chn: 我想要和做好万全准备的你战斗。

eng: You are ready then, I take it?
chn: 准备好了吧？

eng: Then let us begin!
chn: 那就开始吧。

eng: I am the great jar warrior, Iron Fist Alexander!
chn: 我正是壶中战士，“铁拳”亚历山大！

eng: Lend me strength, O warriors within!
chn: 在我体内的诸位战士啊，把力量借给我吧！

eng: Let us become one champion, together!
chn: 一起成为英雄吧！

eng: Ah, I see you've finally made it here yourself.
chn: ……哦，你也抵达这里啦。

eng: The city hanging in the air is slowly crumbling. What an incredible place we find ourselves.
chn:
漂在空中的城市渐渐崩落……
这个地方真的很神秘。

eng: But that aside, I can't believe you felled that giant. It was practically a god...
chn: ……话说回来，那个跟神祇一样威严的巨人，

eng: I doubt there's another soul out there who could've done the same.
chn: 想必除了你以外，没有人能打倒。

eng: Of course I count myself, the great Alexander, among the many.
chn: ……当然，我亚历山大也没办法。

eng: Which means, I've but one thing to ask of you.
chn: ……所以啊，有一件事情想要拜托你。

eng: Would you kindly undertake my ordeal?
chn: 你能不能成为磨练我的试炼？

eng: Come and tell me when you're ready.
chn: ……等你准备好了，再告诉我吧。

eng: I've been longing to fight a warrior as accomplished as you.
chn: 我想要和做好万全准备的你战斗。

eng: As I suspected... Victory...was impossible.
chn: ……还是到达不了那境界啊。

eng: This vessel...was found lacking...
chn: 靠目前的器量，办不到啊……

eng: My thanks. I knew you were the stuff of champions.
chn: 谢谢，你真的是我认定的英雄。

eng: It was a marvellous battle.
chn: 这场战斗十分精采。

eng: I implore you, take what I bequeath...from inside me...
chn: 请务必收下我体内的内容物。

eng: All vessels are destined to one day break.
chn: 壶逃不过毁坏的命运，

eng: But the great Alexander lived as a warrior to his last!
chn: 而我亚历山大直到最后一刻，都是战士壶！

eng: Ha ha ha ha!
chn: 哇哈哈哈。

eng: Good sir, I can't believe your heart was in it at all.
chn: ……你的力量不只有这样吧？

eng: Good lady, I can't believe your heart was in it at all.
chn: ……你的力量不只有这样吧？

eng: By the gods you are a man of vision!
chn: 哦哦，你脑筋动得真快！

eng: By the gods you are a woman of vision!
chn: 哦哦，你脑筋动得真快！

eng: This will have me as slippery as a toad.
chn: 这下子真的滑不溜丢了。

eng: I have a good feeling about this, my friend.
chn: 感觉应该有办法脱困。

eng: Right! Give me a good smack from behind with something nice and big!
chn: 好，快拿够大的东西打我的底部吧！

eng: Argh! Cease! Please!
chn: 啊！

eng: Just stop a moment, I beg!
chn: 等等！快住手！

eng: My lower half is stuck on something down there!
chn: 下半身好像被什么地方卡住了！

eng: I'll break! I'll break before I'm out!
chn: 继续打也脱不了身！会裂开！

eng: Argh! No!
chn: 啊！不要啊！

eng: Stop, please!
chn: 快住手！

eng: I beg! I beg of you!
chn: 我求你了！

eng: Argh!
chn: 啊啊啊啊啊！

eng: Phew.
I thought I was apt to split in half...
chn: 我还以为会裂成两半……

eng: Mm, I can feel my lower half is stuck on something.
chn:
只是说，还真伤脑筋。
下半身好像被什么地方卡住了。

eng: I don't think you can get me out just by hitting me, this time.
chn: 继续打下去也没办法脱身……

eng: Hmm...
Let's think... Perhaps there's a way to slide me out a little more smoothly...
chn: 不知道……有没有让我滑出去的方法？

eng: W-what if I could somehow be made slippery, or somesuch?
chn: 如果我能变得滑不溜丢的就好了……

eng: My thanks! A thousand thanks!
chn: 你愿意帮忙啊！谢谢你。

eng: Just give me a good smack from the rear, with something nice and big.
chn:
那麻烦你用随便一个够大的东西，
打我的底部吧。

eng: And I'll pop clean out. I'm sure!
chn: 这样做应该就能顺利脱困。

eng: Don't worry about my wound sustained at the festival.
chn: 哦，不用担心我在战斗祭典受到的伤，

eng: I'm stuck back together good and proper!
chn: 伤口已经漂亮密合了。

eng: Just give it your all!
chn: 所以用力打下去吧，不用担心。

eng: Ngh!
chn: 哇！

eng: What are you playing at?
chn: 你在做什么啊！

eng: This is no time for games!
chn: 快点住手！

eng: Wait, I see. I see it now.
chn: 原来是这么一回事──

eng: Humans all lose their wits, eventually.
chn: 人逃不过发疯的命运。

eng: Then there's nothing left to say, except...
chn: 既然如此，不必多说。

eng: I am Iron Fist Alexander!
chn: 我正是“铁拳”亚历山大！

eng: The great jar warrior!
chn: 壶中战士！

eng: A finer battle was never witnessed.
chn: ……这是一场精彩的战斗，

eng: How do you fancy joining the lads inside, eh?
chn: 你愿意成为我的内容物吗？

eng: How could this...
chn: ……竟然会这样……

eng: Was my whole existence... just a crock?
chn: 我是没用的壶吗……？

eng: Oi! You there!
chn: 喂──路过的人啊，

eng: Could you help us out, cully?
chn: 帮帮我吧。

eng: You, yeah, you there!
chn: 喂──我说的就是你啊，

eng: Stop pretending you can't see me!
chn: 为什么要装作没看见？

eng: Why won't anyone look me in the eye?
chn: ……为什么所有人都这样？

eng: I-I'm not that ugly, am I?
chn: 难道我就真的那么丑陋？

eng: Ow!
chn: 好痛！

eng: What'd you go and do that for!
chn: 你怎么突然打人啊，很过分耶！

eng: Hm? Oh, yes, I remember.
chn: ……嗯？啊，对喔。

eng: Some clod turned me into a tree.
chn: 因为我被施魔法，变成树了。

eng: You were just breaking the spell, weren't you.
chn: 你是为了帮我破除魔法啊。

eng: Thank you. The name's Boc.
chn: 谢谢你，我叫作柏克。

eng: I was pushed out of the cave. Told not to come back, not ever.
chn: 不受洞窟的其他人欢迎，被赶了出来……

eng: Then I ended up as a tree.
chn: 然后还被变成了树。

eng: Lucky you came along, really.
chn: ……所以说，你真的帮了我大忙。

eng: Oh, what a shame.
chn: 啊，还有对不起，

eng: When they threw me out of the cave, they took everything I owned,
chn:
在被赶出洞窟的时候，
身上重要的东西都被拿走了，

eng: and so this is all I have to express my thanks.
chn: 所以只能拿这种东西答谢你。

eng: I hope you can forgive me.
chn: 真的很对不起。

eng: Or, if you can afford to wait for a while,
chn: ……再等我一下下，

eng: I could sneak back into the cave, and bring back something of actual value.
chn: 我想偷偷回洞窟，拿回重要的东西。

eng: Then I'd be of some real use to you, I reckon.
chn: 这样我就一定能帮到你的忙。

eng: Right, but I'll need a moment.
chn: ……嗯，但是要再等一下。

eng: I-I'm frightened of them... So I have to gather myself.
chn:
我还是……很怕他们……
需要一点时间做心理准备。

eng: My knees start knockin'...just thinking about that god-awful cave on the shore...
chn:
……一想到他们，还有那座海岸的洞窟，
我就怕得脚都动不了……

eng: Oh, what are you doing here?
chn: ……你怎么会来这里？

eng: You must leave this place at once. They'll rush in and beat you to a pulp.
chn:
这里很危险，快点逃吧。
他们肯定会跑过来攻击你。

eng: You'll end up just like me.
chn: ……最后落得跟我一样的下场。

eng: Wait, is that what I think it is?
chn: ……咦？这该不会……

eng: You got it back for me? My sewing needle!
chn: 我的缝衣针！是你帮我拿回来的吗？

eng: <sob>
chn: 呜、呜呜……

eng: What made you go and do a thing like that...
chn: 你为什么要对我这么好？

eng: My mum was a seamstress...
chn: 我的母亲是裁缝师……

eng: ...and that sewing kit was all I had to remember her by.
chn: 这是她的遗物。

eng: I always wanted to be just like sweet old Mum.
chn: 我想成为像母亲那样的裁缝师，

eng: Then, I suppose I-I can't just curl up and die, can I.
chn: 所以不可以轻易死掉，对吧……？

eng: Thank you.
chn: 谢谢你。

eng: You're very kind.
chn: 我真的很高兴。

eng: I always wanted to be a seamster, l-like my mum.
chn: 我想成为像母亲那样的裁缝师，

eng: Then, I suppose I can't just curl up and die, can I.
chn: 所以不可以轻易死掉，对吧……？

eng: Oh..
It...hurts...
chn: ……呜，好痛喔……

eng: Ooh...
chn: 呜，呜啊啊……

eng: Good to see you! Master.
chn: 主子，好久不见了！

eng: Do you remember me? Boc, the demi-human.
chn: 您还记得我吗？我是亚人柏克。

eng: You helped me before, and retrieved my sewing needle.
chn: 之前因为有主子的帮忙，才能顺利拿回缝衣针。

eng: Please, master.
chn: 主子，我拜托您。

eng: Allow me to serve you, as your seamster.
chn: 请您让我作为裁缝师，替您工作。

eng: I can't make nothing from scratch, but…
chn: 我还没办法从零开始缝制衣服，

eng: I'm happy to make adjustments to your garments.
chn: 但如果需要修改衣服，请您尽管吩咐。

eng: Boc the seamster, at your service, Master.
chn: 主子，裁缝师柏克为您服务。

eng: Ready to make adjustments to your garments.
chn: 需要修改衣服的话，请尽管吩咐。

eng: Oh, going so soon?
chn: 啊，您要出发了吗？

eng: Please, do be safe on your journeys.
chn: 请一路上小心安全。

eng: Master, I was wondering...
chn: ……我其实在想……

eng: Do you ever...make adjustments to your garb yourself?
chn: 主子会自己修改服装吗？

eng: I would, well, rather you let me do the job when possible, please.
chn:
那个，如果您有修改服装的需要，
希望能尽可能交给我处理。

eng: I don't ask anything in return, you know, and, well...
chn: 我不求任何回报，毕竟……

eng: I am your personal seamster, after all!
chn: 柏克是主子的裁缝师啊！

eng: I am your personal seamster, after all!
chn: 因为柏克是主子的裁缝师啊！

eng: Master, my apologies.
chn: ……主子，很抱歉。

eng: Your wardrobe includes the garb of old demigods,
chn:
老实说，您带来的东西里，
我发现有属于古老半神的衣物。

eng: and I'm afraid I can't make adjustments to them.
chn: 我没有能力修改这类衣物。

eng: My mum told me once.
chn: 我曾经听母亲说过，

eng: That a royal seamster would do them up in a jiffy.
chn:
如果是王室的裁缝师，
修改这类衣物是轻而易举的事情……

eng: Just wait, master. Before long, I'll be that good, too!
chn:
主子，我也会加油，
努力成为那么厉害的裁缝师！

eng: Is that a gift for my undeserving self?
chn: ……您要送礼给柏克？

eng: Thank you kindly. But what on earth could it...
chn: 谢谢您。是什么东西呢……？

eng: Oh!
Amazing! I've never seen a golden needle, not in all my life!
chn: 好棒！是黄金缝衣针，我第一次看到！

eng: With a spectacular royal crest, to boot...
chn: 还有这么威武的王室徽章在上头……

eng: Are you certain that this is for me?
chn: 这东西真的要送给我吗？

eng: Oh, I can hardly believe it.
chn: ……啊啊，真的好棒……

eng: Have faith in me, Master!
chn: 主子，请您放一百二十个心！

eng: I'll polish my craft enough that I deserve this golden gift!
chn:
我一定会成为厉害的裁缝师，
不会让您送缝衣针的美意白费。

eng: I'll be the golden seamster, Boc!
chn: 我是“黄金裁缝师”柏克！

eng: Now I'll be able to sew anything, even the threads of the demigods!
chn: 不会再说自己不能修改半神的衣物了！

eng: Do you think that Mum would be pleased if she knew?
chn: ……如果母亲知道了，会不会替我高兴呢？

eng: That I'm as good as any royal seamster, now.
chn: 我已经不输王室的裁缝师了。

eng: Oh, it's still not enough.
chn: ……啊，但我还不成气候。

eng: I need to learn how to sew from scratch, like her.
chn: 得先像母亲一样，有能力从零开始缝制衣服。

eng: Master, may I ask you something?
chn: ……主子，我有一件请求。

eng: Would you mind if I called you lord?
chn: 我能改称呼您为“吾王”吗？

eng: I heard that you and the other Tarnished seek the throne of the Elden Lord.
chn:
……主子是褪色者，而我听说
褪色者的目标是成为艾尔登之王。

eng: Well, I know that you will be the one,
chn: 我认为主子能当上艾尔登之王……

eng: and you'd make just the manner of kind-hearted lord that I'd wish for.
chn:
我也希望像您这么温柔的人，
能够当上艾尔登之王。

eng: So, please, if you would.
chn: 希望您允许这件请求，

eng: Allow me to call you lord.
chn: 让我称呼您为“吾王”。

eng: You don't say! Thank you, thank you!
chn: 真的吗！谢谢您！

eng: M'lord, m'lord, m'lord!
chn: 吾王、吾王、吾王啊──

eng: Please, become Elden Lord.
chn: 请您当上艾尔登之王。

eng: And please, let I, Boc the seamster, remain at your side.
chn: 请允许裁缝师柏克，终生随侍身旁。

eng: No, and why would you...
chn: ……是我、冒昧了……

eng: Forgive me, for overstepping my bounds. I didn't mean it.
chn:
竟然提出令人不快的请求，
请您当作没发生过吧。

eng: Boc the seamster, at your service, m'lord.
chn: 吾王啊，裁缝师柏克在此。

eng: Ready to make adjustments to your garments.
chn: 需要修改衣服的话，请尽管吩咐。

eng: Going already, m'lord?
chn: 吾王啊，您要出发了吗？

eng: Please, do be safe on your journeys.
chn: 请一路上小心安全。

eng: Master, did you see it?
chn: ……主子，您有看见吗？

eng: Th-the Erdtree?
chn: 那、那棵，黄金树的模样？

eng: I, oh, I don't really have the words for this...
chn: 我没有办法好好表达出来……

eng: But I was so...so dazzled, I felt something stir, in my breast.
chn: 那看起来非常、非常耀眼，我好感动。

eng: The Erdtree is waiting for you, master.
chn: ……而且，那棵黄金树在等主子找祂。

eng: I know it, I do. I feel it in my bones.
chn: 我很清楚，肯定不会有错。

eng: M'lord, did you see it?
chn: ……吾王啊，您有看见吗？

eng: Th-the Erdtree?
chn: 那、那棵，黄金树的模样？

eng: I, oh, I don't really have the words for this...
chn: 我没有办法好好表达出来……

eng: But I was so...so dazzled, I felt something stir, in my breast.
chn: 那看起来非常、非常耀眼，我好感动。

eng: The Erdtree is waiting for you, m'lord.
chn: ……而且，那棵黄金树在等您找祂。

eng: I know it, I do. I feel it in my bones.
chn: 我很清楚，肯定不会有错。

eng: O please, take the throne of Elden Lord.
chn: ……请您当上艾尔登之王。

eng: M'lord... Have you ever wished you might be born again?
chn: 吾王啊，您有想过重生吗？

eng: Well, they say that Rennala of Raya Lucaria
chn: 我听说雷亚卢卡利亚的蕾娜菈大人，

eng: has the power to help people be reborn.
chn: 拥有使人重生的力量喔。

eng: Oh? Me? Reborn?
chn: ……嗯？您问我想不想重生吗？

eng: Oh, look at me. When you're this ugly...
chn: ……您也知道，我的外表奇丑无比。

eng: well, being reborn? It would hardly make a difference, I'm afraid.
chn: 我想即使有办法重生，一定也是无药可救。

eng: M'lord, what's this?
chn: 吾王啊，这东西是……？

eng: Oh! Oh!
It can't be… For my rebirth?
chn: 这该不会是重生用的必需品？

eng: But these are precious, are you certain that it's for me?
chn: 要给我这么贵重的东西吗？

eng: Oh...
chn: 呜、呜呜……

eng: M'lord, how did you know?
chn: ……吾王啊，您真的是看透一切。

eng: It was my only wish, that I might honour you with a decent appearance.
chn:
我打从心底一直这么想──
希望自己的外表能够不丢您的脸……

eng: M'lord, it shouldn't take me long.
chn: ……吾王啊，请您稍待。

eng: I'm off to see Rennala of Raya Lucaria.
chn: 我准备前往雷亚卢卡利亚的蕾娜菈大人身边，

eng: I'll be reborn, fresh and new.
chn: 一定会重生成理想的外表。

eng: M'lord.
chn: ……吾王啊。

eng: In all honesty, what do you think of me?
chn: 您是怎么想的呢？

eng: Am I fit to serve a lord such as you, in all my ugliness?
chn: 我的外表丑陋，肯定无法终生侍奉您。

eng: Must I be reborn, no matter what ill fate awaits me?
chn: 是否不论结果，都该试试看重生呢？

eng: Oh, I'm such a fool.
chn: 唉，我真笨。

eng: I don't even have answers to the simplest of questions.
chn: 这种理所当然的事情，竟然还不懂。

eng: Master... Have you ever wished you might be born again?
chn: 主子，您有想过重生吗？

eng: Master, what's this?
chn: 主子，这东西是……？

eng: Master, how did you know?
chn: ……主子，您真的是看透一切。

eng: Master, it shouldn't take me long.
chn: ……主子，请您稍待。

eng: Master.
chn: ……主子啊。

eng: Am I fit to serve you, master, in all my ugliness?
chn: 我的外表丑陋，肯定无法终生侍奉您。

eng: Did I just hear my mum speaking?
chn: ……我刚才听到了母亲的声音。

eng: Thank you very much.
chn: ……谢谢您。

eng: Mum was always the only one who said I was beautiful.
chn: 我这副外表也只有母亲会夸我好看，

eng: And now, my dear lord let me hear her voice.
chn: 但刚才，您让我听见了那道声音。

eng: Please, if I may dream, just once...
chn: ……啊啊，如果我的想法逾矩，请您见谅。

eng: Do you feel the same way my mum did, m'lord?
chn: 那道声音的背后，是否也存在吾王的想法？

eng: Do you think I'm beautiful, despite these looks?
chn: 对奇丑无比的我，您是否也夸我好看？

eng: <sob>
chn: 呜、呜呜……

eng: M'lord, my dear lord...
chn: 吾王、吾王啊。

eng: I, Boc the seamster, am forever in your service.
chn: 请让裁缝师柏克终生随侍您身旁。

eng: May the throne of Elden Lord be yours.
chn: 请您当上艾尔登之王。

eng: No, why on earth would you...
chn: ……这、天经地义啊……

eng: It was silly of me to ask. Please, forget that I did.
chn: 我说了不切实际的话了，请您当作没发生过吧。

eng: But I beg, don't renounce me for my appearance.
chn: 但拜托您，千万不要抛弃丑陋的我。

eng: One day, I'll look every bit the servant.
chn: 我一定会变成不让您丢脸的外表……

eng: Did I just hear my mum speaking?
chn: ……我刚才听到了母亲的声音。

eng: Thank you very much.
chn: ……谢谢您。

eng: Mum was always the only one who said I was beautiful.
chn: 我这副外表也只有母亲会夸我好看，

eng: And now, my kind master let me hear her voice.
chn: 但刚才，您让我听见了那道声音。

eng: Please, if I may dream, just once...
chn: ……啊啊，如果我的想法逾矩，请您见谅。

eng: Do you feel the same way my mum did, master?
chn: 那道声音的背后，是否也存在主子的想法？

eng: Do you think I'm beautiful, despite these looks?
chn: 对奇丑无比的我，您是否也夸我好看？

eng: <sob>
chn: 呜、呜呜……

eng: Master, kind master...
chn: 主子、主子啊，

eng: I, Boc the seamster, am forever in your service.
chn: 请让裁缝师柏克终生随侍您身旁。

eng: No, why on earth would you...
chn: ……这、天经地义啊……

eng: It was silly of me to ask. Please, forget that I did.
chn: 我说了不切实际的话了，请您当作没发生过吧。

eng: But I beg, don't renounce me for my appearance.
chn: 但拜托您，千万不要抛弃丑陋的我。

eng: One day, I'll look every bit the servant.
chn: 我一定会变成不让您丢脸的外表……

eng: S-surely, not? For me?!
chn: 咦！要送给我吗？

eng: Oh no, I can't. It would be wasted on the likes of me.
chn: ……怎么可以，这样太浪费了。我不能收。

eng: You should drink it yourself, master.
chn: 请主子享用就好。

eng: I would be far happier knowing you enjoyed it yourself.
chn: 对柏克而言，这样最幸福。

eng: S-surely, not? For me?!
chn: 咦！要送给我吗？

eng: Oh no, I can't. It would be wasted on the likes of me.
chn: ……怎么可以，这样太浪费了。我不能收。

eng: You should drink it yourself, m'lord.
chn: 请吾王享用就好。

eng: I would be far happier knowing you enjoyed it yourself.
chn: 对柏克而言，这样最幸福。

eng: Master...
O-oh...
chn: 呜、呜呜……

eng: My most earnest thanks.
chn: 真的……谢谢您。

eng: I don't deserve it, but I'll savour every last drop.
chn: 柏克一定、一定会好好珍惜。

eng: M'lord...
chn: ……吾王啊……

eng: O-oh...
chn: 呜、呜呜……

eng: My most earnest thanks.
chn: 真的……谢谢您。

eng: I don't deserve it, but I'll savour every last drop.
chn: 柏克一定、一定会好好珍惜。

eng: <sleeping>
Ow!
chn: 好痛！

eng: Why'd you go and do that?
chn: 你干么打我啦！

eng: It's because I'm ugly, isn't it?
chn: 就因为我长得很丑吗？

eng: Oh, now, you too, is it?
chn: ……哦，果然是这样吗？

eng: The story of my rotten life...
chn: 怎么都是我……

eng: Ah...aaah!
chn: ……呜、呜呜……哇啊啊啊啊！

eng: No...
chn: ……不对啊……

eng: I never wanted this...
chn: 我根本不想做这种事情……

eng: Mum...
I've... I've let you down...
chn: 我、我……

eng: Ow!
chn: 好痛！

eng: M-master?
chn: 主、主子……？

eng: Is something wrong?
chn: 您怎么了？

eng: It's me! Boc, the seamster!
chn: 是我啊！您的裁缝师柏克！

eng: Master, what's happened...
chn: ……主子，怎么会这样……

eng: Did I do something wrong?
chn: 难道是柏克事情没做好吗？

eng: Or is it just...because I'm ugly?
chn: 还是说，是因为我太过丑陋了？

eng: Oh, my...
chn: ……啊，怎么会……

eng: Master, is that the truth, your heart of hearts? My, oh my...
chn: 被主子这么说……我、我……

eng: Ah...aaah!
chn: ……呜、呜呜……哇啊啊啊啊！

eng: Oh, master, what have I done...
chn: ……啊，我对主子做了什么……

eng: Master! Master!
chn: 主子！主子啊！

eng: Master...
chn: ……啊，主子啊，

eng: I've failed you...please, forgive me.
chn: 请原谅柏克的无能……

eng: Ow!
chn: 好痛！

eng: M-m'lord?
chn: 吾、吾王……？

eng: Is something wrong?
chn: 您怎么了？

eng: It's me! Boc, the seamster!
chn: 是我啊！您的裁缝师柏克！

eng: M'lord, what's happened...
chn: ……吾王啊，怎么会这样……

eng: Did I do something wrong?
chn: 难道是柏克事情没做好吗？

eng: Or is it just...because I'm ugly?
chn: 还是说，是因为我太过丑陋了？

eng: Oh, my...
chn: ……啊，怎么会……

eng: M'lord, is that the truth, your heart of hearts? My, oh my...
chn: 被吾王这么说……我、我……

eng: Ah...aaah!
chn: ……呜、呜呜……哇啊啊啊啊！

eng: M'lord, what have I done...
chn: ……啊，我对吾王做了什么……

eng: M'lord! M'lord!
chn: 啊，吾王！吾王啊！

eng: M'lord...
chn: ……啊，吾王啊，

eng: I've failed you...please, forgive me.
chn: 请原谅柏克的无能……

eng: Well, look at you. We don't receive many visitors.
chn: ……哦，有访客啊？太难得了。

eng: I presume you are a Tarnished. What brings you here?
chn: 你看起来是褪色者，请问有什么事？

eng: Oh, pardon me. It's hardly my place to ask, is it.
chn:
啊，抱歉。
用这种刨根究底的口吻，是不太礼貌。

eng: I am Iji. A blacksmith who once served the Carian royals…
chn: 我叫伊吉，过去以铁匠身分侍奉过卡利亚王室。

eng: An old codger who refuses to retire his rusty hammer.
chn: ……然后，即使锻造的工夫退步了，

eng: So, here I am, still quietly plying my trade, on this spot.
chn: 还不愿退休，继续留在这里默默当铁匠。

eng: Perhaps you'd like a display? These bones are old, but still able.
chn: ……我这老头子还有多少能耐，要不要一探究竟？

eng: Well, it's kind of you to speak to me again.
chn: 你又过来了，真令我高兴。

eng: Then I presume these old bones served their purpose, more or less?
chn: 这代表我锻造的工夫还不算太差？

eng: Brave Tarnished. Here to put my old bones to work again?
chn: 褪色者啊，又想找老头子锻造吗？

eng: Brave Tarnished. A word of warning, if you please.
chn: 褪色者啊，请听听我的忠告。

eng: This territory once belonged to the Carian royal family. Their manor lies not far beyond this point.
chn:
这块土地原本是卡利亚王室的领地，
再往前的地方，有王室成员居住的城寨。

eng: When the Raya Lucaria Academy turned on the Carians, the Knights of the Cuckoo descended on this tract.
chn:
在雷亚卢卡利亚学院背叛王室以后，
众多杜鹃骑士前来攻击此地……

eng: After leveling it, they carried on to the manor.
chn: 在摧毁这里之后，步步逼近城寨。

eng: The Carians were taken off guard, but their strength had not waned, and they repelled the knights' onslaught...
chn:
不过，即使遭受出其不意的攻击，
卡利亚王室仍有能力击退骑士，

eng: By conjuring an enchanted snare that remains potent to this day.
chn:
只是当时使用的那些恐怖魔法陷阱，
就直接维持原状，留在原地。

eng: That is why I say, Tarnished. Don't go near the manor.
chn: 所以说，褪色者啊，别靠近城寨。

eng: Unless you wish to lie with the corpses of the heedless Knights of the Cuckoo.
chn: 你也不想踏上那些愚蠢杜鹃的后路吧？

eng: Oh, watch out, there.
chn: 啊啊，请你当心。

eng: When I'm absorbed in my smithing, I lose sight of all else.
chn: 我一旦全神贯注地锻造，就无法留意周遭事物。

eng: If you come too close, I'm apt to cause you harm.
chn: 靠太近的话，有可能会让你受伤。

eng: I am, after all, terribly large compared to you, Tarnished.
chn: 而且我的体型比你们褪色者大上非常多，

eng: You don't know how hard it is not to break anything while I work.
chn: 要我不碰坏东西行动，实在困难重重。

eng: Something else for you?
chn: ……还有事情没有做吗？

eng: I've explained the peril.
chn: ……别忘记我的忠告。

eng: Of the enchanted snare that remains at the royal Carian Manor.
chn:
卡利亚王室的城寨里，
还留着当时使用的恐怖魔法陷阱。

eng: Whatever you do, brave Tarnished, stay away from that deathtrap.
chn: 所以褪色者啊，别靠近城寨。

eng: Blaidd actually did that, did he?
chn: ……哦，你是因为布莱泽的介绍……

eng: Quite a rare occurrence, for such a guarded soul as he.
chn: 那个独来独往的人会这么做，这还真稀奇。

eng: Perhaps he sensed something unusual about you.
chn: ……肯定是因为，他从你身上看到了什么。

eng: At any rate, if you're friendly with Blaidd,
chn: 无论如何，既然你是布莱泽的朋友，

eng: I've a few more things that might suit you.
chn: 那些物品应该能卖给你。

eng: I've something else that might suit you.
chn: 那物品应该能卖给你。

eng: Oh, so you were the one. Lady Ranni has explained everything.
chn: 哦，你过来了。菈妮大人和我提过了。

eng: Again, I am Iji.
chn: 容我再自报名号，我叫伊吉。

eng: The Carian royal family's dedicated blacksmith, and Lady Ranni's war counsellor.
chn: 是侍奉卡利亚王室的铁匠，也是菈妮大人的军师。

eng: I am told that you are searching for Nokron with Blaidd.
chn:
听说你和布莱泽合作，
一同寻找前往诺克隆恩的去路。

eng: I will give you whatever guidance I can. And pray, for your success.
chn: 我愿尽己所能、提出建言，请你们一定要成功。

eng: The Carian royal family's dedicated blacksmith, and Lady Ranni's war counsellor.
chn: 是侍奉卡利亚王室的铁匠，也是菈妮大人的军师。

eng: I am told that you are searching for Nokron with Blaidd.
chn:
听说你和布莱泽合作，
一同寻找前往诺克隆恩的去路。

eng: I will give you whatever guidance I can. And pray, for your success.
chn: 我愿尽己所能、提出建言，请你们一定要成功。

eng: Oh, then you must be the one. Lady Ranni has explained everything.
chn: 哦，就是你吧？菈妮大人和我提过了。

eng: The pleasure is mine. I am Iji.
chn: 初次见面，你好。我叫伊吉。

eng: I take it you've heard of the Eternal City of Nokstella?
chn: ……你听过“永恒之城”诺克史黛拉吗？

eng: Well, it has a twin, known as Nokron. The other Eternal City.
chn: 那是和诺克隆恩成对存在的另一座永恒之城。

eng: After years of expeditions, we've determined the location of Nokron.
chn: 经过我们长久以来的调查，已经知道诺克隆恩的所在地。

eng: By going underground through the well in the Mistwood of Limgrave, you can see Nokron up above.
chn:
宁姆格福的雾林，从那地方的井下到地底之后，
仰望就能看到诺克隆恩……

eng: Only, we've failed to find a path leading to the city.
chn: 只是该如何前往，至今我们还找不到路。

eng: Blaidd's made a good go of it, but I'm afraid this has him quite stumped.
chn: 布莱泽做了不少努力，目前就在这一步遇到瓶颈。

eng: To be honest, I'm not sure where to go from here...
chn: ……嗯，该用什么办法……

eng: Blaidd is Lady Ranni's stepbrother.
chn: 布莱泽是菈妮大人结拜而来的弟弟。

eng: Ranni's mother, Queen Rennala, approved of him, and they played like siblings from childhood.
chn:
大人的母亲，蕾娜菈大人对此表示赞同。
在他们还年幼的时候，看起来真的有如亲姊弟。

eng: They were always happy to have me tag along, as well.
chn: 我也时常陪着他们两位玩耍。

eng: When Lady Ranni renounced her flesh, and chose the dark path of the Empyrean,
chn:
当菈妮大人选择抛弃身体，
决心走上神人的黑暗道路，

eng: Blaidd and I swore allegiance as vassals,
chn: 我和布莱泽都选择成为臣子，侍奉菈妮大人。

eng: but none of us will ever forget our earliest days together.
chn: ……但那段孩提时期度过的时光，肯定所有人都记得。

eng: Promise to look after Blaidd for me, will you?
chn: 布莱泽就麻烦你关照了。

eng: The man is honest to a fault. But fortunately, now he has you.
chn: 他从小性格就一板一眼，很需要像你这样的搭档。

eng: Jerren. Now, that's a name I haven't heard for a while.
chn: ……杰廉啊，让人怀念的名字。

eng: Before taking up the banner of General Radahn, he was a guest of the Carian royal family.
chn:
在他加入拉塔恩将军旗下以前，
曾在卡利亚王室作客。

eng: An expert swordsman, to be sure, but ever the eccentric.
chn: ……杰廉是一名身手不凡的剑士，但为人也颇为奇特。

eng: No surprise he'd get wrapped up in some festival.
chn: 竟然想举办祭典，很像他的作风……

eng: Oh, no, wait...
chn: ……不对，等一下……

eng: How did I not see it before!
chn: ……啊啊，是这么一回事吗！

eng: I ought to retire as war counsellor for such a gross oversight!
chn: 我伊吉身为军师，竟然没有读出这一步！

eng: Let me explain. The fate of the Carian royal family is guided by the stars.
chn:
请你仔细听好了：
卡利亚王室的命运是随着星星而动。

eng: As is the fate of Lady Ranni, first heir in the Carian royal line.
chn:
所以身为卡利亚王室的正统公主──
菈妮大人的命运也同样不例外。

eng: But General Radahn is the conqueror of the stars.
chn: 再加上，拉塔恩将军是“碎星”英雄──

eng: Who stood up to the swirling constellations, halting their movement in a smashing victory.
chn:
在过去，他打碎了星星流转的定律，
从此星星受到封印、不再转动……

eng: And so, if General Radahn were defeated, the stars would once again resume their movement.
chn:
既然如此，在拉塔恩将军死亡之际，
星星就会再一次转动。

eng: As would Lady Ranni's destiny.
chn: 连带着，菈妮大人的命运肯定也会开始转动。

eng: Perhaps, even, revealing the elusive path. That leads to Nokron.
chn:
这么一来，也许会出现──
那前往诺克隆恩的道路。

eng: My apologies for the misleading words of warning.
chn: ……看来我先前的忠告，警告错了人。

eng: I never imagined that an audience, let alone service to Lady Ranni was in your fate.
chn: 没想到你有着觐见、侍奉菈妮大人的命运，

eng: I, for one, should have seen it, but I did not.
chn: 只能说我有眼无珠。

eng: Do forgive me, my fellow.
chn: 这件事请你见谅。

eng: Let us give all that we can of ourselves.
chn: 然后，今后再请你多多关照了，

eng: Together, for Lady Ranni.
chn: 一起为了菈妮大人奋斗吧。

eng: Let us give all that we can of ourselves.
chn: 今后再请你多多关照了，

eng: Together, for Lady Ranni.
chn: 一起为了菈妮大人奋斗吧。

eng: Let us give all that we can of ourselves.
chn: 今后再请你多多关照了，

eng: Together, for Lady Ranni.
chn: 一起为了菈妮大人奋斗吧。

eng: Well, my fellow. How may I serve you?
chn: 哦，欢迎你来。

eng: As war counsellor, or as blacksmith?
chn:
这次来是要找铁匠锻造，
还是想找军师谈一谈？

eng: Greetings, my fellow. How can I help?
chn: 哦，欢迎你来。有什么事吗？

eng: Something else for you?
chn: ……还有事情没有做吗？

eng: Go with Blaidd to the festival grounds.
chn: ……请你和布莱泽一起前往祭典的举办地。

eng: Should General Radahn be defeated, the stars would once again resume their movement.
chn: 在拉塔恩将军死亡之际，星星也会再一次转动。

eng: Perhaps revealing the elusive path to Nokron.
chn: 那前往诺克隆恩的道路，说不定会出现。

eng: Ah, you've finally come. Blaidd told me everything.
chn: 哦，等你很久了。我有收到布莱泽的报告──

eng: You've defeated General Radahn, unlocking the stars.
chn: 你打倒了拉塔恩将军，解开星星的封印。

eng: The General was blighted by scarlet rot and driven to madness, but not long ago he was hailed as the mightiest demigod of them all.
chn:
即使受到猩红腐败侵蚀，陷入疯狂，
将军仍是被誉为最强半神的英雄。

eng: There is no parallel to your achievement. Nor to Lady Ranni's acute judgement of character.
chn:
你的战果肯定无人出其右。
菈妮大人真是慧眼独具，深感佩服。

eng: Thanks to you, Lady Ranni's fate once again stirs, and the path to Nokron has opened.
chn:
幸亏有你，菈妮大人的命运已经开始转动，
而且通往诺克隆恩的道路已经出现。

eng: Descend underground where the fallen star struck Limgrave.
chn:
请你前往宁姆格福，
从星星坠落的地方前往地底──

eng: And make it yours. The precious treasure of Nokron.
chn: 把珍藏在诺克隆恩的宝藏拿到手。

eng: Oh, Blaidd wanted me to tell you.
chn: ……啊，还有，布莱泽有留话给你。

eng: Not to bother waiting for him, and head straight to Nokron.
chn: 他要你不必等他，先出发前往诺克隆恩。

eng: Blaidd has been given an important task.
chn: ……布莱泽还有其他重要的任务在身，

eng: Apparently, a matter of great urgency.
chn: 似乎是颇为紧急的任务。

eng: You need not await Blaidd.
chn: 不必等待布莱泽。

eng: Descend underground alone where the fallen star struck Limgrave.
chn:
请先出发前往宁姆格福，
从星星坠落的地方前往地底，

eng: And make it yours. The precious treasure of Nokron.
chn: 再把珍藏在诺克隆恩的宝藏拿到手吧。

eng: So that Lady Ranni may tread the dark path of the Empyrean.
chn: ……这是为了让菈妮大人走上神人的黑暗道路。

eng: Now the festival is over, and General Radahn is defeated...
chn: ……祭典结束，拉塔恩将军被打败之后，

eng: Jerren's duties are finally fulfilled.
chn: 杰廉总算是尽了他的责任。

eng: Though we served different masters, I could see he was truly adept in his role.
chn: 即使侍奉的主人不同，我还是对他深感敬佩。

eng: Now the time has come to remind him of an old promise made.
chn: ……不过也是时候提醒他，关于以前的约定。

eng: With the stars of fate set into motion, a certain sorceress is dispossessed of her immortality...
chn:
在星星的命运开始转动之后，
那个女魔法师就不再“不死”。

eng: Finally, we can be rid of a longstanding Carian weed...
chn: 总算有办法刨除卡利亚的祸根……

eng: Jerren. Now, that's a name I haven't heard for a while.
chn: ……杰廉啊，让人怀念的名字。

eng: Before taking up the banner of General Radahn, he was a guest of the Carian royal family.
chn:
在他加入拉塔恩将军旗下以前，
曾在卡利亚王室作客。

eng: An expert swordsman, to be sure, but ever the eccentric.
chn: ……杰廉是一名身手不凡的剑士，但为人也颇为奇特。

eng: It's funny how things happen.
chn: 只是这事说也奇妙。

eng: Jerren and I parted ways long, long ago, yet here he is, playing his part in Lady Ranni's fate.
chn:
我们与杰廉分道扬镳已久，
万万没想到他会和菈妮大人的命运相关。

eng: I'm afraid I never saw it coming. And I thought myself a capable war counsellor...
chn: 我伊吉身为军师，却没能读出那一步，实在遗憾。

eng: I presume you've spoken with Blaidd?
chn: ……你见到布莱泽了吗？

eng: Very well. There is something you should know.
chn: ……好吧，我告诉你详情。

eng: The Two Fingers gave Blaidd to Lady Ranni, as a faithful follower. Her very shadow, incapable of treachery.
chn:
布莱泽是双指赐予菈妮大人的侍者，
是绝对不会背叛的，菈妮大人的影子。

eng: But if Lady Ranni, as an Empyrean, resists being an instrument of the Two Fingers,
chn:
但是当菈妮大人作为神人，
拒绝成为受双指摆布的傀儡，从那一刻起……

eng: the shadow will go mad, transforming from a follower into a horrid curse.
chn:
影子就会发狂。
这对菈妮大人而言，是恐怖的诅咒。

eng: But such is his destiny. In such matters, Blaidd's own thoughts hold no weight.
chn:
……这是注定好的事，
布莱泽本身的意志无从介入。

eng: It pains me so, but he must be neutralised. For Lady Ranni's sake.
chn:
做这种事很不好受，
但为了菈妮大人，我也只能封印他了。

eng: Unthinkable, how could Blaidd...
chn: ……怎么会，布莱泽……

eng: How did he break free from his cell?
chn: 他是怎么逃出那座封印监牢……

eng: No, more importantly...
chn: 不，比起这件事……

eng: Blaidd became a curse that plagued Lady Ranni, yet even in madness, gave himself to her.
chn:
即使受到诅咒而发狂，
还是为了菈妮大人鞠躬尽瘁……

eng: I've made a grave misjudgment. And I thought myself a capable war counsellor...
chn: 我军师伊吉，真是天大的失算……

eng: I'll catch up with you soon enough, Blaidd.
chn: ……能见到面的日子也渐渐近了，

eng: When I do, I only hope you'll accept my apology.
chn: 到时候再让我好好道歉吧，布莱泽啊……

eng: Oh, so you were the one. Lady Ranni has explained everything.
chn: 哦，你过来了。菈妮大人和我提过了。

eng: You've defeated General Radahn, unlocking the stars.
chn: 你打倒了拉塔恩将军，解开星星的封印。

eng: A grand reward, justly procured by any measure.
chn: ……真的该说战果丰硕。

eng: Again, I am Iji.
chn: 容我再自报名号，我叫伊吉。

eng: The Carian royal family's dedicated blacksmith, and Lady Ranni's war counsellor.
chn: 是侍奉卡利亚王室的铁匠，也是菈妮大人的军师。

eng: I welcome one of your calibre. A fellow champion in service of Lady Ranni.
chn:
我们很欢迎勇士加入，成为同志。
一起为了菈妮大人奋斗吧。

eng: Thanks to you, Lady Ranni's fate once again stirs, and the path to Nokron has opened.
chn:
幸亏有你，菈妮大人的命运已经开始转动，
而且通往诺克隆恩的道路已经出现。

eng: Descend underground where the fallen star struck Limgrave.
chn:
请你前往宁姆格福，
从星星坠落的地方前往地底──

eng: And make it yours. The precious treasure of Nokron.
chn: 把珍藏在诺克隆恩的宝藏拿到手。

eng: So that Lady Ranni may tread the dark path of the Empyrean.
chn: ……这是为了让菈妮大人走上神人的黑暗道路。

eng: Oh, so you must be the one. Lady Ranni has explained everything.
chn: 哦，就是你吧？菈妮大人和我提过了。

eng: You've defeated General Radahn, unlocking the stars.
chn: 你打倒了拉塔恩将军，解开星星的封印。

eng: A grand reward, justly procured by any measure.
chn: ……真的该说战果丰硕。

eng: The pleasure is mine. I am Iji.
chn: 初次见面，你好。我叫伊吉。

eng: The Carian royal family's dedicated blacksmith, and Lady Ranni's war counsellor.
chn: 是侍奉卡利亚王室的铁匠，也是菈妮大人的军师。

eng: I welcome one of your calibre. A fellow champion in service of Lady Ranni.
chn:
我们很欢迎勇士加入，成为同志。
一起为了菈妮大人奋斗吧。

eng: Oh, there you are. Good of you to drop by.
chn: 哦，欢迎你来。

eng: Have you heard? Lady Ranni has departed on her journey.
chn:
你已经知道了吗？
菈妮大人总算出发旅行了。

eng: Along the dark path of the Empyrean, from Renna's Rise, as she calls it.
chn:
她前往了那座名叫“蕾娜”的塔，
走上神人的黑暗道路。

eng: It would not have been possible without you.
chn: ……一切幸亏有你帮忙。

eng: As Lady Ranni's war counsellor, and moreover, her childhood warden, I express my deepest gratitude.
chn:
作为菈妮大人的军师，不对，
应该说作为从小照顾她的老随从，容我致上最深的谢意。

eng: You, and only you, were Lady Ranni's true champion.
chn: 你是菈妮大人货真价实的英雄。

eng: My purpose is nearing its end.
chn: ……我的职责就要结束。

eng: I've served Lady Ranni for as long as I can remember...
chn: 我伊吉长年侍奉菈妮大人，不曾间断……

eng: It has been a long and wondrous journey.
chn: 这是一段漫长，却很圆满的旅程。

eng: Now Lady Ranni is in your hands.

eng: I pray that you serve her well, unto the very end.

eng: Well, what's this?

chn: ……那我不客气了。

eng: I'll save it for a quiet moment, that I might truly savour it.
chn: 之后再找时间，好好品味。

eng: Lady Ranni has departed on her journey.

eng: Along the dark path of the Empyrean, from Renna's Rise, as she calls it.

eng: Now Lady Ranni is in your hands.

eng: <sleeping>

eng: There is no fight without a foe.

eng: If that's the cloth you're cut from,

eng: don't ever show your face again.

eng: Not to me. And not to my liege.

eng: Not to me. And not to my liege.

eng: Lady... Ranni...

eng: Agh.

eng: Cease this treachery at once.

eng: Lady Ranni will be devastated.

chn: 大姐姐，你怎么了？

eng: What's the matter, coz?
chn: 大姐姐，你怎么了？

eng: Don't be such a nasty brute.
chn: 不要那么暴力啦。

eng: Is this who you are, coz?
chn: ……原来大哥哥是这种人。

eng: Is this who you are, coz?
chn: ……原来大姐姐是这种人。

eng: Is this who you are, coz?
chn: ……原来大姐姐是这种人。

eng: You've cracked my heart.
chn: 我好伤心。

eng: Please, don't crack the others...
chn: 求求你，不要打破大家……

eng: You were a poacher, all along.
chn: ……原来大哥哥是盗猎者。

eng: You were a poacher, all along.
chn: ……原来大姐姐是盗猎者。

eng: You were a poacher, all along.
chn: ……原来大姐姐是盗猎者。

eng: You've cracked my heart.
chn: 我好伤心。

eng: Please, don't crack the others...
chn: 求求你，不要打破大家……

eng: So, you were a poacher, too.
chn: ……原来大哥哥也是盗猎者。

eng: So, you were a poacher, too.
chn: ……原来大姐姐也是盗猎者。

eng: So, you were a poacher, too.
chn: ……原来大姐姐也是盗猎者。

eng: But the tale of house Hoslow is told in blood.
chn: 但是“霍斯劳以血代言”──

eng: I'll find you, one day, coz...
chn: 所以总有一天，我会对大哥哥……

eng: I'll find you, one day, coz...
chn: 所以总有一天，我会对大姐姐……

eng: I'll find you, one day, coz...
chn: 所以总有一天，我会对大姐姐……

eng: Sister... Where did you go?
chn: ……姐姐，你到哪里去了？

eng: You promised me. When we turned 14, we'd go to see the stars...
chn:
我们不是约好了吗？
等到１４岁了，就要一起去看星星。

eng: I've been waiting ever so long. Forever and ever, it seems.
chn: 我一直在等喔，已经等了好久、好久了……

eng: Ahh, dear sister, you're finally here.
chn: 啊，你终于来了，姐姐。

eng: No time to waste. Let's see the stars.
chn: 快点，我们走吧，一起去看星星嘛。

eng: Foul Tarnished, what do you want?
chn: ……褪色者，你来做什么？

eng: I told the all-hearing brute.
chn: 我也告诉过百耳男了，

eng: That I possess no such medallion.
chn: 我没有符节。

eng: Or have you come to take more from me?
chn: 难道你们还不知足？

eng: Was my other half not enough?
chn: 都夺走我的伙伴了，还不够吗？

eng: I told the bastard in the bone armour.
chn: 我也告诉过骨盔男了，

eng: I told the all-hearing brute already.
chn: ……我告诉过百耳男了，

eng: That I possess no such medallion.
chn: 我没有符节。

eng: Or have you come to take more from me?
chn: 难道你们还不知足？

eng: Was my other half not enough?
chn: 都夺走我的伙伴了，还不够吗？
