eng: I told the bastard in bone armour already.
chn: ……我告诉过骨盔男了，

eng: Oh...do you speak true?
chn: ……是这样吗？

eng: So old Albus entrusted his medallion to you.
chn: 艾尔帕斯老先生把符节交给你保管了。

eng: Then I've no choice. But to trust that this was his dying will.
chn: ……既然是他的遗愿，我也愿意相信你。

eng: Let's try again. I'm Latenna. An Albinauric, the same as Old Albus.
chn:
我的名字是勒缇娜，
和艾尔帕斯老先生一样，是白金之子。

eng: My apologies for my coarse words earlier.
chn: 刚才对你不太礼貌，请见谅。

eng: I presumed the worst, seeing that you were another Tarnished, like that all-hearing brute.
chn:
只因为一样是褪色者，
就擅自认定你和百耳男是一丘之貉……

eng: I hope that you will forgive me.
chn: 抱歉。

eng: I presumed the worst, seeing that you were another Tarnished, like the bastard before.
chn:
只因为一样是褪色者，
就擅自认定你和那个男人是一丘之貉……

eng: Mm, the medallion is better off in your hands, anyway.
chn: 嗯，那符节该由你继续保管。

eng: Would you consider doing me a great service?
chn: 只是，你能听听我的请求吗？

eng: I must go back.
chn: ……我必须回去。

eng: There is something that I must do, even if I must say farewell to my wolf, Lobo.
chn:
即使和我的狼，罗伯死别了，
我还是必须完成使命。

eng: Will you show me the way? To the land of Miquella's Haligtree.
chn: 你能带我回到米凯拉大人的圣树吗？

eng: If you accept, I would gladly apprise you.
chn: 只要你答应我的请求，

eng: Of the whereabouts of the medallion's other half.
chn: 我愿意告诉你另一个符节的所在地。

eng: Thank you kindly.
chn: ……谢谢。

eng: They say the other half of the medallion is beyond the forbidden lands north of the Erdtree.
chn:
我听说另一个符节
在黄金树的北方，必须深入禁域──

eng: In Castle Sol, on the Mountaintops of the Giants, accessible by the Grand Lift of Rold.
chn:
就在索尔城。用洛德大升降机向上移动，
那座城就在巨人山顶。

eng: Then I suppose it's time.
chn: ……时候到了。

eng: Farewell, Lobo. My faithful wolf, my better half.
chn:
罗伯，该道别了。
我的狼，忠心不二的伙伴啊。

eng: I will go with the Tarnished. So that our journey will not have been in vain.
chn:
为了不白费我们过去的努力，
接下来，我要和这位褪色者同行。

eng: Forgive me, Lobo.
chn: 所以原谅我吧，罗伯。

eng: Call upon me when needed.
chn: ……需要时，随时呼唤我。

eng: And I will fight at your side.
chn: 我愿意为你而战。

eng: Well...
chn: ……这样啊。

eng: I understand. You must have your own duty to fulfil.
chn: 我知道了，毕竟你也有要完成的使命。

eng: But please, allow me to say my piece.
chn: 不过，我还是透露一些资讯给你。

eng: Even if you cannot take me, old Albus wished I relay to you the following:
chn:
即使你无法答应我的要求，
我也不能忽视艾尔帕斯老先生的遗愿。

eng: The other half of the medallion can be found beyond the forbidden lands north of the Erdtree.
chn:
……我听说另一个符节
在黄金树的北方，必须深入禁域──

eng: In Castle Sol, on the Mountaintops of the Giants, accessible by the Grand Lift of Rold.
chn:
就在索尔城。用洛德大升降机向上移动，
那座城就在巨人山顶。

eng: If you seek the other half of the medallion, they say it's beyond the forbidden lands north of the Erdtree.
chn:
……我听说另一个符节
在黄金树的北方，必须深入禁域──

eng: In Castle Sol, on the Mountaintops of the Giants, accessible by the Grand Lift of Rold.
chn:
就在索尔城。用洛德大升降机向上移动，
那座城就在巨人山顶。

eng: My thanks...
chn: ……谢谢。

eng: You'll lead me then, to the land of Miquella's Haligtree.
chn: 谢谢你愿意带我回到米凯拉大人的圣树。

eng: Farewell, Lobo. My faithful wolf, my better half.
chn:
罗伯，该道别了。
我的狼，忠心不二的伙伴啊。

eng: I will go with the Tarnished. So that our journey will not have been in vain.
chn:
为了不白费我们过去的努力，
接下来，我要和这位褪色者同行。

eng: Forgive me, Lobo.
chn: 所以原谅我吧，罗伯。

eng: Do you hear me? It is I, Latenna.
chn: ……能打扰你一下吗？

eng: We're almost there. Castle Sol lies just off to the north,
chn: 索尔城就在附近，从这里往北走一段路的地方。

eng: where the other medallion is housed. It will grant passage to the land of the Haligtree.
chn: 通往圣树所需的另一个符节，应该能在那里找到。

eng: Castle Sol lies just off to the north,
chn: 索尔城就在从这里往北走一段路的地方。

eng: where the other medallion is housed. It will grant passage to the land of the Haligtree.
chn: 通往圣树所需的另一个符节，应该能在那里找到。

eng: Oh young yet towering sister of ours.
chn: 来，庞大的妹妹啊。

eng: Let the birthing droplet in.
chn: 接受初始泪滴吧。

eng: And create life. For us. For all the Albinaurics.
chn: 为了我们白金之子，萌发生命吧。

eng: Thank you.
chn: ……谢谢你。

eng: I've finally fulfilled my purpose.
chn: 我终于完成使命了。

eng: Our young yet towering sister will give us hope.
chn: 我们那身形庞大的妹妹，肯定会成为希望。

eng: Now that nothing is left unfinished,
chn: 我心中已无罣碍。

eng: I will join you in battle to the bitter end.
chn: 让我和你战斗到最后一刻吧。

eng: And when the fighting is done,
chn: ……然后，等到战争结束后，

eng: then you may lay me to rest. Beside Lobo, my dear wolf.
chn: 能把我葬在我的狼，罗伯身边吗？

eng: Do you hear me? It is I, Latenna.
chn: ……能打扰你一下吗？

eng: We have reached the land of Miquella's Haligtree, where Lobo and I began our travels.
chn:
这里是米凯拉大人的圣树所在地，
也是我和罗伯旅行的起点。

eng: It's entirely thanks to you that I'm so close to home.
chn: 幸亏有你帮忙，我终于回到这里。

eng: These great snow-laden lands stretch far to the north.
chn: 在这片雪白大地往北一直走，

eng: And beyond the ancient bowers, and the liturgical town of Ordina,
chn: 经过几棵古代树、“仪典镇”奥缇那之后，继续往前，

eng: lies the place to which I must return.
chn: 那里有我想回去的地方。

eng: We have reached the land of Miquella's Haligtree.
chn: 这里是米凯拉大人的圣树所在地。

eng: These great snow-laden lands stretch far to the north.
chn: 在这片雪白大地往北一直走，

eng: And beyond the ancient bowers, and the liturgical town of Ordina,
chn: 经过几棵古代树、“仪典镇”奥缇那之后，继续往前，

eng: lies the place to which I must return.
chn: 那里有我想回去的地方。

eng: Ngh!
chn: 呜。

eng: Stop, now.
chn: 快住手吧。

eng: And I'll consider that a simple mishap.
chn: 现在还能一笑置之。

eng: Are all you Tarnished the same?
chn: 褪色者全都是一丘之貉……

eng: Was taking my other half not enough for you?
chn: 都夺走我的伙伴了，你们还不知足吗！

eng: There is no meaning in a fight, lest it serve a greater duty.
chn: ……与使命无关的战斗，毫无意义。

eng: Ohh...Phillia
chn: ……啊，菲莉亚……

eng: Take...the birthing...droplet...
chn: 你的、初始泪滴……

eng: Brave Tarnished, welcome to the Volcano Manor.
chn: 褪色者啊，欢迎来到火山官邸。

eng: I am Tanith, the proprietress of this house.
chn: 我名为塔妮丝，是这座官邸的主人。

eng: Rya spoke well of you.
chn: 菈雅曾提过你，

eng: "A warrior of promise," I believe she said.
chn: 听说你是大有可为的人才。

eng: Perhaps you are prepared to make a commitment.
chn: 那么请容我一问，再次确认你的意愿：

eng: Will you join us here at the Volcano Manor, and resist the tide?
chn: 你愿意加入火山官邸，与我们并肩而战吗？

eng: Why accept the burden of their grace, or be fooled by the dogmatic ramblings of the Fingers?
chn:
赐福的指引，指头的傲慢空话──
那强加的一切，我们不打算遵从……

eng: Rise with us, against the Erdtree.
chn: 我们要对黄金树举剑相向。

eng: Interesting. Your decision is most welcome.
chn: 谢谢你给出肯定的回复。

eng: Now you belong to the Volcano Manor family.
chn: 如此一来，你就是火山官邸的一员。

eng: The drawing room lies down the hall. Make yourself comfortable.
chn: 走廊的尽头有间客房供你使用，请当作自己家。

eng: But be sure to earn your keep.
chn: ……接下来要请你多关照了。

eng: Well. That is unfortunate.
chn: ……这样啊，真遗憾。

eng: Rya will be disappointed, but I won't twist your arm.
chn: 菈雅听到肯定会很难受，虽然这也是无可奈何。

eng: Now, time for you to leave, I should think.
chn: ……请离开这座官邸，

eng: Let this intersection of our paths be the last.
chn: 我们彼此是走在平行线上。

eng: Aren't you precocious.
chn: 哦，你是……

eng: We rarely receive visitors to the Volcano Manor without invitation.
chn: 竟然自行前来我们火山官邸，真是稀客。

eng: Fascinating. And not unlike another guest we had long ago…
chn: ……有趣。回想起来，那人也是如此……

eng: So, Tarnished, have you ever harboured doubts?
chn: 我说，你身为褪色者，难道不曾怀疑？

eng: About the burden of grace, and the dogmatic ramblings of the Fingers?
chn:
赐福的指引，指头的傲慢空话──
那强加的一切，你认为理所当然？

eng: If you have, why not join the Volcano Manor, and fight with us?
chn: 既然心存疑念，何不加入火山官邸，一起并肩战斗？

eng: Rise with us, against the Erdtree.
chn: ……一同对黄金树举剑相向。

eng: Your decision is most welcome.
chn: 谢谢你给出肯定的回复。

eng: Now you belong to the Volcano Manor family.
chn: 如此一来，你就是火山官邸的一员。

eng: The drawing room lies down the hall. Make yourself comfortable.
chn: 走廊的尽头有间客房供你使用，请当作自己家。

eng: I am Tanith, the proprietress of this house. An honour to have you.
chn:
我名为塔妮丝，是这座官邸的主人。
接下来要请你多关照了。

eng: Well. That is unfortunate.
chn: ……这样啊，真遗憾。

eng: Now, time for you to leave, I should think.
chn: ……既然如此，请离开这座官邸，

eng: Let this intersection of our paths be the last.
chn: 我们彼此是走在平行线上。

eng: Did you read the letter left for you?
chn: ……放在房间里的信件，你应该看过了。

eng: That is the task the Volcano Manor desires you enact.
chn: 那是火山官邸对你发出的委托，

eng: You will be compensated once the deed is done. Good luck.
chn: 当然也有相对的报酬，拜托你了。

eng: If you are loath to hunt your own kin, so be it.
chn: 但如果你对狩猎同胞仍有一丝犹豫，那也无妨。

eng: But you must leave this house at once.
chn: 立刻离开这座官邸便是。

eng: This is a war against the Erdtree.
chn: 我们要对黄金树举剑相向，

eng: We have no place for the meek, nor the luxury of keeping clean hands.
chn:
不需要软弱的人为伙，
人人都要有玷污双手的心理准备。

eng: What's this?
chn: ……什么事？

eng: Have you reconsidered the prospect?
chn: 难道你想说，自己改变心意了？

eng: Of rising with us, against the Erdtree?
chn: ……想与我们并肩而战，对黄金树举剑相向？

eng: Very well.
chn: ……嗯，也好。

eng: Your decision is most welcome.
chn: 谢谢你给出肯定的回复。

eng: Now you belong to the Volcano Manor family.
chn: 如此一来，你就是火山官邸的一员。

eng: The drawing room lies down the hall. Make yourself comfortable.
chn: 走廊的尽头有间客房供你使用，请当作自己家。

eng: You've completed your task.
chn: 看来你完美达成委托了。

eng: I am pleased. Now you are a recusant true, and a full-fledged member of the Volcano Manor.
chn:
真令人雀跃。如此一来，你也挤身叛律者之列。
名符其实，成为我们火山官邸的一员。

eng: This is your reward, as promised.
chn: 收下吧，这是先前提过的报酬。

eng: Never forget. That the recusant fights to tread the path of the champion.
chn:
……请记得，叛律者的战斗，
会开拓出成为英雄的道路。

eng: The way is tainted, but for this very reason,
chn:
即使过程会遭遇污秽、不洁，
不，应该说正因为如此，

eng: it is the true path to valour.
chn: 才能通往成为英雄的道路。

eng: I see you've performed another task for us.
chn: ……你又完美达成委托了。

eng: Here is your usual reward. Please, take it.
chn: 收下吧，平时受你关照，这是谢礼。

eng: Now, perhaps the time has come to tell you.
chn: ……看来也是时候告诉你了──

eng: Of the true ruler of this manor, Lord Rykard.
chn: 关于火山官邸的真正主人，吾王拉卡德的事情。

eng: The Erdtree blessed the Tarnished with grace.
chn: 黄金树给予褪色者赐福，

eng: But it was all too meagre, in the face of the enormity of their task.
chn:
但和受到指引，随之肩负的使命相比，
那赐福实在过于渺小……

eng: The Tarnished were forced to scavenge, squabbling for crumbs.
chn: 因此褪色者渴求力量，也被迫如此。

eng: Like the shardbearers, vying for power in the wake of the Shattering.
chn:
如同当年艾尔登法环破碎之时，
拥有大卢恩的君王面临的窘境。

eng: Our Lord, indignant, has refused. To scurry about, fighting over what miserly scraps they allow us.
chn:
被迫抢夺彼此分得的力量──
吾王对此气愤非常，无法接受如此肤浅的行为。

eng: If the Erdtree, and indeed the very gods, would debase us so,
chn: 既然黄金树，也就是神祇有意糟蹋我们，

eng: then we are willing to raise the banner of resistance, even if it means heresy.
chn:
那么，即使要犯下叛律的亵渎之举，
我们也要揭竿而起，维护尊严。

eng: We at the Volcano Manor, under Lord Rykard, have sworn no rest until it is done.
chn: 此为火山官邸的全体共识，更是吾王拉卡德的决心。

eng: If you follow this heroic path, one day the Lord will see you.
chn:
……只要继续在英雄的道路上迈进，
总有一天，你也会见到吾王。

eng: The Lord's visits with our champions are always a spectacle.
chn: 身处战场之人邂逅彼此，那一刻总是绝景。

eng: It cannot come a day too soon!
chn: 尽管期待那一天到来吧，呵呵。

eng: The letter describes the task the Volcano Manor desires you enact.
chn: 放在房间里的信件，是火山官邸对你发出的委托。

eng: You will be compensated once the deed is done. Good luck.
chn: 当然也有相对的报酬，拜托你了。

eng: If you follow this heroic path, one day the Lord will see you.
chn:
……只要继续在英雄的道路上迈进，
总有一天，你也会见到吾王。

eng: It cannot come a day too soon!
chn: 尽管期待那一天到来吧，呵呵。

eng: She said that, to you?
chn: ……那孩子问了这件事吗……？

eng: I should have known something was wrong. The signs were clear enough.
chn: 看她最近有些怪异，果然是心里有烦恼……

eng: Well. Zorayas has placed her trust in you. All the more reason I must tell you.
chn:
泽菈雅丝对你敞开了心房，
所以我希望你也能明白──

eng: That some things are better left unknown. Besides, no-one should be blamed for their heritage.
chn:
真相大白不见得是好事。
身世如何，也不该责怪当事人。

eng: Think about it. We are resisting the ways of the Erdtree itself.
chn: 你也清楚，我们该做的是对抗黄金树律法。

eng: What matters one's lineage in such a crisis?
chn: 相比之下，身世根本不值一提。

eng: No, I haven't seen Zorayas anywhere.
chn: ……是你啊，我找不到泽菈雅丝。

eng: And she has no scouting duties now.
chn: 她应该没有招募者的任务在身。

eng: Has she gone off in search of answers?
chn: ……她还在调查吧。

eng: Why won't she just listen...
chn: 为什么这么不明事理……

eng: May I ask your aid?
chn: 我有事情想要拜托你。

eng: Not as the Manor's proprietress, but as Zorayas' mother.
chn:
不是以火山官邸之主，
而是以泽菈雅丝之母身分请托。

eng: If she discovers the answer to her question, and it causes distress,
chn:
如果你发现她找到盼望已久的答案，
因此一蹶不振的时候，

eng: have her drink this potion.
chn: 希望你让她喝下这帖药。

eng: To purge that which would cause her pain.
chn: ……这可以让她忘记所有的痛苦。

eng: Yes, I know.
chn: 嗯，我心知肚明。

eng: My wish is a grave disrespect to her.
chn: 这个请托是在践踏泽菈雅丝的尊严，

eng: No different than the Erdtree's imposition.
chn: 和黄金树对我们做出的事情没有两样。

eng: But I've no choice... It must be done.
chn: 可是，我……我不得不出此下策。

eng: Thank you, for allowing me this.
chn: ……谢谢你实现我的愿望。

eng: I will never be a good mother. My heart is too frail.
chn: 我真的不配为人母，我太软弱了，

eng: Our Lord must have known this all along.
chn: 吾王应该早就知情。

eng: My meekness is all too clear...
chn: 哈哈……真是软弱……

eng: Really, she is dead, then...
chn: ……她丧失性命了，是吗。

eng: My gratitude for your forthrightness.
chn: 谢谢你告诉我。

eng: If you would...allow me some time alone.
chn: 只是……可以让我独处一阵子吗……？

eng: Please, allow me some time alone.
chn: ……抱歉，让我一个人静一静吧……

eng: I see that you've stayed the path of champions.
chn: 看来，你确实走在英雄的道路上。

eng: This is your usual reward. Please, take it.
chn: 收下吧，平时受你关照，这是谢礼。

eng: Perhaps you are ready. Might you see our Lord?
chn: ……也是时候让你觐见吾王，你意下如何？

eng: Our Lord will no doubt welcome you. Another kindred spirit, treading the path of champions.
chn: 吾王肯定很欢迎你这位并肩同行的英雄──新的族人。

eng: Yes, as it should be.
chn: ……嗯，我知道了。

eng: Now, close your eyes for a moment.
chn: 闭上你的双眼，稍待片刻，

eng: I will transport you to the Lord's chamber.
chn: 我来带领你前往吾王的身边。

eng: Farewell, then.
chn: ……永别了，

eng: May your visit be fruitful.
chn: 希望会是一场完美的邂逅。

eng: I see... Well, I cannot make you take the leap.
chn: 这样啊……没关系，这不强迫。

eng: But do know this.
chn: 但是希望你记住，

eng: To follow the path of valour, an audience with our Lord is essential.
chn: 既然有意在英雄的道路上迈进，你是应该觐见吾王。

eng: In order to defy this debasement, and rise up against the Erdtree.
chn: 有意为了黄金树践踏尊严一事揭竿而起，更是如此。

eng: Like a true recusant of the Volcano Manor.
chn: 这是火山官邸渴求达成的愿望。

eng: Won't you consider having an audience with our Lord?
chn: ……觐见吾王这事，你意下如何？

eng: Our Lord will no doubt welcome you. Another kindred spirit, treading the path of champions.
chn: 吾王肯定很欢迎你这位并肩同行的英雄──新的族人。

eng: You...
It's true then. You've defeated our Lord.
chn: ……是这样啊，吾王败下阵来了。

eng: No, I must thank you. Our Lord was yet weak. You have taught us that.
chn:
没关系，我很感谢你。
让我明白了吾王的力量还不足。

eng: Defeat is not the end. Our Lord is immortal, and will one day rise again, stronger.
chn:
……然而败战并不是终点──
吾王是不死之身，总有一天会复活成更强的存在。

eng: Until then, I must stay the path, and do my part.
chn: 我会为此开始做一切准备。

eng: I will leave the Volcano Manor before long.
chn: 我就快离开火山官邸了。

eng: I suggest you do the same.
chn: 你也尽快准备离开吧。

eng: Here is my thanks. For allowing our Lord to be revived, even stronger than before.
chn:
这是我的谢礼──
你让吾王看见目标，他将复活成更为强大的存在。

eng: I will miss these encounters.
chn: ……只是我感到些许惆怅。

eng: The champion who walks the tainted path shines all the more.
chn: 走在污秽、不洁之路的英雄，总是如此耀眼──

eng: I always was an admirer.
chn: 你真的很吸引人。

eng: Oh, you...
chn: 噢，是你啊……

eng: Allow me some time.
chn: 要再麻烦你稍待片刻。

eng: Our Lord's carcass is vast, and not easily consumed.
chn: 吾王的身体过于巨大，实在是很费力。

eng: Dear Rykard, please find purchase within me,
chn: 拉卡德啊，请在我体内安歇吧。

eng: I wish to be your serpent; your family.
chn: 我想要成为您的蛇，您的族人。

eng: One day, let us devour the gods together.
chn: 在未来，一定要一起吞噬神祇……

eng: Dear Rykard, please find purchase within me,
chn: 拉卡德啊，请在我体内安歇吧。

eng: I wish to be your serpent; your family.
chn: 我想要成为您的蛇，您的族人。

eng: One day, let us devour the gods together.
chn: 在未来，一定要一起吞噬神祇……

eng: Now, time for you to leave, I should think.
chn: ……既然如此，请离开这座官邸，

eng: Let this intersection of our paths be the last.
chn: 我们彼此是走在平行线上。

eng: The drawing room is through the hall.
chn: ……走廊的尽头有间客房供你使用。

eng: Use the key I handed you, and make yourself comfortable.
chn: 交给你的那把钥匙能开门，请当作自己家。

eng: What's this?
chn: ……什么事？

eng: Have you reconsidered the prospect?
chn: 难道你想说，自己改变心意了？

eng: Of rising with us, against the Erdtree?
chn: ……想与我们并肩而战，对黄金树举剑相向？

eng: Very well.
chn: ……嗯，也好。

eng: Your decision is most welcome.
chn: 谢谢你给出肯定的回复。

eng: Now you belong to the Volcano Manor family.
chn: 如此一来，你就是火山官邸的一员。

eng: The drawing room lies down the hall. Make yourself comfortable.
chn: 走廊的尽头有间客房供你使用，请当作自己家。

eng: Now, time for you to leave, I should think.
chn: ……既然如此，请离开这座官邸，

eng: Let this intersection of our paths be the last.
chn: 我们彼此是走在平行线上。

eng: The drawing room is through the hall.
chn: ……走廊的尽头有间客房供你使用，

eng: Use the key I handed you, and make yourself comfortable.
chn: 交给你的那把钥匙能开门，请当作自己家。

eng: Now you are a recusant true, and a full-fledged member of the Volcano Manor.
chn:
如此一来，你也挤身叛律者之列。
名符其实是我们火山官邸的一员。

eng: I am pleased to have you on our side.
chn: 接下来要请你多关照了。

eng: Did you see her?
chn: ……你看见了吗？

eng: The girl, Rya…with her true face.
chn: 那孩子……菈雅的真面目。

eng: Well, if she confided in you the name Zorayas,
chn: ……嗯，既然她告诉了你“泽菈雅丝”这个名字，

eng: then perhaps it is not my place to speak.
chn: 这件事就没有我置喙的余地。

eng: But as her adoptive mother, I ask of you.
chn: 只是身为养育她的母亲，请让我说句话──

eng: Please, be kind to her. Look after young Zorayas.
chn: 希望从今以后，你能继续好好对待泽菈雅丝。

eng: Her true visage belies the purity of her heart.
chn: 无论那模样有什么缘由，她依旧是个好孩子。

eng: …Honestly, I hardly deserve the sweet child.
chn: ……让我这个做母亲的，都会感到心虚。

eng: Please, be kind to her. Look after young Zorayas.
chn: 希望从今以后，你能继续好好对待泽菈雅丝。

eng: Her true visage belies the purity of her heart.
chn: 无论那模样有什么缘由，她依旧是个好孩子。

eng: Zorayas has placed her trust in you. All the more reason I must tell you.
chn: 泽菈雅丝对你敞开了心房，所以我希望你也能明白──

eng: That some things are better left unknown. Besides, no-one should be blamed for their heritage.
chn:
真相大白不见得是好事。
身世如何，也不该责怪当事人。

eng: My wish is a grave disrespect to her.
chn: 这个请托是在践踏泽菈雅丝的尊严，

eng: But I've no choice... It must be done.
chn: 可是，我……我不得不出此下策。

eng: Sweet Zorayas, have I earned your scorn?
chn: ……泽菈雅丝，你会恨我吗……？

eng: This is farewell.
chn: ……永别了。

eng: Perhaps we will meet again, along the path.
chn: 希望有一天，我们的路再次交集。

eng: What is it?
chn: ……那是什么？

eng: I have no need of that.
chn: ……我不再需要它了。

eng: I must continue devouring my beloved lord...
chn: 我要先吞噬吾王……

eng: Oh, you...
chn: 噢，是你啊……

eng: Allow me some time.
chn: 要再麻烦你稍待片刻。

eng: Our lord's carcass is not easily consumed.
chn: 吾王的身体过于巨大，实在是很费力。

eng: Ngh!
chn: 呜！

eng: Ahh, my lord...
Rykard...
chn: 拉卡德……

eng: Oh, Rykard…
chn: ……啊，拉卡德……

eng: Let me be your serpent…
chn: 我想要成为您的蛇……

eng: Oh, yes... Tarnished, are we?
chn: ……噢，你是……是褪色者吧？

eng: Come to the Lands Between for the Elden Ring, hmm?
chn: 渴求艾尔登法环，因此来到这块交界地。

eng: Of course you have. No shame in it.
chn: 我全都知道，事情肯定是如此。

eng: But I'm afraid you're plumb out of luck.
chn: 但是呢，着实可悲可叹……

eng: You are maidenless. A bit player, fully divorced from the strength of runes.
chn:
你没有女巫陪伴，无法获得卢恩的力量，
只是一个脱队的瑕疵品。

eng: Feel free to go off and die in a ditch somewhere.
chn: 死得默默无名的下场等着你啊。

eng: Oh, can't seem to wrap your head around your predicament?
chn: ……唉，你还不能接受吗？

eng: It's no surprise. You poor have-nots are a stubborn lot.
chn:
我想也是。
这就是一无所有者的悲哀。

eng: Fine, then.
chn: 好吧。

eng: If you must have a go at it, maidenless as you are, you'll require an education.
chn:
如果没有女巫，还想要挣扎的话──
那我来告诉你吧。

eng: On the ways of the learned Tarnished.
chn: 什么是褪色者该有的作为。

eng: Are you familiar with grace? The golden light that gives life to you Tarnished.
chn:
你知道赐福吧？
就是让你们褪色者能稍事歇息的金光。

eng: You may also behold its golden rays pointing in a particular direction at times.
chn: 那簇金光会产生光芒，指往某个方向──

eng: That is the guidance of grace. The path that a Tarnished must travel.
chn: 那正是所谓“赐福的指引”，褪色者该行进的道路。

eng: It's nothing short of a miracle. That the guidance of grace can lead you,
chn: ……是啊，没有错，指引会告诉你。

eng: maidenless as you are, to the perfect place to die in obscurity.
chn: 没有女巫的你，最后死得默默无名的地方。

eng: What's the matter?
chn: 怎么了吗？

eng: Shouldn't you be off proving yourself, or some such?
chn: 不是还打算继续挣扎吗？

eng: Then go on, take the hint and follow the guidance of grace.
chn: 那就快朝赐福指引的方向前进，

eng: To Castle Stormveil, on the cliff.
chn: 前往断崖上的那座史东薇尔城。

eng: And if, by chance, you do find your way to the castle,
chn: ……要是你有个万分之一的可能，抵达那座城，

eng: you may receive a summons. To the famed Roundtable Hold…
chn: 说不定连你也能受邀到圆桌厅堂……

eng: Guidance will show the way, most certainly.
chn: ……我想赐福指引的方向，

eng: To Castle Stormveil, over on the cliff.
chn: 肯定是那座断崖上的城，史东薇尔。

eng: The home of the decrepit demigod, Godrick the Grafted.
chn: 那座城是又老又丑的半神，“接肢”葛瑞克的居所。

eng: Although I'm afraid you'll never make it that far, hmm.
chn: ……但像你这种人，根本没能耐抵达那座城吧。

eng: Rest assured, I sympathise, deeply. There's no worse fate than to be maidenless.
chn:
唉，我很同情你。
没有女巫的陪伴，看了真让人于心不忍。

eng: Oh, but if, by chance, you do find your way to the castle,
chn:
……噢，不过啊。
要是你有个万分之一的可能，抵达那座城，

eng: you may receive a summons. To the famed Roundtable Hold…
chn: 说不定连你也能受邀到圆桌厅堂……

eng: Oh, yes... Tarnished, are we?
chn: ……噢，你是……是褪色者吧？

eng: Come to the Lands Between for the Elden Ring, hmm?
chn: 渴求艾尔登法环，因此来到这块交界地。

eng: Of course you have. No shame in it.
chn: 我全都知道，事情肯定是如此。

eng: Unfortunately for you, however, you are maidenless.
chn: 但是呢，着实可悲可叹……你没有女巫陪伴。

eng: Without guidance, without the strength of runes, and without an invitation to the Roundtable Hold...
chn:
不知引导在何方，无法获得卢恩的力量，
更不可能受邀到圆桌厅堂……

eng: You are fated, it seems, to die in obscurity.
chn: 只能死得默默无名吧。

eng: Luckily for you, however, there is one shining ray of hope for even the maidenless.
chn: ……即使你没有女巫，也还有一丝希望──

eng: Me. Varré. Take care to listen.
chn: 因为你遇到了我，梵雷。

eng: Are you familiar with grace? The golden light that gives life to you Tarnished.
chn:
你知道赐福吧？
就是让你们褪色者能稍事歇息的金光。

eng: You may also behold its golden rays pointing in a particular direction at times.
chn: 那簇金光会产生光芒，指往某个方向──

eng: That is the guidance of grace. The path that a Tarnished must travel.
chn: 那正是所谓“赐福的指引”，褪色者该行进的道路。

eng: Mm, indeed. Grace's guidance holds the answers.
chn: ……对，没错。指引会告诉你──

eng: It will lead you Tarnished to the path you are meant to follow.
chn: 褪色者该往什么方向去……

eng: Even if it leads you to your grave.
chn: 或是该葬身何处。

eng: Grace's guidance will reveal the path forward, most certainly.
chn: ……我想赐福指引的方向，

eng: To Castle Stormveil, over on the cliff.
chn: 肯定是那座断崖上的城，史东薇尔。

eng: The home of the decrepit demigod, Godrick the Grafted.
chn: 那座城是又老又丑的半神，“接肢”葛瑞克的居所。

eng: It's time you set off, I should think.
chn: ……快动身吧。

eng: To Castle Stormveil, on the cliff, where grace would guide you.
chn: 前往指引提示的方向，那座断崖上的史东薇尔城。

eng: If you seek the Elden Ring, maidenless as you are.
chn: 没有女巫陪伴也渴求艾尔登法环的话，就该如此。

eng: Ohh, well done, well done indeed.
chn: ……噢，等你很久了。

eng: You made it through that entire mess, all the way to Stormveil.
chn: 看来历经一番折腾，你抵达史东薇尔了。

eng: And off you trotted to the Roundtable Hold… My sincerest congratulations.
chn: 而且也受邀到圆桌厅堂……恭喜你。

eng: But, how did you find the Roundtable?
chn: ……那么，看到圆桌厅堂，有什么感想呢？

eng: Oh, you don't have to say it.
chn: 噢，不必说出口，我也明白。

eng: Before, the Roundtable was chock full of venerated warriors, but now, it's home to puff-chests and has-beens.
chn: 过去英雄云集的圆桌厅堂，如今也徒留垃圾残渣。

eng: I fear you've been terribly disappointed.
chn: 你是不是感到失望？

eng: I don't blame you. But still, the Roundtable has its perks.
chn:
我能体会。只是现况如此，
如果你还是认为这对自己有所帮助……

eng: Why not earn a seat? Fly straight and true, so to speak.
chn:
那首先，要不要立下目标──
成为圆桌厅堂真正的一员呢？

eng: Ahh, then you're interested? A wise choice indeed.
chn: 噢，你有意愿啊，真是了不起。

eng: To join the Roundtable proper, you must acquire a Great Rune, and request audience...
chn:
要成为圆桌厅堂真正的一员，
必须要拥有大卢恩，还需要……

eng: ...with the Two Fingers, in the inner chamber.
chn: 觐见位于厅堂最深处房间的双指。

eng: They are the purported masters of the grace that guides your kind, the Tarnished.
chn: 那位是为你们褪色者降下指引赐福的尊者。

eng: Mm, yes, pay them a visit, so that you may see for yourself.
chn: 对，所以你有必要觐见祂、知道祂。

eng: Challenge Godrick the Grafted, lord of Stormveil, to acquire a Great Rune.
chn:
至于大卢恩，去挑战史东薇尔的城主，
“接肢”葛瑞克吧。

eng: Decrepit, he may be, but a demigod he remains. And of course, an inheritor of a Great Rune.
chn:
即使又老又丑，那也还是个半神，
也是拥有大卢恩的碎片君王。

eng: Worse yet, I hear old Godrick's acquired a ferocious new toy to graft...
chn:
……不过这阵子，听说葛瑞克
拿到了相当致命的接肢祭品。

eng: So. Prepare for the worst.
chn: 你要当心啊。

eng: Yes, I see. Perhaps it's just as well.
chn: 是吗？唉，我想也是吧。

eng: Besides, you are maidenless. One can only do so much with the materials provided.
chn: 你没有女巫陪伴，本质就是脱队的瑕疵品。

eng: But then again, if you should realise the error of your ways,
chn: 但如果这决定只是一时糊涂，你回心转意了，

eng: I'm always willing to hear you out.
chn: 再来找我吧。

eng: Oh, have you decided to have a go after all? At joining the Roundtable proper?
chn:
……噢，你回心转意，
想成为圆桌厅堂的真正一员了？

eng: What's the matter?
chn: 怎么了吗？

eng: Aren't you supposed to be earning your place at the Roundtable Hold?
chn: 不是想成為圓桌廳堂真正的一員嗎？

eng: Then you must face Godrick the Grafted, lord of Stormveil,
chn: 那就快去挑战史东薇尔的城主，“接肢”葛瑞克……

eng: for without a Great Rune, you will not be granted audience.
chn: 取得大卢恩之后，

eng: With the Two Fingers, in the inner chamber.
chn: 觐见位于圆桌厅堂，最深处房间的双指。

eng: Ohh, well done, well done indeed.
chn: ……噢，等你很久了。

eng: You bested Godrick the Grafted, and claimed a Great Rune.
chn: 成功打倒“接肢”葛瑞克，取得大卢恩了啊。

eng: You felled a demigod, and claimed a Great Rune.
chn: 成功打倒半神，取得大卢恩了啊。

eng: My congratulations.
chn: 恭喜你。

eng: Now, visit the Roundtable Hold.
chn: ……那么，请前往圆桌厅堂吧。

eng: For an audience with the Two Fingers, in the inner chamber.
chn: 到最深处的房间，觐见双指。

eng: Go to the Roundtable Hold.
chn: ……请前往圆桌厅堂吧。

eng: For an audience with the Two Fingers, in the inner chamber.
chn: 到最深处的房间，觐见双指。

eng: Ah, there you are.
chn: ……噢，等你很久了。

eng: You claimed a Great Rune, and had your audience. With the Two Fingers, at the Roundtable Hold.
chn:
不仅成功取得了大卢恩，
也觐见了圆桌厅堂的双指。

eng: You've had your audience. With the Two Fingers, at the Roundtable Hold.
chn: 看来你觐见了圆桌厅堂的双指。

eng: What was your impression?
chn: 那么，你有什么想法？

eng: Ah-ha, your intuition serves you well.
chn: ……你果然也有感觉啊。

eng: My doubts had been piling up, you see.
chn: 老实说，我也有同感。

eng: ...The words of the Two Fingers cannot be trusted.
chn: ……双指的话不能相信。

eng: Truly, naught but rambling, senile delusions.
chn: 仿佛是上了年纪的老人在说满口空话……

eng: I believe, that when the Elden Ring was shattered, the Two Fingers were corrupted, their guidance; skewed.
chn:
我心里是这么想的：当艾尔登法环破碎之际，
双指与祂的指引是否也同样毁坏了？

eng: Even worse, the Fingers harbor no love for our kind.
chn: 而且，我感受不到双指对我们的爱──

eng: That's the part that irks the most.
chn: 这是我最不能忍受的部分。

eng: Oh, I have a gift for you, something fit only for the wise.
chn:
噢，还有一件事。
有件物品想要送给聪颖的你。

eng: A means for circumventing the draw of the Two Fingers.
chn: ……这是可以摆脱双指指引的手段，

eng: Give it a try, won't you?
chn: 请你务必一试。

eng: And if it please you, may we meet again.
chn: 如果你对此感到满意，我们再见面吧。

eng: I've high hopes for you. My lambkin.
chn: 我很期待再会呢，亲爱的。

eng: You don't say. Well, what a relief that must be.
chn: ……原来如此，那很好。

eng: You may go, then. My work here is done.
chn: 那么请你出发吧，我的使命已经达成。

eng: May the wisdom of the Two Fingers guide you.
chn: 愿你有双指的指引。

eng: Oh? Is something wrong?
chn: 嗯？有什么事吗？

eng: Be sure to try that finger I gave you.
chn: ……送给你的那手指，请务必一试。

eng: There's no reason to dither.
chn: 你根本不需要犹豫──

eng: The Tarnished were spurned by grace, forsaken by the Two Fingers. And now they ask you to mend their crumbling world?
chn:
赐福跟双指都曾对褪色者弃之不顾……
等到面临毁灭了，又向你们求助。

eng: Hah, your loyalties are misplaced with them.
chn: 对于这种存在，哪有必要讲求情义？

eng: Be sure to try that finger I gave you.
chn: ……送给你的那手指，请务必一试。

eng: I'm quite certain that you'll take to it.
chn: 你肯定会感到满意。

eng: Oh, lambkin, so pleased you're here.
chn: 啊，亲爱的，你来啦。

eng: I'm glad that you're enjoying my gift.
chn: 看来你很喜欢我送的礼物。

eng: Mmm, I knew it from the very start.
chn: 噢，和我料想的一样，

eng: You have a taste for noble blood.
chn: 尊贵之血和你实在太相配了。

eng: I wish to anoint you a proper inductee.
chn: 我想要邀请你成为我们的正式成员──

eng: A knight to serve Luminary Mohg, the Lord of Blood, and establish a new dynasty.
chn:
成为“鲜血君王”蒙格大人的骑士，
与我们一同建立新王朝。

eng: Luminary Mohg has strength, vision, and of course, love.
chn:
蒙格大人不只有强大的力量与信念，
也满怀着爱。

eng: So, what do you say, my lambkin?
chn: 想必答案呼之欲出了吧，亲爱的？

eng: Mm, yes, who would have it any other way?
chn: 没错，我想也只有这种答案。

eng: Now, take this.
chn: 那么，请收下这个吧。

eng: For your final trial. Soak the cloth with a maiden's blood.
chn: 这是最后的试炼──请用那块布浸满女巫的血。

eng: Normally, this ritual would involve killing one's own maiden, and recanting the wisdom of the Two Fingers.
chn:
这仪式原本是杀害自己的女巫，
代表与双指的指引就此诀别……

eng: But since you are maidenless, the blood of anyone's maiden will do.
chn: 但因为你没有女巫，所以用其他女巫的血也无妨。

eng: Oh my, perhaps you misheard me.
chn: ……看来我听错了吧。

eng: Nothing wrong with giving you a day or two.
chn: ……我们择日再谈吧？

eng: For your ears to clear out.
chn: 下一次希望能听到正确的答案。

eng: Oh, it's you.
chn: 噢，是你啊。

eng: Could you tell me once more? Your honest reply.
chn: 可以请你再一次给出答案吗？

eng: Ahh, my lambkin.
chn: ……噢，亲爱的。

eng: You've completed your final trial.
chn: 你完成最后的试炼了。

eng: And with this, you are a formal inductee.
chn: 如此一来，你就是我们正式的成员──

eng: A knight who will assist Luminary Mohg, the Lord of Blood, in the establishment of a new dynasty.
chn: 与“鲜血君王”蒙格大人一同建立新王朝的骑士。

eng: Now, give me your finger.
chn: 来吧，请伸出你的手指。

eng: This noble blood will be an immutable badge of honor, once it settles. Inside of you.
chn: 让尊贵之血融入你的体内，化作永恒的证明。

eng: Oh, good heavens. Clench your teeth, or something.
chn: 哎，真是丢人。好好忍耐吧。

eng: Never forget that feeling of agony.
chn: ……千万要记住这股痛楚，

eng: For it is what binds you, to Luminary Mohg. To all of us.
chn: 这正是蒙格大人与我们之间的连系铁证。

eng: Ha ha ha...
chn: 呵呵呵。

eng: You have the sweetest scream. My lambkin.
chn: 刚才的惨叫真是动听啊，亲爱的。

eng: Oh, another thing. You should have this.
chn: 啊，对了。我要把这个交给你。

eng: A medal granted by the new Mohgwyn dynasty.
chn: 这是新王朝“蒙格温”的勋章──

eng: With the power to grant audience with Luminary Mohg.
chn: 代表有资格觐见蒙格大人的特殊奖章。

eng: I've gone out of my way to provide one to you.
chn: 亲爱的，这是特别为你疏通拿到的喔。

eng: But you mustn't use it just yet.
chn: 但目前还不允许使用那枚勋章，

eng: The meeting must wait until the Mohgwyn dynasty commences.
chn: 要等即将到来的蒙格温王朝开创之后，才能觐见大人。

eng: Luminary Mohg yet slumbers beside the Divinity.
chn: 蒙格大人还在与神共度良宵，

eng: We must endure a little longer.
chn: 应该还需要一些时间。

eng: Ahh, it is trying, but we must be patient.
chn: 噢，真教人迫不及待啊。

eng: One day, you will be elevated, deservedly, basking in love.
chn: 你肯定能受到重用，沐浴在大人的爱之下。

eng: Right, my lambkin?
chn: 对不对呢？亲爱的。

eng: Ha ha ha...
chn: 呵呵呵。

eng: The cloth is your final trial. Soak it with the blood of a maiden.
chn:
交给你的布是用在最后的试炼──
用那块布浸满女巫的血吧。

eng: The blood of anyone's maiden will do. You are maidenless, after all.
chn: ……用任一女巫的血都可以喔，因为你没有女巫嘛。

eng: What business does a maidenless wretch like you have here?
chn: ……没有女巫的瑕疵品，来这里做什么呢？

eng: Did you come seeking violence, upon learning my esteemed position under Luminary Mohg?
chn:
我是光芒万丈的蒙格大人的重臣，
你是知道，才如此放肆？

eng: I'll take pleasure in ensuring you regret this.
chn: ……我会让你悔不当初。

eng: Before you die in obscurity.
chn: 死得默默无名吧。

eng: You seek violence, heedless of my warning, though you have been raised to a knight of the dynasty?
chn:
……身为王朝的骑士，对警告充耳不闻，
还做出如此蛮横的行为。

eng: I am pained, to the very depths of my being.
chn: 我打从心底对你感到失望。

eng: I'll ensure you regret this, my lambkin.
chn: ……亲爱的，我会让你悔不当初。

eng: Enjoy your miserable death.
chn: 接受横死的下场吧。

eng: How dare you trouble Luminary Mohg's passions.
chn: ……不准让蒙格大人的心有一丝烦忧，

eng: You vulgar churl.
chn: 下等的瑕疵品。

eng: I made a grave error.
chn: ……我真是犯下了大错。

eng: Why must I be...
chn: ……我为什么……

eng: Disgraced by this lowborn...
chn: 会败给这种瑕疵品……

eng: O...Luminary...Mohg...
chn: ……蒙格大人……蒙格大人……

eng: Please grant...the strength...you promised...
chn: 请您赐予小的，那股力量……

eng: I have given...everything...
chn: 小的已经竭尽全力……

eng: Please...my lord...
chn: 蒙格大人，求求您……

eng: Please, answer me...Luminary...Mohg.
chn: ……蒙格大人，您为什么保持沉默？

eng: A-ahh...
chn: 啊啊……啊啊啊……

eng: Bless the Mohgwyn Dynasty, with love!
chn: 愿蒙格温王朝沐浴在爱之下……！

eng: <groan>
Oh?
chn: 哦？

eng: Do you even comprehend?
chn: 你明白这些举动……

eng: The gravity of this choice.
chn: 代表着什么吗？

eng: Very well.
chn: ……好吧。

eng: If you mistake kindness for frailty of heart,
chn: 如果你以为，我只是个和善的好人，

eng: then perhaps a more physical lesson is in order!
chn: 那我就让你体会，看不起人的代价！

eng: You disappoint me.
chn: ……实在可叹。

eng: Perhaps noble blood is too rich for the maidenless.
chn:
对没有女巫陪伴的人而言，
尊贵之血可能过于刺激了……

eng: Well, no sense in sparing your life now.
chn: 没有活命的价值呢。

eng: You were a maidenless upstart to begin with.
chn: 说到底，你也只是个没有女巫陪伴的瑕疵品。

eng: You will die nameless, without ceremony.
chn: 默默无名地横死路边吧。

eng: Oh dear, a pity it's come to this, my lambkin.
chn: 唉，亲爱的，我真的很惋惜。

eng: How does it feel to die a failure?
chn: 凄惨地死去吧。

eng: Materials of quality are so hard to find, these days...
chn: 拥有资质的人真的不好找呢……

eng: You maidenless runt...
chn: ……没有女巫陪伴的，瑕疵品……

eng: Who do you think I am?
chn: 就凭你，你知道我是谁吗……？

eng: <groan>
Luminary Mohg...
chn: ……蒙格大人……

eng: Bless the Mohgwyn Dynasty, with love!
chn: 愿蒙格温王朝沐浴在爱之下……！

eng: <groan>
You there.
chn: 不好意思，那边的那位……

eng: Come over here, would you?
chn: 你能不能过来这里？

eng: You're Tarnished, aren't you?
chn: 你是褪色者，对吧？

eng: I would advise against taking the main gate into the castle.
chn: 想进城里的话，劝你最好别从正门进去。

eng: It's tightly guarded by hardened old hands.
chn: 那边有一群身手高超的士兵挡着。

eng: Try the opening right here.
chn: 但你也别烦恼，从那边的洞穴进去吧。

eng: The guards don't know about it.
chn: 那条小路士兵并不知情。

eng: You'll breach the castle undetected.
chn: 应该有办法直接入侵城内，不被他们发现。

eng: Yes, that's the spirit.
chn: 嗯，明智的选择。

eng: ...You're just the kind of Tarnished that I like.
chn: ……像你这样的褪色者，我很有好感。

eng: I pray for your success.
chn: 希望你一路幸运。

eng: Fair enough, you certainly don't have to trust me.
chn: 好吧……也对，你会怀疑也是正常……

eng: Well, If you must go through the gates, I'll signal them to open.
chn:
我尊重你的选择。
如果你想从正门进去，我会大喊开门。

eng: But of course, I'd advise against it.
chn:
……但你再想想，这样好吗？
我劝你还是仔细思考过吧？

eng: Use that opening to breach the castle.
chn: 想进城里的话，从那边的洞穴进去吧。

eng: The guards haven't a clue about it.
chn: 那条小路士兵并不知情。

eng: You'll slip right inside undetected.
chn: 应该有办法直接入侵城内，不被他们发现。

eng: Of course. I understand.
chn: 好吧……我尊重你的选择。

eng: When you approach the gates, I'll signal them to open.
chn: 如果你想从正门进去，我会大喊开门。

eng: It's only your neck on the line, after all.
chn: ……人如果一心求死，真的没人能拉得住。

eng: The gates! Open the gates!
chn: 开门！把门打开吧！

eng: ...You're just the kind of Tarnished that I like.
chn: ……像你这样的褪色者，我很有好感。

eng: I pray for your success.
chn: 希望你一路幸运。

eng: The gates are open. Do as you like.
chn: ……正门打开了，看你想怎么做吧。

eng: It's only your neck on the line, after all.
chn: ……人如果一心求死，真的没人能拉得住。

eng: Oh, oh, you...
Oh, great, I'm glad you're here.
chn: 啊，对、对了，我在找你……

eng: Just a small reward, I was saving it for you.
chn: 之前要给你饯别礼，结果没能交给你。

eng: Please, it's all yours.
chn: 快点收下吧。

eng: Good, now let's be on our way, shall we?
chn: ……好啦，你趁现在快走。

eng: Wouldn't want the guards to spot you.
chn: 现在士兵还没有发现异状。

eng: Hop along, will you?
chn: ……好啦，快点走吧。

eng: What'll happen if the guards catch you strutting about?
chn: 再慢吞吞的，被士兵发现了怎么办？

eng: Rubbish...
chn: ……派不上用场嘛……

eng: Another one...another one all skin and bones.
chn: 这个也是……这也一样干瘪……

eng: ...Worse than a petty squire...
chn: ……毕竟是上不了台面的家伙……

eng: ...Ahh, not a muscle on this one either...
chn: ……唉，这一个也太细瘦了……

eng: Oh, you...
chn: ……噫！是、是你……

eng: For god's sake, don't scare me like that!
chn: 我真的吓了一大跳，别这样吓人啊。

eng: What, oh, just clearing out some corpses.
chn: 我、我没有在做什么，只是在清理尸体。

eng: Can't just leave them about, you know, they'll start to pong, eh.
chn:
你想想，如果放着不管，
味道肯定会非常不好闻啊。

eng: Oh, hello. No, don't you mind me for a minute.
chn: ……噢，没关系，你不用放在心上。

eng: It's my job to keep the grounds clean.
chn: 因为清理环境是我分内的工作啊。

eng: Oh, hello... Glad to see you safe.
chn: 噢，是你啊……人平安无事就好。

eng: I've come into some fine goods.
chn: 其实最近我拿到了一些物资，

eng: Only, it turns out I can't use a one of them.
chn: 但都是我用不到的东西。

eng: Perhaps you'd like to take them off my hands?
chn: 不嫌弃的话，要不要来买一些？

eng: Oh, hello, anything you'd care to purchase?
chn: 噢，是你啊。要不要来买些东西？

eng: Fare thee well.
chn: 那个，就是啊……

eng: I pray for your success.
chn: 希望你一路幸运。

eng: What a pathetic excuse for a Lord you were. Craven to the bone.
chn: ……软弱的君王啊，真是可悲。

eng: Pushing me about like that. And after all that grafting? Where did that get you?
chn: 劳师动众要人帮忙“接肢”，结果落得这种下场？

eng: Look down, on me, would you?
chn: 竟敢贬低我！

eng: Godrick? You filthy slug.
chn: 葛瑞克，你这蛞蝓！

eng: Feel it! Feel it! Feel my bloody wrath!
chn: 活该！活该啊！感受我的怒火吧！

eng: Oh...hello there.
chn: ……噢，是你啊。

eng: This weasel was... Godrick was always looking down on me.
chn: 这东西，葛瑞克做出贬低我的行为，

eng: He got what he bloody deserved, thanks to you.
chn: 我只是让他受到应有的报应。

eng: I tell you though, what goes around comes around.
chn:
只是话说回来，
世上真的有所谓的因果吧？

eng: He had an ugly heart, an uglier countenance, and met the ugliest of ends, eh.
chn:
外表丑陋，内心丑陋，下场也非常丑陋，
全配合得天衣无缝。

eng: He he he he he...
chn: 嘻……嘻嘻……

eng: Now, I suppose I'm free.
chn: ……这下我终于自由了，

eng: I can do whatever takes my fancy...
chn: 能够尽情做想做的事情。

eng: Can't I, mate?
chn: 你说对不对？

eng: You giving that to me?
chn: ……你要给我吗？

eng: Well, I suppose I did save your life, in a way.
chn: ……我确实对你有恩。

eng: I'll gladly take it off your hands. Be rude not to, eh!
chn: 那我当成谢礼，直接收下了。

eng: Mmm, you Tarnished are alright by me.
chn: 噢，像你这样的褪色者，

eng: The sweet ones like you, anyway.
chn: 我真的很有好感。

eng: Ah, you, is it?
chn: ……噢，是你啊。

eng: Haven't seen your mug in quite some time.
chn: 真的好久不见了。

eng: As you can see, I'm the new Lady's attendant.
chn: 你也看到了，到头来我还是王的奴仆，

eng: Freedom? Wasn't worth squat.
chn: 什么鬼自由，一点价值都没有。

eng: B-besides, I like it 'round 'ere...
chn: ……不过，事情也不算太糟。

eng: Lady Nepheli's still fair of heart and countenance...
chn:
涅斐丽王没有丑陋的外表，
也没有丑陋的内心，至少现在还是如此。

eng: Still, I have the Lady's trust.
chn: ……况且啊，王她相信我。

eng: ...So I can loot all the corpses I like.
chn: ……幸亏如此，我也能尽情搜刮尸体。

eng: I'll let you take a look at the goods, if you fancy.
chn: 不嫌弃的话，来做点买卖吧。

eng: Ah, back again, are we? Curious one, you are.
chn: ……又来了啊？你也真是怪人。

eng: Well then, what are you after?
chn: ……好吧，想找些什么？

eng: Ouch!
chn: 啊。

eng: Oi, what're you doing?
chn: 你在做什么？

eng: Stop that!
chn: 快住手啊。

eng: Blast, what's it to you!
chn: 可恶，怎么回事啊？

eng: Step back, you wretched Tarnished!
chn: 下贱的褪色者，你在耍人吗！

eng: Finally given up the ghost, eh...
chn: 总算死了吗……

eng: Oh, don't worry, I've got big plans for what's left of you...
chn: 我会让你的牺牲，发挥最大的价值。

eng: Hah! Do you feel it?
chn: 怎么样，这下你懂了吧！

eng: Do you feel my bloody wrath?
chn: 感受到我的怒火了吧！

eng: Damn it all. Why is it always me...
chn: ……混账啊，为什么光是我……

eng: What did I do to deserve...
chn: 我又做了什么……

eng: But...I'm free...
chn: ……我自由了，

eng: I can do...what I like...
chn: 能做想做的事……

eng: Good Lord! Good God of Vengeance!
chn: 噢，神啊！复仇之神啊！

eng: Till grudges soak the lands!
chn: 请庇佑复仇之心充斥人间！

eng: Oh...
chn: 哦，你是谁……？

eng: I see, you're Tarnished.
chn: 原来啊，你是褪色者吧？

eng: I am Guilbert. A Redeemer of vengeance. In all its forms.
chn:
我是吉尔伯特，是复仇的代理人。
任何仇恨都能代为寻仇。

eng: By the way...
chn: 话说回来，我问你……

eng: Have you heard of the crucible knights?
chn: 你知道熔炉骑士吗？

eng: There's one by the name of Ordovis, and I must find him.
chn: 我在找他们的其中一名成员，名叫奥陶琵斯。

eng: He's an old hero of the Shattering, but there's a grudge out against him.
chn:
……听说他是经历破碎战争的老英雄，
但现在还是有人要向他复仇。

eng: The Lands Between are brimming with those who cannot die. It makes for a cesspool of vengeance.
chn:
交界地有太多死不了的人，
所以也是复仇念头丛生的苦海。

eng: ...Gives me a shiver just thinking about it...
chn: ……实在让人为之沸腾……

eng: These fellows?
chn: ……你想问这些人是谁吗？

eng: Who knows, just some lads who did someone wrong.
chn: 招人怨恨了，事情就是这么简单。

eng: They got what was coming, nothing more.
chn: 只是遭到报应，然后丢了性命。

eng: If you're intent on revenge, pray to the God of Vengeance.
chn:
……如果你也有真心想寻仇的对象，
就向复仇之神祈祷吧。

eng: You'll have yourself a corpse in no time.
chn: 过不了多久，对方肯定会变成一具尸体。

eng: You're Tarnished. Then you're here to fight, aren't you?
chn: 你是褪色者，那应该也会战斗吧？

eng: For the Elden Ring.
chn: 尤其事关艾尔登法环的时候。

eng: Well, there's something you ought to know.
chn: 那么，你最好记住一件事。

eng: There's an aberration of a blacksmith past the checkpoint that leads to Stormveil.
chn: 在前往史东薇尔城的关卡前，有一个混种的铁匠。

eng: He doesn't seem to think much of anyone or anything, but oddly, he's willing to smith weapons for Tarnished.
chn:
那铁匠个性顽固，怨恨一切，
但不知怎地，会替褪色者锻造武器。

eng: He has a fine arm. Have him take a crack at your goods.
chn: 总之他确实有本事，叫他帮你锻造武器吧。

eng: ...The question for me, of course, is whether he's in need of any vengeance...
chn: ……我个人认为，那倒像是一种复仇的形式。

eng: In the Lands Between, everyone lives longer than they should.
chn: 在交界地的人都太长寿了，

eng: They may go mad, but even so, they plead to the God of Vengeance.
chn:
所以才会发疯。
发疯之后，又会向复仇之神祈祷……

eng: That's why I'm here. To exact revenge for those who can't do it themselves.
chn: 我再代为寻仇。

eng: Like someone did for me, when I...when I was but a tyke.
chn: 就像在小时候，有人替我挥下复仇之剑……

eng: Oh, there you are...
chn: ……啊，是你啊……

eng: It must have been a dream. Strange.
chn: ……好像在做梦，感觉真不可思议。

eng: I was fighting at your side. Against Ordovis of the Crucible.
chn: 我竟然和你一起对上“熔炉”的奥陶琵斯。

eng: It was a revenge so sweet, fit to serve the very God of Vengeance.
chn: 这场复仇之精彩，足以献给复仇之神。

eng: Heh...
Maybe you're meant to be a Redeemer, as well...
chn: ……或许你也拥有成为代理人的命运。

eng: I was fighting at your side. Against Ordovis, the Crucible Knight.
chn: 我竟然和你一起对上“熔炉”的奥陶琵斯。

eng: Ah, you...
chn: ……啊，是你啊……

eng: Did you defeat Ordovis of the Crucible?
chn: 你打败“熔炉”的奥陶琵斯了？

eng: I could sense it. The God of Vengeance surely smiled upon that battle.
chn:
我感觉得到──即使你毫无自觉，
但那无疑是一场该献给复仇之神的战斗。

eng: Heh...
Maybe you're meant to be a Redeemer too...
chn: ……或许你也拥有成为代理人的命运。

eng: Did you defeat Ordovis, the Crucible Knight.
chn: 你打败“熔炉”的奥陶琵斯了？

eng: Alright, then.
chn: 那接下来……

eng: I'm off to Stormveil Castle.
chn: 我要进入史东薇尔城。

eng: Lord Godrick has kept busy with his grafting...
chn: 君王之一的葛瑞克重复骇人的接肢行为……

eng: Slicing off arms like harvesting ears of wheat. He's run up a mighty debt in blood.
chn: 像割稻一般地切下他人的手臂，招致了许多人的怨恨。

eng: A demigod, yes, he may be...
chn: 即使贵为半神……

eng: But no one escapes a Redeemer.
chn: 也不可能逃得过代理人的手掌心。

eng: I was thinking...
chn: ……除此之外，

eng: Godrick must have an idea.
chn: 葛瑞克肯定知情──

eng: About the vengeance sought by General Radahn, to whom I swore my oath.
chn: 我等誓约所在，拉塔恩将军的仇恨源头……

eng: ...Yes, Godrick's corpse will know what to do...
chn: 我会讯问他的尸体。

eng: Godrick must know.
chn: 葛瑞克肯定知情──

eng: That of all the grudges born of the Shattering, Malenia the Rotted is the object of the most profound.
chn:
破碎战争中最大的仇恨源头，
“腐败”玛莲妮亚身在何方……

eng: Ahh, my head is throbbing, everything is bright red...
chn: ……啊，整颗脑袋鲜红沸腾……

eng: Master Radahn, is this how it feels to ferment with vengeance?
chn: 拉塔恩啊，这就是复仇，就是迫不及待吗？

eng: I can hardly keep from trembling...
chn: 必须止住颤抖、我必须停止颤抖……

eng: Well, well, you've made yourself a target of vengeance.
chn: ……没想到你会变成他人寻仇的对象。

eng: Perhaps this, too, was meant to be.
chn: 这也是命运吧。

eng: Prepare to become an offering.
chn: ……好了，成为复仇的祭品──

eng: Trust me, you'll rest easier as a corpse.
chn: 准备变成尸体吧。

eng: Hello there, I don't believe we've met.
chn: ……第一次见到你啊，你好。

eng: I'm afraid you've made yourself the object of somebody's ire.
chn: 不好意思，你是他人的寻仇对象。

eng: As a Redeemer, I'm bound to exact revenge.
chn: 我身为代理人，要取你的性命。

eng: Prepare to become an offering.
chn: ……好了，成为复仇的祭品──

eng: Trust me, you'll rest easier as a corpse.
chn: 准备变成尸体吧。

eng:
Whoah, what're you playing at? (OKテイク, v303902000_ALT_3)
What're you playing at?
chn: 你有什么意图？

eng: This is a little awkward.
chn: 虽是情非得已，

eng: There's no revenge to be had in this killing.
chn: 竟然要杀害没有遭人怨恨的人。

eng: Not too sharp, are you?
chn: ……你还真是“锲而不舍”啊。

eng: If you want to die, ask someone else.
chn: 既然一心寻死，能不能去找其他人？

eng: Let it be known.
chn: ……劝你最好记住，

eng: Wherever vengeance must be had, a Redeemer there will be...
chn: 只要复仇存在，代理人是如影随形……

eng: Oh, my Lord. Good God of Vengeance!
chn: ……噢，神啊，复仇之神啊……

eng: Till grudges soak the lands...
chn: 请庇佑复仇之心充斥人间……

eng: Don't you see now?
chn: 你也很清楚吧？

eng: There is no escape from a Redeemer.
chn: 不可能逃得过代理人的手掌心。

eng: Death ought to be earned.
chn: 一心寻死的人真是恼人。

eng: What am I to make of this?
chn: 这场战斗毫无意义……

eng: Didn't I tell you before?
chn: ……我没有告诉过你吗？

eng: No one escapes a Redeemer.
chn: 你不可能逃得过代理人的手掌心。

eng: Prepare to become an offering, once and for all.
chn: ……好了，这次真的该成为复仇的祭品──

eng: Trust me, you'll rest easier as a corpse.
chn: 准备变成尸体吧。

eng: I see... You must be Ranni's new hireling.
chn: ……你是菈妮推荐的人？

eng: I see... You must be Ranni's new girl.
chn: ……你是菈妮推荐的人？

eng: Yes, yes, I've heard all about you.
chn: 嗯，我有听说。

eng: I am Seluvis, preceptor in the sorcerous arts.
chn: 我是赛尔维斯，是魔法教授。

eng: I don't know what it is the mistress sees in a provincial Tarnished like you,
chn:
这种没见过世面的褪色者，
真不知道她抱有什么期待。

eng: but since we have the misfortune of serving the same Lady,
chn: 只是偏偏那么巧，很不幸地共事一主，

eng: I ask that you kindly try not to drag us all down with you.
chn: 希望你能有点用处。

eng: I reside...in another tower, close by.
chn: ……我待在这附近的另一座塔。

eng: Come and pay me a visit...
chn: 如果你希望自己对菈妮有点用处，

eng: Should you wish to be of actual service to Mistress Ranni.
chn: 就过来找我吧。

eng: If it were up to me, I wouldn't waste my time on the likes of you.
chn:
照道理而言，
我是不可能为你这种角色花时间，

eng: But who am I to stand against the wishes of my Lady?
chn: 但我也不能无视她的意思……

eng: Well, well. You took me at my word.
chn: ……哦，你还真的过来找我？

eng: Did you not realise I was merely being polite? You provincials never cease to amaze...
chn:
连场面话都听不懂，
所以我才受不了井底之蛙。

eng: Hmm, I suppose you're here now.
chn: ……唉，既然人来都来了，

eng: Perhaps I'll give you something to do.
chn: 那就麻烦你办一件事吧。

eng: I'd like you to find a woman called Nepheli, to administer a potion.
chn: 找出名叫涅斐丽的女人，让她喝下药水。

eng: Even you can do that much, can't you?
chn: 才这点事情，你办得到吧？

eng: Good, good.
chn: 很好。

eng: Now I shall hand over the potion in question.
chn: 那这瓶药你收着。

eng: Find Nepheli, and ensure she drinks it.
chn: 找出涅斐丽，让她喝下。

eng: I expect glad tidings. And soon.
chn: ……我等你的好消息。

eng: I see...
chn: 原来如此……

eng: What a wretched bunch you Tarnished are.
chn: 所以我才说，褪色者就是没眼界。

eng: Do you understand? I've given you a very fine chance.
chn: 我是在给你机会，你明不明白？

eng: If you complete this simple task, I will graciously permit you to learn from me.
chn:
要你去办个事，事成之后，
你就有机会接受我的指导。

eng: Even you wish to serve our Lady well, do you not?
chn: 你也想为菈妮出一己之力吧？

eng: Turn those little cogs upstairs, and return with the correct answer.
chn: 想好之后再给出回答。

eng: Have you fumbled out the correct answer now?
chn: ……好啦，让我听听你深思熟虑后的回答吧。

eng: Then you will undertake my task?
chn: 你愿意替我办事吗？

eng: You are peerless in your dullardry.
chn: 你真的是无药可救的蠢蛋。

eng: Fine. I can feel my wits evaporating in your mere presence.
chn: 够了，和你对话只会消耗我的脑力，

eng: Don't bother wasting your breath on me again.
chn: 不要再向我搭话。

eng: I could have sworn I told you to trouble me no more...
chn: ……我都说了，不要再向我搭话……

eng: Are you here to tender your sincere apology, and undertake my task?
chn: 难道你是真心悔过，想为我办事？

eng: Good, good.
chn: 很好。

eng: As a man of abundant charity, I accept your apology.
chn: 我为人宽大为怀，愿意接受你的悔过。

eng: Now I shall hand over the potion in question.
chn: 这瓶药你收着。

eng: Find Nepheli, and ensure she drinks it.
chn: 找出涅斐丽，让她喝下。

eng: I expect glad tidings. And soon.
chn: ……我等你的好消息。

eng: I've no time for idle chit chat.
chn: ……我不想听废话。

eng: The only thing I will hear from you is a report of your task's completion.
chn: 我想听的是事情办妥了没。

eng: Are we understood? Then off you trot.
chn: 听懂了就快点出去，

eng: I have enough on my plate.
chn: 我忙得很。

eng: Ahh, so you made Nepheli drink the potion?
chn: ……哦？这样啊。涅斐丽喝下去了？

eng: Well done. You are a touch more useful than I had thought.
chn: 做得很好嘛，想不到你还真有点用处。

eng: Well done. You are a slight more useful than I had thought.
chn: 做得很好嘛，想不到你还真有点用处。

eng: Very well. Then you shall have your gift.
chn: 很好，那我就赐予你天大的名誉，

eng: Knowledge of the sorcerous arts, under the tutelage of the great Preceptor Seluvis.
chn: 允许你接受我魔法教授，赛尔维斯的指导。

eng: I doubt much of it will lay within the grasp of a mere Tarnished, but...
chn: 绝大部分都是褪色者无法掌握的知识，

eng: If you put your mind to it, perhaps you won't embarrass our Lady.
chn: 你就尽力学，努力为菈妮尽一份力吧。

eng: You wish to begin right this moment?
chn: ……这么快就想求人指教？

eng: Well, your impatience, though boorish, is understandable. Let's have at it.
chn: 真是肤浅，虽然我能体会这种心情。

eng: Begging for another lesson so soon?
chn: ……又来求人指教了？

eng: There remains much to be done. Make it quick.
chn: 我很忙啊……

eng: Come now, the pretence of comprehension becomes you not.
chn: ……想假装自己都学会了是无妨，

eng: Bend over backwards any further and you're apt to break.
chn: 但要记住，所谓的棒打出头鸟啊。

eng: Well, well. You're asking me about that, are you?
chn: ……哦，这件事你拿来问我？

eng: The task was left to you and the mongrel, was it not?
chn: 那不是你跟那只蠢狗的任务吗？

eng: Not only are you incompetent, but shameless to boot.
chn: 无能就算了，你们还这么不知耻？

eng: Well...there's no helping it.
chn: ……不过，好吧。

eng: Now's as good a time as any. I'll let you in on it.
chn: 时机也成熟了，我告诉你。

eng: There's a glintstone sorcerer by the name of Sellen in Limgrave.
chn:
在宁姆格福，
那里应该有位名叫瑟濂的辉石魔法师。

eng: She owes me for the help I gave her when she was expelled from the academy.
chn: 在她被逐出学院的时候，我关照过她。

eng: I asked her to look into the matter some time ago.
chn: 以前也很常委托她调查事情。

eng: I'll write you a letter of introduction. Go ask her.
chn: 我帮你写介绍信，带着过去问她吧。

eng: So, you had Nepheli drink the potion? Truly?
chn: ……你是真的有让涅斐丽喝下药水？

eng: Hmm. Then perhaps something was amiss with it.
chn: ……嗯，既然如此，代表那瓶药有问题。

eng: It's concocted from the finest ingredients. But perhaps I should review the recipe.
chn:
那是用稀有材料制成的药水，
看来需要重新检验一遍。

eng: I may have expected too much of her, to begin with.
chn: 但也有可能，是我对那女人的期望过高……

eng: You break into a man's private chambers, rooting about as you please?
chn: ……你不经同意，擅自溜进别人的房间翻箱倒柜？

eng: Your oafishness knows no bounds.
chn: 真是肤浅至极。

eng: Fine and well.
chn: ……唉，想想也罢。

eng: You tricked Nepheli, and had her drink the potion.
chn: 你欺骗涅斐丽，让她喝下那瓶药──

eng: I believe that makes you my accomplice.
chn: 仔细一想，你我早就是共犯。

eng: You yearn for a puppet of your own, hmm?
chn: 你也想拥有自己的傀儡吧？

eng: Well, normally one of your stature would never be allowed.
chn: 真是不知天高地厚的奢望，

eng: But perhaps I can make a very special exception.
chn: 但我可以特别开恩，实现你的愿望。

eng: Now, choose.
chn: 来，选吧。

eng: Ah, I knew you'd see things my way.
chn: 啊，我就相信你会这么做。

eng: You knew you were already my accomplice, and as such...
chn: 你我已经是共犯，而且我知道……

eng: You wanted one for yourself, hmm? A puppet, to cherish.
chn: 你也很想品味傀儡的美吧？

eng: Oh I can see right through you. That's just the kind of man you are.
chn: 我当然明白，你就是这种人。

eng: Oh I can see right through you. That's just the kind of woman you are.
chn: 我当然明白，你就是这种人。

eng: Well, it's been some time since a pupil of mine last walked this road.
chn: ……好久没有收这方面的学生了，

eng: To mark the occasion, I shall grant you the puppet you so desire.
chn: 就给你特别的傀儡当作纪念。

eng: Now, choose.
chn: 来，选吧。

eng: Well, this is a surprise.
chn: ……哦，来这一手啊。

eng: But aren't we forgetting something?
chn: 只是你该不会忘了吧？

eng: The tipple you fooled Nepheli into drinking, yes, my little draught.
chn:
在你诓骗涅斐丽，让她喝下那酒……
那瓶我拿给你的药酒。

eng: You are already my accomplice.
chn: 从那时候开始，你我早就是共犯。

eng: Are you ready to change your mind, now?
chn: 既然如此，你还能有其他答案吗？

eng: It's no sin, pining for a puppet to cherish.
chn:
……我说啊。
品味傀儡的美，是非常美好的一件事。

eng: Now, hand it over, and don't make a fuss.
chn: ……好了，快点归还那物品吧。

eng: Nothing bad will happen. I'll even consider giving you a puppet of your own.
chn:
我不会加害于你。
除此之外，我还可以给你一具傀儡。

eng: (huge sigh)
chn: （大口叹气）

eng: You truly are beyond salvation.
chn: 无药可救的蠢蛋。

eng: Fine. Leave this place, and never darken my doorstep again.
chn:
那就免谈了。
快点离开，不要再让我见到你。

eng: Ah, what a terrible pity.
chn: ……唉，真是惋惜。

eng: This is the last time I'll see you, in your present state.
chn: 这是最后一次见到神智清楚的你。

eng: I thought I told you never to show your face again.
chn: ……我有说过，不要再让我见到你……

eng: Have you decided to return what's mine, and proffer a sincere apology?
chn: 难道你是真心悔过，想归还那物品？

eng: Good, good.
chn: 很好。

eng: As a man of abundant charity, I accept your apology.
chn: 我为人宽大为怀，愿意接受你的悔过。

eng: And well, you finally realised, did you?
chn: ……况且，你应该有自觉了吧？

eng: All you really wanted was a puppet to cherish. To fill that hole deep in your heart.
chn: 自己打从心底，想要品味傀儡的美。

eng: Oh I can see right through you. That's just the kind of man you are.
chn: 我当然明白，你就是这种人。

eng: Oh I can see right through you. That's just the kind of woman you are.
chn: 我当然明白，你就是这种人。

eng: Well, it's been some time since a pupil of mine last walked this road.
chn: ……好久没有收这方面的学生了，

eng: To mark the occasion, I shall grant you the puppet you so desire.
chn: 就给你特别的傀儡当作纪念。

eng: Now, choose.
chn: 来，选吧。

eng: How's the puppet I gave you?
chn: ……傀儡的状况如何？

eng: A thing of exquisite craft, is it not?
chn: 那孩子很棒，对吧……？

eng: What's that? You want another puppet?
chn: ……哦？你想要新的傀儡？

eng: Quite the keen paramour, aren't we.
chn: 出乎意料，你还真是博爱啊。

eng: Well, aren't you a woman of many passions.
chn: 出乎意料，你还真是博爱啊。

eng: But, I'm afraid each and every one is like a child to me.
chn: 但那些全是我心爱的孩子，

eng: I can hardly just give them away.
chn: 不能白白让出……

eng: Oh dear, what's to be done?
chn: ……嗯，该怎么办才好……

eng: Why don't you...fetch me some starlight shards?
chn: 好，你去准备星光碎片吧。

eng: It's no mere booze, but a refined old drink of amber hue.
chn: 那可不是普通的酒，是形似琥珀的老酒。

eng: If you can manage it, I'll gladly prepare a new puppet for you.
chn: 把那交给我，我很乐意送你新的傀儡。

eng: The soul of every puppet has its own ambience. You'll soon come to know, once you possess a few.
chn:
……拥有的傀儡一多就会明白，
每个灵魂各有千秋。

eng: And once each's predilections are known to you, the better you'll be able to love them.
chn: 在理解到这一点之后，就会更加疼爱每个孩子。

eng: Oh yes, you have much to look forward to, further down this road.
chn: 只是你现在还不能体会……

eng: You're proving to be quite the puppeteer.
chn: ……你在傀儡师的领域十分上进啊。

eng: I've not had an apprentice for…a very long time indeed.
chn: 好久没有收这方面的学生了。

eng: Perhaps, you'd be interested in a little scheme of mine?
chn: ……有个秘密，你有没有兴趣听？

eng: It will produce the finest of puppets.
chn: 那是关于能亲自品味上乘傀儡的美……

eng: Which I aspire to cherish with these very hands.
chn: 但是连带着，会蒙骗菈妮的秘密。

eng: A ploy to fool even Lady Ranni... How does that sound?
chn: 怎么样？我想你一定有兴趣吧？

eng: Ahh, I knew I had you pegged.
chn: ……啊，我明白你就是这种人。

eng: Heh. I knew I had you pegged.
chn: ……啊，我明白你就是这种人。

eng: You're just like me.
chn: 和我一样兴趣盎然。

eng: Then I'd like you to procure something.
chn: 我想要你去准备一样东西。

eng: A rather unique starlight shard that glistens with amber.
chn: 闪耀着琥珀色光芒的，特殊的星光碎片。

eng: With that, my special draught will gleam with nectar-sweetness.
chn: 只要有它，我的药水就能散发出柔美光泽……

eng: And even a demigod would be slave to its charms...
chn: 肯定连半神也会为之心醉。

eng: Procure it for me.
chn: 快去准备先前说的东西，

eng: The rather unique starlight shard that glistens with amber.
chn: 那闪耀着琥珀色光芒的，特殊的星光碎片。

eng: With that, my special draught will gleam with nectar-sweetness.
chn: 只要有它，我的药水就能散发出柔美光泽……

eng: And even a demigod would be slave to its charms...
chn: 肯定连半神也会为之心醉。

eng: Very good.
chn: ……很好。

eng: A wise choice, indeed.
chn: 标准答案。

eng: You passed my little test with flying colours.
chn: ……对，我是在考验你。

eng: I was merely gauging your loyalty to Lady Ranni.
chn: 测试你身为侍奉菈妮的人，到底称职与否。

eng: Well done, I'm very proud of you.
chn: 你及格了，我也与有荣焉。

eng: Let's both do our utmost in service of our Lady.
chn: 继续为了她鞠躬尽瘁吧。

eng: Ah ha. Might you be interested after all?
chn: ……难道说，你有兴趣吗？

eng: In a fine scheme to sport with Lady Ranni?
chn: 那个会蒙骗菈妮的秘密？

eng: Alright, enough of these games.
chn: ……别说废话浪费时间，

eng: Your test is well and truly over.
chn: 考验已经结束了。

eng: Wag your tail for master all you like, but your loyalty is merely blind.
chn:
对主人摇尾巴、展现忠诚是无妨，
但是不是也该适时遵循自己的渴望？

eng: I fear your wretched provinciality is apt to burst. You're oozing at the seams.
chn: 那股藏也藏不住的肤浅，欲盖弥彰啊。

eng: Well, well, you managed to lay your hands on it!
chn: ……你拿到了吗！

eng: The blessed day is finally upon us...
chn: 这就是我梦寐以求的……

eng: Goodness gracious, the way it glistens...utterly enchanting.
chn: 哦、哦哦，多么魅惑的光芒啊……

eng: To think, this was once a demigod's very fate...
chn: 这曾是半神的命运啊……

eng: My oh my oh my...
chn: 哦、哦哦……

eng: Ah, are you still here?
chn: ……哦，你还没离开啊。

eng: Oh yes, I should give you your reward.
chn: 想起来，我还没有给你奖励。

eng: Please, it's all yours. Splendid work. Just marvellous.
chn: 你做得非常好，收下吧。

eng: Now, just you wait. The merriment is soon to begin.
chn: ……还有，慢慢期待吧。

eng: The scheme I promised is to be revealed very shortly...
chn: 那“秘密”已经推进到最后阶段了。

eng: Good, I've been waiting for you.
chn: ……啊，等你很久了。

eng: It's finally complete. The perfection of my draught, gleaming nectar-sweet.
chn:
终于完成了──
我的药水发出了堪称完美的柔美光泽。

eng: Give it to Ranni and ensure she drinks it.
chn: 好啦，让菈妮喝下吧。

eng: The dead-eyed doll lets down her guard in your presence, rather remarkably.
chn:
……没什么好担心的。
那冷冰冰的人偶，不知怎地，对你特别有兴趣。

eng: Though she might dip her hands in the dirt, and feign that icy persona…she's a frail, gentle girl at heart.
chn:
即使背负罪孽，举止岸然──
她也不过是个娇弱的可爱女孩。

eng: Though she might dip her hands in the dirt, and feign that icy persona...she's still just a feeble, pampered little girl when it comes down to it.
chn:
即使背负罪孽，举止岸然──
菈妮也不过是个娇弱的可爱女孩。

eng: Which is why you're the only one for the job.
chn: 所以你应该能成功，

eng: Now do it. Make Ranni drink my draught.
chn: 让菈妮喝下我制成的药酒吧。

eng: You...understand, don't you?
chn: ……你懂了吗？

eng: That once you have Ranni drink my draught, my scheme will come to fruition.
chn: 让菈妮喝下药水，就能实现“秘密”了──

eng: And we, well, we'll be in a position to claim the very finest puppet ever crafted.
chn: 你我就能得到上乘的傀儡，尽情品味她的美。

eng: Just imagine...the pure elation...
chn: 试想那有多么地愉快……

eng: Come now, don't make me wait.
chn: ……啊，不要让我等太久……

eng: I can barely contain myself as it is...
chn: 我快要等不及了……

eng: You'll be flabbergasted, I can assure you.
chn: ……慢慢期待吧。

eng: The scheme I promised is to be revealed very shortly...
chn: 那“秘密”已经推进到最后阶段了。

eng: Hmm. Is that a scroll?
chn: ……哦，是卷轴啊。

eng: I won't bother to ask where you pilfered it, but...
chn: 受不了，你是从哪偷来的？

eng: You're correct to assume I'm one of the few who can decipher it.
chn:
……但确实，大概要到我这种水准的人，
才有办法解读内容。

eng: So, I'm perfectly happy to take it off your hands.
chn: 我就收下了。

eng: That said, don't you dare get your hopes up.
chn: 别抱太大的期待啊。

eng: More often than not, new knowledge is merely an opportunity to reflect…
chn: 接触新事物通常是发觉自身的平庸，

eng: …upon the mediocrity of one's intellect.
chn: 还有脑力贫乏的契机。

eng: Oh, perhaps you've already noticed.
chn: ……对了，话说回来，

eng: The nightly wolf howling that's been disturbing the peace here.
chn: 这几天夜里有时会听见狼嚎，相当扰人。

eng: If that bothersome mutt, Blaidd, is back in town,
chn: 如果你在附近见到那只蠢狗，布莱泽，

eng: then tell him to pack up and ship out.
chn: 帮我传话给他，叫他快滚。

eng: I never liked the din of a dog's howl.
chn: ……畜生的吠声实在恼人，受不了。

eng: From a mongrel like him, it's simply agony.
chn: 更别提是那种不上不下的家伙。

eng: Well, what have we here?
chn: ……哦，你这是……

eng: Are you proposing that I partake?
chn: 要我喝酒吗？

eng: Do I appear such a gormless tomfool to you?
chn: 你认为我有那么愚蠢？

eng: A slow-wit who'd divulge his secrets for a moment of bliss?
chn: 会沉浸在一时的快乐，吐露自己的秘密？

eng: Well, let me give you some advice.
chn: ……给你一个建议。

eng: Scheming has its place, but consider the one you're scheming against.
chn: 用计谋算人是无妨，但要看清对手的底细。

eng: You might find yourself on the wrong end of a proper beating one day.
chn: 不然总有一天，你会吃尽苦头。

eng: O-oh!
Y-you! I, er, sorry, your worship...
chn: 你、你……不，您怎么……

eng: Y-you! I, er, sorry, madam...
chn: 你、你……不，您怎么……

eng: I-I apologise for any offence given.
chn: 没、没有注意到您，万分抱歉。

eng: I am Pidia. Servant to the Carian royal family.
chn: 小的名叫毕迪，是卡利亚王室的仆人。

eng: I am charged with maintaining these g-ghastly dolls.
chn: 负责打理这些恶、恶心的人偶。

eng: Ahh, your worship, allow me to be of use.
chn: 啊，还请您关照、关照毕迪──

eng: Ahh, kind madam, allow me to be of use.
chn: 啊，还请您关照、关照毕迪──

eng: Other than the puppets, there are some very fine things up here in this storeroom.
chn: 除了人偶以外，这座仓库还有各式稀奇的物品，

eng: Why not pick something out, before you go?
chn: 看过之后有属意的，也请别吝啬带走。

eng: But please, can you offer poor ill-starred Pidia...
chn: 只、只是，还请您可怜、可怜小的，

eng: A little something by way of compensation?
chn: 带走之余，也请留下相对的钱财……

eng: Ah, a fine day to your worship.
chn: 啊，您好。

eng: Ah, kind madam, a fine day to y-you.
chn: 啊，您好。

eng: Please, choose whatever you like.
chn: 有属意的，请别吝啬带走。

eng: Ah, I'm sorry your worship, but poor Pidia has given all he has.
chn:
啊，是您。
小的把全部的物品都交给您了。

eng: Ah, I'm sorry kind madam, but poor Pidia has given all he has.
chn:
啊，是您。
小的把全部的物品都交给您了。

eng: I can't be of further use to you. Please, forgive me.
chn: 毕迪已经竭尽所能了，请您见谅。

eng: Please, find it in your heart... Forgive me...
chn: 啊啊，请您见谅、请您见谅……

eng: Argh!
chn: 呀！

eng: Arrgh!
chn: 呀啊！

eng: S-stop, please, stop!
chn: 住手啊、住手啊……

eng: Y-you're my puppets! I loved you with all I have!
chn: 你们是我的傀儡，我都投注这么多爱给你们了，

eng: How could you forget...such bliss?
chn: 难道你们忘记了吗？我们的那段幸福时光。

eng: Ouch!
chn: 好痛！

eng: That hurts!
chn: 好痛啊！

eng: Please, I beg you, cease this cruelty!
chn: 求求你们了，不要这么残忍。

eng: Eeek
chn: 呀啊！

eng: Eeeeeeek!
chn: 啊啊啊啊啊啊啊！

eng: Oh, that's very kind.
chn: ……您、您这是，

eng: Poor Pidia could never accept such a precious brew.
chn: 这么稀罕的珍品，毕迪实在不能收。

eng: Very sorry, really, if I... I've disappointed you,
chn: 非、非常抱歉，无法接受您的好意。

eng: If you will, please forget this matter entirely.
chn: 请您见谅。

eng: Agh!
chn: 呜哇。

eng: Enough of that, now.
chn: 快点住手。

eng: Have you forgotten that we both serve the same Lady?
chn: 再怎么说，你我还算是共事一主的人。

eng: You incorrigible lout.
chn: ……无药可救的蠢蛋。

eng: Don't you dare waltz back here ever again.
chn: 不要再让我见到你。

eng: Well, well, well?
chn: 哦哦哦？

eng: Thought you'd just help yourself to a man's personal belongings?
chn: 想偷偷摸摸拿走别人的东西喔？

eng: You scheming little thief. The gods demand repentance!
chn: 不要脸的小偷就活该遭天谴！

eng: Cough up your coin, all of it!
chn: 把值钱的东西全部留下，滚吧！

eng: Wait, wait, please!
chn: 等、等一下！

eng: I surrender! White flag and all!
chn: 我投降！投降！

eng: For Pete's sake! I concede!
chn: 住手啦！我不是说投降了吗！

eng: No one likes a bull-headed brute, you know!
chn: 不听人话，小心惹人嫌喔！

eng: I yield, yield! You can't harm a yielding man!
chn: 你打算攻击手无寸铁的人喔？

eng: Cripes, are you dense, boy?
chn: 啧！不甩我吗！

eng: Cripes, are you dense, sweetheart?
chn: 啧！不甩我吗！

eng: Fine, have it your way. You'll get what's coming.
chn: 好啊，要打就来啊，打就打嘛！

eng: We're about to make out like Bandits, boys!
chn: 做坏事还理直气壮，指的就是你这种人！

eng: Well, finally come around, have you?
chn: ……呼，终于把人话听进去了，谢天谢地。

eng: I knew you would. You're a man of reason, through-and-through.
chn:
我其实一开始就知道，
你这个人会讲理啦。

eng: I knew you would. You're a lady of reason, through-and-through.
chn:
我其实一开始就知道，
你这个人会讲理啦。

eng: Ha ha ha...
chn: 嘿嘿嘿……

eng: Ahhh...
Well, what do you know? You're Tarnished, like me.
chn: 仔细一看，你不也是褪色者吗？

eng: Now, how did I get that wrong?
chn: 哎呀，我完全误会了说，

eng: I took you for a demi-human, or some such.
chn: 还以为你是亚人之类的……

eng: An innocent mistake, I assure you.
chn: 总而言之，这种不幸的误会常有啦。

eng: Well, water under the bridge. Now we're squared up, how about we play nice from now on?
chn:
话说开之后，恩怨就放水流吧。
之后再多多关照啦，如何？

eng: A true man of reason. Just what I like about you.
chn: 哎呀，我就知道你讲理，太赞了。

eng: A true lady of reason. Just what I like about you.
chn: 哎呀，我就知道你讲理，太赞了。

eng: I'm Patches. Patches the Untethered.
chn: 我叫帕奇，“疯癫”帕奇。

eng: Tarnished, like you, only, free-spirited. Nomadic, you might say.
chn: 和你一样都是褪色者，也是到处旅行的漂泊者。

eng: Only for now, those retired-soldiers-turned-bandits they're paying for my gruel.
chn:
现在跟着那个落魄士兵变成的强盗团行动。
我算是同路人啦……

eng: In exchange for my, well, showing them the ropes.
chn: 总之，我有在罩他们就对了。

eng: But honestly... this looting racket is bloody terrifying.
chn: 不过啊……抢夺财物这一行，风险也不小嘛。

eng: Frankly, I'm ready to wash my hands clean. Maybe set up a legitimate shop.
chn: 我正打算洗手不干，改开店做生意。

eng: So, don't be a stranger, eh?
chn: 所以说，有空再过来喔。

eng: I'll be ready to wheel and deal, come next time.
chn: 我会做好准备，等待你大驾光临。

eng: Ha ha ha...
chn: 嘿嘿嘿……

eng: Slow down, son...
chn: 欸欸欸……

eng: Slow down, madame...
chn: 欸欸欸……

eng: What's the matter? This simply isn't like you.
chn: 怎么啦？你应该很讲理的啊。

eng: You've always known an innocent mistake when you see one.
chn: 明明知道这只是一场不幸的误会。

eng: Well, suit yourself.
chn: 唉，就算了吧。

eng: I'm Patches. Patches the Untethered.
chn: 我叫帕奇，“疯癫”帕奇。

eng: Tarnished, like you, only, free-spirited. Nomadic, you might say.
chn: 和你一样都是褪色者，也是到处旅行的漂泊者。

eng: Only for now, those retired-soldiers-turned-bandits are paying for my gruel.
chn:
现在跟着那个落魄士兵变成的强盗团行动。
我算是同路人啦……

eng: In exchange for my, well, showing them the ropes.
chn: 总之，我有在罩他们就对了。

eng: But honestly... this looting racket is bloody terrifying.
chn: 不过啊……抢夺财物这一行，风险也不小嘛。

eng: I'm ready to wash my hands clean. Maybe set up a legitimate shop.
chn: 我正打算洗手不干，改开店做生意。

eng: So, don't be a stranger, eh?
chn: 所以说，有空再过来喔。

eng: I'll be ready to wheel and deal, come next time.
chn: 我会做好准备，等待你大驾光临。

eng: Ha ha ha...
chn: 嘿嘿嘿……

eng: Don't forget to pop back for another visit, friend.
chn: ……有空再过来吧。

eng: I'll be ready to wheel and deal, come next time.
chn: 我会做好开店准备，等你大驾光临。

eng: Ha ha ha...
chn: 嘿嘿嘿……

eng: Well, nice of you to drop in, finally.
chn: 嗨，你好啊，等好久啦。

eng: It's all a bit ad hoc, but I'm sure you'll find something.
chn: 都是些临时进货的商品，别嫌弃来看看吧。

eng: And welcome to Patches' Emporium.
chn: 欢迎光临帕奇商店，

eng: Where you won't need a refund, 'cause everything's top notch.
chn: 买到绝对让你赚到。

eng: Hello, again. Welcome to Patches' Emporium.
chn:
嗨，你好啊。
欢迎光临帕奇商店。

eng: Cheers for that.
chn: 铭谢惠顾──

eng: Stingy little beggar...
chn: 啧，铁公鸡喔……

eng: Try to find it in your heart next time, eh?
chn: 下次再请多多惠顾啦。

eng: Yeah, I had those bandits make a clean break.
chn: 哦，之前那个强盗团，全都金盆洗手啦。

eng: Now they're all suppliers, and good ones at that.
chn: 现在他们的专职是进货。

eng: I mean, they don't understand a word I'm saying,
chn: ……哎呀，虽然完全无法沟通，

eng: but it hardly matters, we have a natural connection.
chn: 但我就是觉得和他们合得来。

eng: They're all foot soldiers. Survivors of a defeated army.
chn: 乍看之下，他们好像是战败的士兵。

eng: Worked to the bone by their high-and-mighty lord, only to be thrown out with the rubbish.
chn:
替某个大人物做牛做马，压榨完了就被随便一扔──
反正八九不离十，就是这回事吧。

eng: ...It's the same old story, everywhere I go. Ah, to hell with it all.
chn: ……走到哪都在玩历史重演啊，混账东西。

eng: Hm? Wondering what's inside the treasure chest?
chn: 嗯？你注意到那个宝箱了？

eng: Well, it's uh, nothing too special.
chn: 那宝箱，嗯……放了特殊的宝物。

eng: Just something I'm saving as thanks, for a very valuable customer...
chn:
我想说之后可以把那东西
送给我们店的贵客，当作谢礼。

eng: But then again, it would fetch some spectacular coin...
chn: 但是又觉得送出去很舍不得……

eng: And besides, this valuable customer could be a long time coming...
chn: 唉，还不是贵客的话，这件事也不好说。

eng: Eh? Everything is give and take, give and take.
chn:
你是明事理的人，应该也知道吧？
就是所谓的人要互相、各取所需嘛。

eng: Forgot something on your shopping list?
chn: 哦，漏了东西没买吗？

eng: No, no trouble to me.
chn: 我最欢迎回头客了。

eng: By the way, friend...
chn: 啊，你好。

eng: You've really been there for me, through thick and thin.
chn: 感谢你时常光顾。

eng: And so, I've made up my mind. I bequeath that chest to you.
chn: 我决定啦，那个宝箱就送给你吧。

eng: An extra-special thanks, for an extra-special customer.
chn: 特殊宝物就送给你这位大贵客了。

eng: What's wrong? I've made up my mind.
chn: 怎么啦？我都下定决心了。

eng: The treasure chest is yours, in word and deed.
chn: 那个宝箱是你的了。

eng: Sure, it may be worth its weight in gold.
chn: ……舍不得，说实话真舍不得，

eng: But a Patches Promise? Well, that's priceless!
chn: 但我男子汉帕奇一言既出，驷马难追！

eng: Ah, oh... How in blazes... You're alive.
chn: 哦、哦……你平安无事啊。

eng: You had me proper scared. Poofing away in a flash like that.
chn: 我真的吓坏了，你突然就消失不见。

eng: Maybe it's a sign to keep your mitts off what's not rightly yours, hmm?
chn:
说不定是因为你乱碰别人的东西，
才会遭到这种天谴。

eng: But I'll forgive you. View it as a learning experience.
chn: 唉，但我愿意原谅你。之后不要再犯了。

eng: At any rate, it's nice just to see you safe.
chn: 总而言之，你人没事就好。

eng: And don't miss all the bargains, here at Patches' Emporium!
chn: 来逛一逛帕奇商店吧。

eng: Ah, oh... How in blazes... You're alive.
chn: 哦、哦……你平安无事啊。

eng: You had me proper scared. Poofing away in a flash like that.
chn: 我真的吓坏了，你突然就消失不见。

eng: Who on earth spends their time booby-trapping treasure chests?
chn: 万万没想到那个宝箱会藏着那种陷阱。

eng: No way I could've known, but still, I apologise. It's all very unfortunate.
chn:
就算我不知情，还是万分抱歉。
竟然发生这种不幸的意外。

eng: At any rate, it's nice just to see you safe.
chn: 总而言之，你人没事就好。

eng: And don't miss all the bargains, here at Patches' Emporium!
chn: 来逛一逛帕奇商店吧。

eng: Oh yes, by the way. I'm saying goodbye to the old cave.
chn:
哦，你来啦。
我差不多要离开这座洞窟了。

eng: I'm untethered, by nature, and It's about time that I moved on.
chn: 我生来居无定所，疯癫度世──时候差不多到了。

eng: No worries, the old gang will inherit the shop.
chn: 帕奇商店会交由他们继续经营，

eng: They may not speak a word, but they never forget a face.
chn: 沟通是没办法沟通，但他们认得你。

eng: Spare them some coin after I'm gone, eh?
chn: 之后再请多惠顾啦。

eng: Oh, well! It's been a long while.
chn: 哦，好久不见。

eng: It's me. Patches the Untethered.
chn: 是我啦，“疯癫”帕奇。

eng: I'm still in business, if you can believe it.
chn: 其实我还是有继续做生意。

eng: Now I'm my only supplier, so I haven't got much, but everything here is top notch.
chn:
现在连进货都是我自己包办，
品项稍微少了点，但绝对买到不吃亏。

eng: Patches' Emporium, now open in Raya Lucaria.
chn: 来逛一逛帕奇商店，雷亚卢卡利亚分店吧。

eng: You have yourself a discerning eye, I can tell.
chn: 你很有眼光喔。

eng: That statuette will net you a small fortune, no doubt.
chn: 那尊小雕像一定能卖很多钱。

eng: In fact, I'll bet any of those scruffy merchants would leap at the chance to buy it...
chn:
比如说卖给那边那群……
穿着破烂衣服的流浪商人。

eng: (laughs)
chn: 嘿嘿嘿……

eng: Oh, really? No interest in the statuette?
chn: 哦？你不买小雕像吗？

eng: I was sure it would catch your eye.
chn: 你那么有眼光，这不寻常喔。

eng: Well, I can't force it on you, but...
chn: 唉，我也不强迫推销啦……

eng: Incomparable craftsmanship, you know. I'd hate to see it go to someone else...
chn: 但那东西真的不错，不买可惜啦……

eng: By the way, have you met that girl Rya?
chn: 话说回来，你有见过一个叫菈雅的女孩吗？

eng: I spotted her somewhere along the highroad not long ago.
chn: 前阵子我有在大道附近看到她……

eng: She's a strange one, but I believe she was in need of help.
chn: 那女孩子有点奇特，看起来好像需要人帮忙。

eng: Not that it's any of my business, but...
chn: 嗯，反正不关我的事……

eng: If she rings your bell, why not lend her an ear?
chn: 如果你想管闲事，要不要跑一趟找她？

eng: Looking for Rya? Still hanging around on the high road, I suppose.
chn: 那个叫菈雅的女孩子，应该还在大道附近吧？

eng: Oh, hello. I knew it'd all be fine...
chn: 嗨，你好，还是全身而退啊。

eng: Oh, it's nothing, don't mind me. Welcome to Patches' Emporium!
chn:
没事，我自言自语。
欢迎光临帕奇商店。

eng: You're...making your way to the Erdtree, no?
chn: ……你想到那棵黄金树的所在地，是吧？

eng: Well I heard something that might help. A special means of reaching your destination.
chn:
是的话正好，我知道一个好方法。
有一个特殊的方法可以到那里。

eng: Have you ever seen an iron virgin?
chn: 你有看过铁少女人偶吗？

eng: The clunky contraptions are whirlwinds of sickles and spiked wheels.
chn:
就是那个拿着锁镰和刺轮挥舞，
很奇怪的自动人偶……

eng: ...but long ago, they were endowed with a spell of transposition.
chn:
……听说在以前啊，
它身上会搭载传送魔法的装置喔。

eng: And get this. A surviving virgin sits at the bottom of the big waterwheel in the Academy of Raya Lucaria.
chn:
然后啊，在雷亚卢卡利亚学院里面，
有座大水车的底部，那里有一尊少女人偶。

eng: Its transpositional powers fully intact.
chn: 据说那一尊人偶的魔法装置还好好的没坏。

eng: So, right, if you get caught in it on purpose...
chn: ……所以啊，只要故意被它抓到，

eng: It'll chuck you out straight at the base of the Erdtree... Or so I'm told...
chn: 就有办法到黄金树的树脚下喔……

eng: Ha ha...ha ha...
chn: 嘿嘿嘿……

eng: Oh yeah, great story isn't it. I'll tell you as many times as you like.
chn: 哦，那个好方法啊。多听几次也好。

eng: There's a surviving Iron Virgin at the bottom of the big waterwheel in the Academy of Raya Lucaria.
chn:
在雷亚卢卡利亚学院里面有座大水车，
它的底部有一尊少女人偶。

eng: And I heard...if you let yourself get caught in it, it'll chuck you out straight at the base of the Erdtree.
chn:
……然后啊，只要故意被它抓到，
就有办法到黄金树的树脚下。

eng: Heh heh...ha ha...
chn: 嘿嘿嘿……

eng: Well, fancy meeting you here.
chn: ……没想到又遇见你啦。

eng: Hold on, don't you say a word, my friend.
chn: 哦，我大概知道你想说什么，

eng: I spoke no lie, not a one.
chn: 但是我可没说谎喔。

eng: You were trapped inside a volcano, no mistake,
chn: 只要被抓去火山再逃出来的话，

eng: but the Erdtree was right outside. You just had to spring yourself out.
chn: 那边就是黄金树的树脚下啊。

eng: I'm willing to admit. I could have been more clear.
chn:
对、对啦……
可能是我解释得不够清楚啦……

eng: But I did not lie, and you're perfectly unscathed. All's well that ends well, right?
chn:
但我没说谎啊，你也平安无事。
这就是圆满落幕、皆大欢喜啊，对不对？

eng: Oh, erm, hello, yes.
chn: ……哦、哦，是你啊。

eng: Strange place for a chance encounter, eh?
chn: 好巧啊，在这里遇见你。

eng: Thought I could use a rest. Don't mind me, go about your business.
chn:
我正在休息。
不用管我，你先走吧。

eng: Right, over there, see that? Something's shimmering, I swear.
chn: 你看，那边好像有东西在发光耶？

eng: Heh heh heh...
chn: 嘿嘿嘿……

eng: What is it? Oh, don't mind me. Off you trot.
chn: ……怎、怎样啦，不用管我，你先走吧。

eng: Right over there, see that? Something's shimmering, I swear.
chn: 你看，那边好像有东西在发光耶？

eng: Heh heh heh...
chn: 嘿嘿嘿……

eng: Oh, my, well, here you are again.
chn: 嗨、嗨，你回来啦。

eng: So sorry for that. I meant to warn you, but whoops! There you went.
chn:
刚才抱歉啦，我本来想要警告你，
没想到你竟然掉下去了。

eng: Despite my best intentions, I've done you wrong, I have.
chn: 虽然说是弄巧成拙，抱歉给你添了麻烦。

eng: But here you are, standing tall and proud. All's well that ends well, eh.
chn:
但是啊，你也平安无事嘛。
这样不算数啊，不算数。

eng: And my warning was spot-on, you tell me different!
chn: 而且我说的警告是真的。

eng: Stay clear of Volcano Manor, end of discussion.
chn: 劝你别靠近火山官邸，

eng: I heard the brutes there hunt Tarnished like animals.
chn: 听说那群人正在狩猎褪色者啊。

eng: Mm...heh heh...
chn: 嘿嘿嘿……

eng: You didn't listen last time, but I'm warning you again.
chn: ……我说的警告是真的。

eng: Stay clear of Volcano Manor, end of discussion.
chn: 劝你别靠近火山官邸，

eng: I heard the brutes there hunt Tarnished like animals.
chn: 听说那群人正在狩猎褪色者啊。

eng: Heh heh...heh heh...
chn: 嘿嘿嘿……

eng: Well, you've joined the Manor, eh?
chn: ……哦，你变成火山官邸的一员啦？

eng: I don't believe it. Didn't think you had it in you.
chn: 没想过你会加入这一边，吓我一跳。

eng: And here I thought Rya was barking up the wrong tree...
chn: 菈雅的眼光算是马马虎虎吧。

eng: All good, though. We're on the same side, now.
chn: 唉，也好啦，总之就是同伴了。

eng: We'll do good work together.
chn: 那之后再请多关照啦。

eng: Oh, and of course, we can do business, if you like.
chn:
啊，对了。
想买东西的话，我可以卖你喔。

eng: Patches' Emporium at the Volcano Manor. Specially for you.
chn:
帕奇商店，火山官邸分店，
特别为你敞开大门。

eng: Ahh, hello, what impeccable timing.
chn: 哦，你在啊，刚好。

eng: This is for you.
chn: 这个让给你吧。

eng: You're new here at the Manor.
chn: 你在火山官邸还是个菜鸟──

eng: But if you complete the request, you can improve your standing.
chn:
好好完成委托，提升对自己的信任，
这样比较有利喔。

eng: Relax, we're old friends. Time's come to pass the torch, right?
chn:
不用客气啦，我们这么熟。
而且前辈要提携后进嘛。

eng: Go on, break a leg, then.
chn: 唉，加油啦。

eng: Heh heh...
chn: 嘿嘿嘿……

eng: What's the matter? Having trouble nabbing your prey?
chn: 怎么啦？那份委托太棘手了吗？

eng: Well, I wouldn't go asking for help so soon.
chn: 不过，该怎么说呢？才刚开始就要人帮忙，

eng: We're not here to make your life easier.
chn: 那你不适合待在火山官邸吧。

eng: Do you remember your vow to Tanith? To rise against the Erdtree.
chn:
你不是在塔妮丝面前发过誓了吗？
说要对黄金树举剑相向。

eng: Dare I say your heart was never in it to begin with?
chn: 这样不就代表，你的决心根本不够吗？

eng: You and Diallos both. Perhaps your hearts were never in it to begin with?
chn:
这样不就代表，你还有那个叫狄亚罗斯的，
你们的决心根本不够吗？

eng: You hunted down Tragoth?
chn: ……你杀了忒拉格斯？

eng: Are you certain?
chn: 真的？

eng: No, it's quite alright, fine work, indeed.
chn:
不，没事，这样很好。
你做得很好。

eng: I'll give Tanith the news.
chn: 我来替你向塔妮丝报告吧。

eng: Have some rest, by all means.
chn: 你好好休息。

eng: Are you surprised? That I belong to the Volcano Manor.
chn: ……我是火山官邸的一员，你很意外吗？

eng: I always hated the gibberish about lost grace and the laughable Two Fingers.
chn:
那个什么赐福的指引，还有双指之类的，
我很认同那根本就是狗屁。

eng: I thought I could lend a hand in unmasking the charade.
chn:
既然有人心有二意，打算攻其不备，
我就觉得助阵一下也不坏。

eng: Not to mention Tanith has always made me curious.
chn: ……而且啊，我觉得塔妮丝颇有意思的。

eng: I guess her master must really be something, cause she's pretty damn smug about it.
chn:
不清楚她背后的主人是多厉害的角色，
但就看她自信满满的，

eng: Even after announcing her blasphemous ambitions, she still stands proud.
chn:
公开宣告亵渎的意图与野心就算了，
还一副凛然的态度。

eng: I've never seen a woman quite like her...
chn: 我还是第一次遇到那种女人……

eng: Hmph.
Sharper than you seem, aren't you...
chn: 你还挺会计较的嘛。

eng: I was just holding onto it for you, you know.
chn: 对啦，塔妮丝是有给我报酬。

eng: Here you go. The reward for hunting Tragoth. All yours.
chn: 给你，狩猎忒拉格斯的奖励。收下吧。

eng: Now you've gone and killed Rykard?
chn: ……你干掉拉卡德啦？

eng: You scheming little bastard.
chn: 嘿嘿……你这男人真恐怖。

eng: You scheming little doxie.
chn: 嘿嘿……你这女人真恐怖。

eng: Cripes, you make this nonsense seem, well, less nonsensical...
chn:
看了你这个人，
就觉得那句话不是空穴来风──

eng: Perhaps a Tarnished will be Elden Lord after all...
chn: 褪色者能当上艾尔登之王啊……

eng: But for now, this Manor is finished.
chn: ……这座官邸也差不多完蛋了。

eng: The demigod beast is slain, and Tanith has lost her head.
chn:
半神怪物被打败，
塔妮丝也失去了自我……

eng: A fine mess, but how else could it end when daddy ambition is head over heels courting lady blasphemy.
chn:
心存亵渎的意图与野心，
最后落得这种烂下场还真适合喔。

eng: Heh heh...ha ha...
chn: 嘿嘿嘿……

eng: Well, here I am. Untethered, once again.
chn: 我打算回到疯癫度世的生活，

eng: Good-bye, my friend.
chn: 再会啦。

eng: What is it?
chn: 怎么啦？

eng: Oh, come to make a parting donation to Patches' Emporium?
chn: 打算为帕奇商店来个最后的送别吗？

eng: Ah, oh, you again...
chn: ……嗨、嗨，你好啊……

eng: A shame you had to see me like this...
chn: 这么巧，在栽了斤斗的时候遇见你……

eng: Ohh, I had a bit of a slip-up, that's all.
chn: ……嗯，我一闪神就这副德性了。

eng: I should have stuck to what I know best...
chn: 人真的不该做超出本分的事……

eng: No matter. I know I-I can trust you.
chn: ……唉，也好啦。我信得过你。

eng: Gullible, yes, but a good soul.
chn: 你是个烂好人嘛……

eng: Make certain that Tanith gets this.
chn: 把这东西交给塔妮丝吧。

eng: Oh, it's nothing, it's just... Makes me sick to see her all bent out of shape.
chn:
那不是多厉害的东西……
我只是看那个失去自我的女人不顺眼。

eng: C'mon, Tanith, back on your high horse, where you belong.
chn: 想要她恢复自信满满的样子……

eng: You're able, then?
chn: 欸，那东西，

eng: Then I can rest easy, my friend...
chn: 就拜托你了……

eng: Well, well, well?
chn: 哦哦哦？

eng: Thought you'd just help yourself to a man's personal belongings?
chn: 想偷偷摸摸拿走别人的东西喔？

eng: You scheming little thief. The gods demand repentance!
chn: 不要脸的小偷就活该遭天谴！

eng: Cough up your coin, all of it!
chn: 把值钱的东西全部留下，滚吧！

eng: Hm? Wait, don't tell me, is that you?
chn: ……嗯？欸，是你喔？

eng: Oh, cripes, please, wait!
chn: 欸，等、等一下啦！

eng: I surrender! I surrender, I swear!
chn: 投降啦！我说投降啦！

eng: Do you even hear me? I said "surrender", loud and clear!
chn: 你的耳朵是怎样？我说投降了耶！

eng: No one likes a bull-headed brute!
chn: 不听人话，小心惹人嫌喔！

eng: You'd clobber your old mate, then, would you?
chn: 你打算伤害朋友喔？

eng: Cripes! Are you dense, mate?
chn: 啧！不甩人喔！

eng: What in the world has gotten into you!
chn: 你到底是哪根筋不对啦？

eng: Fine, have it your way. You'll get what's coming.
chn: 好啊，要打就来啊，打就打嘛！

eng: Don't go thinking I'm a soft touch!
chn: 劝你不要看扁我！

eng: Well, glad to see we're on the same page.
chn: ……呼，终于把人话听进去了，谢天谢地。

eng: I'd never cross you, not even close.
chn: 要我跟你打，我还真百般不情愿咧。

eng: He he he...
chn: 嘿嘿嘿……

eng: Ahhh...
It's been ages since I've seen you.
chn: 好久不见了啊。

eng: I didn't even realise it was you.
chn: 我完全误会了说，

eng: Took you for a demi-human, or some such.
chn: 还以为你是亚人之类的……

eng: You know how it is, just an innocent mistake.
chn: 唉，这种不幸的误会常有嘛。

eng: Water under the bridge, eh, back to business as usual?
chn:
话说开之后，恩怨放水流。
再多多关照啦。

eng: Hell's bells...
chn: 话说回来啊……

eng: This bandit business is hardly what it's cracked up to be...
chn: 抢夺财物这一行，风险真的不小。

eng: Especially if we keep running into the likes of you...
chn:
要是运气差抢到像你这种人，
完全就会赔了夫人又折兵。

eng: ...Maybe I'll set up another shop with the lads...
chn: 也许该和他们再开始做生意吧……

eng: ...Maybe I'll set up another shop with the lads...
chn: 也许该和他们再开始做生意吧……

eng: Well, finally made it, eh, and just in time.
chn: 嗨，你好啊，等好久啦。

eng: For the grand reopening of Patches' Emporium.
chn: 帕奇商店重新开幕。

eng: Where you won't need a refund, 'cause everything is top notch!
chn: 买到绝对让你赚到。

eng: Hello, again. Welcome to Patches' Emporium.
chn:
嗨，你好啊。
欢迎光临帕奇商店。
