I require the sword...and raiment...of D...
chn: 请给我Ｄ的剑……Ｄ的盔甲……

eng: I require the sword...of D...
chn: 请给我Ｄ的剑……

eng: For revenge...
chn: 为了复仇……

eng: For the wrath...of D...
chn: 为了Ｄ的怒火……

eng: Yeeesss...
chn: 哦、哦哦哦……

eng: YESSS!
chn: 哦哦哦哦哦哦哦！

eng: Soon you will know, filthy witch...
chn: 骯脏的魔女，好好感受吧──

eng: Soon you will know... Vengeance for Darian.
chn: 达利安的仇人，好好感受吧──

eng: The wrath of D...
chn: 何谓Ｄ的怒火……

eng: I don't believe we've met.
chn: ……之前没见过你。

eng: I'm known as D. I hunt down Those Who Live in Death, and weed their Deathroot.
chn:
你可以称我为Ｄ。
我正在狩猎死诞者，摘除死根。

eng: Heed my warning.
chn: ……先警告你一声，

eng: Those Who Live in Death should be left well alone.
chn: 不要靠近死诞者。

eng: All the more, should you spy a mariner among their number.
chn: 尤其是在“船”出现的时候。

eng: Unless you wish to lay down your life in vain.
chn: ……你应该不想平白送命吧？

eng: Those Who Live in Death should be left well alone.
chn: 不要靠近死诞者，

eng: All the more, should you spy a mariner among their number.
chn: 尤其是在“船”出现的时候。

eng: Ah...we meet again.
chn: ……哦，是你啊。

eng: I'm glad you took my warning to heart.
chn: 看样子我的警告奏效了。

eng: Those Who Live in Death should be left well alone.
chn: 不要靠近死诞者。

eng: All the more, should you spy a mariner among their number.
chn: 尤其是在“船”出现的时候。

eng: Well, well...
chn: ……哦，你这是……

eng: Another fool who won't listen to reason, eh?
chn: ……听不懂警告的蠢蛋啊，

eng: But with a prowess for weeding Deathroot.
chn: 但看来是有摘除死根的实力……

eng: With a prowess for weeding Deathroot.
chn: 看来是有摘除死根的实力……

eng: How would you like to earn the strength of beasts?
chn: 你对野兽的力量有兴趣吗？

eng: If you're inclined to hunt more of Those Who Live in Death, and weed their Deathroot,
chn: 要是你有意愿狩猎死诞者，摘除死根，

eng: then I'll introduce you to Gurranq, the beast clergyman.
chn: 我会把你推荐给“野兽祭司”古兰格。

eng: I have a matter of my own to attend to.
chn: ……我有其他规划，

eng: And the beast himself wishes for someone to take my place.
chn: 古兰格大概也想换个帮手。

eng: What say you?
chn: 你怎么想？

eng: Very well. Show me your map.
chn: ……很好，借我地图。

eng: I've marked the location for you. Of a hidden gateway.
chn:
我在地图上做好标记了，
记号的地方有隐藏的传送门。

eng: It will lead you to Gurranq, the beast clergyman.
chn: 用那传送门去见“野兽祭司”古兰格吧。

eng: I have a matter of my own to attend to.
chn: ……我有其他规划。

eng: I've spotted the mark of the centipede.
chn: ……百足环的烙印出现了，

eng: An ill-omened symbol that should not be.
chn: 那是不该有的不祥印记。

eng: Someone, or something, threatens the sanctity of the Golden Order.
chn: ……有人意图玷污黄金律法，

eng: And must be eradicated.
chn: 必须除之而后快。

eng: What is it? Still milling about?
chn: ……怎么？你还不出发？

eng: The map indicates where the gateway is hidden.
chn: 地图上的记号标着传送门隐藏的位置，

eng: It will lead you to Gurranq, the beast clergyman.
chn: 用那传送门去见“野兽祭司”古兰格吧。

eng: Well, all right, then.
chn: ……哦，是吗？

eng: No sense in forcing you.
chn: 我不勉强。

eng: What's wrong? Got cold feet, have you?
chn: ……怎么？改变心意了？

eng: You've met Gurranq, I take it?
chn: ……你见到古兰格了吧？

eng: Then owing to our duties shared, we are now comrades-in-arms.
chn:
既然你愿意一起摘除死根……
我们就是同伴了。

eng: I think you've earned this.
chn: ……那我应该告诉你，

eng: The power of the Golden Order, to aid the hunt of Those Who Live in Death.
chn: 何谓狩猎死诞者的，黄金律法的力量。

eng: Did you need something else?
chn: ……还有事吗？

eng: Ah, hello there. What can I do for you?
chn: ……啊，是你。还有事吗？

eng: Ah, hello. You've been busy weeding Deathroot, I take it.
chn: ……你真勤奋啊。

eng: I thank you, as your brother-in-arms.
chn: 身为共事的人，很感谢你的努力。

eng: So what can I do for you?
chn: 找我有什么事？

eng: Ah, hello again.
chn: ……哦，是你啊。

eng: You haven't gone to see Gurranq yet, have you?
chn: 你还没去见古兰格？

eng: Well, no rush. You do as you please.
chn: ……也罢，你自己决定吧。

eng: Just as long as he doesn't starve to death, eh.
chn: 只希望古兰格不会饿死。

eng: Go to Gurranq only if you feel the time is right.
chn: ……见不见古兰格，你自己决定吧。

eng: Killing Those Who Live in Death and weeding their Deathroot...
chn: 狩猎死诞者、摘除死根……

eng: Is a path not to be trod without ample resolve.
chn: 都要有决心才能办到。

eng: I serve the Golden Order.
chn: ……我志愿为黄金律法服务。

eng: That I might put this crooked land to rights.
chn: 只有伟大的艾尔登法环能引导我们，

eng: Following only the guidance of the great Elden Ring.
chn: 带领我们修复这破坏殆尽的世界。

eng: Those Who Live in Death fall outside the principles of the Golden Order.
chn: ……那些死诞者不存在于黄金律法的法则之内，

eng: Their mere existence sullies the guidance of gold. Tainting its truth.
chn:
他们只要留在世上就会玷污引导，
还会让引导的正当性蒙上阴影。

eng: And so it is the vermin must be exterminated... Down to the very last.
chn: ……所以必须除掉他们，一个也不能留……

eng: Are you acquainted with a man named Rogier?
chn: ……你认识罗杰尔吗？

eng: You know, the piteous fellow hiding away on the balcony?
chn: 躲在圆桌厅堂露台的，那个可悲的男人。

eng: He was a formidable spellblade, in times past.
chn: ……他以前是位优秀的魔法剑士。

eng: Don't let his easy air deceive you. He was wise beyond his years, stout of heart and clear of mind.
chn:
天资聪颖，看似一派从容，
但意志坚定，不会受外力影响。

eng: No more though.
chn: 可是你看，现在是什么德行？

eng: You see him now, ravaged by thorns, muttering and rambling...
chn: 被玷污荆棘贯穿，不停讲些没用的废话──

eng: Like he's half dead already. I can't stomach to watch.
chn: 不堪入目，犹如半具尸体的东西。

eng: Take well the lesson, friend.
chn: ……劝你要记牢了，

eng: That's how you end up, when seduced by Those Who Live in Death.
chn: 那就是受死诞者魅惑的下场。

eng: When grace is sullied, it rots people from the inside. Breaks them.
chn: 当引导受到玷污，必会侵蚀人……毁了人。

eng: Well, what have we here?
chn: ……哦，那武器……

eng: How did you get your hands on that dagger?
chn: 你怎么拿到那把短剑的？

eng: Well. That hardly matters.
chn: ……嗯，没关系。

eng: I know very well whose dagger it is.
chn: 我熟识那把短剑的主人，

eng: Why don't I return it to them for you?
chn: 由我代为归还吧？

eng: Good work, bringing this to me.
chn: ……辛苦你了……

eng: <wince>
chn: 唔。

eng: Don't you dare.
chn: ……劝你停手。

eng: Unless you want to die like a dog?
chn: 还是说，你这么想平白送命？

eng: Very well.
chn: ……好吧。

eng: Honeyed rays of gold, deliver this spirit.
chn: 黄金啊，掌管此人的魂魄吧。

eng: I swear, there's a blight spreading amongst the Tarnished.
chn: ……褪色者里的无聊之辈也多了不少……

eng: How could this...happen...?
chn: ……怎么会……

eng: Forgive me, Devin... D-Devin...
chn: 对不起，达文……达、文……

eng: Oof!
chn: 唔。

eng: What's the meaning of this?
chn: ……你做什么？

eng: Has she bewitched you?
chn: 你是魔女的奴隶吗？

eng: Very well.
chn: ……好吧。

eng: Then you are a blight.
chn: 那你就是玷污者。

eng: A defiler of the Golden Order, and murderer of my brother!
chn: 玷污黄金律法之辈，我要替哥哥报仇！

eng: Die! Die! Die!
chn: 去死！去死！去死吧！

eng: I'll grind your corpse into that vile wench's rotting remains.
chn: 我要把你的尸体刺进那骯脏娼妓的尸块里。

eng: A witch's eternal embrace, just as you wished!
chn:
这样就能永远被它抱在怀里了！
不是你梦寐以求的吗！

eng: You defiled cretin. My brother is now avenged!
chn: ……玷污者，这就是我哥哥带来的报应！

eng: How could this...
chn: ……怎么会……

eng: Forgive me, Darian... D-Darian...
chn: 原谅我，达利安……达、利……

eng: Everyone's...been grafted.
chn: ……大家都被“接肢”了。

eng: Everyone who came with me. They crossed the sea for me. They fought, for me.
chn: 和我一起来到交界地，为我而战的那些人……

eng: Heh...
chn: 呵呵。

eng:
Only to have their arms taken. Their legs taken. Even their heads...taken.
Taken and stuck to the spider.
chn: 手、脚、头全部被砍断，变成蜘蛛的一部分了。

eng: Did you know? If you're grafted by the spider, you become a chrysalid.
chn:
你知道吗？被接到蜘蛛身上之后，
人就会长得像是虫蛹喔。

eng: It's quite the lark, when you think about it.
chn: 真的很奇妙，对不对？

eng: You're all on your own, are you?
chn: 你一个人行动吗？

eng: And heading to Stormveil Castle?
chn: 正朝着史东薇尔城前进吗？

eng: Enticed by the one in the white mask, I suppose. Oh, you've come to be one with the spider?
chn:
是因为听信那位白面具先生的好听话？
还是说，你想要变成蜘蛛的一部分呢？

eng: Well, that makes us two peas in a pod.
chn: 如果是的话，那就和我一样了。

eng: But I don't have your courage.
chn: 可是我没有勇气──

eng: It's scary, you know. Having your arms cut off. Or legs. Or your head.
chn: 要被砍断手脚、砍断头，太可怕了。

eng: I want to be like everyone else, but I'm just too scared.
chn: 我很想和大家变得一样，但实在怕得不得了。

eng: I'm nothing but a craven.
chn: 我太懦弱了。

eng: Oh, I know.
chn: 啊，对了。

eng: Can you take this little one along with you?
chn: 能请你带着这孩子一起旅行吗？

eng: Can you take these little ones along with you?
chn: 能请你带着这些孩子一起旅行吗？

eng: The poor thing deserves someone braver than myself…
chn: 要他陪着这么懦弱的我，太可怜了……

eng: And the spirits look rather fondly upon you.
chn: 而且灵魂好像很喜欢你，

eng: It'll be glad of your company, I think, the little'un.
chn: 我想这孩子也会很开心。

eng: They'd be glad of your company, I think, the little'uns.
chn: 我想这些孩子也会很开心。

eng: The poor things deserve someone braver than myself…
chn: 要他们陪着这么懦弱的我，太可怜了……

eng: It was a pleasure to see you.
chn: 那么，请多保重。

eng: Oh, can you pass on a message for me, if you see the little chrysalids in Stormveil Castle?
chn:
如果你准备前往史东薇尔城，
请帮忙转达给成为虫蛹的大家：

eng: Tell them I love them. And that despite my craven heart, I'm sure I'll be joining their club soon enough.
chn:
“我爱你们。虽然还是很害怕，
但迟早会变得和大家一模一样。”

eng: I'm finally getting the hang of this whole "pain" thing, you know.
chn: ……我终于比较不怕痛了。

eng: Heh heh...
chn: 呵呵。

eng: What's this?
chn: ……这是什么？

eng: A keepsake? From my men?
chn: 这是大家的遗物？

eng: Oh, goodness me…
I can't…
chn: 竟然有这种事……

eng: A pleasure to see you.
chn: ……你好。

eng: Did you give the little chrysalids the message?
chn: 你帮我转达给大家了吗？

eng: That I love them. And that despite my craven heart, I'm sure I'll be joining their club soon enough.
chn:
“我爱你们。虽然还是很害怕，
但迟早会变得和大家一模一样。”

eng: They all...believed in me.
chn: ……大家相信我。

eng: They all thought I'd make something of myself. Me! Who can't do anything...
chn:
即使现在什么事都办不到，
还是相信在未来，我能够成就些什么。

eng: I think I'll head to the Roundtable Hold.
chn: ……我想前往圆桌厅堂。

eng: Perhaps I'll find my purpose there.
chn: 去找出自己能做些什么。

eng: I think I'll head to the Roundtable Hold.
chn: ……我想前往圆桌厅堂。

eng: Perhaps I'll find my purpose there.
chn: 去找出自己能做些什么。

eng: Greetings. Nice to see you again.
chn: 好久不见了。

eng: My name is Roderika. I should have told you sooner.
chn:
我叫罗德莉卡。
抱歉，这么晚才告诉你名字。

eng: Isn't this place impressive, though?
chn: 说起来，圆桌厅堂很厉害呢。

eng: The Roundtable Hold, covert quarters of the Two Fingers, and gathering place of champions who vie to become Elden Lord.
chn:
既是双指的藏身处，
也是想当上王的英雄群集的地方……

eng: I never knew the guidance bestowed upon us Tarnished had such fantastic roots.
chn: 真没想到褪色人的指引，背后竟然充满着奥秘。

eng: Although, it's all a bit much for me, in truth.
chn:
……只是对我而言，
圆桌厅堂的指引过于伟大。

eng: I'm still looking for my own purpose.
chn: 我想找找其他自己能做的事。

eng: You're telling me I possess some kind of gift?
chn: ……我有那方面的潜力吗？

eng: I don't believe you. But...
chn: 真不敢置信，但如果是真的……

eng: If I do have this talent, and goodness knows it would be my first...
chn: ……如果是真的，就算我不够优秀，

eng: I suppose I should try to hone it. Shouldn't I?
chn: 我也想去学习，想去磨练。

eng: I'll ask Master Hewg to teach me.
chn: ……我想请修古先生指导我。

eng: Certainly, he does appear intimidating, and holds no love for us Tarnished...
chn:
那位先生外表恐怖，被束缚在圆桌厅堂，
厌恶我们褪色者。

eng: But I know he's trapped here, at the Roundtable Hold... So...
chn: 会被讨厌是理所当然，但是……

eng: I can tell. He's a gentle soul, underneath it all.
chn: 我却认为，那位先生其实非常温柔。

eng: Oh, and…
chn: 啊，还有一件事……

eng: Please, allow to me to express my thanks.
chn: 请让我向你道谢。

eng: For giving me that keepsake from my men.
chn: 如果你没有将大家的遗物转交给我，

eng: It was as if I was frozen with self-pity. I failed them at every turn.
chn:
我肯定会一直坐在原地，自怨自艾，
继续背叛大家的期待。

eng: You have my gratitude. Please, take this.
chn: 我很感谢你，请收下这个。

eng: A pleasure to meet you.
chn: 初次见面，你好。

eng: My name is Roderika. I'm a recent arrival.
chn: 我叫罗德莉卡，刚来到这里。

eng: Isn't this place impressive?
chn: 说起来，圆桌厅堂很厉害呢。

eng: The Roundtable Hold, covert quarters of the Two Fingers, and gathering place of champions who vie to become Elden Lord.
chn:
既是双指的藏身处，
也是想当上王的英雄群集的地方……

eng: I never knew the guidance bestowed upon us Tarnished had such fantastic roots.
chn: 真没想到褪色人的指引，背后竟然充满着奥秘。

eng: Although, it's all a bit much for me, in truth.
chn:
……只是对我而言，
圆桌厅堂的指引过于伟大。

eng: I'm still looking for my own purpose.
chn: 我想找找其他自己能做的事。

eng: It's all a bit much for me, in truth.
chn: 对我而言，圆桌厅堂的指引过于伟大。

eng: I'm still looking for my own purpose.
chn: 我想找找其他自己能做的事。

eng: A pleasure to see you.
chn: 你好。

eng: Thank goodness you're safe.
chn: 平安无事比什么都重要。

eng: I'm still looking for my own purpose.
chn: ……我还在寻找自己能做的事。

eng: It's not easy, by any means, but it's what I must do.
chn:
这没有办法马上找到。
但我想，这是目前的我该做的事情。

eng: If I do have a talent for spirit tuning, and goodness knows that would be a surprise…
chn:
……如果我真的有调灵的潜力，
即使不够优秀也好。

eng: I suppose I should try to hone it. Shouldn't I?
chn: 我也想去学习，想去磨练。

eng: I'll ask Master Hewg to teach me.
chn: ……我再去请修古先生指导我。

eng: Good to see you again. Thank you very much!
chn: 啊，谢谢你。

eng: I have you to thank, don't I? For persuading Master Hewg?
chn: 你替我说服修古先生了，对吧？

eng: I can happily announce that he has taught me the noble toil of spirit tuning.
chn:
多亏如此，修古先生愿意教导我
关于调灵的学问。

eng: I'm as yet unsure of what I might be able to accomplish,
chn: ……我还不知道自己能走得多远，

eng: but if I might be any help to you all, I'd certainly like to try.
chn: 但只要一想到自己能尽棉薄之力帮助你们，

eng: And if there's any chance to ease the suffering of my dear men who were grafted...
chn: 也能慰藉被“接肢”的大家──

eng: Well, I certainly must try.
chn: 我就想继续努力下去。

eng: Roderika the spirit tuner prentice. Pleased to make your acquaintance.
chn: 调灵实习生罗德莉卡，今后请多多指教。

eng: Greetings.
chn: 你好啊。

eng: Are you here for spirit tuning?
chn: 要委托调灵吗？

eng: I feel like I'm really coming to grips with spirit tuning of late.
chn: 这阵子，我开始熟悉调灵的工作了──

eng: I can see how and why immortal essence exists as spirit under the Golden Order.
chn: 灵魂具有的不死特质，在律法之下会是如何运作，

eng: I can understand their yearnings, what they become drawn to...
chn: 而他们渴望着什么，以及会被什么吸引。

eng: Master Hewg said it himself, actually, that I'm no mere prentice any longer.
chn: ……修古先生说了，我已经不算实习生了。
呵呵。

eng: Once again, I'm pleased to make your acquaintance. Roderika the certified spirit tuner.
chn: 那么，调灵师罗德莉卡，再请你多多关照了。

eng: I'd like to ask you a small favour.
chn: ……我可以拜托你一件事吗？

eng: Can you take this little one along with you?
chn: 我想请你带着这孩子一起旅行。

eng: Can you take these little ones along with you?
chn: 我想请你带着这些孩子一起旅行。

eng: They can't be summoned here.
chn: 毕竟在这个地方也不能召唤出来，

eng: But the spirits look rather fondly upon you.
chn: 而且灵魂好像很喜欢你，

eng: It'll be glad of your company, I think, the little'un.
chn: 我想这孩子也会很开心。

eng: They'd be glad of your company, I think, the little'uns.
chn: 我想这些孩子也会很开心。

eng: I need to warn you about something.
chn: ……有件事情，我想和你说一声。

eng: A little while ago someone started lurking in the wing on the opposite side of the roundtable.
chn:
在不久以前，隔着圆桌的另一侧，
更往里面走的地方，好像有人来了。

eng: And I can hear, from all the way over there...
chn: ……即使隔了这么远的距离，我还是能听到──

eng: The howling and wailing of spirits in fear of a curse. I can even hear the repulsive, twisted malison itself...
chn:
灵魂发出的悲叹、哭喊，害怕诅咒的声音，
也能感觉到恐怖、疯狂的诅咒。

eng: A plethora of spirits in an unceasing cacophony...
chn: 那群灵魂为数众多，声音也不曾停息。

eng: I can't even imagine. How much suffering, inflicted to who knows how many souls...
chn:
我实在无法想象──会有这种情况，
到底是什么样的人，做了什么样的事情？

eng: Not even the grafting caused anything like this to happen...
chn: ……即使做出“接肢”恶行，也不会如此。

eng: You should keep your distance.
chn: ……我认为不该靠近那里。

eng: I know you're strong, but please...
chn: 就算你很强大，也不该贸然接近。

eng: I can hear it from across the wing, past the roundtable...
chn:
……我听到声音，从圆桌的另一侧
更往里面走的地方传来。

eng: The howling and wailing of spirits in fear of the curse. I can even hear the repulsive, twisted malison itself...
chn:
灵魂发出的悲叹、哭喊，害怕诅咒的声音，
也能感觉到恐怖、疯狂的诅咒。

eng: You should keep your distance.
chn: ……我认为不该靠近那里。

eng: I know you're strong, but please...
chn: 就算你很强大，也不该贸然接近。

eng: I can't hear them any more; the voices of the spirits cowering from the curse...
chn:
之前和你提过的，灵魂害怕诅咒发出的声音，
现在已经听不见了。

eng: I suppose the Dung Eater must have left the Roundtable.
chn: 食粪者先生已经离开圆桌厅堂了吗？

eng: I just pray nothing ill comes of this.
chn: 希望不会再有坏事发生……

eng: Be on your guard, I beg you.
chn: ……请多加小心。

eng: He's back. The Dung Eater. Again.
chn: 那位食粪者先生，好像又回来了。

eng: I can hear them; the spirits as they howl and lament in fear of the curse.
chn: 我能听见，灵魂发出的悲叹、哭喊，害怕诅咒的声音。

eng: And worse than ever, the reverberations of the twisted malison itself.
chn: 还能感觉到那恐怖、疯狂的诅咒，又增强了几分。

eng: But after all this time, I've started to grasp it now.
chn: ……只是听着听着，我也感觉到了──

eng: I can hear, in the malison, another fearsome Order.
chn: 那诅咒是一种无法撼动的律法。

eng: The voices of the tormented spirits are silent again..
chn: ……现在又听不见灵魂害怕诅咒的声音了。

eng: But it isn't like last time.
chn: 但是这一次和上一次的情况不同，

eng: I'm almost certain...the spirits have escaped their confinement.
chn: 我觉得灵魂一定是摆脱禁锢，逃出来了。

eng: Did you...have anything to do with it, I wonder?
chn: 是不是你从中助了一臂之力呢？

eng: Take a look around. The Roundtable Hold is burned. Razed to the ground.
chn: ……请看，祝融肆虐，圆桌厅堂就快烧毁。

eng: The Two Fingers went mad, and the Tarnished have all left.
chn: 双指陷入疯狂，褪色者的大家都已经离开，

eng: Myself and Master Hewg are the only ones who remain.
chn: 只剩我和修古先生留下来。

eng: Don't worry, I don't blame you.
chn: ……我没有指责你的意思。

eng: I'll continue spirit tuning just the same as before.
chn: 调灵的工作，我也会继续做──

eng: Which is why I need your help persuading Master Hewg to leave.
chn: 但是可以拜托你，劝劝修古先生吗？

eng: His roots are so knotted in this place.
chn: 他与圆桌厅堂之间的缘分太深，

eng: He won't last much longer if he stays here...
chn:
再继续留在这里，
会跟着圆桌厅堂一起陪葬的。

eng: His shackles are broken. He's a free man, now.
chn:
……修古先生的俘虏枷锁已经损毁，
他早已获得自由。

eng: It's high time he put the Roundtable behind him.
chn: 我希望他离开圆桌厅堂。

eng: I see. You're here for some spirit tuning?
chn: 我知道了，想要委托调灵，是吗？

eng: Oh, is that right...
chn: ……这样啊。

eng: So Master Hewg won't listen to you, either.
chn: 即使由你开口，修古先生还是这么坚持。

eng: You have my thanks, regardless.
chn: 谢谢你。

eng: I'll try and talk him round next time.
chn: 我再去说服他看看。

eng: I know he was given this great entreaty;
chn: ……关于弒神武器，

eng: To craft a weapon which could slay a god. Though I can't help but think of it as a curse.
chn:
修古先生一直挂念着那件事，
我觉得那就像是个诅咒──

eng: A fearsome curse, put on him by Queen Marika.
chn: 玛莉卡女王施加的恐怖诅咒。

eng: And if that's the case, I'm not sure there's anything we can do...
chn: 真是如此，我们有任何对抗的手段吗？

eng: Ah. So it wasn't just me this happened to...
chn: ……唉，果然不只有我。

eng: To think he'd forget who you were, as well.
chn: 修古先生连你都忘了，

eng: I knew he'd burn himself out, old Hewg.
chn: 真的已经回天乏术了……

eng: I think we could talk him into leaving the Roundtable Hold, now.
chn: 现在就有可能说服他离开圆桌厅堂……

eng: But maybe it's better that we don't.
chn: 但我决定放弃了。

eng: It's only proper that we respect his choice to stay.
chn: 因为不离开，是出自修古先生的选择。

eng: I'll remain with Hewg.
chn: ……我要陪修古先生一起留下来。

eng: He made me who I am today.
chn: 修古先生让我的生命有了意义，

eng: I'd like to return the kindness, in whatever small way I can.
chn:
所以轮到我回报他了。
即使力量绵薄，我也想要帮助他。

eng: Please, become Elden Lord.
chn: 请你一定要当上艾尔登之王。

eng: Hewg was always saying that you were a Lord, to him.
chn: 修古先生总是挂在嘴上，说你才是他的王。

eng: So slay her, with the weapons he smithed.
chn: 还有，请你用修古先生锻造的武器杀害神祇吧。

eng: Slay the god, Marika, who cursed us all.
chn: 杀害那诅咒我们的玛莉卡女王。

eng: You're...giving it to me?
chn: ……这要送给我吗？

eng: I've never had alcohol before...
chn: 我不曾喝过酒……

eng: I'm no longer a child. It's about time I took this step.
chn: 但我已经不是小孩子了，会挑战喝喝看。

eng: <sleeping>
You're willing to make me a chrysalid?
chn: 你想把我变成虫蛹吗？

eng: Ah, but I'm still a milksop craven...
chn: 唉，但我太过胆小、懦弱，

eng: I can't even govern myself to step beyond the bounds of this ward...
chn: 没有勇气踏出这层防护障壁。

eng: Please. You're only wasting your strength.
chn: 所以，请你放弃吧。

eng: I know how you must feel.
chn: 我了解你的想法，

eng: But please, I'm not ready.
chn: 但现在请你先放弃吧。

eng: Or are you like me? You're so far out of your mind with fear...
chn: 难道说，你的心里很害怕吗？

eng: You've divested yourself of all reason?
chn: 所以才会表现得如此疯狂？

eng: Please, stop.
chn: 拜托你了，请你放弃吧。

eng: Even if you persist, your fear will not abate.
chn: 这么做也不会冲淡你的恐惧。

eng: Hello? Is anybody there?
chn: ……来人啊！有没有人在？

eng: Someone who might be interested in rescuing the great Kenneth Haight?
chn: 任何能帮助我──肯尼斯·海德的人啊！

eng: Servant to the true Order, and celebrated repudiator of the false!
chn: 志愿屏除不合理，维护正当秩序的人啊！

eng: O Erdtree! Grant me succour!
chn: 啊，黄金树啊！请带来您的侍者吧！

eng: What are you waiting for? A kiss goodbye?
chn: ……你还在这里做什么？

eng: My fort lies to the south, beyond the Mistwood. Take it back for me.
chn: 快点往南走，穿过雾林，夺回我的要塞。

eng: Oh I see. You wish to know the reward?
chn: ……啊，原来如此。你想问报酬吧？

eng: Fret not, the great Kenneth Haight is known for his considerable largesse.
chn: 别小看我肯尼斯·海德，打赏我绝不吝啬。

eng: The celebrations will be lavish indeed, upon the dawn of my fort's retrieval.
chn: 只要确实夺回要塞，肯定大大有赏。

eng: Hmph, yes, now allow me to furnish you with a little advice.
chn: 啊，对，给你一个建议。

eng: I would take great care to avoid Godrick's Tarnished hunts, were I in your shoes.
chn: 最好小心葛瑞克的褪色者猎人。

eng: That depraved lot are obsessed with sacrificing Tarnished like you for the sake of "grafting".
chn:
那群家伙一心想抓到你们褪色者，
当作恐怖“接肢”的祭品。

eng: Honestly, Godrick's nothing more than a jumped up country bumpkin. Lord? Don't make me laugh.
chn:
……只是凭葛瑞克那种格局，
根本不配挤身君王之流。

eng: First he hid himself amongst the womenfolk to flee the capital, then hid from Radahn in that castle...
chn:
战败之后混在女人堆里逃出王城，
忌惮拉塔恩，躲在城里一个气也不敢吭。

eng: Then he insulted Malenia, lost to her in battle, only to lick her boots rather than die like a man.
chn:
小看玛莲妮亚，结果输得落花流水，
还跪地亲吻她的脚表示服从。

eng: Has he no shame, the big girl's blouse?
chn: 实在是软弱无比，不知羞耻的男人。

eng: And to think, he's the blood of Godfrey! Last of the golden lineage, though you almost wouldn't know it to look at him.
chn:
即便出身名门黄金一族，
也看得出来葛孚雷的血统淡了许多。

eng: I almost feel sorry for the chap the more I think of it.
chn: 仔细一想，还真是可悲。

eng: What are you waiting for? A kiss goodbye?
chn: ……你还在这里做什么？

eng: My fort lies to the south, beyond the Mistwood. Take it back for me.
chn: 快点往南走，穿过雾林，夺回我的要塞。

eng: Ah, you've come to lend me your aid, have you?
chn: ……哦哦，出现了啊。

eng: Well, that's very kind, but, um...
chn: 但是，嗯……

eng: No, no. Th-the help is very much appreciated. Even from a Tarnished.
chn: ……不，即便是褪色者，也值得欢迎。

eng: Despite appearances, nobility is no prerequisite to serving the true Order.
chn: “不限身分尊贵与否，皆能维护正当秩序。”

eng: You might have heard of me. Kenneth Haight. Next in line as the rightful ruler of Limgrave.
chn:
我名为肯尼斯·海德，
是宁姆格福领主的嫡长子。

eng: Young Tarnished, I would have a boon of you.
chn: 褪色者啊，我有事要你帮忙。

eng: I want you to take back my fort. It lies to the south, beyond the Mistwood.
chn:
从这里往南走，穿过雾林有一座要塞──
那是我的要塞，希望你帮忙夺回来。

eng: A Knight commander from Stormveil took it. A fool, and plumb mad to boot. Simply obsessed with blood!
chn:
都怪史东薇尔派来的骑士长
实在过于驽钝，竟然会为血痴狂。

eng: Hm? What's this, kind sir?
chn: ……嗯？你想说什么？

eng: Hm? What's this, fair lady?
chn: ……嗯？你想说什么？

eng: Remarkable! The Knight Commander, dead. Already!
chn: 什么！骑士长已经死了吗！

eng: A blessing, if ever I chanced upon one.
chn: 哈哈！实在天助我也。

eng: Fine work, I say, fine work, indeed.
chn: 做得好，做得非常好。

eng: I doubt that it was your intention, but the deed is done, and I commend you.
chn: 虽然你意不在领赏，但实在值得嘉许。

eng: Now, this is your reward.
chn: ……来，这是给你的奖赏。

eng: Go on, it is yours, for the keeping.
chn: 尽管大方收下吧。

eng: Ah-ha! I've been waiting for you with baited breath!
chn: 哦哦，是你啊，我等好久了！

eng: Did you manage to recapture my fort?
chn: 你成功夺回我的要塞了？

eng: Oh excellent news, just wonderful. And the knight's dead to boot!
chn: 成功了吗！骑士长死了啊！

eng: Well done my friend, well done indeed!
chn: 做得好，做得非常好。

eng: I knew I was right to trust you!
chn: 我的眼光果然够精准。

eng: Now, here's your reward, as promised.
chn: ……好，这是说好的报酬。

eng: Go ahead, it's all yours.
chn: 大方收下吧。

eng: Right then. Time for me to head to the fort.
chn: 我要准备回去要塞了。

eng: I've much to do. First I'll have to reestablish communication with the demi-humans.
chn:
该做的事情堆积如山。
首先，必须重启与亚人之间的交流。

eng: What's that look? You don't believe me?
chn: ……瞧你一脸狐疑。

eng: Well, under the Erdtree, commingling with the demi-humans is made possible.
chn:
只要身在黄金树之下，
即便是亚人也会是芳邻。

eng: Even the vulgar shall not be left behind, under the rule of true Order.
chn: “那些卑贱的，正当秩序不会屏除在外。”

eng: Which is why I, Kenneth Haight, next in line as the rightful ruler of Limgrave, have sworn to uphold it.
chn:
这也是宁姆格福的正统政权后代──
我肯尼斯·海德应尽的使命。

eng: Just you watch, my friend. Just you watch.
chn: 你就好好见证一切吧。

eng: Ah, yes. I've been meaning to ask.
chn: 啊，是你啊。我看时机也成熟了……

eng: Would you like to enter my service?
chn: 有没有意思在我底下工作？

eng: I see bright things in your future, stout warrior.
chn: 我很看好你的能力。

eng: Enter into my service and learn the workings of the Erdtree's true Order.
chn: 在我这里工作，学习何谓黄金树之下的正当秩序，

eng: And who knows, perhaps some time down the line, the grace of gold will return to those Tarnished eyes of yours.
chn: 说不定有一天，赐福也会重回你那对褪色的双眼。

eng: What say you? A fine accord, is it not?
chn: 你怎么想？在我看来，是个不错的提案。

eng: Very well. Very well, indeed.
chn: 哦，明智的判断。

eng: I knew I saw something in you.
chn: 你果然前途无量。

eng: I shall await you at my fort.
chn: 我在要塞等你，

eng: We shall hold the ceremony for your knighting there, I think.
chn: 届时封你为骑士。

eng: I see great things ahead of us. We are truly by the Erdtree blessed.
chn:
……多么美好的未来。
名副其实“黄金树赐福我等”啊。

eng: Excuse me?
chn: 什么！

eng: Such foolishness have I never seen!
chn: 你是认真的吗？真是不智。

eng: Well...not that I can't sympathise with your choice.
chn: ……不过，我也能理解，

eng: Such a miraculous manifestation of felicity is like to startle one such as yourself.
chn: 毕竟幸运从天而降，遇见了当然会踌躇。

eng: Should you change your mind, do visit me at my fort.
chn: 如果你改变心意，随时造访我的要塞。

eng: What is it? Have you put your misgivings to rest?
chn: 怎么样？心里的踌躇已经化解了吗？

eng: Well...not that I can't sympathise with your choice.
chn: ……是吗？我能理解。

eng: Such a miraculous manifestation of felicity is like to startle one such as yourself.
chn: 这对你来说真的是天大的幸运。

eng: Oh don't fret, there's no hurry.
chn: 没关系，不急一时。

eng: Should you change your mind, do visit me at my fort.
chn: 如果你改变心意，随时造访我的要塞。

eng: Why...
chn: ……唔，为什么……

eng: Why the queen... Now all hope is...
chn: 为什么对女王……为时、已晚……

eng: (dies)
chn: （死亡）

eng: Ah, you, is it?
chn: ……啊，是你啊。

eng: I suppose you must have seen it by now, yes, the sorry state of my fort?
chn: 要塞的现况，你也看到了。

eng: Oh, indeed, it is a foul fate for a land, to be without a ruler.
chn: ……没有王的土地，实在惨不忍睹。

eng: One must be found, with haste. And not that awful Godrick.
chn: 我必须找到王，但绝非葛瑞克之流，

eng: But a true and stalwart Lord of the proper lineage to take the reigns of Limgrave.
chn:
是能将宁姆格福的正统政权托付于他，
走在正道上的强大王者。

eng: I am sorry to have lifted your hopes...
chn: ……抱歉在你满心期待的时候泼冷水。

eng: But I haven't the authority to raise you to knighthood as things stand.
chn: 现况如此，我没有资格封你为骑士。

eng: The great Kenneth Haight issues his sincerest apology.
chn: 我肯尼斯·海德，由衷地向你致歉。

eng: But now, I must begin my search post-haste.
chn: ……我必须动身寻找──

eng: For a true and stalwart Lord of the proper lineage to take the reigns of Limgrave.
chn:
能将宁姆格福的正统政权托付于他，
走在正道上的强大王者。

eng: I must begin my search post-haste.
chn: ……我必须动身寻找──

eng: For a true and stalwart Lord of the proper lineage to take the reigns of Limgrave.
chn:
能将宁姆格福的正统政权托付于他，
走在正道上的强大王者。

eng: Ah, nice to see you after so long.
chn: ……啊，是你啊。好久不见。

eng: Safe and sound, I take it, yes? Good.
chn: 别来无恙？

eng: Ah, quite. I have indeed selected a new ruler.
chn: ……没错，我找到王了──

eng: Lady Nepheli is strong and just. Worthy of the burden of Limgrave's lineage.
chn:
涅斐丽王。她目视正道、强大，
值得我将宁姆格福的正统政权托付于她。

eng: Such is the sincere opinion of I, Kenneth Haight, no less.
chn: 我肯尼斯·海德有十二万分的肯定。

eng: For the time being, I share command of the castle with my Lady, but I plan on returning to my fort afterwards.
chn:
我将从旁协助涅斐丽王治理这座城，
随后回到我的要塞。

eng: At which time I can fulfil my old promise.
chn: ……届时，我会实现先前的承诺──

eng: By raising you to the glory of knighthood.
chn: 封你为骑士。

eng: I hope it is just as wonderful as you imagine.
chn: 好好期待吧。

eng: For the time being, I share command of the castle with my Lady, but I plan on returning to my fort afterwards.
chn:
我将从旁协助涅斐丽王治理这座城，
随后回到我的要塞。

eng: At which time I can fulfil my old promise.
chn: ……届时，我会实现先前的承诺──

eng: By raising you to the glory of knighthood.
chn: 封你为骑士。

eng: I hope it is just as wonderful as you imagine.
chn: 好好期待吧。

eng: Oof!
chn: 哇啊。

eng: Goodness gracious!
chn: 你做什么！

eng: Calm yourself, this instant!
chn: 冷静下来！

eng: Enough! This is madness!
chn: 快住手！少做蠢事！

eng: Blast! You wretched Tarnished!
chn: 可恶！就凭你这种褪色者！

eng: I am Kenneth Haight, and I have seen quite enough!
chn: 不准小看我肯尼斯·海德！

eng: The madness leaves nothing untouched.
chn: ……所有人都渐渐疯狂，

eng: I fear for the integrity of the Order...
chn: 秩序已经破坏到这种程度了吗……？

eng: Where are my...men...?
chn: ……啊，都没有人在吗？

eng: O Erdtree, why have you forsaken me...?
chn: 黄金树啊，为何弃我于不顾……

eng: Greetings, great champion called by grace.
chn:
受赐福指引而来的英雄啊，
初次见面，幸会。

eng: I am Fia.
chn: 我名为菲雅，

eng: Circumstances have compelled my stay at the Roundtable Hold.
chn: 因故栖身在圆桌厅堂。

eng: Great champion, would you allow me to hold you, but briefly?
chn: 英雄啊，片刻就好，能否让我抱紧你呢？

eng: Perhaps you might share with me some of your lifely vigour, and your stout-heartedness.
chn: 希望你能分给我生存的力量与意志力。

eng: Doing so will grant me the warmth of a champion.
chn: 在抱紧英雄之余，我能感受到你的温暖，

eng: And you, I am sure, will bear a baldachin's blessing.
chn: 也能带给你床帘恩泽。

eng: Do you think it vulgar, perhaps?
chn: ……你会不齿这种行为吗？

eng: Where I come from, it is a sacred act.
chn: 但是在我的故乡，这是具有神圣意义的做法。

eng: Ah, my thanks, great champion.
chn: ……英雄啊，感谢你。

eng: You are...very warm...
chn: ……你好温暖啊……

eng: What you felt light up inside you was a baldachin's blessing.
chn: 现在在你体内深处点亮的，是床帘恩泽。

eng: Though it is but a fleeting thing, I am afraid.
chn: 但那非常短暂易逝……

eng: Come back to me, should you require another.
chn: 在你需要恩泽的时候，请来找我。

eng: I will take you in my arms as often as you need.
chn: 不论几次，我都会再抱紧你。

eng: I understand.
chn: ……我明白了。

eng: Your disdain is only natural.
chn: 会感到不齿，我也能理解。

eng: But should you change your mind...
chn: 但如果你改变了心意……

eng: Come pay me another visit.
chn: 请再过来这个房间。

eng: Oh, my dear...
chn: ……哎呀，是你……

eng: Had a change of heart already?
chn: 难道你改变心意了？

eng: I am pleased to see you again.
chn: 欢迎你来找我。

eng: Would you like me to hold you, once more?
chn: 需要我再抱紧你吗？

eng: The blessing is still aflame in your breast, dear.
chn: 但是你的恩泽还没有熄灭……

eng: Would you like to be held, regardless?
chn: 这样还要继续吗？

eng: Now, come closer...
chn: ……来，过来吧……

eng: You are so...very warm...
chn: ……你真的好温暖唷……

eng: Then good day to you, my dear.
chn: ……请多保重。

eng: I was known as a Deathbed Companion, where I come from.
chn: ……我在故乡的时候，被称呼为“死眠少女”。

eng: After I received the warmth and lifely vigour from a number of champions,
chn: 在我得到无数英雄的温暖，以及生存的力量之后，

eng: I lay with the remains of an exalted noble, to grant him another chance at life.
chn:
再与伟人的尸体同床，
就能让尊贵的生命重回于他──

eng: To do so is the purpose of my being.
chn: 我是为了这个目的而在。

eng: But before I could bear the noble into new life,
chn: ……但是在让伟人重新获得生命之前，

eng: I was awakened by the guidance of grace, and chased from my birthplace.
chn: 我却因为赐福而觉醒……被赶出故乡。

eng: Pray, be kind.
chn: 你应该也察觉到了──

eng: Despite all that, I still wish to be a Deathbed Companion.
chn: 即使如此，我还是想当个死眠少女。

eng: So please, let me hold you like this, as often as it takes.
chn: 所以不论几次都好，请让我像这样抱紧你吧。

eng: My dear...
chn: ……我问你唷。

eng: Might I ask something of you?
chn: 你愿意听听我的请求吗？

eng: Could you please find the owner of this dagger, and return it to them?
chn: 我想请你找出这把短剑的主人，再把短剑还给对方。

eng: A certain person gave it to me, as a gift.
chn: 那是某位大人送给我的礼物，

eng: It's a very precious thing. It must have a special place in the owner's heart.
chn:
但那非常地贵重……
而且好像是具有纪念价值的物品。

eng: So I would like for the original owner to have it back, if you wouldn't mind.
chn: 所以我希望能将它物归原主。

eng: I'd like you to find the owner of the dagger I gave you, and return it to them.
chn:
那把交给你的短剑，
可以帮我找出它的主人，物归原主吗？

eng: It's a very precious thing. It must have a special place in the owner's heart.
chn:
那非常地贵重……
而且好像是具有纪念价值的物品。

eng: My dear...
chn: ……我问你唷。

eng: Have you ever heard of black knifeprints?
chn: 你知道什么是黑刀烙印吗？

eng: Dear Rogier likes to talk of them when abed.
chn: ……罗杰尔先生对我说了枕边故事：

eng: And the ancient plot, in which the first of the Demigods was slain.
chn: 在半神首次出现死者的遥远阴谋之夜，

eng: The black knives wielded by the assassins who committed the act,
chn: 那些动手暗杀的刺客持有的黑刀，

eng: along with the impressions they made, somehow hide the truth of the conspiracy.
chn: 上头肯定藏有烙印，还有阴谋背后的真相。

eng: These grand affairs are hardly my forté...
chn: ……太过复杂的事情，我也是听得一知半解，

eng: But dear Rogier began to weep as he spoke...
chn: 但罗杰尔先生那时说着说着，就哭出来了。

eng: Dear Rogier likes to talk of it when abed.
chn: ……罗杰尔先生对我说了枕边故事：

eng: The ancient plot, in which the first of the Demigods was slain.
chn: 在半神首次出现死者的遥远阴谋之夜，

eng: The black knives wielded by the assassins who committed the act,
chn: 那些动手暗杀的刺客持有的黑刀，

eng: along with the impressions they made, somehow hide the truth of the conspiracy.
chn: 上头肯定藏有烙印，还有阴谋背后的真相。

eng: I heard that you lent a hand to dear Rogier.
chn: ……你帮了罗杰尔先生，对不对？

eng: He seemed positively elated.
chn: 他高兴得不得了呢。

eng: He must be possessed of great mental fortitude.
chn: 罗杰尔先生的心中，肯定有坚强的意志。

eng: It anchors his will, and sustains him, despite his grievous wounds.
chn:
所以即使身体伤痕累累，
还是有办法贯彻自己的信念。

eng: You truly are a champion.
chn: 你果然是英雄。

eng: To dear Rogier, and myself, too.
chn: 尤其对罗杰尔先生，还有对我而言……

eng: In truth I've heard tell from someone else,
chn: ……但其实，罗杰尔先生说的黑刀烙印，

eng: about the black knifeprints that fascinate dear Rogier so.
chn: 我曾经听某位大人说过。

eng: But It wouldn't be right to give this to him, stuck as he is in the Roundtable Hold.
chn:
……罗杰尔先生没有办法离开圆桌厅堂，
所以这张纸条不能交给他。

eng: Perhaps you could make use of it?
chn: 我想把它交给你，你能好好利用它吗？

eng: Finally, it is returned to its rightful place.
chn: ……总算物归原主了。

eng: The stolen hallowbrand, of the exalted noble.
chn: 那位伟人被夺走的圣痕，总算回来了。

eng: And now, I must bid you goodbye as well.
chn: ……该和你道别了。

eng: Though I ask you deliver this message to the Roundtable Hold.
chn: 最后，请替我转达给圆桌厅堂的所有人：

eng: I am Fia, Deathbed Companion.
chn: 我名为菲雅，是“死眠少女”。

eng: Hark, Roundtable. Disturb not the Death of Godwyn, the exalted.
chn: 圆桌厅堂啊，请勿干扰伟人葛德文的死亡。

eng: We, who humbly live in Death...
chn: 我们仅仅因为死亡而诞生──

eng: Live in waiting, to one day welcome our Lord.
chn: 总有一天，我们会得到王。

eng: What right does anyone have to object?
chn: 人民、弱者拥戴自己的王，

eng: Our Lord will rise. The Lord of the many, and the meek.
chn: 会有谁出声指责？

eng: Ah...there you are.
chn: ……你果然来了呢。

eng: I knew you would come.
chn: 我有料想到。

eng: What is it you intend?
chn: 那么，你想怎么做呢？

eng: To deny us, and our ways?
chn: 要像那群粗鲁的黄金律法基本主义者，

eng: Like the dogmatic brutes of the Golden Order?
chn: 否定我们的一切吗？

eng: I see. Then you must kill me.
chn: ……我明白了，那么，请你动手。

eng: For I am the companion of Godwyn, Prince of Death.
chn: 我是葛德文──死王子的同床者。

eng: I wished to be a mother to Those Who Live in Death.
chn: 自认为是众多死诞者的母亲。

eng: So it is, that any loathing, any hatred that overshadows them...
chn: 你对他们的憎恨，

eng: I must bear, as a matter of duty, with my own flesh.
chn: 应该由我全盘承受。

eng: Go on, kill me.
chn: 快，请你动手。

eng: You deny us, do you not?
chn: 你不是否定我们吗？

eng: Because we deign to live in Death, and wish our Lord to rise to glory.
chn:
即使我们不过是因为死亡而诞生，
想要拥戴属于自己的王。

eng: You are an odd one.
chn: ……你还真是奇特。

eng: I am the guardian of Those Who Live in Death.
chn: 我是保护死诞者的人，

eng: They call me a foul and rotten witch.
chn: 甚至被咒骂成骯脏的魔女呢。

eng: Yet you still wish to be held by me?
chn: 你是知情之后，还这么要求吗？

eng: I will soon lay with Godwyn.
chn: ……我就快和葛德文同床了。

eng: And it will surely stir within me.
chn: 一切肯定都会开花结果──

eng: the new life of the golden prince, and first Dead of the demigods,
chn: 黄金王子、半神的初始死者，他将重新获得生命。

eng: as the rune of Those Who Live in Death.
chn: 那为了死诞者而生的卢恩，也要孕育而出。

eng: Please, do one thing for me.
chn: 我想要拜托你。

eng: Brandish this child, my rune, and take for yourself the throne.
chn:
能不能展现我的孩子，
也就是那卢恩，当上王呢？

eng: Stay the persecution of Those Who Live in Death.
chn: 成为允许死诞者存在的，

eng: By becoming our Elden Lord.
chn: 属于我们的艾尔登之王。

eng: I will soon lay with Godwyn.
chn: ……我就快和葛德文同床了。

eng: To conceive my child, the rune.
chn: 而且肯定会怀上孩子，也就是卢恩。

eng: Brandish my rune, and take for yourself the throne.
chn: 你能不能展现那个卢恩，当上王呢？

eng: Stay the persecution of Those Who Live in Death.
chn: 成为允许死诞者存在的，

eng: By becoming our Elden Lord.
chn: 属于我们的艾尔登之王。

eng: This is goodbye, my dear.
chn: ……该和你道别了呢。

eng: But I am satisfied.
chn: ……其实，我很心满意足。

eng: I choose to lie with Godwyn of my own will. Not the remains of one chosen for me.
chn:
因为我不是被迫与某具尸体，
而是自愿与葛德文同床……

eng: And I will bear a child.
chn: 然后怀上孩子。

eng: Who will inherit your warmth, too.
chn: 我想那孩子肯定会继承你的温暖。

eng: What greater blessing could there be, but to be born a Deathbed Companion?
chn: 生为死眠少女，还有什么会比这样更幸福呢？

eng: Have you ever seen a hallowbrand?
chn: ……你看过圣痕吗？

eng: When the first of the demigods died, his flesh was marked with the half-wheel wound of the centipede.
chn:
那是在半神的初次死亡时，
被刻下的、缺半的百足伤环。

eng: Godwyn's hallowbrand has since been recovered at the Roundtable Hold.
chn: 我在圆桌厅堂拿回了葛德文的圣痕，

eng: But there is another hallowbrand out there somewhere.
chn: 但还有另外一个圣痕。

eng: And I must find it.
chn: ……我必须找出另一个圣痕。

eng: Before the time comes we receive our Lord.
chn: 在拥戴我们的王以前，必须要找到。

eng: When Godwyn died, a hallowbrand scored his flesh.
chn: ……葛德文死亡的时候，被刻下了圣痕，

eng: But another exists. Another mark in the shape of the half-wheel wound of the centipede.
chn: 但应该还有另外一个缺半的百足伤环。

eng: And I must find it.
chn: ……我必须找出另一个圣痕。

eng: Before the time comes we receive our Lord.
chn: 在拥戴我们的王以前，必须要找到。

eng: My hands will be dirtied once more by the deed.
chn: ……我很有可能会再弄脏这双手。

eng: Will you still let me hold you, even then?
chn: 即使如此，你还愿意接受我的拥抱吗？

eng: When Godwyn died, a hallowbrand scored his flesh.
chn: ……葛德文死亡的时候，被刻下了圣痕，

eng: But another exists. Another mark in the shape of the half-wheel wound of the centipede.
chn: 但应该还有另外一个缺半的百足伤环。

eng: And I must find it.
chn: ……我必须找出另一个圣痕。

eng: Before the time comes we receive our Lord.
chn: 在拥戴我们的王以前，必须要找到。

eng: This...is the other hallowbrand.
chn: 这是……另一个圣痕……

eng: How did you...
chn: 你为什么会……

eng: Oh, my utmost thanks.
chn: ……啊，谢谢你。

eng: With this, Godwyn can take his rightful place as First of the Dead.
chn: 这么一来，葛德文就能成为纯粹的初始死者，

eng: And claim a second, illustrious life.
chn: 一定能让尊贵的生命重回于他。

eng: You are my-- our true champion.
chn: 你是我的……不对，你是我们的英雄。

eng: And though I can't be of any use to you...
chn: 我能做的事情非常有限……

eng: Can I hold you tight, if only for a moment?
chn: 只有一瞬间也好，让我紧紧拥抱你吧。

eng: Godwyn...
Is that you, dear?
chn: 葛德文，是你吗……？

eng: Will your kind never stop?
chn: ……这就是你们的一贯作风吧……？

eng: Ravaging...the weak?
chn: ……欺凌，弱者……

eng: Have you ever felt the curse, with your whole being?
chn: ……你曾经感应过诅咒吗──

eng: The pox upon life itself, feared and despised by all. The reviled blessing.
chn: 那受人恐惧、嫌恶的生命宿疾，那丑陋的赐福？

eng: Apparently not.
chn: ……在我看来，你不曾吧。

eng: You are but a lamb. A stranger to defilement. Ignorant of your own ignorance.
chn:
你还是稚子──
不知污秽，也浑然不觉自身的无知。

eng: You no longer interest me.
chn: 和你，我没有话好谈。

eng: I've been long without peace. Don't spoil my quietude.
chn: 难得这么宁静……不要打扰我。

eng: I asked you not to disturb me.
chn: ……我都说了，不要打扰我。

eng: Be thankful of the Hold's serenity.
chn: 你要感谢圆桌厅堂不得械斗的规矩，

eng: It is all that keeps your death and defilement at bay.
chn: 因此你才留住一命，得以不受玷污。

eng: No, wait.
chn: ……慢着，等一下。

eng: You have felt the curse.
chn: 你感应得到诅咒吧？

eng: I can smell it on you. The pox, yet tender.
chn: 那湿润的宿疾气味，扑鼻而来啊。

eng: Apparently my seedbed is ripe and waiting.
chn: ……看来，我的温床已经熟成了，

eng: Twas a brief respite, I must say.
chn: 这份宁静真短暂。

eng: Go, and unshackle my corporeal flesh.
chn: ……你来释放我的身体吧。

eng: Trapped in the sewer gaol, below the capital.
chn: 我的身体被关在王城地底的下水道监牢。

eng: I can kill you, and defile your corpse.
chn: 到时候，我会杀了你、玷污你，

eng: Then the pox will truly be your own.
chn: 让那宿疾完全转化，变成属于你的东西。

eng: Go, and unshackle my corporeal flesh.
chn: ……你来释放我的身体吧。

eng: Trapped in the sewer gaol, below the capital.
chn: 我的身体被关在王城地底的下水道监牢。

eng: I can kill you, and defile your corpse.
chn: 到时候，我会杀了你、玷污你，

eng: Then the pox will truly be your own.
chn: 让那宿疾完全转化，变成属于你的东西。

eng: Let me out! Let me out of here!
chn: 让我出去！让我从这里出去！

eng: Must eat more! Defile more!
chn: 让我吃！让我玷污！

eng: Everything that matters to you!
chn: 吃尽你们的一切！

eng: For generations to come!
chn: 玷污你们的未来！

eng: I am the Dung Eater!
chn: 我是“食粪者”！

eng: A scourge upon the living!
chn: 你们所有人的诅咒！

eng: Who are you?
chn: ……你是谁？

eng: I've been here long enough.
chn: ……我要出去，从这里出去。

eng: I will kill again. And defile each corpse with care.
chn: ……我要杀，还要仔仔细细玷污，

eng: Just to be sure. That when they're reborn…
chn: 让所有人都变成在诅咒下诞生，

eng: They'll be cursed. Along with their children, and their children's children, for all time to come…
chn: 让子孙，后代的诅咒源源不绝。

eng: I will kill again. And defile each corpse with care.
chn: ……我要杀，还要仔仔细细玷污，

eng: Just to be sure. That when they're reborn…
chn: 让所有人都变成在诅咒下诞生，

eng: They'll be cursed. Along with their children, and their children's children, for all time to come…
chn: 让子孙，后代的诅咒源源不绝。

eng: I am the Dung Eater.
chn: 我是“食粪者”，

eng: A scourge upon the living.
chn: 你们所有人的诅咒。

eng: I must eat more. Defile more...
chn: 让我吃，让我玷污……

eng: Let me out. Let me out of here.
chn: ……我要出去，让我出去。

eng: I will kill you, and defile your corpse.
chn: ……我要杀了你、玷污你，

eng: Then the pox will truly be your own.
chn: 让那宿疾完全转化，变成属于你的东西。

eng: I'll give you a good blessing.
chn: ……赐福降临了──

eng: You'll be nourishment for the pox.
chn: 变成宿疾的温床吧。

eng: There you are.
chn: ……我等你很久了。

eng: You warded off my blessing.
chn: ……你拒绝了赐福。

eng: Despite the curse stirring within you.
chn: 你明明感应得到诅咒，

eng: No one has succeeded in that before.
chn: 那无人能敌的赐福，你却拒绝了。

eng: How? I thought. Then it hit me.
chn:
为什么？
……背后的原因，我终于想通了。

eng: That you are, in fact, me. And I...am the Dung Eater.
chn: 你，就是我。而我，是“食粪者”。

eng: It is my flesh that must receive the blessing.
chn: 我的身体蒙受赐福的时刻，总算来到。

eng: Give me your blessing.
chn: ……对我降下赐福吧──

eng: Defile my flesh with the seedbed curse.
chn: 让温床的诅咒侵蚀我的身体。

eng: Again and again. Until it is done.
chn: 周而复始、巡回不断地，侵蚀我吧──

eng: Until a cursed ring coalesces, that may one day defile Order itself.
chn: 玷污律法，直到诅咒法环降临于世。

eng: Countless, I have killed. And countless, I have defiled.
chn: ……我杀人无数，玷污更不在话下，

eng: And soon the fruits will be borne.
chn: 一切总算开花结果。

eng: Hundreds will be reborn cursed, and they'll bear thousands of cursed children, who'll bear tens of thousands more.
chn:
数以百计的诅咒应运而生，数以千计的诅咒之子降世，
再之后，数以万计，受诅咒的后代繁衍不息，

eng: A few of those will be born just like me, and they'll kill, and defile, and bless in my stead!
chn:
从那之中再诞生几个我一般的存在──
无止尽地杀害、玷污、降下赐福。

eng: The rotten fools. My fate was the grandest, most brilliant of them all!
chn:
……好好看仔细了。
我们受到的引导有多么美妙。

eng: My corporeal flesh lies in the sewer gaol beneath the Capital.
chn: ……我的身体在王城地底的下水道监牢。

eng: Give it your blessing. Defile my flesh with the seedbed curse.
chn: 对我降下赐福吧──让温床的诅咒侵蚀我的身体。

eng: Until a cursed ring coalesces, that may one day defile Order itself.
chn: 玷污律法，直到诅咒法环降临于世。

eng: Uur...urgh...
chn: ……呜呜、呜呜呜……

eng: A curse... A curse upon them all.
chn: 诅咒，我要诅咒……

eng: They'll be born cursed, all of them.
chn: 让所有人在诅咒之下诞生……

eng: Along with their children, and their children's children, heh, for all time to come…
chn: 让子孙，后代的诅咒源源不绝……

eng: Uur...urgh...
chn: ……呜呜、呜呜呜……

eng: Curse you, Golden Order.
chn: 黄金律法啊，受诅咒吧……

eng: One day, you'll get what's coming.
chn: 我一定要玷污你……

eng: Ah...argh...
No... I am... the Dung Eater...
chn: 住手……我、我是……“食粪者”……

eng: I am...
chn: 直到最后一刻……

eng: Bless you!
chn: 蒙受赐福吧──！

eng: Oh, this is a rare occasion.
chn: ……哦，有新的褪色者来到圆桌厅堂。

eng: I can't remember the last time a new Tarnished made their way to the Roundtable.
chn: 上一次有新人来，是很久以前了。

eng: Very well. As your senior, I bid you welcome.
chn:
很好。作为圆桌厅堂的前辈，
欢迎后生晚辈来到这里。

eng: It is safe here. You may let down your guard.
chn: 这里很安全……好好放松吧。

eng: Allow me a word of advice, as your senior.
chn: ……前辈我想先给你一个建议。

eng: You are a mere visitor to the Roundtable, nothing more.
chn: 现在的你只是有办法出入圆桌厅堂。

eng: A house guest, yet to earn their keep.
chn: 换句话说，就只是个过客。

eng: Remember your place, newcomer.
chn: 把这件事谨记在心，不要逾矩。

eng: There's nothing left to say. Be at your leisure.
chn: ……我该说的都说完了。好好放松吧。

eng: What do you need? I have little time to spare.
chn: ……有什么事吗？我还有事要忙……

eng: Oh, are you aggrieved? At the notion you are but a visitant here?
chn: ……哦，说你是圆桌厅堂的过客，不高兴吗？

eng: Then you would do well to remember the first words of grace given to you.
chn:
那你回想一下吧──
得到赐福指引的最一开始，自己听到了什么。

eng: Stand before the Elden Ring, and become the Elden Lord.
chn: 如果不想把那些话当作天方夜谭，

eng: If those words held any meaning to you...
chn: 想要觐见艾尔登法环，成为艾尔登之王……

eng: Follow the guidance of grace, lay low the shardbearers, and claim for yourself a Great Rune.
chn:
就遵从赐福的指引，打倒碎片君王，
成为大卢恩的持有者吧。

eng: Do so, and the doors to the Roundtable's inner chamber will open.
chn:
成功之后，圆桌厅堂最深处的房间──
它的门也会为你敞开。

eng: And you will receive the wisdom of the Two Fingers.
chn: 你就能听到双指的建言。

eng: Once the wisdom of the Two Fingers becomes your own, I'll impart to you a proper welcome.
chn: 在你听过双指的建言之后，我会欣然欢迎你──

eng: As a true member of the Roundtable.
chn: 成为圆桌厅堂真正的一员。

eng: I have high hopes for you.
chn: ……我很期待你的表现。

eng: I'm sick and tired of them.
chn: 老实说，我已经受够了那群人──

eng: These namby-pamby Tarnished think us no more than a shelter from the rain...
chn: 误以为圆桌厅堂是避难所的，褪色者冒牌货。

eng: We've spoken long enough. I have matters to attend to.
chn: ……该说的都说完了，我还有事要忙。

eng: If you haven't anything to say, I would prefer you didn't pester me for attention.
chn: ……既然无话可说，就不要搭话。

eng: Try not to make a spectacle of yourself either. Or are you as irredeemably foolish as you appear?
chn: 自己胸无点墨，用不着昭告天下。

eng: You've received the wisdom of the Two Fingers, have you not?
chn: ……你听过双指的建言了。

eng: Then just as promised, I bid you welcome, as a true member of the Roundtable.
chn:
那么，如同我承诺的──
欢迎你加入，成为圆桌厅堂真正的一员。

eng: I am known as Gideon Ofnir.
chn: 我是基甸·奥夫尼尔。

eng: As a Tarnished who wishes to stand before the Elden Ring and become Elden Lord,
chn:
作为一名褪色者，
为了觐见艾尔登法环，成为艾尔登之王，

eng: I am accumulating knowledge. To be all-knowing.
chn: 求知若渴，渴望全知的人。

eng: You now belong to a select group of fellows. As such, I ask that you remain constant.
chn: ……为数不多的同志啊，希望我们能长久合作。

eng: You'll be after more Great Runes, now eh?
chn: ……你应该想得到更多大卢恩吧？

eng: Then as your fellow, allow me to divulge a little knowledge.
chn: 看在彼此的同志情谊，我共享一些情报。

eng: The inheritors of the Great Runes; the shardbearers.
chn: 拥有大卢恩的碎片君王──

eng: We of the Roundtable know the location of five of them, including the one you defeated.
chn:
包含你打倒的在内，
圆桌厅堂已经掌握了其中５位的所在地。

eng: Godrick the Grafted, Lord of Stormveil.
chn: 史东薇尔之主，“接肢”葛瑞克。

eng: General Radahn, who fought Malenia and her rot to a standstill in the Caelid Wilds.
chn: 在盖利德原野与玛莲妮亚战成平手的拉塔恩将军。

eng: Praetor Rykard, Lord of the Volcano Manor of Mt. Gelmir.
chn: 格密尔的火山官邸之主，拉卡德司法官。

eng: Morgott the Grace-Given, Veiled Monarch and Lord of Leyndell.
chn: 王城罗德尔的城主，不见形影的王，“赐福”蒙葛特。

eng: And Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon, ruler of Raya Lucaria's Academy.
chn: 还有魔法学院雷亚卢卡利亚，“满月女王”蕾娜菈。

eng: ...You'll still be after more Great Runes, won't you?
chn: ……他们之中，你想得到谁的大卢恩？

eng: So. Godrick the Grafted, Lord of Stormveil.
chn: 史东薇尔之主“接肢”葛瑞克，

eng: Despite being the blood of Godfrey, first Elden Lord, he's a grotesque old fool, grasping for power.
chn:
他是“初始艾尔登之王”葛孚雷的后代，
却是又老又丑，汲汲营营、贪得力量的异形。

eng: His castle lies upon the cliff to Limgrave's northwest.
chn: 那座城就在宁姆格福地区，西北方的断崖上。

eng: ...but I suspect you know that well enough already.
chn: ……这些，我想你很熟悉。

eng: General Radahn, the famed Red Lion and scourge of the stars, is a ferocious warrior.
chn: “碎星红狮子”拉塔恩将军，是万夫莫敌的习武之人，

eng: He fought Malenia and her rot to a standstill in the Caelid Wilds to Limgrave's east.
chn:
然而他在宁姆格福往东，那辽阔的盖利德原野上，
和玛莲妮亚的腐败战成平手。

eng: And now Caelid has been engulfed by the scarlet rot, even approaching the region is no mean feat.
chn:
……从那之后，盖利德就被猩红腐败吞噬，
无法轻易靠近。

eng: I've heard survivors of Radahn's army are still in the wilds, staving off the rot with fire.
chn:
我听说拉塔恩军队的残兵还留在原地，
用火焰对付腐败。

eng: And if it's true, I suspect Radahn is still there as well, in Caelid.
chn: 看样子，拉塔恩应该还在盖利德。

eng: Though I doubt he much resembles his former self anymore...
chn: ……但他现在的模样，可能让人不敢领教。

eng: Praetor Rykard is the Lord of the Volcano Manor on Mt. Gelmir.
chn: 拉卡德司法官是格密尔火山官邸的主人，

eng: He is a ruthless justiciar who commands a company of inquisitors, reviled for his serpentine demeanour.
chn:
是个毫无怜悯心的法官，也是众多拷问官的长官。
如蛇一般，令人感冒的男人。

eng: The volcano, Mt. Gelmir, lies in the west of the Altus Plateau; the realm of the Erdtree.
chn: 格密尔火山在黄金树大地，亚坛高原的西边。

eng: It was the stage of the most appalling battle in the entirety of the Shattering.
chn: 那里是破碎战争中，战况最为惨烈的地方。

eng: Rykard has committed the grave sin of blasphemy. Marking himself as an enemy, never to be forgiven.
chn: ……拉卡德犯下了亵渎罪，是罪无可赦的敌人。

eng: Morgott the Grace-Given is Lord of Leyndell, the capital city.
chn: “赐福”蒙葛特是王城罗德尔的主人。

eng: It lies at the foot of the Erdtree, in the east of the Altus Plateau.
chn: 那座城就在亚坛高原以东的黄金树树脚……

eng: But the Two Fingers forbid us from venturing there.
chn: 但双指不允许我们靠近该处。

eng: Until we've acquired enough Great Runes to repair the Elden Ring.
chn:
直到获得多个大卢恩，
得以修复艾尔登法环之后，才有可能靠近。

eng: Set your sights elsewhere for the time being. The Veiled Monarch can wait.
chn: 因此那不见形影的王，现在不是我们的目标。

eng: The Academy of Raya Lucaria lies to Limgrave's north, towering over the mist-laden lands of Liurnia.
chn:
魔法学院雷亚卢卡利亚耸立在宁姆格福以北，
飘着浓雾的利耶尼亚地区。

eng: Rennala is the queen of the Carian royals, who govern the academy.
chn: 蕾娜菈是学院的领导者──卡利亚王室的女王。

eng: But Rennala herself is no demigod.
chn: ……然而蕾娜菈本身不是半神。

eng: She is merely the recipient of an amber egg, given to her by Radagon,
chn: 她手上有一颗受赠的琥珀卵──

eng: Her beloved, Radagon, left her to become Queen Marika's second husband, taking the title of King Consort.
chn:
抛弃她之后，成为玛莉卡女王
第二任丈夫的王夫拉达冈──

eng: The Great Rune dwells within the amber egg that was Radagon's gift to her.
chn: 据说那男人送给她的琥珀卵里头，藏着大卢恩。

eng: There are four more demigods yet to be located.
chn:
还有４位半神的所在地，
我个人和圆桌厅堂都毫无线索。

eng: Miquella of the Haligtree, the Unalloyed.
chn: 纯净无比的黄金，“圣树”米凯拉。

eng: His twin, Malenia, the undefeated swordswoman.
chn: 米凯拉的孪生手足，“战无不胜之剑”玛莲妮亚。

eng: Lunar Princess Ranni, daughter to Rennala.
chn: 蕾娜菈的女儿，“月之公主”菈妮。

eng: And the one only known as the Lord of Blood.
chn: 还有被称为“鲜血君王”的不明人物。

eng: Ranni is said to have cast aside her Great Rune,
chn: 据说菈妮抛弃了大卢恩，

eng: so here at the Hold, we seek the whereabouts of the remaining three shardbearers.
chn: 所以圆桌厅堂一直在搜寻其他３位的下落。

eng: If you should learn anything of these matters,
chn: 如果你告诉我相关的情报……

eng: I'll trade your findings for a hidden treasure, or a long-lost rite, known only to me.
chn:
我会提供你只有我知道的秘密宝藏，
或是秘术作为交换。

eng: We both desire to stand before the Elden Ring, and become Elden Lord.
chn:
彼此都为了觐见艾尔登法环，
成为艾尔登之王而努力，

eng: As such, I hope we are compelled to work together.
chn: 看在同志情谊，还望你鼎力相助。

eng: I'll trade your findings for something rather special.
chn: 我会提供你特殊的物品，作为交换。

eng: Ah, you. What is it?
chn: ……啊，是你啊。有什么事吗？

eng: Well...what is it now?
chn: ……还有什么事吗？

eng: Well. I see you've found another Great Rune.
chn: ……哦，你拿到另一个大卢恩了？

eng: Wonderful. You are a worthy fellow Tarnished, indeed.
chn:
太出色了，你真是表现出色的同志，
出色的褪色者。

eng: Make the journey.
chn: ……既然如此，你就动身前往吧。

eng: To the capital Leyndell, that lies to the east of the Altus Plateau, at the foot of the Erdtree.
chn: 朝亚坛高原以东的黄金树树脚，王城罗德尔前进。

eng: The Two Fingers will deny your passage no longer.
chn: 双指的封印不会再拒你于门外。

eng: You may be our best hope. Find your way to the Elden Ring.
chn: ……我满心期待，你接近艾尔登法环的那一刻。

eng: For we are Tarnished. And we must answer the call of grace.
chn: 我们褪色者受到指引，那是指引所说的下一步啊。

eng: Journey to the capital Leyndell, to the east of the Altus Plateau, at the foot of the Erdtree.
chn:
动身前往吧。朝亚坛高原以东的黄金树树脚，
王城罗德尔前进。

eng: The Two Fingers will deny your passage no longer.
chn: 双指的封印不会再拒你于门外。

eng: You may be our best hope. Find your way to the Elden Ring.
chn: ……我满心期待，你接近艾尔登法环的那一刻。

eng: General Radahn, the famed Red Lion and scourge of the stars, is a ferocious warrior.
chn: “碎星红狮子”拉塔恩将军，是万夫莫敌的习武之人，

eng: He fought Malenia and her rot to a standstill in the Caelid Wilds to Limgrave's east.
chn:
然而他在宁姆格福往东，那辽阔的盖利德原野上，
和玛莲妮亚的腐败战成平手。

eng: And by my reckoning Radahn remains there, even now.
chn: 拉塔恩应该还在盖利德。

eng: Though I doubt he much resembles his former self anymore...
chn: ……但他现在的模样，可能让人不敢领教。

eng: Morgott the Grace-Given is Lord of Leyndell, the capital city.
chn: “赐福”蒙葛特是王城罗德尔的主人。

eng: It lies at the foot of the Erdtree, in the east of the Altus Plateau.
chn: 那座城就在亚坛高原以东的黄金树树脚……

eng: But the Two Fingers forbid us from venturing there.
chn: 但双指不允许我们靠近该处。

eng: Until we've acquired enough Great Runes to repair the Elden Ring.
chn:
直到获得多个大卢恩，
得以修复艾尔登法环之后，才有可能靠近。

eng: The Academy of Raya Lucaria lies to Limgrave's north, towering over the mist-laden lands of Liurnia.
chn:
魔法学院雷亚卢卡利亚耸立在宁姆格福以北，
飘着浓雾的利耶尼亚地区。

eng: Rennala is the queen of the Carian royals, who govern the academy.
chn: 蕾娜菈是学院的领导者──卡利亚王室的女王。

eng: And her Great Rune dwells within the egg she so dearly clutches.
chn: 她紧紧抱着的琥珀卵里头，藏着大卢恩。

eng: You've received the wisdom of the Two Fingers, have you not?
chn: ……你听过双指的建言了。

eng: Then I bid you welcome, as a true member of the Roundtable.
chn: 那么欢迎你加入，成为圆桌厅堂真正的一员。

eng: I am known as Gideon Ofnir.
chn: 我是基甸·奥夫尼尔。

eng: As a Tarnished who wishes to stand before the Elden Ring and become Elden Lord,
chn:
作为一名褪色者，
为了觐见艾尔登法环，成为艾尔登之王，

eng: I am accumulating knowledge. To be all-knowing.
chn: 求知若渴，渴望全知的人。

eng: You now belong to a select group of fellows. As such, I ask that you remain constant.
chn: ……为数不多的同志啊，希望我们能长久合作。

eng: I understand you've been speaking to Nepheli.
chn: ……你和涅斐丽说过话了？

eng: She is my daughter.
chn: 对，她是我的女儿。

eng: I took her in when she lost the guidance of grace.
chn: 在她失去赐福指引的时候，我收养了她。

eng: Though a mere axe-wielding barbarian, her youthful credulity suited my purposes.
chn:
虽然是个只懂得挥舞斧头的野人，
但那孩童一般，对人深信不疑的性格，实在可爱。

eng: So I put her to work.
chn: 所以我让她替我做事。

eng: Do not hesitate to employ her, should her services benefit you.
chn: ……如果有她能帮忙的，就让她出力吧。

eng: Despite her looks, she is more than capable in the press of battle.
chn: 你看到她的外表可能会怀疑，但她确实有实力。

eng: Ahh, you've already heard?
chn: ……哦，这件事你知情啊？

eng: Indeed, it seemed the whelp harboured suspicions.
chn: 对，既然她开始心存疑念……

eng: So I had no further use for her.
chn: 那就没用处了。

eng: Honestly, what's a man to do.
chn: ……实在恼人。

eng: A determined plebian is more wicked than an Omen horn, quite frankly.
chn:
无知者的意志是毒瘤，
恶质到连恶兆的角都显得逊色。

eng: I suspect...that's just what the Queen wants.
chn: ……但我猜想，可能女王盼的也是如此──

eng: A dose of ambition, to incite the Tarnished.
chn: 我们褪色者的相互猜忌。

eng: Is that potion what I think it is?
chn: ……哦，你手上的那种药……

eng: Bloody Seluvis. I suppose he's up to something again.
chn: 赛尔维斯那厮，恶习又犯了。

eng: Oh, I won't interfere. You go ahead and do what you must.
chn: 啊，无妨。你也有自己的做事方式。

eng: The Roundtable has no code to speak of.
chn: 圆桌厅堂无意约束任何人。

eng: But, I ask you this. Are you really going to do the bidding of that twisted dolly botherer?
chn: 但是啊，你打算任凭那令人不悦的男人摆布？

eng: Or would you rather hand that potion to me, and see if we can't get one over on the bastard?
chn:
还是说，你愿意把药交给我，
假装自己有照他的意思行事？

eng: Good. I'll dispose of the potion myself.
chn: ……很好。药交给我善后。

eng: You go and see Seluvis, but don't give anything away.
chn: 你只要装作不知情，回报赛尔维斯就好──

eng: Just tell him that you tricked your mark into drinking the potion as planned.
chn: “确实让对方喝下了。”

eng: Despite knowing next to bloody nothing, he's so far up his own arse he won't suspect a thing.
chn:
那厮绝对不会察觉。重要的事情他一概不知，
那书痴连发生这种事的可能性都不曾推想过。

eng: His inevitable display of arrogance will certainly be a sight to behold.
chn: 好好欣赏他自大的滑稽样吧。

eng: Well, I won't force you.
chn: ……嗯，我不会强求。

eng: But I think your plan would be a dreadful waste.
chn: 但难道，你不觉得可惜？

eng: She's not herself right now, and though I have no need of her, she still has potential.
chn:
尽管那女娃儿不合我的心意，现在又是那副样子，
但她的确是未经琢磨的原石。

eng: Certainly more value than she'd have as a bloody puppet.
chn: ……那样的她，竟然要变成无趣的傀儡啊。

eng: I hear you helped get the girl back on her feet.
chn: ……那女娃儿受你照顾了。

eng: Though I'm not her foster father anymore, I'd still like to thank you.
chn: 我毕竟曾是义父，该向你致谢。

eng: Sorry. For the time you had to waste.
chn: ……不好意思，浪费你不少的时间。

eng: Well, I won't force you.
chn: ……嗯，我不会强求。

eng: If you want to do that dolly botherer's bidding, that's up to you.
chn: 你愿意接受那男人摆布，也是种选择。

eng: Not that I could fathom why you'd want to...
chn: 只是我无法理解罢了……

eng: Oh, my apologies for that nasty business.
chn: ……啊，发生那件事，我深感抱歉。

eng: Ensha got rather ahead of himself, it seems.
chn: 恩夏实在太过急躁。

eng: As his master, I'd like to express my regret.
chn: 身为他的主人，向你致上歉意。

eng: But now, Ensha is slain and gone.
chn: 但又说来，恩夏战败、赔上性命──

eng: Finished, forever more.
chn: 实在是无药可救啊。

eng: Ah, yes, by way of apology,
chn: ……啊，为了表示歉意，

eng: allow me to tender some advice, in regard to the half of the secret medallion you possess.
chn:
我来提供情报吧──
关于你拿到的秘密符节，它的另一半边的情报。

eng: Find the Albinauric woman.
chn: ……去找白金之子的女人吧。

eng: She hides in a cave to the west of the Laskyar Ruins which jut from the mist-shrouded lake of Liurnia,
chn:
那女人躲在利耶尼亚的雾湖，
拉斯卡废墟西边的洞窟内，

eng: She knows the location of the medallion's counterpart, I am sure.
chn: 她肯定知道另一半的秘密符节在哪里。

eng: together with her great wolf.
chn: 和她的大狼一起行动。

eng: Find the Albinauric woman.
chn: ……去找白金之子的女人吧。

eng: She hides in a cave to the west of the Laskyar Ruins which jut from the mist-shrouded lake of Liurnia,
chn:
那女人躲在利耶尼亚的雾湖，
拉斯卡废墟西边的洞窟内，

eng: She knows the location of the medallion's counterpart, I am sure.
chn: 她肯定知道另一半的秘密符节在哪里。

eng: together with her great wolf.
chn: 和她的大狼一起行动。

eng: Ah, yes, by way of apology,
chn: ……啊，为了表示歉意，

eng: allow me to tender some advice, in regard to the half of the secret medallion you possess.
chn:
我来提供情报吧──
关于你拿到的秘密符节，它的另一半边的情报。

eng: Find the village of the Albinaurics.
chn: ……去找白金村吧。

eng: It lies to the southwest of Liurnia, below the Altar clifflands.
chn: 白金村就在利耶尼亚的西南边，祭坛悬崖的下方。

eng: And some of the old village folk have hidden the secret medallion's other half somewhere.
chn:
……那另一半边的秘密符节，
应该是村里的那群老人把它藏了起来。

eng: Find the village of the Albinaurics.
chn: ……去找白金村吧。

eng: It lies to the southwest of Liurnia, below the Altar clifflands.
chn: 白金村就在利耶尼亚的西南边，祭坛悬崖的下方。

eng: Some of the old village folk have hidden the secret medallion's other half somewhere.
chn:
……那另一半边的秘密符节，
应该是村里的那群老人把它藏了起来。

eng: Ahh, I know already. You're after it too, aren't you.
chn: ……嗯，我当然知道，你的目标也一样。

eng: To pass the impenetrable thorns, you seek the forge of the flame of ruin, in the snowy mountaintops of the giants.
chn:
你想穿过拒绝的刺，所以要前往
积着厚雪的巨人山顶，抵达灰灭火焰的大锅。

eng: Then you need to reach the Grand Lift of Rold, beyond the forbidden region.
chn: ……既然如此，你该朝禁域前头的洛德大升降机前进。

eng: Hah, no need to pay me for that gift.
chn: 不需要道谢，别客气。

eng: All my knowledge is for the sake of guidance.
chn: 我的知识全为了引导而在，

eng: That a Tarnished might stand before the Elden Ring, and become Elden Lord.
chn:
也是为了让褪色者觐见艾尔登法环，
成为艾尔登之王而在。

eng: It doesn't have to be me, my fellow.
chn: ……达成这些伟业的，不必是我本人。

eng: If you're heading to the forge of the flame of ruin, in the snowy mountaintops of the giants.
chn:
……想前往积着厚雪的巨人山顶，
抵达灰灭火焰的大锅，

eng: You'll need to find the Grand Lift of Rold, beyond the forbidden region.
chn: 你该朝禁域前头的洛德大升降机前进。

eng: I marked your map with its location.
chn: ……刚才我已经在你的地图上注记。

eng: Go, if you would. Take no heed of "cardinal sin".
chn:
做出这些行为等同犯下重罪，
但你还是出发吧。

eng: The Two Fingers lost their purpose a long, long time ago.
chn: ……早在很久以前，双指就已经毁坏了。

eng: Ahh, I see you've laid your hands on the other secret medallion.
chn: ……哦，两个秘密符节，你都拿到手了？

eng: I'm glad to see my counsel has borne fruit, but the honour of the deed is yours alone.
chn:
我很庆幸先前的情报有帮上忙……
但话说回来，你真的很出色。

eng: You've made more of yourself than Ensha has...
chn: 比起恩夏，更是出色……

eng: Now, more importantly, both secret medallions are in your hands.
chn: 总之，现在总算凑齐了秘密符节。

eng: I suppose you'd like to know then? What awaits you on the path ahead?
chn: 你想知道前头会有什么等着你吧？

eng: Me too, my friend, me too. I wait with baited breath.
chn: 对，我也很想知道。我很期待。

eng: Ahh, so the secret medallions led you to the land of the Haligtree?
chn:
……果然如此。秘密符节带你前进的地方，
是圣树的所在地。

eng: I'd expect to find Malenia there. She who fought Radahn to a standstill.
chn: 和拉塔恩战成平手的玛莲妮亚，人应该就在那。

eng: Well, if the scarlet rot hasn't eaten her away completely.
chn: ……前提是，她没有因为猩红腐败自毁的话。

eng: But...with the Haligtree as it is...
chn: ……只是说，圣树的那模样……

eng: I suppose Miquella must already be...
chn: 米凯拉可能已经……

eng: Ah, my apologies. Lost myself, for a moment there.
chn: 啊，抱歉，我自顾自地陷入沉思。

eng: The information you've shared is of great value. As promised, your reward:
chn: 你的情报很有价值，如同我们约定的──

eng: A hidden treasure, known only to me.
chn: 我愿意提供给你，只有我知道的秘密宝藏。

eng: A secret rite known only to me.
chn: 我愿意提供给你，只有我知道的秘术。

eng: You are a true fellow. All I ask is that you remain constant.
chn:
……你是我如假包换的同志。
希望我们可以一直长久合作。

eng: And it is a wondrous thing indeed.
chn: 我愿意提供给你特殊的物品。

eng: So. The Haligtree, now but a husk...
chn: ……原来啊。圣树果真变成空壳了。

eng: I heard speculation Miquella embedded himself in the Haligtree,
chn: 听说米凯拉原本寄宿在圣树之中，

eng: but before he could finish, someone cut the tree open and absconded with his infant form.
chn:
然而在他完全寄宿以前，
有人剖开圣树，夺走其中的稚子。

eng: Indeed, it seems those words held weight.
chn: ……看样子，那件事不假。

eng: How vexing. That the All-knowing didn't have the full story...
chn:
……真是棘手。
居然会有百智爵士无从知晓全貌的事。

eng: Perhaps the Queen's sorrow was justified...
chn: 也难怪女王会感到烦忧……

eng: Oh, so that's where the so-called Lord of Blood was hiding himself eh.
chn: ……哦，那名叫鲜血君王的，竟然藏身在那种地方。

eng: A fitting little squat for that deluded maniac to bleat about the revival of his precious dynasty, while he turns our fellow Tarnished into Bloody Fingers.
chn:
意图将我们褪色者化为血指，
满怀着复兴王朝的夸张妄想，那地底倒是很适合他。

eng: Let him stay there. That way, his delusions will remain as they are - distant and unattainable.
chn:
……他继续蛰伏地底倒也好。
如此一来妄想只会是妄想，也是永远的美梦。

eng: But perhaps it's worth looking into...
chn: ……话说回来，这听来有调查的必要。

eng: If what I've heard is right, then maybe...
chn: 如果那件事不假，有可能……

eng: Ahh, I see! So Miquella was with the Lord of Blood after all!
chn:
……哦哦，原来啊！
米凯拉果真在鲜血君王的身旁吗？

eng: That is some fine intelligence indeed!
chn: 你啊，这可是天大的情报。

eng: With it, the final clue has been brought into the light.
chn:
圆桌厅堂，不，该说是我个人该知道的，
这是最后一件了。

eng: One of the last few pieces the Roundtable-- I need, to put everything together.
chn: 那条线索总算明朗了。

eng: As promised, allow me to impart to you
chn: ……依照我们的约定，我愿意提供给你──

eng: the last of the hidden treasures known only to me.
chn: 只有我知道的秘密宝藏，其中最上等的一个。

eng: the last of the secret rites known only to me.
chn: 只有我知道的秘术，其中最上等的一个。

eng: a thing most wondrous, known only to me.
chn: 只有我知道的特殊物品。

eng: Well, I wonder what comes next...
chn: ……嗯，接下来该怎么做……

eng: If he continues his slumber within the cocoon, all would be well.
chn: 让他继续沉眠茧中，也是不错。

eng: But perhaps it would be safer to destroy it.
chn: 但也许该消灭他才是。

eng: Miquella is the one thing that remains a mystery to me...
chn: ……米凯拉，蒙着一层面纱的存在……

eng: You...burned the Erdtree, didn't you?
chn: ……你燃烧了黄金树吧？

eng: Then the Roundtable is soon to follow.
chn: 看来圆桌厅堂就快画下句点。

eng: Ah, no need to fret about that.
chn: 哦，不必放在心上。

eng: The Roundtable Hold served to put a Tarnished upon the throne of Elden Lord.
chn:
圆桌厅堂本来就是
为了让褪色者成为艾尔登之王而设。

eng: And if the Erdtree needed to burn for that to happen,
chn: 如果为此必须燃烧黄金树，

eng: then the Roundtable must go, as well.
chn: 那圆桌厅堂画下句点，也是必然。

eng: I'll stay at the Roundtable, for a time.
chn: ……我会暂时留在圆桌厅堂。

eng: I must learn all that can be taken from this place,
chn: 我必须把放在这里，该知晓的一切记在脑海。

eng: and sear it into my memory.
chn: 必须把这一切刻划在心中。

eng: How could I call myself the All-Knowing, if I did any less?
chn: ……“百智爵士”的含意，正是如此。

eng: The pursuit of knowledge is without end, for knowledge is never a thing complete.
chn: ……知识无穷，但也不尽完美。

eng: Thus, I maintain the mantle of All-Knowing.
chn: 也因此，我能一直是“百智爵士”。

eng: Perhaps the same could be said of guidance.
chn: 试想，这可能与引导很雷同。

eng: Who's to say whether we'll remain who we are, once the fight is finished?
chn: 在战争结束之后，我们还有办法维持本性吗？

eng: What do you think, as one who aspires to become Elden Lord?
chn: ……想成为艾尔登之王的人啊，你有什么想法？

eng: Ahh, I knew you'd come.
chn: ……啊，结果真的是你。

eng: To stand before the Elden Ring. To become Elden Lord.
chn: 准备觐见艾尔登法环，成为艾尔登之王吗。

eng: What a sad state of affairs.
chn: ……不胜唏嘘啊。

eng: I commend your spirit, but alas, none shall take the throne.
chn:
我认同你的意志，
但要让你得偿所愿是另当别论。

eng: Queen Marika has high hopes for us.
chn: 因为玛莉卡女王希望我们做的，

eng: That we continue to struggle. Unto eternity.
chn: 是维持现状，不停挣扎啊。

eng: You think I don't know what that is?
chn: ……我这等人物，会不知道这是什么？

eng: I have no secrets for you to salaciously gawp at.
chn: 我没有让你窥视的秘密。

eng: You think too little of Gideon Ofnir, the All-knowing.
chn: ……劝你不要小看我“百智爵士”基甸·奥夫尼尔。

eng: My fellow, you've fought well, until now.
chn:
……同志啊，到目前为止，
你的战果确实不凡。

eng: I know...in my bones...
chn: ……我全都知道。

eng: A Tarnished cannot become a Lord. Not even you.
chn: 褪色者无法成为王，即使是你也一样。

eng: A man cannot kill a god...
chn: ……人类，杀不了神。

eng: Knowledge above all!
chn: 百智的世界啊！

eng: Ah, nice to meet you.
chn: ……我们是第一次见面吧？

eng: The pleasure's mine. Rogier's the name. A sorcerer, as you might have guessed.
chn:
你好，我是罗杰尔。
正如你所想的，我是魔法师。

eng: I'm looking for a little something, here in the castle.
chn: 我想找的物品就在这座城里，

eng: When I'm not hotfooting it from the troops, that is.
chn: 所以一直在躲避士兵的追缉。

eng: But enough about me, what are you doing here in Stormveil Castle?
chn: ……话说回来，你为什么来到史东薇尔呢？

eng: This place is bristling with Tarnished hunters, you know. They sacrifice our kind, for grafting.
chn:
这座城的人都在狩猎褪色者，
拿来当作“接肢”的祭品，

eng: Not exactly a place I'd stroll into without a purpose in mind...
chn: 正常来说，应该不会主动靠近吧……

eng: I see. Here to challenge Godrick, and lay your hands upon a Great Rune, are you?
chn:
原来是这样，你是为了获得大卢恩，
跑来挑战葛瑞克啊……

eng: You can see it then, I take it? The guidance of grace.
chn: 所以你看得到赐福的指引？

eng: Well, enjoy it while you can.
chn: ……真羡慕你。

eng: I'm Tarnished, like you.
chn: 我也跟你一样是褪色者，

eng: But unlike you, I've seen neither hide nor hair of this guidance for the longest time.
chn: 只是已经很久没再看过指引。

eng: Still, I won't forget how it felt when I first came here, to the Lands Between.
chn:
不过，当时来到交界地的初心，
我还是牢牢记在心底。

eng: I'm privy to a few magical battle arts.
chn: ……我知道几招魔法相关的战技。

eng: Would you care to learn one?
chn: 如果你愿意的话，要不要学看看？

eng: As a fellow Tarnished, once guided by grace. I'd love to help you out, if it please.
chn:
我也是受过赐福指引的褪色者，
想以这种身分帮助你。

eng: Oh? Keen to learn another battle art, are we?
chn: 哦？又想再学习战技吗？

eng: Oh hello there, good to see you safe.
chn: 嗨，你好啊。平安无事就好。

eng: Stopping by to learn a battle art or two?
chn: 要来学习战技吗？

eng: The battle art you've learned is of the glintstone family.
chn: ……你学习的战技是归在辉石魔法之下──

eng: They were conceived at the great Academy of Raya Lucaria, to the north of this castle.
chn:
据说是出自这座城北方的雷亚卢卡利亚，
有一间规模庞大的学院……

eng: In the past, they obeyed laws which contravened the Golden Order, or so I'm told.
chn:
听说从很久以前开始，
他们就遵循着与黄金律法完全对立的法则。

eng: Fascinating, isn't it?
chn: ……这件事情真的很有意思。

eng: That the Golden Order was pliable enough to absorb practices that contradicted itself in the past.
chn:
以前的黄金律法十分宽大，
连完全对立的法则都能够包容。

eng: With the Order broken, twisted, and in need of repair,
chn: 在黄金律法破碎、扭曲，必须被修复的现在……

eng: such adaptability is more important now than ever.
chn: 我认为这种特质，真的是万分重要。

eng: Of course. I understand.
chn: 啊，也对。

eng: Why place trust in a perfect stranger?
chn: 对素昧平生的人，要有所防备嘛。

eng: Be safe, then, stranger.
chn: 那么，和你说声再会。

eng: Watch you don't get sacrificed, eh. I'll do the same.
chn: 希望彼此都能平安，不会沦为祭品。

eng: Oh? Something bothering you?
chn: 哦？还有什么事吗？

eng: Or are you just trying to pass the time?
chn: 难道说……你改变心意，愿意告诉我了？

eng: I'm curious how you ended up inside this castle.
chn: 你是为什么来到这座城呢？

eng: Ah, we meet again after all.
chn: ……嗨，你好，又见面了。

eng: I apologise for any offence given by my bearing, but I'm quite unable to move, you see.
chn:
抱歉，用这种姿势跟你说话，
但我的身体真的无法动弹。

eng: So. What do you need?
chn: 所以找我有什么事吗？

eng: Ah, you defeated Godrick and claimed yourself a Great Rune.
chn:
哦，你成功了啊！
顺利打倒葛瑞克，获得大卢恩了。

eng: Mm, looks like we both got we wanted out of Stormveil, didn't we.
chn: 这么一来，你跟我来到史东薇尔的目标都达成了。

eng: Well done, friend.
chn: 恭喜你。

eng: Something to mark the occasion. Go on, take it.
chn: 这是给你的贺礼，请收下。

eng: As you might've guessed, I still can't move. My fighting days are behind me.
chn:
……看我这副模样──
身体无法随意行动，战斗更是不用说。

eng: No need to be polite, I've no use for it anymore.
chn: 所以那物品对我来说，已经毫无用武之地。

eng: The misshapen corpse under Stormveil?
chn: 你想问史东薇尔地底的，那副异形身体吗？

eng: That is a sacred relic. Of the black knives plot. As that famed night of assassination is known.
chn: ……那是人称黑刀阴谋的暗杀之夜，留下的产物。

eng: It happened during the Golden Age of the Erdtree, long before the shattering of the Elden Ring.
chn: 在艾尔登法环破碎以前，那遥远的黄金树全盛时期，

eng: Someone stole a fragment of the Rune of Death from Maliketh, the Black Blade.
chn:
不知道是谁，
偷走了“黑剑”玛利喀斯持有的死亡卢恩碎片，

eng: And on a bitter night, murdered Godwyn the Golden.
chn: 在冰冷的夜里，杀害了“黄金”葛德文。

eng: That was the first recorded Death of a demigod in all history.
chn: 那是史上第一起半神死亡的记录，

eng: And it became the catalyst. Soon, the Elden Ring was smashed, and thus sprang forth the war known as the Shattering.
chn: 也连带影响了艾尔登法环的破碎，还有破碎战争的爆发。

eng: I once wished to become a scholar, you see. I've spent many an hour scouring the archives for knowledge of that fateful plot.
chn:
……其实我原本希望成为学者，
所以一直在调查那场阴谋。

eng: The world has grown crooked, and if you intend to put it to rights,
chn: 我认为想导正这世界的扭曲之处，

eng: You'd better understand what happened to make it this way, mm?
chn: 就必须先了解事情发生的成因。

eng: This...is a black knifeprint!
chn: ……这该不会是黑刀烙印吧？

eng: I can scarcely believe you managed to get your hands on this!
chn: 你竟然把它拿到手了……

eng: You recall our conversation about the Night of the Black Knives, yes?
chn: 之前我曾跟你说过黑刀阴谋之夜……

eng: They say the assassins who carried out the deed were scions of the Eternal City.
chn: 听说动手的人是永恒之城的后裔──

eng: A group entirely of women, arrayed in armour of silver under cloaks which fooled the eye.
chn:
一群穿着具有隐身效果的衣服，
再披上银色盔甲，只有女性成员的刺客集团。

eng: The knives they wielded though, were imparted with the power of the Rune of Death through sinister rite.
chn:
而她们使用的武器黑刀，
则是透过仪式注入死亡卢恩的力量。

eng: Please, I beg of you, lend me the knifeprint for a time.
chn: ……我拜托你，能不能将那烙印暂时借给我？

eng: I'd love nothing more than to tease out its secrets.
chn: 我想要花一些时间仔细调查。

eng: Though only a fragment, a very specific ritual had to be performed to impart the power of the Rune of Death.
chn:
想要注入死亡卢恩的力量，
虽说只是碎片，还是需要一定规模的仪式才办得到。

eng: Traces of the one who performed the rite are sure to remain in the imprint...
chn: 而仪式的烙印，肯定会留下主导者的蛛丝马迹……

eng: Half my body has been suffused with Death. I'm certain it will help me see.
chn: 像我这样半身受死亡侵蚀的人，一定能找得到线索。

eng: Oh, still need something?
chn: 哦，还有什么事吗？

eng: Always good to see you safe.
chn: 啊，是你。平安无事就好。

eng: So. What do you need?
chn: 所以找我有什么事吗？

eng: Ah, so you've met D.
chn: 哎呀，你知道Ｄ这个人吗？

eng: D is an old friend.
chn: ……他是我的老朋友。

eng: We found ourselves journeying together for a time, bound by our exploration of Death.
chn: 我们都在探寻死亡，所以一起旅行过。

eng: But our paths have since diverged. Never again to cross.
chn: 但最后我们分道扬镳了，从那之后不曾再有交集。

eng: Though that's hardly an uncommon fate for two friends.
chn: ……所谓的朋友，大概都是如此吧。

eng: Pleased to meet you.
chn: ……我们是第一次见面吧？

eng: The name's Rogier. A sorcerer, by trade.
chn: 我是罗杰尔，是魔法师。

eng: But now I'm in this sorry state.
chn: ……说是这么说，但现在是这副模样。

eng: I had a little mishap, and now I can't move.
chn: 因为事情发展不如我的预期，身体变得无法动弹了。

eng: As you might guess, it's far from ideal...
chn: 唉，真是伤脑筋……

eng: Ah, I know.
chn: ……啊，对了。

eng: I'm privy to a few magical battle arts.
chn: 我知道几招魔法相关的战技。

eng: Would you care to learn one?
chn: 如果你愿意的话，要不要学看看？

eng: Time can move rather slowly, stuck here, you know.
chn: 一直待在这种地方，其实心情有点闷。

eng: A little conversation goes a long way.
chn: 也想要找人说说话。

eng: Ahh, hello. I was hoping to see you.
chn: ……嗨，你好。久候多时啰。

eng: My examination is complete. Here's the knifeprint back, with my thanks.
chn: 调查完毕了，烙印还给你。

eng: Now, I have a fairly good idea who performed the rite upon the blade. The person who orchestrated the Night of the Black Knives.
chn:
……我也查到了关于仪式的主导者，
也就是阴谋之夜的主谋身分。

eng: Lunar Princess Ranni. One of the children born to King Consort Radagon and his first wife, Renalla.
chn:
“月之公主”菈妮──
王夫拉达冈与第一任妻子蕾娜菈生下的其中一位孩子，

eng: Demigod and sister to General Radahn and Praetor Rykard.
chn: 她与拉塔恩将军、拉卡德司法官之间是兄妹关系。

eng: Her's was the name I discovered in the imprint.
chn: 她的名字被隐藏在烙印里面。

eng: Truly, you have my thanks.
chn: ……真的很谢谢你。

eng: But, if I might be so bold, I would also like to ask something more of you.
chn: 还有就是，我可以向你提出不情之请吗？

eng: If Ranni truly is the one who plotted that fateful night,
chn: 既然“月之公主”菈妮是阴谋之夜的主谋，

eng: then she should bear the cursemark of Destined Death somewhere upon her flesh.
chn: 那她的身体一定有“命定之死”留下的咒痕。

eng: I would like you to procure it for me.
chn: 你能不能将咒痕拿到手呢？

eng: And then all will be laid bare. I will have the answers I have sought for so long.
chn:
……这么一来，我应该就能豁然开朗，
得到一直以来追求的答案。

eng: Don't fret, it is entirely in accordance with the guidance of grace.
chn: 而且如果你想要遵从赐福的指引，

eng: If you seek to stand before the Elden Ring and become Elden Lord,
chn: 觐见艾尔登法环，成为艾尔登之王的话，

eng: The answers you find will surely bolster your chances.
chn: 我所追求的答案，肯定也能助一臂之力。

eng: I have some idea of Ranni's potential whereabouts.
chn: ……菈妮的所在地，我有些头绪。

eng: There's a manor to the north of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.
chn: 在雷亚卢卡利亚学院的北方，有一座城寨。

eng: It is the familial home of the Carian royals from whom Ranni descends.
chn: 那里是菈妮的原生家庭──卡利亚王室的故乡。

eng: There's been talk of the old royals' vassals gathering there in recent years
chn: 有传闻说最近几年，王室的老臣陆陆续续前往那座城寨。

eng: Ranni's whereabouts since the Shattering are a well-kept secret. She hasn't been seen even once.
chn:
在破碎战争的时候，菈妮销声匿迹，
从那之后就没有人见过她的身影。

eng: But I suspect she might have returned to the manor in which she was born...
chn: 我在猜想，她有可能回到了故乡，也就是那座城寨。

eng: If Lunar Princess Ranni truly is the one who plotted that fateful night,
chn: 既然“月之公主”菈妮是阴谋之夜的主谋，

eng: then she should bear the cursemark of Destined Death somewhere upon her flesh.
chn: 那她的身体一定有“命定之死”留下的咒痕。

eng: Would you be willing to procure it for me?
chn: 你能不能将咒痕拿到手呢？

eng: She may have returned to the manor that is her home.
chn: ……她有可能回到了故乡，也就是那座城寨。

eng: The Royal Carian residence to the north of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.
chn: 位在雷亚卢卡利亚学院的北方，那座卡利亚王室的城寨。

eng: I'm afraid there's something I must tell you.
chn: ……我想，还是该和你说吧。

eng: Do you know of Those Who Live in Death?
chn: 你知道“死诞者”吗？

eng: The very notion of life in death defies the Golden Order.
chn:
他们是被排除在黄金律法的法则之外，
因为死亡而诞生的人。

eng: By D's account, these defiled fiends must be expunged.
chn:
套用Ｄ的话来说，
那些人是不允许存在世上的玷污者。

eng: But truth be told, I seek the cursemark to save them.
chn: ……我之所以想找到咒痕，就是想要拯救他们。

eng: You may find this peculiar,
chn: 你肯定认为我在说天方夜谭吧？

eng: but I discovered something in my examination of the Night of the Black Knives.
chn: 但是我在调查阴谋之夜的过程中，明白了一件事：

eng: These souls have committed no offence. They have every right to life, only, they happened to touch upon a flaw in the Order.
chn:
死诞者没有侵害任何事物。
他们只是拚命生存，也就因此冒犯了律法。

eng: Yes, indeed.
chn: ……我想也是。

eng: If D knew what drives me now,
chn: 如果Ｄ知道了，我現在想要做什麼，

eng: he would surely boil over with rage.
chn: 肯定會氣得怒不可遏。

eng: Or perhaps, he would even feel some pity.
chn: ……還是說，他會感到一絲絲哀傷呢？

eng: But no need to fret, none of that will come to pass.
chn: 不管怎麼樣，這些情況都不會發生──

eng: I can tell a good lie when I need to.
chn: 因為我很會說謊啊。

eng: And...that thing is to blame for the shape I'm in now...
chn: ……唉，结果现在落得这副模样就是了。

eng: I urge the utmost caution. Don't disturb the corpse more than necessary...
chn: 你也要小心喔，不要长时间接触那副异形身体。

eng: Oh? Forgot something, did you?
chn: 哦？还有什么事吗？

eng: Alright there. Good to see you safe.
chn: 啊，是你。平安无事就好。

eng: I see...
chn: ……原来如此……

eng: When Ranni shed her flesh, she shed the cursemark, too.
chn:
菈妮抛弃身体的同时，
连带抛弃了咒痕，原来是这样啊。

eng: You know, not everyone would trust such a tale...
chn: 乍听之下难以置信，

eng: But, if she in her current form is nothing more than the living doll you profess...
chn:
但如果她现在的外表，
如你所说，是有着少女外貌的人偶……

eng: Then perhaps it's true after all.
chn: 也不是完全不可能。

eng: Hmm.
Forgive the bluntness of the notion, but...
chn: 如果这提议冒犯到你，请你见谅……

eng: How would you like to become one of Ranni's vassals?
chn: 你愿意成为菈妮的臣子吗？

eng: Ah, only in order to get what we want, of course.
chn: 啊，当然，只是为了方便行事。

eng: The location of the body which bore the cursemark, which right now I haven't the faintest.
chn: 现在还不知道她抛弃的身体在什么地方，

eng: And the best way to find out is for you to enter her service and take a poke around on the sly.
chn:
所以说，我希望你成为她的臣子，
待在她身边刺探，找出身体的所在地。

eng: I know you've got what it takes.
chn: 我相信你办得到。

eng: Not only are you a superb fighter, but people want to trust you. I've seen it.
chn:
因为你不只是一名优秀的战士，
还有一种特质，让人容易相信你。

eng: Can you become Ranni's vassal to advance our agenda?
chn: ……为了方便行事，可以请你成为菈妮的臣子吗？

eng: While in her service, you'll be able to take a poke around on the sly.
chn:
希望你成为她的臣子，
待在她身边刺探，找出身体的所在地──

eng: And determine the location of her original body that bears the cursemark.
chn: 那连同咒痕一起抛弃的，原本身体的所在地。

eng: I realise that I'm asking you to put yourself in grave danger.
chn: ……我知道这要求会让你身处险境，

eng: But I know you've got what it takes. Quite possibly the only one, in fact.
chn:
但我相信你办得到……
不对，我认为也只有你办得到。

eng: Not only are you a superb fighter, but people want to trust you. I've seen it.
chn:
因为你不只是一名优秀的战士，
还有一种特质，让人容易相信你。

eng: D was telling me.
chn: ……话说回来，我有听Ｄ稍微提到。

eng: That he discovered the mark of the centipede.
chn: 他好像发现了百足环的烙印。

eng: The centipede is an ancient symbol of the cursemark.
chn: 百足环是和咒痕有密切关系的古老烙印。

eng: As long as whoever finds and uses it is not nefarious by nature,
chn: 那知情而使用的人，如果不是坏人……

eng: then we may be able to form an alliance.
chn: 也许我们可以互相帮助。

eng: If only I could speak to them in person.
chn: ……真希望能够见面聊一聊啊。

eng: And if they were like you, all the better.
chn: 对方是类似你这样的人就好了。

eng: Hmm. Maybe I should tell you.
chn: ……我想了想，还是和你说一声。

eng: Lately, I feel I'm on the precipice...
chn: 老实说，我最近的睡意非常浓。

eng: Of falling into a deep...fathomless slumber.
chn: ……感觉会睡得很沉、很沉的那种睡意。

eng: And I have an inkling it could spell trouble for you, somehow.
chn: 我想可能会给你添麻烦，

eng: So I just wanted to get the apology out of the way, beforehand.
chn: 所以先和你说声抱歉。

eng: Since you're so scary and all.
chn: ……毕竟，你很凶嘛。

eng: <sleeping>
<moans and stutters>
<struggles to say a word, but mostly fails>
Off..er her c-curse...m-mark
chn: 啊、啊……咒、咒痕……

eng: Fi…a's… fi…a's…
chn: 菲、雅……菲、雅……

eng: T-to... G-god... wyn
chn: 献、葛、葛德文……

eng: A…fu-full...circle
chn: 合、为一……成、圆……

eng: F-forms…a…r...rune...
chn: 变、卢、卢恩……

eng: (Dies)
For me, really?
chn: ……这要给我吗？

eng: Why thank you very much.
chn: ……我欣然收下啰。

eng: I'll try anything once.
chn: 凡事都要亲身尝试，是我的主张嘛。

eng: <sleeping>
...No thank you.
I don't need your pity.
chn: 如果你是可怜我，就别费心了。

eng: Ah...
Sorry. You were only trying to be nice.
chn: 抱歉，你明明是一番好意。

eng: It would be my pleasure to take it. My thanks.
chn: 我欣然收下了，谢谢你。

eng: <sleeping>
Oof!
chn: 呜。

eng: I fear you are mistaken.
chn: ……你怎么了吗？

eng: I am no foe of yours, far from it.
chn: 我不打算和你为敌……

eng: This is rather unfortunate.
chn: ……那就没办法了。

eng: I don't normally find myself cornered like a rat.
chn: 既然已经穷途末路……

eng: But I have my ways...
chn: 那也只能杀出重围。

eng: No need to grandstand; you're not even on stage.
chn: ……我认为真人不露相才是上策喔。

eng: Well, this is unfortunate.
chn: ……真是，伤脑筋啊……

eng: Couldn't change a thing...
chn: ……结果没成就任何事……

eng: Agh!
chn: 呜。

eng: I fear you are mistaken.
chn: ……你怎么了吗？

eng: I am no foe of yours, far from it.
chn: 我不打算和你为敌……

eng: If you think I am helpless,
chn: ……请不要一厢情愿了，

eng: you are quite mistaken, I'm afraid.
chn: 我还是有能力抵抗。

eng: If this doesn't cause you shame, nothing will.
chn: ……你都不觉得丢脸吗？
