eng: Well, this is unfortunate.
chn: ……真是，伤脑筋啊……

eng: Couldn't change a thing...
chn: ……结果没成就任何事……

eng: C-curse...m-mark
Fi…a's… fi…a's…
chn: 菲、雅……菲、雅……

eng: T-to... G-god... wyn
chn: 献、葛、葛德文……

eng: Not seen you before.
chn: ……第一次见到你啊。

eng: Name's Bernahl. Tarnished, just like you.
chn: 我是贝纳尔，和你一样是褪色者。

eng: Let me ask you something.
chn: ……能问你一件事吗？

eng: Are you here in the Lands Between to take up the fight?
chn: 你会待在这块交界地，不停战斗下去吗？

eng: Does your faith in the guidance of grace hold firm,
chn: 即使黄金律法破碎到难以修复的境界，

eng: despite the collapse of the Golden Order?
chn: 还会继续相信赐福的指引吗？

eng: Yes, you're a Tarnished through and through.
chn: ……嗯，堪称褪色者的楷模。

eng: Takes me back, but that's a quality needed now more than ever.
chn:
真让人怀念。
放眼现下，有这种想法很珍贵。

eng: Any interest in bearing the torch, of my battle arts?
chn: 那么，你有意思继承我的战技吗？

eng: All I know is the sword. Picked up a fair few tricks in my time, too.
chn: 我只懂得用剑，心血全投注在战技上。

eng: Now's the time to pass 'em on. To a good and proper Tarnished, like you.
chn:
我想把战技传承下去，
传给像你这种模范褪色者。

eng: Oh, not had your fill, eh? Worry not, I've enough to keep you busy.
chn:
……哦，还学得不够吗？
很好，我奉陪到底。

eng: Ah, hello. Glad to see you safe.
chn: ……是你啊，平安无事就好。

eng: Here to learn a battle art or two?
chn: 那么，再来学习战技吧。

eng: There's a myriad of battle arts in these lands that I've yet to discover.
chn: ……这块土地上，还有很多我没见过的战技。

eng: Mementos of all the warriors who raised their arms in battle, lost, and died.
chn: 战技是战士持武而战、败北、丧命的证明，

eng: A fine tale, all told, of true chivalric romance.
chn: 是最为鲜明的英雄故事。

eng: That's how I fell in love with the sword, and the arts of combat.
chn: 所以我才会对剑，还有战技爱不释手──

eng: It grants meaning even to falling in battle, to death itself.
chn: 那传达、赋予了战败与死亡的意义。

eng: Honest to a fault, I see.
chn: ……你还真老实。

eng: Such thoughts won't behove you, as a Tarnished.
chn: 就褪色者而言，这确实是缺点……

eng: But there's nothing wrong with that.
chn: 但这种态度，我不反感。

eng: Any interest in bearing the torch, of my battle arts?
chn: 你有意思继承我的战技吗？

eng: All I know is the sword. Picked up a fair few tricks in my time, too.
chn: 我只懂得用剑，心血全投注在战技上。

eng: Now's the time to pass 'em on. To a good Tarnished, like you.
chn: 我想把战技传承下去，传给像你这样的褪色者。

eng: Not floating your boat, eh?
chn: ……没兴趣吗？

eng: Well, there's no rush. Knowledge of the arts can wait another day.
chn:
不急于一时。
等有意愿的时候，再来找我。

eng: There you are. Decided to bear the torch of my battle arts?
chn: ……是你啊。有兴趣继承战技了？

eng: Well, until we meet again.
chn: ……再会了。

eng: You...
What in heaven's name are you doing here?
chn: 为什么来这种地方？

eng: The Volcano Manor is a pit of recusants who spit at grace and hunt our own kind.
chn:
火山官邸是亵渎赐福、
狩猎同胞的叛律者聚集的巢穴。

eng: I hope you understand the weight of my words.
chn: 你懂这代表什么吗？

eng: Well. As long as you understand what you're saying.
chn: ……明白的话，我不多说。

eng: I thought you a Tarnished bred by virtue.
chn: 我还以为你是褪色者中的楷模……

eng: Perhaps playing that part led you to your doubts, I wonder.
chn: 也可能正因为如此，才会感到疑惑。

eng: But know that the path you walk is blasphemy, and leads only to a miserable death.
chn: 参与亵渎，最后只会不得善终，

eng: Before you consider hunting any of your own kind, think on that.
chn: 劝你狩猎同胞之前，先仔细思考。

eng: This blasphemous path leads only to a pitiful death.
chn: 参与亵渎，最后只会不得善终，

eng: Before you consider hunting any of your own kind, think on that.
chn: 劝你狩猎同胞之前，先仔细思考。

eng: So. You've bloodied your sword in the hunt.
chn: ……你狩猎同胞了。

eng: Then I shall introduce myself once more.
chn: 那是该重新介绍自己──

eng: Bernahl, a recusant, just like you.
chn: 我是贝纳尔，和你一样是叛律者。

eng: Recusants have particular battle arts, styled to our methods of slaughter.
chn:
……而叛律者自然有叛律者的战法，
也就是所谓的战技。

eng: Why not add some to your repertoire?
chn: 学了是有备无患。

eng: Oh, not had your fill, eh?
chn: ……哦，还学得不够吗？

eng: You're still alive, I see.
chn: ……你还活着啊。

eng: Why not learn another battle art, see if we can't keep it that way.
chn: 那再来学习战技吧。

eng: You've come to understand, now, eh?
chn: ……我想你也很明了。

eng: To take power and make it his own,
chn: 抢夺他人的力量、化为己有──

eng: The recusant must hunt his own kind.
chn: 就是叛律者狩猎同胞的目的。

eng: To raise the flag of revolt against this sanctified pillaging,
chn: 为了那被迫互相残杀的恶令，叛律者揭竿而起。

eng: We recusants must become the most wretched of predators.
chn: 但到头来，却变成最为肤浅的掠食者。

eng: All you can do is laugh.
chn: ……真可笑。

eng: Look at you. A recusant through and through.
chn: ……你越来越有叛律者的味道了。

eng: I knew you had it in you.
chn: 正所谓适才适所吧。

eng: Take this.
chn: 这个交给你。

eng: A special invitation, to hunt some of the first Tarnished who sat at the Roundtable Hold.
chn:
那是特殊的邀请函──
邀请你狩猎圆桌厅堂的创始褪色者，其中的幸存者。

eng: If you should accept, I'll next see you on the field of battle.
chn: 有意思出席的话，届时在战场会合吧。

eng: Ah, I had hoped you'd soon return.
chn: 我等你很久了。

eng: I have the reward from Lady Tanith.
chn: 塔妮丝女士拿给我先前那场狩猎的谢礼。

eng: Take it. It's yours, by right.
chn: 但这谢礼该由你收下。

eng: Let us tread the path of the recusant together.
chn: ……一起在叛律的路上前进吧，

eng: Till we reach the miserable death that awaits us.
chn: 直到不得善终的时刻到来。

eng: So. You killed Rykard?
chn: ……看来你杀害了拉卡德。

eng: I harbour you no ill will. The strong take. Such is our code.
chn:
我无意出言责备，
弱肉强食是我们的规矩。

eng: Even he was prepared to meet a wretched end when he first took blasphemy unto his very flesh.
chn:
在投身亵渎之中的那一刻起，
他应该也做好不得善终的心理准备。

eng: But anyroad, the Volcano Manor is no more.
chn: ……但这样一来，火山官邸也就此落幕。

eng: Though we may yet fulfil an old promise.
chn: 我该履行以前许下的约定了。

eng: We hunted our own kind, and took what was theirs.
chn: ……我狩猎了不少同胞，也抢夺了不少力量。

eng: And with everything in hand, the time has come to rise, against the Erdtree.
chn:
这一切都是为了对黄金树举剑相向，
时机已经成熟。

eng: O Greater Will, hear my voice.
chn: ……无上意志啊，仔细听好。

eng: I am the recusant Bernahl, inheritor of my brother's will, and you will fall to my blade.
chn:
我“叛律者”贝纳尔继承了挚友的遗志，
决意要让你溃不成形。

eng: We refuse to become your pawns. Consider this fair warning.
chn:
我们不会沦为你手掌心的傀儡，
你很快就能亲身领教。

eng: Who are you?
And what in heaven's name are you doing here?
chn: 为什么来这种地方？

eng: The Volcano Manor is a pit of recusants who spit at grace and hunt our own kind.
chn:
火山官邸是亵渎赐福、
狩猎同胞的叛律者聚集的巢穴。

eng: I hope you understand the weight of my words.
chn: 你懂这代表什么吗？

eng: Well. As long as you understand what you're saying.
chn: ……明白的话，我不多说。

eng: You have harboured doubts from the very beginning.
chn: 原本你就心存迷惘，

eng: Perhaps this day was always lurking on the horizon.
chn: 会走到这一步也是必然吧。

eng: But know that the path you walk is blasphemy, and leads only to a miserable death.
chn: 但参与亵渎，最后只会不得善终，

eng: Before you consider hunting any of your own kind, think on that.
chn: 劝你狩猎同胞之前，先仔细思考。

eng: Then you must leave immediately.
chn: ……那就立刻离开。

eng: Those with weak stomachs have no place here.
chn: 没有决心叛律的家伙，只会碍手碍脚。

eng: I thought I told you to leave.
chn: ……我说了立刻离开吧？

eng: Or do you claim to understand?
chn: ……还是你真的明白？

eng: What it means to be a recusant, renouncing grace and hunting down one's own.
chn: 成为亵渎赐福、狩猎同胞的叛律者，代表着什么？

eng: Well. As long as you understand what you're saying.
chn: ……明白的话，我不多说。

eng: But know that the path you walk is blasphemy, and leads only to a miserable death.
chn: 参与亵渎，最后只会不得善终，

eng: Before you consider hunting any of your own kind, think on that.
chn: 劝你狩猎同胞之前，先仔细思考。

eng: Oh, a brew, is it?
chn: ……哦，是酒啊。

eng: Thanking me for the battle arts?
chn: 这是传承战技给你的谢礼吗？

eng: You're one of the good ones. Thank you.
chn: 礼数真周到，那我不客气了。

eng: Oh, a brew, is it?
chn: ……哦，是酒啊。

eng: Fitting, I suppose.
chn: ……确实，对沉醉于亵渎的叛律者来说，

eng: For a recusant already drunk on blasphemy.
chn: 酒说不定是很适合的礼物。

eng: <sleeping>
Agh!
chn: 唔。

eng: What's wrong with you?
chn: 你这是做什么？

eng: I won't say it twice. Stop this.
chn: 好话不说第二遍，住手吧。

eng: I suppose I have no choice, then.
chn: ……不得不战吗？

eng: Is this what grace would have of us?
chn: 赐福啊，这也是指引吗？

eng: Dog eat dog, once again. A sad lot, we Tarnished.
chn:
又是互相残杀的肤浅作为，
这就是我们褪色者……

eng: You are an enigma, to be certain.
chn: ……你这人有意思……

eng: The Volcano Manor awaits you.
chn: 去火山官邸吧……

eng: You're Tarnished, aren't you?
chn: ……阁下是褪色者吗？

eng: I welcome you, to the Church of Vows.
chn: 欢迎来到结缘教堂。

eng: I am Miriel, steward of this sacred chamber.
chn: 我名叫米利耶，负责管理这座教堂。

eng: My apologies, for the unseemly state of affairs.
chn: 只是任它荒废成这副模样，着实令人汗颜……

eng: Do you know the origin of this place?
chn: 在这里，想请教阁下是否听过？

eng: How it came to be known as the Church of Vows?
chn: 关于这座结缘教堂，背后有什么样的故事。

eng: Well, that is a shame. But who can blame you?
chn: 啊，阁下不清楚啊。这也是很自然的事情。

eng: The Shattering has caused us - all of us - to lose sight of something very dear.
chn:
毕竟在爆发破碎战争之后，
人们都遗忘了那些重要的事情。

eng: It is here, at the Church of Vows, that the great houses of the Erdtree and the Moon were joined.
chn: 过去黄金树与月，双方王室为求和平共存──

eng: By the matrimonial bond between red-haired Radagon and Rennala of the Full Moon.
chn:
“红发”拉达冈与“满月”蕾娜菈，
两位大人就是在这座教堂缔结契约。

eng: And so, our church holds in view the monuments of both houses.
chn:
至今这座教堂与王城黄金树，
以及雷亚卢卡利亚学院仍有所联系，

eng: The Erdtree of the Capital, and the Academy of Raya Lucaria.
chn: 也是出自这个原因。

eng: Oh, was there something you needed?
chn: 啊，这么说来，阁下有什么事吗？

eng: You are free to show yourself around.
chn: 如果阁下的目的是参观，就请随意。

eng: I would serve as your guide, only my legs aren't what they used to be...
chn:
我的脚已经不方便行走，
没办法领着阁下四处介绍……

eng: If you find anything of use, you are free to take it with you.
chn: 如果看到需要的物品，不必介意，带走它吧。

eng: Unless perhaps you are in search of instruction?
chn: 还是说，阁下是为了学问而来呢？

eng: In which case, I will share all that I know.
chn: 真是如此，我愿意倾囊相授。

eng: Whether it be sorcery or incantations, learning should not fetter you to one side or the other.
chn: 魔法也好，祷告也罢──学问不分高低。

eng: This is, after all, a church celebrating the union of two such opposed practitioners.
chn: 在两者结合的地方，这道理更是自然。

eng: Is there something else?
chn: ……怎么了？还有什么事吗？

eng: Greetings. Do you need anything?
chn: ……您好啊，有什么事呢？

eng: Do you possess any celestial dew?
chn: ……阁下持有星星泪滴吗？

eng: Then I would like to share my knowledge with you.
chn: 既然如此，那我需要告诉阁下──

eng: Concerning the miracle of this Church of Vows.
chn: 关于这座结缘教堂所蕴藏的奇迹。

eng: Radagon once cleansed himself with celestial dew,
chn: 在过去，拉达冈大人用星星泪滴沐浴自身，

eng: repented his territorial aggressions, and swore his love to Rennala.
chn:
此举是为侵略战争真心忏悔，
同时也是立誓，对蕾娜菈大人的爱永志不渝。

eng: The Order of the Erdtree and the fate of the moon were conjoined, and all the wounds of war forgiven.
chn:
在黄金树律法与月之命运结合之际，
所有的一切，包含纷争带来的伤害，就回归于零。

eng: This miracle blesses the church to this day.
chn: 之后，那奇迹就一直留存在这座教堂里。

eng: And so, you need only follow Radagon's example,
chn: 只要拉达冈大人做过的，阁下照着做──

eng: to restore any bond, however strained or severed, to its rightful state of harmony.
chn:
那产生裂痕、难以修复的人际关系，
想必也能重回安稳的状态吧。

eng: My faith does not waver.
chn: ……我坚信不移──

eng: The miracle rooted in these grounds will, once again, mend the world.
chn:
总有一天，蕴藏在这块土地的奇迹，
能够再一次将世界连系起来。

eng: And this time, its bounty will not be squandered.
chn: 而且这一次，毁约之事不会再发生。

eng: If you would be Elden Lord, Tarnished,
chn: 褪色者啊，如果阁下当上了艾尔登之王，

eng: I hope that you, too, will share my faith.
chn: 请成为有如此作为的王者吧。

eng: Are you taking the sword with you?
chn: ……阁下想带走那把剑吗？

eng: Oh, fear not, I don't wish to chide you.
chn: 啊，不是，我没有责问的意思。

eng: Clearly, you are no conniving thief.
chn: 阁下不可能是可鄙的梁上君子，

eng: The sword is telling us something, no doubt.
chn: 既然如此，那肯定是剑本身想离开此处。

eng: Rather than collect dust in the shadows underground,
chn: 与其被供奉在无人出入的地下室，

eng: it yearns to be wielded by your rightful hand.
chn: 那把剑更希望阁下正确地使用它。

eng: Ah, now I recall.
chn: ……相信肯定是如此。

eng: As the priest of the Church of Vows, I undo the sword's seal, and bequeath it unto you.
chn:
我身为结缘教堂的神父，
愿意解除剑的封印，把它交给阁下。

eng: May you hold it high and proud.
chn: 请大方地挥舞那把剑吧。

eng: Are you quite finished?
chn: ……您冷静下来了吗？

eng: Take this opportunity to learn to master your emotions.
chn: 请趁这次机会，学会控制自己的情绪。

eng: Worry not, I take no offence. But others are not always so forgiving.
chn: 我倒是无妨，但相同情况发生在其他人身上，

eng: Some take to anger, others sorrow... Bonds are fragile things, wont to break under strain.
chn:
有些人会生气，有些人会难过……
人际关系会产生裂痕，或是陷入难以修复的境地。

eng: And once they're broken, everything is lost, with naught to gain.
chn: 这对阁下而言，绝对是有害无益。

eng: Are you quite finished?
chn: ……您冷静下来了吗？

eng: I suppose my ample frame must have given you quite the fright.
chn: 看到身形巨大的生物，想必让阁下吓了一跳。

eng: Allow me to introduce myself. Miriel, steward of this sacred chamber.
chn:
请容我自我介绍──
我名叫米利耶，负责管理这座教堂。

eng: My apologies, for the unseemly state of affairs.
chn: 只是任它荒废成这副模样，着实令人汗颜……

eng: Do you know the origin of this place?
chn: 在这里，想请教阁下是否听过？

eng: How it came to be known as the Church of Vows?
chn: 关于这座结缘教堂，背后有什么样的故事。

eng: Are you quite finished, now?
chn: ……您冷静下来了吗？

eng: To experience the miracle, kneel in the basin at the back, and cleanse yourself with celestial dew.
chn:
……如果阁下期盼奇迹发生，
请到里头的水池中跪下，用星星泪滴沐浴自身。

eng: Absolution will be yours. Any bond, no matter how strained, or even severed, will be put to rights.
chn:
此举为赎罪──那产生裂痕、难以修复的人际关系，
想必也能重回安稳的状态吧。

eng: Ah, I see you have undergone absolution, the miracle that blossoms from these grounds.
chn: ……我注意到阁下蒙受这块土地的奇迹，完成了赎罪。

eng: Good. As such, the bond you may have strained or severed...
chn: 没错。如此一来，阁下那产生裂痕、难以修复的人际关系，

eng: Has been restored, to its rightful state of harmony.
chn: 想必已经重回安稳的状态。

eng: Be mindful, not to take for granted...
chn: ……奇迹带来的安稳时光，

eng: the serenity restored by this miracle.
chn: 请阁下好好珍惜。

eng: And take care. Never to break a bond again.
chn: 并请多留意，别让憾事再次发生。

eng: You wish to know more of Lord Radagon?
chn: ……您想知道关于拉达冈大人的事情啊。

eng: Lord Radagon was a great champion, possessed of flowing red locks.
chn: 拉达冈大人是有着一头飘逸红发的英雄。

eng: He came to these lands at the head of a great golden host, when he met Lady Rennala in battle.
chn:
他率领黄金树的军队来到此地，
在战场上邂逅了蕾娜菈大人。

eng: He soon repented his territorial aggressions though, and became husband to the Carian Queen.
chn:
随后对发起侵略战争一事真心忏悔，
和卡利亚女王，蕾娜菈大人结为伴侣。

eng: However. When Godfrey, first Elden Lord, was hounded from the Lands Between,
chn: ……但是在初始艾尔登之王，葛孚雷被逐出交界地之后，

eng: Radagon left Rennala to return to the Erdtree Capital, becoming Queen Marika's second husband and King Consort.
chn:
拉达冈大人抛弃了蕾娜菈大人，回到黄金树王城，
成为玛莉卡女王的王夫、第二任丈夫……

eng: Taking the title...of second Elden Lord.
chn: 也成为第二任的艾尔登之王。

eng: The mystery endures, to this day...
chn: 这件事情依旧成谜──

eng: As to why Lord Radagon would cast Lady Rennala aside...
chn: 为了什么原因，拉达冈大人抛弃蕾娜菈大人？

eng: And moreover...why a mere champion would be chosen for the seat of Elden Lord...
chn:
又话说从头，拉达冈大人不过是位英雄，
为什么会被选为艾尔登之王呢？

eng: You know, it's said that Lord Radagon harboured a secret...
chn:
……不过，关于拉达冈大人……
我曾听说一个关于他的秘密。

eng: A famed sculptor of the Erdtree Capital was once summoned to render Lord Radagon's likeness in giant stature.
chn:
黄金树王城里有一位知名的雕刻家，
受王室委托，制作拉达冈大人的大型雕像……

eng: When he glimpsed the skeleton in Radagon's closet.
chn: 听说他因此窥见了那个秘密。

eng: And as such, it's said the great statue harbours his secret too.
chn: 又听说，那座大型雕像藏着那个秘密。

eng: You wish to know more of Lady Rennala?
chn: ……您想知道关于蕾娜菈大人的事情啊。

eng: She is Queen, head of the Carian royal family, and governor of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.
chn:
蕾娜菈大人是卡利亚王室的女王，
也是雷亚卢卡利亚学院的掌权者。

eng: The great and beautiful Full Moon Witch.
chn: 一名既伟大又美丽的“满月”魔法师。

eng: Sadly, her heart was broken when Lord Radagon left her.
chn:
但是啊，自从丈夫拉达冈大人抛弃了她，
她就失去了自己的心。

eng: And then, when the academy rebelled against the royals, she was locked away in the grand library.
chn: 在学院背叛王室的时候，她被囚禁在大书库里头。

eng: In the end, Lady Rennala was left alone, cradling the amber egg Lord Radagon bequeathed her.
chn:
……事情发生之后，蕾娜菈大人仰赖着
拉达冈大人赠予的琥珀卵，度过每一日。

eng: Now she devotes herself to it through forbidden rite;
chn: 将自己的一切奉献在不容于世的法术上──

eng: the grim art of reincarnation.
chn: 那恐怖无比的，重新诞生的秘术。

eng: You would do well to remember...
chn: ……希望阁下能记得，

eng: Severing a vow, strongest of bonds, has consequences ever more dire.
chn:
在结下缘分之后遭到反悔，
所带来的伤害是难以估计啊。

eng: Why, this is nectar, is it not?
chn: ……哦，这是……是甘露啊。

eng: And you're giving it to me?
chn: 阁下要送给我吗？

eng: Oh, wonderful, just wonderful.
chn: 哦哦，真令人喜上眉梢。

eng: Truth be told, I'm rather fond of the stuff.
chn: 老实说，我非常喜爱甘露。

eng: I'll happily take it off your hands!
chn: 恕我不推辞了。

eng: <sleeping>
Oh, what have we here?
chn: ……哦，这确实不错。

eng: Very well, let us both learn together.
chn: 让我们一同学习，教学相长吧。

eng: Heresy is not native to the world; it is but a contrivance.
chn: ……这个世界原本没有异端，

eng: All things can be conjoined.
chn: 所有的一切都能结合、互融。

eng: Mngh!
chn: 唔。

eng: Stop it, please.
chn: 阁下，请停手。

eng: My flesh is akin to stone.
chn: 我的身体和石头没有两样。

eng: I cannot be wounded. I cannot die.
chn: 我既不会受伤，也不会死亡。

eng: But nor will I cause any harm unto you.
chn: 当然，我更不会伤害阁下。

eng: Cease your futile efforts.
chn: 请阁下不要走冤枉路。

eng: Well, aren't we determined.
chn: ……阁下不肯放弃啊。

eng: Aaa...aaargh!
chn: 呀啊啊啊啊啊啊啊啊啊！

eng: What are you lookin' at?
chn: ……啊？你谁啊？

eng: You trying to start something, mate?
chn: 你有事吗？看什么看？

eng: Oh, that necklace what you're after, is it?
chn: ……哦，你想要那条项链啊？

eng: Hmm, well…
chn: 哼，你想要啊……

eng: Show me what it's worth to you,
chn: ……那总该表现出一点诚意吧？

eng: and I'll consider parting ways with it.
chn: 看情况，说不定我愿意卖给你喔。

eng: I'm not in love with it or nothing.
chn: 反正那玩意儿也是随手拿到的。

eng: You're a shrewd one, chief.
chn: ……很会听话嘛。

eng: First, you hand me the runes. And don't try nothin', neither.
chn: 先把卢恩交过来，劝你少耍花招。

eng: Hmm...
Alright. Take it.
chn: 好吧，东西拿去。

eng: Thing's no damn use to anyone, anyway.
chn: 那本来就是没路用的东西……

eng: Your bloody idea, mate. Don't come crying to me later.
chn: 你自己找上门来谈的，不关我的事啊。

eng: Oh piss off, what is it now?
chn: ……啊？你又要干么？

eng: Oh, I see. You want some of me prawn?
chn: ……啊，是喔。你想吃虾子啊？

eng: Freshly cooked, it is.
chn: 是啦，虾子是刚煮好……

eng: Alright then. It's yours, if you can meet me price.
chn:
知道啦。东西我可以卖给你，
但是该给我的，拿出来。

eng: I could be persuaded to sell you some other bits too, if you've got the runes.
chn: 还有其他想要的，可以问我。

eng: What the hell is wrong with you.
chn: ……你是怎样？

eng: You trying to start something?
chn: 站在那干么？

eng: Piss off. Before I crack you in 'alf.
chn: ……宰了你喔，滚啦。

eng: This bloody swine...
chn: ……啊？你干么？

eng: Decided to play ball now, 'ave you?
chn: 想表现诚意了吗？

eng: You'll be wantin' the necklace, then?
chn: 你不是想要那条项链吗？

eng: Think you're bloody clever, do ya?
chn: ……听不懂人家的意思喔？

eng: Then how about you piss off?
chn: 那就快滚。

eng: fore I crack you in 'alf.
chn: 小心我宰了你。

eng: Marika's tits, you must be 'ungry.
chn: ……是怎样，你还吃不够喔？

eng: Alright mate. Want some more prawn, do ya?
chn: 哦，是你啊。又跑来买虾子了吗？

eng: Alright mate. Still 'ungry, are ya?
chn: 哦，是你啊。又想吃了吗？

eng: Never met someone with a taste for prawn I couldn't trust.
chn: ……喜欢虾子的，绝对没坏人。

eng: We'd make good mates, I reckon.
chn: 我应该跟你合得来。

eng: I'll be seeing ya.
chn: 再见啦。

eng: Oh, so you met the girl, did ya?
chn: ……搞什么，你认识那女的喔？

eng: Alright, well, sod the particulars of the matter,
chn: ……就不用往下讲了。

eng: But it ain't my fault she's stupid enough to get duped, is it.
chn: 管他怎样，都是被骗的人有错啦。

eng: Anyway, she ain't all right, that one.
chn: 只是那女的真的怪怪的。

eng: Lucky she ain't died on the bloody roadside, I reckon.
chn: 唉，也好啦，至少她没有死在路边。

eng: You're Tarnished too, ain'tcha?
chn: ……你也是褪色者吧？

eng: Can you see it then? The guidance of grace, I mean.
chn: 那你看得到吗？那个赐福的指引。

eng: I can't see it at all no more.
chn: 我完全看不到。

eng: Makes no bloody sense anyway, why some no-name shithead like me should get called to the Lands Between.
chn: 说起来，像我这种小混混因为指引跑来这，

eng: Cruel bloody joke, you ask me.
chn: 这件事本身就很可笑。

eng: Maybe something went tits up with it. Maybe... it's been broke for a good long time.
chn: 搞不好安排这些事的，早就没救了。

eng: The Erdtree, I'm sayin'.
chn: 就是说那个黄金树啦。

eng: You what? Sod the particulars, mate.
chn: ……啊？不用往下问啦。

eng: Ain't my fault people are so bloody stupid, is it?
chn: 管他怎样，都是被骗的人有错啦。

eng: Don't like that it's stolen? Don't sodding buy it..
chn: 不想买赃物？那就不要买啊。

eng: What are you lookin' at?
chn: ……啊？你谁啊？

eng: Oh...you again, is it.
chn: 呃，是你喔。

eng: Perfect bloody timing, actually.
chn: 那你来得正好，

eng: I got crab, cooked up fresh.
chn: 这一次是螃蟹刚煮好喔。

eng: Marika's tits, you must be 'ungry.
chn: ……是怎样，你还吃不够喔？

eng: Alright mate. Want some more crab, do ya?
chn: 哦，是你啊。又跑来买螃蟹了吗？

eng: Alright mate. Still 'ungry, are ya?
chn: 哦，是你啊。又想吃了吗？

eng: Never met someone with a taste for crab I couldn't trust.
chn: ……会喜欢螃蟹的，全都是好人。

eng: We've got a real thing here, eh, and it's only gettin' better.
chn: 我们同一挂的，以后交流一下啊。

eng: Mate, there's somethin' I should probably tell ya.
chn: ……还是跟你说一下好了。

eng: You 'eard of the Dung Eater?
chn: 你知道食粪者吗？

eng: E's a madman, 'as it out for everyone. Curses 'em. Goes 'round in this rank armour, an' all.
chn:
就是那个穿着恶心、丑死人的铠甲，
诅咒世间的疯子。

eng: You see 'im though, stay well away.
chn: 要是碰到他，千万不要靠近他。

eng: I was in the same gaol as him, once, so I know first 'and.
chn: ……以前我跟他关在同一间牢房，所以我知道。

eng: E's a god-forsaken monster. Not just some petty thug like me.
chn:
那家伙跟我这种小混混不一样，
是很恐怖的男人。

eng: E's a killer. Kills people and curses their souls...
chn: ……那家伙会为了对灵魂设下永恒诅咒而杀人，

eng: Does all sorts of shit to their corpses, to keep 'em cursed, forever.
chn: 会用自己的诅咒布满整个尸体，玷污尸体。

eng: I ain't seen nothin' more disgustin' in all my years.
chn: ……我不曾看过那么恶心的景象。

eng: I ain't ever been more scared, neither. Rooted to the bloody spot...
chn: 看得我怕到只能像小鬼头一样躲在旁边。

eng: While 'e did all that, to my friend...
chn: ……明明那个被玷污的，还是我朋友。

eng: Yeah...and now I seen it 'ere, again.
chn: ……对，我又看到了──

eng: Never thought I would. What 'e does to those bodies.
chn:
被玷污的尸体。
那绝对不想再看到第二次的东西。

eng: It was... It was 'im, no question.
chn: 只有食粪者会干这种事，

eng: That monster. He's lurkin' round 'ere.
chn: 那恐怖的男人居然在这附近闲晃。

eng: Heh...serves me right.
chn: ……哈，丢脸啊。

eng: Fitting bloody end, for a jumped up little shit with big ideas...
chn:
自以为是的小混混，
最后的下场还不就这样？

eng: Help me out, would ya, mate...
chn: ……喂，救救我啊。

eng: I don't wanna get cursed. Just let me die...
chn: 我不怕死，但我不想被诅咒，

eng: I don't wanna live like this...not anymore...
chn: 我想在下辈子当个走在正路上的人啊……

eng: So, please...
chn: 喂，求求你……

eng: Oof!
chn: 哇。

eng: What's your blinkin' problem!
chn: 你搞什么鬼！

eng: You don't mess with Big Boggart, mate.
chn: 知道我是“愚弄巨妖”，还动手吗！

eng: That bitch put you up to this, eh.
chn: ……看这样子，你是收钱帮那女的办事？

eng: Damn it! I'll rip you to shreds!
chn: 那就来打啊！混账！

eng: Not scared, are ya.
chn: ……啧，果然听了也没在怕。

eng: Damn it! I'll rip you to shreds!
chn: 那就来打啊！混账！

eng: You feel that, eh?
chn: ……懂了没啊？

eng: That's the fists of Big Boggart.
chn: 我“愚弄巨妖”的拳头有多大。

eng: Goddamn it.
chn: ……混账啦……

eng: Why ain't it me, why ain't it ever...
chn: 其实我本来，本来也想……

eng: <sigh>
chn: 呜……呜呜……

eng: Someone, please, kill him...
chn: 有没有人啊？快杀了他吧……

eng: That horrendous serpent... Praetor Rykard...
chn: 快杀了大蛇……快杀了拉卡德大人……

eng: Mm, you're Tarnished.
chn: 呜……你是褪色者吧？

eng: Here to put the demigods to the sword.
chn: 是挑战半神的人吧？

eng: Then please. Kill the great serpent.
chn: 拜托，快杀了大蛇。

eng: The one that devoured Praetor Rykard.
chn: 快杀了吃掉拉卡德大人的大蛇。

eng: I left the serpent-slaying spear in the Lord's Chamber.
chn: 弒蛇的矛就放在谒见厅。

eng: Worthy Tarnished, brandish the spear, and run him through.
chn: 褪色者啊，快用那把矛刺穿大蛇吧……

eng: The great serpent...that unspeakable monstrosity.
chn: 快杀了那可恶的怪物……

eng: Praetor Rykard's ambitions, though blasphemous, marked him a worthy sovereign.
chn:
……以前拉卡德大人抱有亵渎的野心，
那是霸王的雄心壮志。

eng: But they were reduced to gluttonous depravity, once he gave himself to the serpent.
chn:
但是在大人被大蛇吃掉之后，
那雄心壮志摇身一变，沦落成卑贱的贪欲。

eng: Whatever that thing is, it is no longer Praetor Rykard.
chn: 那东西已经不是拉卡德大人了……

eng: Someone must kill him.
chn: 必须杀了那东西。

eng: To spare him, and his ambitions, from further dishonour.
chn: 不能再让那东西侮辱大人的名声与野心。

eng: Worthy Tarnished. I left the serpent-slaying spear in the Lord's Chamber.
chn: 褪色者啊，弒蛇的矛就放在谒见厅。

eng: It is the only thing that can kill that horror.
chn: 用那把矛才能杀死大蛇。

eng: Run it through. The great serpent...that unspeakable monstrosity...
chn: 快刺穿那只大蛇吧……那可恶的怪物……

eng: You're Tarnished, aren't you?
chn: ……你是不是褪色者？

eng: Then, perhaps you could spare some runes?
chn: 既然是的话，方便分一些卢恩给我吗？

eng: Believe it or not, I studied glintstone sorceries at the Academy of Raya Lucaria.
chn:
俗话说人不可貌相，
我曾待过雷亚卢卡利亚学院，在那学习辉石魔法。

eng: For a small donation, I'd be happy to share my knowledge.
chn: 只要你分卢恩给我，我可以教你魔法。

eng: Well, bless you, bless you.
chn: 哦哦，感谢啊，太感谢了。

eng: You are a true saint.
chn: 你真是好人。

eng: My name is Thops.
chn: 我叫托普斯。

eng: Presuming you're interested, I can teach you sorceries, as promised.
chn:
照我们说好的，如果你有兴趣学，
我愿意教你魔法。

eng: Only, none of them are particularly great...
chn: 只是我会的，也不是上得了台面的魔法……

eng: Back to learn another?
chn: 又来学习了吗？

eng: Wonderful. You're most welcome, to any of my anaemic little spells.
chn: 当然欢迎啊，只要你愿意学这些不起眼的魔法。

eng: Back to learn another?
chn: 又来学习了吗？

eng: Why, of course.
chn: 愿意学习，当然好。

eng: Well, I can't blame you, I suppose.
chn: ……好吧，那只能作罢……

eng: But, in the case that you do change your mind,
chn: 但如果你改变心意了，

eng: just speak up, loud and clear.
chn: 再过来找我吧。

eng: Oh, there you are.
chn: ……啊，是你啊。

eng: Care to donate a few runes?
chn: 难道说，你愿意分一些卢恩给我了？

eng: Believe it or not, I studied glintstone sorceries at the Academy of Raya Lucaria.
chn:
俗话说人不可貌相，
我曾待过雷亚卢卡利亚学院，在那学习辉石魔法。

eng: For a small donation, I'd be happy to share my knowledge.
chn: 只要你分卢恩给我，我可以教你魔法。

eng: Apologies, friend.
chn: ……真是不好意思，

eng: I'm afraid my meagre sorceries are no match for your generosity.
chn:
你好心分卢恩给我，
我教的却是些上不了台面的魔法……

eng: Oh, right.
chn: ……啊，既然如此，

eng: I can tell you what I know about this place. That should help a bit.
chn:
不如这样吧。关于这块土地的事情，
我把所知道的一切，全部告诉你。

eng: You've seen that structure to the north, towering over the water?
chn: 从这里往北边看，有看到伫立在水平面的建筑吧？

eng: That's the Academy of Raya Lucaria. Where we study glintstone sorceries.
chn: 那里就是雷亚卢卡利亚学院，辉石魔法师的学问殿堂。

eng: Only, its doors have been closed for quite some time now.
chn: 但是学院已经封闭了很长一段岁月。

eng: After they declared they wouldn't interfere with the Shattering,
chn: 为了贯彻不介入破碎战争的信条，

eng: the academy cast repelling seals on the east gate leading to the Capital and the south gate leading here.
chn:
学院在面向王城的东门，
还有通往这块土地的南门一同设下了魔法封印。

eng: As you might have guessed, the seals are still active,
chn: ……封印直到现在都还没解开。

eng: making entry to the academy impossible without a glintstone key.
chn: 只要没有辉石钥匙，就无法进入学院。

eng: And so I'm stuck here. A fledgling sorcerer, with little chance of acquiring a key.
chn:
……对，我也回不去。像我这种低阶魔法师，
辉石钥匙不是我能奢求的物品。

eng: When they cast the seals, I'd just popped out, and now I'm uprooted from my place of learning.
chn:
施展封印的时候，我恰巧离开学院。
我已经回不去那座学问殿堂了。

eng: Why not find yourself a glintstone key?
chn: ……所以说，你先去找辉石钥匙吧。

eng: Without one, you can't pass through the academy,
chn: 因为没有辉石钥匙，就进不了学院……

eng: and you'll never reach the Erdtree Capital.
chn: 进不了学院，就到不了黄金树王城。

eng: And if you find an extra glintstone key, perhaps...
chn:
然后，如果你除了自己要用的以外，
还有找到另外一支辉石钥匙……

eng: Once you've tied up all your loose ends - and I can be very patient -
chn: 不急，等到你的事情都办完之后就好……

eng: would you consider donating it to me?
chn: 能不能把那支钥匙让给我？

eng: I know it. I'm a bluntstone. Nary a hint of talent for sorcery.
chn:
……我很明白自己只是颗废石，
丝毫没有施展魔法的才能。

eng: But still, my place is at the academy...
chn: 但我还是想再回到那座学问殿堂……

eng: Oh, one more thing... Beware the Albinaurics...
chn: 啊，还有就是……要注意白金之子。

eng: ...accursed souls born of a forbidden rite of the Eternal City.
chn:
他们诞生自永恒之城的秘术，
是一群受到诅咒的人──

eng: The curse withered the legs of the old, and silenced the tongues of the Frogs.
chn:
脚渐渐消失的长者，不能言语的“青蛙”，
他们全部受到了诅咒……

eng: And now they hold deep grudges for anyone left untouched.
chn: 也怨恨那些身体健全的人。

eng: Thank you, kind soul.
chn: ……谢谢你啊。

eng: For learning my paltry sorceries.
chn: 你愿意学这些不起眼的魔法，我很感谢。

eng: I never imagined that a bluntstone like myself would have the chance to play teacher.
chn: 从来没想过像我这种废石，也有机会教人魔法。

eng: Are you certain?
chn: ……真的吗？

eng: You're willing to give your glintstone key to me?
chn: 你真的要把辉石钥匙让给我？

eng: …My oh my!
chn: ……哦哦，哦哦……！

eng: Thank you, thank you dearly.
chn: 谢谢你，真的很谢谢你。

eng: Now I can go back to the academy.
chn: 我又能再回到那座学问殿堂了，

eng: To resume my study...of glintstone sorceries, and the very stars.
chn: 又能再探索辉石魔法……还有星星了……

eng: You've taken an apprenticeship with Sellen?
chn: ……你也有和瑟濂学习魔法啊？

eng: Well, that is something.
chn: 噢，这可是不得了的事。

eng: Sellen was well known. The most promising sorceress in the history of the academy.
chn: 我当然知道她，她是学院有史以来的才女啊。

eng: I followed her at school, but there may as well have been an ocean between us.
chn:
像我这种名不见经传的人，
根本不会和她有交集。

eng: But Sellen was expelled from the academy.
chn: ……只是她被逐出学院了。

eng: Accused of unthinkable treatment of certain sorcerers, under the name of the Graven Witch.
chn:
因为“魔块魔女”的嫌疑──
她被怀疑虐杀了大量人数的魔法师。

eng: I still don't believe the accusations.
chn: ……这我实在无法置信。

eng: The illustrious Sellen would never do such things...
chn: 那么惹人怜爱的女性，哪有可能做出那种事？

eng: Find yourself a glintstone key.
chn: ……你先去找辉石钥匙吧。

eng: Without one, you can't pass through the academy,
chn: 因为没有辉石钥匙，就进不了学院……

eng: and you'll never reach the Erdtree Capital.
chn: 进不了学院，就到不了黄金树王城。

eng: Well, what's this?
chn: ……哦，这个是……

eng: For me, is it? But surely, that's a passing fine brew?
chn: 你要给我吗？这一定很珍贵吧？

eng: My meagre sorceries hardly warrant such a reward.
chn:
我那些不起眼的魔法和它相比，
感觉价值不对等啊……

eng: Oh, bless you.
chn: 嗯，谢谢你。

eng: I'll save it for a special occasion.
chn: 我会留在重要的时刻享用它。

eng: I may never have another drink like it for as long as I live.
chn: 毕竟这辈子，这种酒可能就喝这么一次啊。

eng: So, you've found yourself a glintstone key.
chn: ……你找到辉石钥匙了啊。

eng: But I certainly can't take it from you.
chn: 但是那支钥匙，我不能收。

eng: That key belongs to you.
chn: 那该由你使用。

eng: By rights, you should use it for yourself.
chn: 为了你自己好，那该由你使用。

eng: It's true, I wish to return to my place of study.
chn: ……没错，我很希望回到那座学问殿堂，

eng: But that's no excuse to impose upon others.
chn: 但我不愿意自己达成了目的，却妨碍到其他人。

eng: Ah...is this why bluntstones always finish last?
chn: ……唉，所以我才会一直都是废石吧。

eng: Head to the Academy of Raya Lucaria.
chn: ……快出发去雷亚卢卡利亚学院吧。

eng: Carry on with your journey. Press forward with your fight.
chn: 踏上你的旅程，继续下一场战斗。

eng: Don't bother holding yourself up for my sake.
chn: 不用把我的事放在心上。

eng: Thank you dearly.
chn: ……谢谢你啊。

eng: With your blessing, I will depart for the Academy of Raya Lucaria.
chn: 承蒙你的好意，我要动身前往雷亚卢卡利亚学院了。

eng: Perhaps, one day, you'll pay me a visit?
chn: ……之后等你方便的时候，要不要再来学院一趟？

eng: Who knows, I may be a decorated sorcerer by then!
chn: 到时候，你的老师可能会变得更厉害一些。

eng: Ha ha!
chn: 哈哈。

eng: Oh, did I not mention?
chn: ……我没有告诉过你吧。

eng: I'm a bluntstone. I don't even have a pebble's worth of power.
chn:
我是废石──
意思是完全没有施展魔法的才能。

eng: So I'm afraid I can't help you decipher the scroll.
chn: 所以真的很不好意思……

eng: I'm sorry I'm so useless. I truly am.
chn: 凭我的本事，没办法解读这个卷轴。

eng: Ow!
chn: 啊。

eng: What's wrong with you?
chn: 你怎么了？

eng: Stop that, now. Please.
chn: 住手，住手啊。

eng: There's no getting through to you, is there.
chn: ……听不进我说的话了吗？

eng: Why on earth...
chn: ……为什么要做这种事……？

eng: Oh, Raya... Lucaria...
chn: ……啊，雷亚卢、卡利亚……

eng: The home of my studies...
chn: 我们的、学问殿堂……

eng: Be proud. You were a fine warrior.
chn:
为自己骄傲吧，
你确实是名优秀的战士。

eng: Your only mistake was your choice of master.
chn: 只不过，跟随错了人。

eng: Let the winds lift you, to a higher place.
chn: ……随风消逝，飘摇到遥远的巅峰吧。

eng: Well, who do we have here?
Tarnished, are you? Clearly not one of Godrick's lot.
chn: 是褪色者啊，看起来不是葛瑞克的同伙。

eng: I am Nepheli Loux. Tarnished and warrior, like you.
chn:
我叫涅斐丽·露。
一样是褪色者，也是战士。

eng: I'm here by decree of my father.
chn: 因为义父的命令来到这里。

eng: How utterly repellant this is.
chn: ……话说回来，这真过分。

eng: This "grafting" of Godrick's ill befits a Lord.
chn:
可恶的葛瑞克，竟然做出“接肢”行径，
这绝不是君王该有的作为。

eng: He's tainted the very winds.
chn: 连风都受到玷污。

eng: If you intend to challenge Godrick,
chn: ……如果你准备挑战葛瑞克，

eng: I ask you call upon me.
chn: 可以找我帮忙。

eng: The winds run foul with his deeds.
chn: ……他玷污风，玷污得太过分。

eng: I'm certain father would permit me aid the fight.
chn:
即使我出手帮忙，
义父肯定也会睁一只眼，闭一只眼。

eng: Apologies, but I've idled long enough.
chn: 抱歉，我太多话了。

eng: As fellow Tarnished we must each follow our own guidance.
chn: 同为褪色者，就各自相信指引，往前走吧。

eng: Down whatever road takes us to the throne of Elden Lord.
chn:
相信总有一天，
路会通往艾尔登之王的宝座。

eng: You again...
I thought you'd receive a summons to the Roundtable.
chn: 你果然也受邀到圆桌厅堂了。

eng: Nepheli Loux. We met at Stormveil.
chn:
我是涅斐丽·露，
在史东薇尔之后就没见过面了。

eng: I'm glad to see you here. I have something for you.
chn: 幸好碰面了，我有东西要给你。

eng: I found it in Godrick's grafting grounds.
chn: 那是我在葛瑞克的接肢房找到的。

eng: You defeated him. You should have it.
chn: 既然打倒了葛瑞克，那就是你的。

eng: Make good use of it.
chn: ……别拒收喔。

eng: I don't intend to make a habit of scavenging corpses.
chn: 我可不想变成战场拾荒者。

eng: You again...
I thought you'd receive a summons to the Roundtable.
chn: 你果然也受邀到圆桌厅堂了。

eng: Nepheli Loux. We met at Stormveil.
chn:
我是涅斐丽·露，
在史东薇尔之后就没见过面了。

eng: I'm glad to see you here. I have something for you.
chn: 幸好碰面了，我有东西要给你。

eng: I found it in Godrick's grafting grounds.
chn: 那是我在葛瑞克的接肢房找到的。

eng: You were the one to defeat him, I would hazard?
chn: 打倒了葛瑞克的人是你吧？

eng: Make good use of it.
chn: ……别拒收喔。

eng: I don't intend to make a habit of scavenging corpses.
chn: 我可不想变成战场拾荒者。

eng: Ah, yes.
chn: ……啊，对了。

eng: I wonder if you've met my foster father?
chn: 你有见过我的义父吗？

eng: He's in his study. The room Ensha's guarding just over there.
chn:
他现在人在书房，
书房的门旁有恩夏先生站岗。

eng: If you haven't already, I advise you introduce yourself.
chn: 如果还没见过面，可以去见见他。

eng: Father is leader of the Roundtable.
chn: 义父是圆桌厅堂的领导人，

eng: I'm sure talking to him will be worth your while.
chn: 与他交谈，想必能获益良多。

eng: It's about time I headed off.
chn: ……那么，我该出发了。

eng: I'll see you again, warrior, should the fates deign it.
chn: 战士啊，有缘再见。

eng: You again...
You received a summons to the Roundtable?
chn: 你受邀到圆桌厅堂啊。

eng: Nepheli Loux. We met at Stormveil.
chn:
我是涅斐丽·露，
在史东薇尔之后就没见过面了。

eng: The pleasure's mine, as a fellow Tarnished, guided by grace to the Roundtable Hold.
chn:
同样是被引导、来到圆桌厅堂的褪色者，
今后多指教了。

eng: Oh, hello.
I've not seen you here before.
chn: 我第一次见到你。

eng: I am Nepheli Loux. Warrior.
chn: 我是涅斐丽·露，是战士。

eng: Here by decree of my father.
chn: 因为义父的命令来到这里。

eng: The pleasure's mine, as a fellow Tarnished, guided by grace to the Roundtable Hold.
chn:
同样是被引导、来到圆桌厅堂的褪色者，
今后多指教了。

eng: Is that some kind of medicine?
chn: ……那是某种药品吗？

eng: One that affects the heart, I'd wager.
chn: 看起来是会对心理产生效用的类型。

eng: If it's what I think, I have no need of it.
chn: 是的话，我不需要。

eng: I am a warrior.
chn: 我涅斐丽·露是战士──

eng: I need no external aid.
chn:
不论是对战斗的恐惧也好，
或是陷入一时的迷惘也罢，

eng: Not to brave the horrors of battle. Nor to bolster my resolve.
chn: 都该由我独自承受。

eng: Oh, it's you...
chn: ……啊，是你。

eng: Well, what do you make of it? What's happened to this village?
chn: 这座村子的惨状，你怎么看？

eng: I witnessed a sight much the same, in my infancy.
chn: ……我小时候，曾看过一样的景象。

eng: The oppression of the weak. Murder and pillage unchecked.
chn: 弱者惨遭蹂躏、掠夺、杀害……

eng: A waking nightmare, made by men.
chn: 人间炼狱的景象。

eng: But this time, I'm a woman grown.
chn: ……但我已经不是当时那年幼的孩子，

eng: And though the suffering cannot be undone, I can still mete out justice.
chn: 虽说为时已晚，但来报一箭之仇吧……

eng: Justice to the oppressors.
chn: 对那群施暴的人。

eng: Let the scars I carve remind them. I am Nepheli Loux. Warrior.
chn: 让他们知道，我涅斐丽·露是战士。

eng: Ah, you...
chn: ……啊，是你。

eng: Please, leave me be.
chn: 抱歉，能让我静一静吗？

eng: It's pathetic, I know, but I...need to think.
chn: 说来丢脸，我现在思绪很乱。

eng: ...So you know already, do you?
chn: ……你听说了啊。

eng: Right. It's true. My father cast me out.
chn: 对，没错。我被义父抛弃了。

eng: For indulging my emotions. Forgetting the mission. Punishment for offing his pawns.
chn:
这是沉浸在情绪里，忘记命令……
害他手中的棋子折损的惩罚。

eng: Father...rather, Lord Gideon has offered me guidance all my life.
chn: ……我的义父基甸爵士，一直是我的明灯。

eng: I would have done anything for him, to place him on the throne of Elden Lord.
chn:
只要能让他当上艾尔登之王，
我什么都愿意做。

eng: And yet I... Though it was not my intent...
chn: 但是，我……

eng: I betrayed him...
chn: 我还是背叛他了。

eng: I...can no longer trust in father...
chn: ……而且我已经无法完全信任义父……

eng: To think he'd order his men to enact such tragedy...
chn: 既然那些人是遵从义父的命令，引发那桩惨剧，

eng: Where is the justice he purports, in that?
chn: 那么，义父哪有正义可言？

eng: He once told me that if he became Elden Lord,
chn: 义父曾说过，只要他当上艾尔登之王，

eng: he would never allow the downtrodden to be cheated ever again.
chn: 在他的治理之下，弱者将不再受欺凌──

eng: Was he simply lying to me?
chn: 难道那句话是谎话？

eng: No, no, no...
chn: ……唉，不对，不是这样。

eng: How could I say that?
chn: 忘了我说的话吧。

eng: Father has always given me his guidance...
chn: 义父是我的明灯。

eng: And now...I've lost it...
chn: 但现在，我失去了他……

eng: Medicine, is it?
chn: ……那是药品吗？

eng: Fine. I'll take a dose. Perhaps it'll do me some good.
chn: 嗯，现在的我，可能会需要。

eng: It's very sweet...isn't it...
chn: ……这原来这么香甜啊。

eng: And very...very...
chn: 而且，非常……

eng: Is that ash?
chn: ……这个是骨灰吗？

eng: I can smell the ancient storm in it...
chn: 有一股古老风暴的味道。

eng: My thanks. I'll gladly take it.
chn: 谢谢，我收下了。

eng: I'm...not like Roderika.
chn: ……我和罗德莉卡不一样，

eng: I don't feel the presence of spirits, let alone see them.
chn: 我看不见，也感应不到灵魂。

eng: Still, this ash..
chn: 即使如此，看着这骨灰……

eng: It reminds me of my first hawk.
chn: 还是会让我想起，我的第一只老鹰。

eng: Thank you.
chn: 谢谢你。

eng: In this ash, I can smell the ancient storm.
chn: ……这个骨灰有一股古老风暴的味道。

eng: It reminds me of my first hawk.
chn: ……让我想起，我的第一只老鹰。

eng: It's been some time.
chn: ……好久不见了。

eng: I must thank you, for your aid.
chn: 那个时候，谢谢你的关照。

eng: I told father I would be with him no longer.
chn: 没错，我已经告别了义父。

eng: I remembered the vow I took when I first became a warrior, so many moons ago.
chn:
因为我想起很久以前，
当上战士的时候，立下的誓言。

eng: This land is much like the one from which I hail.
chn: ……这块土地很像我的故乡。

eng: I will call upon the storm, to drive away the foulness that has settled on the winds.
chn: 我很想刮起风暴，吹散风中的污秽。

eng: Again, I am Nepheli Loux. Warrior.
chn:
再次报上名号。
我是涅斐丽·露，是战士。

eng: Some call me by the title of Lady, but I remain the same woman underneath.
chn:
身边虽然有人唤我为王，
但我的本质依旧不变。

eng: Though I have now abandoned my former guidance.
chn: 唯一改变的，是我舍弃了引导的明灯。

eng: I cannot express how much you've helped me.
chn: ……我很感谢你。

eng: Should you become Elden Lord.
chn: 如果是你当上艾尔登之王，

eng: I would gladly lighten your burden.
chn: 我愿意化作你的其中一片羽翼。

eng: Farewell, fellow warrior.
chn: ……再会了。

eng: I will remain, to summon the storm.
chn: 我会继续待在这里，刮起风暴。

eng: But your guidance, and your fight...
chn: 那引导你前进、战斗的地方……

eng: Surely lie elsewhere.
chn: 应该不是这里。

eng: I will remain, to summon the storm.
chn: 我会继续待在这里，刮起风暴。

eng: But your guidance, and your fight...
chn: 那引导你前进、战斗的地方……

eng: Surely lie elsewhere.
chn: 应该不是这里。
呜。

eng: What do you intend?
chn: 这是做什么？

eng: Such conduct ill befits a warrior.
chn: 这不是战士该有的作为。

eng: I see. You are but a simple villain.
chn: ……原来是凶恶盗匪之流。

eng: Let the scars remind you; this lesson comes from Nepheli Loux!
chn: 我涅斐丽·露，要让你明白是非。

eng: You wouldn't even register as a threat to father.
chn: ……像你这种人，用不着义父动手。

eng: Hurry up and die.
chn: 去死吧。

eng: Father... I am slain.
chn: ……义父啊，我战败了。

eng: Please...become Elden Lord...
chn: 请您当上、艾尔登之王……

eng: Hm.
A new face, are you?
chn: 没看过你吶。

eng: Well, while you're here. Have you, too, been seduced by the good lady alcohol?
chn: 不过来得正好，你对酒有没有兴趣啊？

eng: Perhaps you've heard of dreambrew, the nectar of the demigods, once forbidden to we mortals?
chn:
而且不是普通的酒，
是过去只有半神才能喝的甘露，也就是粹酒喔。

eng: Well, believe it or not, I know just how to make it.
chn: 世事难料啊，其实贫僧对粹酒了解得透彻。

eng: And if you were to help me gather its ingredients,
chn: 如果你能帮忙收集制酒的原料，

eng: I'd gladly share some with you.
chn: 贫僧可以分给你一些。

eng: The Lands Between are no kind place for we Tarnished.
chn: ……交界地对我们褪色者实在不算亲切，

eng: And I'm getting too old to keep scavenging corpses on the battlefield...
chn:
大概因为年纪有了吧，
这阵子到战场找原料，身体实在吃不消吶。

eng: You'll help me then?
chn: 哦，这样啊！你愿意帮忙吗！

eng: Wonderful! Music to my ears.
chn: 真好、真好。

eng: Then take this with you.
chn: 那这东西，你拿着吧。

eng: That, is St. Trina's Crystal Ball.
chn: 那东西叫作托莉娜水晶球，

eng: It can be used to take slumber fog from those submerged in deepest sleep,
chn: 当你找到那群酣梦难醒的幸运儿，

eng: those merry fools sunk so low they will not awaken.
chn: 可以用水晶球收集深眠浓雾。

eng: Dreambrew, I should say, is a special filtration of slumber fog.
chn:
所谓的粹酒，是滤过深眠浓雾之后，
生成的特殊液体吶。

eng: Go ahead and bring me some slumber fog, my compeer.
chn: ……帮个忙，去收集深眠浓雾吧。

eng: About two should do it, by my reckoning...
chn: 嗯，再收集２个……

eng: About three should do it, by my reckoning...
chn: 嗯，再收集３个……

eng: About four should do it, by my reckoning...
chn: 嗯，再收集４个……

eng: About five should do it, by my reckoning...
chn: 嗯，再收集５个……

eng: About six should do it, by my reckoning...
chn: 嗯，再收集６个……

eng: And then I'll have enough dreambrew to share.
chn: 贫僧可以考虑分给你一些粹酒。

eng: Drink is a wonderful teacher. Imbibe and you will understand; this world's delights, and its futility.
chn:
……酒可是好东西，
让人体会人生在世的喜悦，还有美妙之处吶。

eng: You what? You hardly know what you're missing out on.
chn: 怎么！你也太不知趣了吶！

eng: Well, suit yourself. But I'm sure you'll be after a drink before long.
chn:
唉，也算啦。
以后你会主动来问酒的事情。

eng: Perhaps you'll tire of this crumbling world...
chn: 当你对逐渐步向毁灭的世间感到厌烦，或是……

eng: Or maybe you'll wish to uncover someone's deepest, darkest secrets...
chn: 当你想知道其他人心底的秘密吶……

eng: What? Taken an interest in the finer things, after all?
chn: 怎么了吶？你有兴趣了吗？

eng: Like dreambrew, the nectar of the demigods, once forbidden to we mortals?
chn: 那个只有半神才能喝的甘露，也就是粹酒。

eng: Well, believe it or not, I know just how to make it.
chn: 世事难料啊，其实贫僧对粹酒了解得透彻。

eng: And if you were to help me gather its ingredients,
chn: 如果你能帮忙收集制酒的原料，

eng: I'd gladly share some with you.
chn: 贫僧可以考虑分给你一些。

eng: What do you say?
chn: 怎么样吶？

eng: Ah, I've been eagerly awaiting your return.
chn: 哦，等你好久啦。

eng: How did you fare? Find any slumber fog?
chn: 事情办得怎么样？有收集到深眠浓雾吗？

eng: Hmm, not quite enough.
chn: ……这样还不够吶。

eng: As I said, if you'd like me to share some dreambrew with you, we'll need two doses of slumber fog, or thereabouts.
chn:
贫僧也说了，想分到粹酒，
还要再收集２个浓雾吶。

eng: As I said, if you'd like me to share some dreambrew with you, we'll need three doses of slumber fog, or thereabouts.
chn:
贫僧也说了，想分到粹酒，
还要再收集３个浓雾吶。

eng: As I said, if you'd like me to share some dreambrew with you, we'll need four doses of slumber fog, or thereabouts.
chn:
贫僧也说了，想分到粹酒，
还要再收集４个浓雾吶。

eng: As I said, if you'd like me to share some dreambrew with you, we'll need five doses of slumber fog, or thereabouts.
chn:
贫僧也说了，想分到粹酒，
还要再收集５个浓雾吶。

eng: As I said, if you'd like me to share some dreambrew with you, we'll need six doses of slumber fog, or thereabouts.
chn:
贫僧也说了，想分到粹酒，
还要再收集６个浓雾吶。

eng: I see, I see. You have what I asked.
chn: ……唔、嗯，这就对啦。

eng: All splendid fogs of superior quality. Sediment firmly settled, mm.
chn: 每个浓雾都很纯净无瑕，也有漂亮的沉淀物。

eng: Good work, my compeer.
chn: ……辛苦你啦。

eng: Here's the dreambrew I promised. All yours.
chn: 来，这是说好要给你的粹酒，收下吧。

eng: Bring me more slumber fog, my compeer.
chn: ……再帮个忙，多收集一些深眠浓雾吧。

eng: Do so, and I'll have a bottle of dreambrew with your name on it.
chn: 这样贫僧就能再分给你粹酒喔。

eng: Allow me a little advice, my compeer.
chn: ……贫僧想给你一个建议。

eng: Dreambrew is known to drag people's secrets into the daylight.
chn: 粹酒能揭露秘密。

eng: If that's what you seek, rather than the usual fleeting pleasures,
chn:
所以说，和获得短暂的愉悦相比，
如果你更希望知道他人的秘密，

eng: Then treat them to some dreambrew.
chn: 就让对方喝下粹酒吧。

eng: Secrets are like fine wine. The longer they mature in the dark, the richer the flavour...
chn: ……秘密就好比老酒──越陈是越香吶。

eng: Know that, and all will be as you desire. Friendship, rule, intrigue...
chn:
懂了这个道理，一切都能随心所欲啦。
想要友情，想要支配，想要欺骗都行啊……

eng: Did you forget something?
chn: ……有什么事吶？

eng: Oh, hello there.
chn: 哦，是你啊。

eng: Have you brought me some more slumber fog?
chn: 又带来深眠浓雾了吗？

eng: You certainly have a taste for spirits.
chn: ……你还真喜欢酒吶。

eng: I'm sure I'll be seeing a lot more of you.
chn: 看来之后，我们会很常打交道啊……

eng: As you surely know, my compeer, I am but a humble man of the cloth.
chn: 你也知道，贫僧是虔诚的圣职人员。

eng: And I must profess, the study of alcohol is but another form of worship.
chn: 对酒有多了解，就等同是祷告有多虔敬吶。

eng: Oh, St. Trina. My faith is in alcohol, and the hearts of men.
chn:
哦，托莉娜。
我的信仰生于酒，我的信仰生于人心吶。

eng: Ah, good to see you.
chn: ……哦，是你呀。

eng: I heard the path to the Haligtree had been reopened.
chn:
贫僧听说那通往圣树的路，
原本封闭不通，现在再一次开放了。

eng: So I forced these old bones to weather the journey.
chn: 所以才拚了老命赶来……

eng: Don't tell me it was you who opened the passage?
chn: 看起来是你的功劳啊？

eng: Nevertheless, it's rather nippy in these lands, eh.
chn: ……说起来，这片土地真够冷。

eng: But there's nothing like a good drink to warm the cockles...
chn: 这时候该上场的，就是酒吶。

eng: Did you need something else?
chn: ……你找贫僧，还有什么事吶？

eng: Oh it's, good, good to see you.
chn: 唔、喔，是你啊。

eng: I think I was about to freeze solid.
chn: 差那么一点就要冻僵了吶。

eng: You know, a holy personage was once abducted from these lands.
chn:
……这块土地啊，曾经发生
某位尊贵的大人被掳走的事情吶。

eng: Thus I am here in search of clues that might unravel the mystery.
chn: 贫僧正在搜集相关的线索……

eng: The abductor's bloody footprints are said to have disappeared in the Forest of Ancient Bowers.
chn:
据说那群贼人躲进古代树森林，
贫僧在找寻他们留下血腥足迹。

eng: Hm? That's quite a face you're pulling...
chn: 唔？瞧你一脸古怪。

eng: Need I remind you? Though I am but a humble man of the cloth,
chn: 贫僧不是常挂嘴上吗？贫僧是虔诚的圣职人员……

eng: each of us has our secrets, my compeer.
chn: 还有，人生在世，谁无秘密吶？

eng: You know, a holy personage was once abducted from these lands.
chn:
……这块土地啊，曾经发生
某位尊贵的大人被掳走的事情吶。

eng: Thus I am here in search of clues that might unravel the mystery.
chn: 贫僧正在搜集相关的线索……

eng: The abductor's bloody footprints are said to have disappeared in the Forest of Ancient Bowers.
chn:
据说那群贼人躲进古代树森林，
贫僧在找寻他们留下血腥足迹。

eng: Finally, I have found it!
chn: ……贫僧总算找到了。

eng: St. Trina's, no, Lord Miquella's cadaver.
chn:
托莉娜，不对，
总算找到您的身体了，米凯拉大人。

eng: I have partaken of untold secrets.
chn: 贫僧遍尝了各种秘密，

eng: Such that I might aid you, O Lord.
chn: 肯定能为您带来益处。

eng: So please, I hope you can welcome your humble servant Rhico,
chn: 还请您允许贫僧里可，

eng: Into your dream, the world of your heart.
chn: 进入您的梦，以及您的心中世界。

eng: Indeed, I beg you grant my wish,
chn: 也请您允准──

eng: That when you transcend from empyrean to god, allow me a place by your side.
chn:
在神人的您成为神的那个时候，
请允许贫僧随侍您的身旁。

eng: I have partaken of untold secrets.
chn: 贫僧遍尝了各种秘密，

eng: Such that I might aid you, O Lord.
chn: 肯定能为您带来益处。

eng: So please, I hope you can welcome your humble servant Rhico,
chn: 还请您允许贫僧里可，

eng: Into your dream, the world of your heart.
chn: 进入您的梦，以及您的心中世界。

eng: Oh ho, are you asking me to partake?
chn: ……哦，你送给贫僧啊。

eng: Well, I haven't got a clue what to think.
chn:
这是脸皮够厚，毫无心机，
还是出于全然的好意吶？

eng: Is this outright impudence? Simple callousness? Or genuine kindness, I wonder?
chn: 真摸不透。

eng: Well, what matters it? I'll take some, regardless.
chn: 唔、嗯，贫僧就收下吧。

eng: You couldn't possibly fathom the secrets I possess, my compeer.
chn:
想来贫僧的秘密对你而言，
可能也太过难解。
啊。

eng: Have you lost your marbles?
chn: ……你是昏头了吗？

eng: You do know I'm merely a beggar.
chn: 贫僧正如你所见，一贫如洗。

eng: I've nothing left to give.
chn: 没有值钱的东西可抢。

eng: Haven't you Tarnished any respect?
chn: ……真是受不了最近的褪色者……

eng: For those who came before you.
chn: 就不能尊重前辈先进吗？

eng: Well, that knocked the wind out of me.
chn: ……呼，没想到有点吃力吶。

eng: The perfect time to try that special reserve…
chn: 拿珍藏的来喝一喝吧……

eng: You base, facile, uncharitable bastard…
chn: ……恶劣，浮躁，短视……

eng: You're beyond help, my compeer…
chn: 你完全无可救药……

eng: Welcome, dear guest.
chn: ……客人啊，欢迎你。

eng: After being out there, it must be quite surprising,
chn:
既然来自外地，
想必入目的一切都令你惊叹吧？

eng: to see our capital, cradled by the Erdtree, showered by an eternal wellspring of grace.
chn:
这座城市位在黄金树的树脚，
沐浴在源源不绝的赐福之下──

eng: The sights, the sounds, the luscious scents. Each precisely as they should be. Each eternal.
chn:
飘扬的乐音、芳香、光辉……
一切都在正轨之上，在永恒之中。

eng: Oh?
I didn't notice that you were Tarnished.
chn: 但仔细看来，你似乎是褪色者？

eng: Now, you mustn't take this the wrong way.
chn: ……既然如此，我好言相劝，

eng: But you must leave the capital at once.
chn: 尽快离开这座城市吧。

eng: It is for your own good, I assure you.
chn: 我是出自好意才如此规劝。

eng: All things have their proper place.
chn: 正所谓人各有安身之地──

eng: We, having been chosen by grace, were given this Golden Capital.
chn: 受赐福宠爱的我们，被赋予这座黄金之城；

eng: You, on the other hand, have your own home, which is a far cry from here.
chn: 不受宠爱的你们，也有恰如其分的郊野可去。

eng: So far, in fact, that it cannot be further marred by your touch.
chn:
只要待在那地方，你们还能维持本色，
不会玷污任何事物。

eng: The Shattering caused a great many fools to overstep their bounds.
chn:
……在破碎战争的时候，
就是有太多蠢人不懂得安分守己。

eng: Their impudence led to insurgency against Morgott, Lord of Grace. They raised an army, and sought to lay siege to this sacred ground.
chn:
竟敢反叛“赐福王”蒙葛特，
举兵进攻，企图侵略、夺走圣地。

eng: But do you see where it got them? King Morgott's rule would not be shaken!
chn: 可是你瞧，蒙葛特王的治理无可匹敌！

eng: Their attempt to defile the capital failed, and while we revelled in eternal grace,
chn:
妄想攻击黄金树之城的，皆不能得逞，
我们得以永远蒙受赐福。

eng: the traitors were eyed by the grotesque Fell Omen, and their corpses piled high outside the wall!
chn:
所有叛徒都被恐怖“恶兆妖鬼”盯上，
一个个都在城墙外尸迭成山、血流成河！

eng: The lesson here is self-evident.
chn: ……客人啊，这样你明白了吗？

eng: The capital is simply not where you belong.
chn: 你是应该离开这座城市。

eng: You mustn't take it the wrong way.
chn: ……我是好言相劝，

eng: But you must leave the capital at once.
chn: 尽快离开这座城市吧。

eng: Well, what have we here...
chn: ……哦，这物品……

eng: You hunt Omen, do you?
chn: 原来你在狩猎恶兆之子啊。

eng: Mm-hmm, yes it appears so...
chn: ……唔、唔，这的确货真价实……

eng: Well, then perhaps we can talk.
chn: 既然如此，你的去留就另当别论。

eng: For a barbarous Tarnished, you see the difference between right and wrong rather clearly.
chn:
你身为褪色者，一介野蛮人，
但似乎能明辨是非。

eng: Very well. I permit your stay in the capital for the time being.
chn: 好吧，我允许你在这座城市短暂停留。

eng: And in the name of the house of Shanehaight, I beseech you hunt down the foul Omen.
chn:
接着，我以榭海德一族之名，
向你提出狩猎恶兆之子的要求。

eng: The Undercapital is a repository of waste.
chn: 这座城市的地底已然化成弃置场，

eng: For ages it's teemed with repulsive Omen. Fiendlings, even, who've never lost a horn.
chn:
从古至今，那群骯脏的恶兆之子，
还有不曾切除畸角的恶鬼之子，就躲藏在地底。

eng: And what's worse, they've taken to bellowing in a most blood-curdling manner. You can hear it all the way up here.
chn:
……让人深感悲痛的是，从不久之前开始，
那些东西发出的，令人作呕的叫声竟然传至地面。

eng: A vile, ceaseless affront to the Erdtree's sanctity.
chn: 丝毫不放弃玷污黄金树的意图。

eng: Get on with it, then.
chn: 快出发吧。

eng: Hunt down the vile Omen scurrying about in the Undercapital, and give us peace from those wretched howls.
chn:
去狩猎那些躲藏在地底弃置场的恶兆之子，
快快断绝那一阵阵令人作呕的叫声。

eng: I know you can do it. Do not dishonour House Shanehaight.
chn:
我很期待你的表现。
切记，勿做出侮辱我族英名的举止。

eng: Haven't set off to hunt the Omen yet?
chn: ……还不打算狩猎恶兆之子吗？

eng: Well, you're certainly dragging your heels more than I foresaw.
chn: 看来你比我认为得还要优柔寡断。

eng: I forgive you.
chn: ……好吧，也无妨。

eng: We Shanehaights are known for patience, a virtue amongst the noble.
chn: 我可以等──宽容待人是身为贵族的气度。

eng: Haven't set off to hunt the Omen yet?
chn: ……还不打算狩猎恶兆之子吗？

eng: That wretched screeching... I feel as if I could go mad.
chn:
那些东西……令人作呕的叫声……
快要逼疯人了。

eng: Ohh, there you are, pleased to see you.
chn: 哦，久候多时了。

eng: You must've expunged the Omen from the repository.
chn: 那些弃置场的恶兆之子，你狩猎完毕了吧？

eng: Otherwise their revolting screeches would still be affronting my ears.
chn: 因为那令人作呕的叫声渐渐消失了……

eng: Well, you've done us a fine service, I must say.
chn: 不过啊，你做得非常好。

eng: The Erdbishops will be very pleased to hear it.
chn: 诸位树神官肯定会欣喜无比。

eng: No, this is above their station...
chn: ……唔，不只如此……

eng: If I explained that this was all my idea,
chn: 只要确实证明是我的功劳，

eng: I could be granted audience with Morgott, Lord of Grace.
chn: 也许还能觐见“赐福王”蒙葛特，一见尊容。

eng: What a wondrous opportunity.
chn: ……准爵家的人有幸觐见赐福王，

eng: That a viscount as myself might be seen by the Lord of Grace.
chn: 这是何等荣耀的事情。

eng: Such an honour will place me amongst the most venerated Shanehaights.
chn: 肯定能成为一族流芳百世的荣誉。

eng: Oh, very sorry, I almost forgot about you completely.
chn: ……唔，失礼了，我忘记你还在现场。

eng: This Shanehaight heirloom has been held for generations.
chn: 这是我们榭海德一族的传家之宝，

eng: It is yours now, a reward for your fearless execution of my request.
chn: 用来奖励你完美达成了要求。

eng: I'm afraid its worth might be lost on a Tarnished, but...
chn: ……对一介褪色者来说，那是过于贵重的物品。

eng: For everything, there is a first. For you, and for House Shanehaight, and its newfound glory.
chn:
哎，也无妨。
当作是庆祝我们榭海德一族的荣耀之始吧。

eng: Now, I need to get myself ready.
chn: ……我得开始做准备了。

eng: If fortune favours me, and I am seen by the Lord of Grace,
chn: 万一真要觐见赐福王，

eng: I'd be put to shame if I didn't look my very best.
chn: 一身邋遢的，成何体统。

eng: Kill our lord...
chn: ……杀了王……

eng: He is a stain upon all things golden...
chn: 不能再玷污黄金……

eng: Kill Morgott, kingly impostor!
chn: 杀了骗徒王、杀了蒙葛特！

eng: Ah...ahh...
Ngh... W-who's there?
chn: ……呜，你、你是谁？

eng: Well, it matters not. If you are wise, you will leave, immediately.
chn: 不管你是谁，最好离开我身边。

eng: My flesh writhes with scarlet rot.
chn: 我体内的猩红腐败正在蠕动……

eng: It is a curse. Not to be meddled with by man.
chn: 这是诅咒，不是一般人该接触的东西。

eng: If you are wise, you will leave, immediately.
chn: ……最好离开我身边。

eng: My flesh writhes with scarlet rot.
chn: 我体内的猩红腐败正在蠕动……

eng: You ask that I stab myself with the needle...
chn: ……要我用这根针刺自己吗？

eng: To quell the scarlet rot?
chn: 能用来抑制猩红腐败？

eng: But...how?
chn: 你是什么人……

eng: Never mind. I've decided.
chn: 没事，我明白了。

eng: I would rather trust you,
chn: 与其继续受腐败侵蚀……

eng: than simply continue to spoil from within.
chn: 我选择相信你。

eng: Would you mind...averting your eyes for a moment?
chn: ……能请你闭上双眼一阵子吗？

eng: Well. That was easier than expected.
chn: ……顺利刺进去了，真没想到。

eng: But...why do I feel so...
chn: 但是……怎么会、这么……

eng: I...hoped to see you again.
chn: ……我在等你。

eng: My apologies, for when last we met. I fainted before I could even thank you.
chn:
抱歉，在那之后就失去意识，
没有向你好好道声谢。

eng: Everything is as you said. Since inserting the needle, the scarlet rot has ceased to writhe.
chn:
没错，和你说得一样。
把针刺进身体后，猩红腐败就不再蠕动。

eng: Even the nightmares have abated... And now, though I can scarcely believe it myself, I can move as I please.
chn:
而且不再做恶梦了……
也能自在行动，我到现在还不敢置信。

eng: Not that I could ever truly repay you,
chn: 对你真是不知从何感谢起。

eng: but I would like you to have this, by way of thanks. A token, though it is.
chn: 这是微薄的心意，请你收下。

eng: I'm considering leaving. On a journey.
chn: ……我想出门旅行。

eng: With the needle buried in my flesh, I've started to recall, but dimly...
chn:
针刺进身体之后，
我在朦胧的意识中想起了──

eng: My destiny...
chn: 自己的命运。

eng: It's all thanks to you.
chn: 没错，这都多亏有你帮忙。

eng: My name is Millicent. I pray fate permits us meet again.
chn: 我叫米莉森，期待以后再相会。

eng: I'm considering leaving. On a journey.
chn: ……我想出门旅行。

eng: With the needle buried in my flesh, I've started to recall, but dimly...
chn:
针刺进身体之后，
我在朦胧的意识中想起了──

eng: My destiny...
chn: 自己的命运。

eng: Oh, hello again.
chn: ……啊，是你。

eng: Something about this place felt familiar to me.
chn: 不知道为什么，这个地方让我有种怀念的感觉。

eng: So I decided to pay a visit, hoping to find someone here.
chn: 想着可能会遇见人，所以来了这里一趟，

eng: But I've only found emptiness.
chn: 结果你也看到了，没有人在。

eng: Perhaps before my departure, I needed someone to say farewell to.
chn: ……我可能想在出门旅行以前，向某个人道别吧。

eng: Well, never mind that.
chn: ……说了一些让人摸不着头绪的话了。

eng: I must focus on my journey, for which I have you to thank.
chn: 总之多亏有你帮忙，我有办法出门旅行了。

eng: I must stay strong.
chn: 我必须变得更强……

eng: Ah. We meet again.
chn: ……又遇见你了。

eng: In truth, it's been smooth sailing, for me.
chn: 嗯，我的状况很稳定。

eng: The scarlet rot has stilled, since last we met.
chn: 猩红腐败从那之后就不再蠕动，

eng: As such, I've been able to continue my journey.
chn: 幸亏如此，我才能继续旅行。

eng: Though rather vexingly,
chn: ……不过，真令人焦虑。

eng: I realise that if I still had my sword arm,
chn: 要是右手没有被切断，

eng: I could have aided you in battle.
chn: 我就能用剑报答你的恩情。

eng: Now, I'm tracing the path Malenia took,
chn: ……我正在追查玛莲妮亚的下落。

eng: after unleashing the power of the scarlet rot, during her battle with General Radahn, in the Caelid Wilds.
chn:
在盖利德原野与拉塔恩将军的战争中，
她释放了腐败的力量──

eng: I should like to meet her, this vanished woman.
chn: 从那之后就失去了踪影，但我想见见她。

eng: I think she's in the north.
chn: ……玛莲妮亚在北方，

eng: In the lands that lie beyond the Erdtree.
chn: 她在走过黄金树之后，更远的地方。

eng: Are you...
chn: ……这只义手……

eng: Giving me this arm?
chn: 你要让给我吗？

eng: I thank you.
chn: ……感谢你。

eng: I am in your debt, yet again.
chn: 老是受你照顾。

eng: I think, If the arm serves well enough,
chn: ……如果我能运用自如，

eng: It might be possible for me to wield a sword again.
chn: 说不定还能继续挥剑。

eng: If the arm serves well enough,
chn: ……如果我能运用自如，

eng: It might be possible for me to wield a sword again.
chn: 说不定还能继续挥剑。

eng: Perhaps, then, I can aid you in battle.
chn: ……到时候，我就能报答你的恩情。

eng: Now, I'm tracing the path Malenia took.
chn: ……我正在追查玛莲妮亚的下落。

eng: She's passed into to the lands that lie beyond the Erdtree.
chn: 她在走过黄金树之后，更远的地方。

eng: Ah, we meet yet again.
chn: ……又遇见你了。

eng: The arm you gave me truly is a thing of wonder.
chn: 你让给我的义手令人非常惊艳，

eng: It feels just like my own, even handling a sword.
chn:
使用起来犹如自己的手，
我也能继续挥剑了。

eng: Perhaps it is foolish to say this to you of all people, but I am sure of my skill with the sword.
chn:
……这样说有些班门弄斧，
但我对剑术有几分自信。

eng: Thus, I would have you call upon me in battle again, should you ever have the need.
chn:
所以在需要人手的时候，
希望你再找我一起作战。

eng: Ah, we meet yet again.
chn: ……又遇见你了。

eng: The arm you gave me truly is a thing of wonder.
chn: 你让给我的义手令人非常惊艳，

eng: It feels just like my own, even handling a sword.
chn:
使用起来犹如自己的手，
我也能继续挥剑了。

eng: Perhaps it is foolish to say this to you of all people, but I am sure of my skill with the sword.
chn:
……这样说有些班门弄斧，
但我对剑术有几分自信。

eng: Thus, I would have you call upon me in battle, should you ever have the need.
chn:
所以在需要人手的时候，
希望你找我一起作战。

eng: I would have you call upon me in battle, should you ever have the need.
chn: ……在需要人手的时候，希望你找我一起作战。

eng: It is the only way that I can express my thanks.
chn: 那是我唯一能报答的方式。

eng: To think we'd meet in such a place...
chn: ……真没想到会在这种地方遇见你。

eng: What could your purpose possibly...
chn: 你是为什么……

eng: No, I know well enough who you are, and what I know is good enough for me.
chn:
没事，你就是你。
对我来说，这样就够了。

eng: Call upon me again in battle, should you have the need.
chn: 需要人手的时候，希望你找我一起作战。

eng: I'm searching for a fort to the west of the ruins.
chn: ……我正在找一座城，据说那在这座遗迹的西方。

eng: I'm searching for a fort to the north of the ruins.
chn: ……我正在找一座城，据说那在这座遗迹的北方。

eng: I heard the master of the fort was given a medallion that allowed him to visit the Haligtree.
chn:
传闻说，那座城的领主曾经受赐符节，
那是前往圣树需要的物品。

eng: Indeed, I believe that is where Malenia will be found.
chn: ……对，玛莲妮亚人在圣树。

eng: The Haligtree is hidden somewhere in these Northern lands.
chn: 圣树就藏在这块北方大地的某处。

eng: I'm searching for a fort to the west of the ruins.
chn: ……我正在找一座城，据说那在这座遗迹的西方。

eng: I'm searching for a fort to the north of the ruins.
chn: ……我正在找一座城，据说那在这座遗迹的北方。

eng: I heard the master of the fort was given a medallion that allowed him to visit the Haligtree.
chn:
传闻说，那座城的领主曾经受赐符节，
那是前往圣树需要的物品。

eng: Again we meet.
chn: ……又遇见你了。

eng: I can only surmise our purposes are aligned.
chn: 看来我们是殊途同归啊。

eng: In which case, allow me to explain myself.
chn: ……既然如此，我想先告诉你──

eng: I am of Malenia's blood.
chn: 其实我和玛莲妮亚有血缘关系。

eng: But in what capacity I know not. I could be sister, daughter, or an offshoot…
chn:
至于是亲子、姊妹，
或者是她的分身──这我不清楚。

eng: Whatever the case though, I am certain of a kinship between us.
chn:
但我能明确感觉到，
自己和她之间有近亲的连结。

eng: There is something I must return to Malenia.
chn: ……我想要还给玛莲妮亚──

eng: The will that was once her own.
chn: 过去玛莲妮亚持有的意志、

eng: The dignity, the sense of self, that allowed her to resist the call of the scarlet rot.
chn: 面对猩红腐败的呢喃，作为人与其抗衡的自尊、

eng: The pride she abandoned, to meet Radahn's measure.
chn: 还有为了与拉塔恩匹敌，她不惜打破的戒律。

eng: There is something I must return to Malenia.
chn: ……我想要还给玛莲妮亚──

eng: The will that was once her own.
chn: 过去玛莲妮亚持有的意志、

eng: The dignity, the sense of self, that allowed her to resist the call of the scarlet rot.
chn: 面对猩红腐败的呢喃，作为人与其抗衡的自尊。

eng: Oh, hello.
chn: ……啊，是你。

eng: Thank you for lending your hand.
chn: 刚才那场战斗你为我助阵，十分感谢。

eng: Without your help, I could not have defeated that quartet.
chn: 单凭一个人要打赢那四个人，想必是不可能的事。

eng: I feel as if I've been in your debt from beginning to end.
chn: ……从头到尾，我一直受你关照。

eng: Thank you. With your help, I was able to live as my own person, if only in passing.
chn:
谢谢你──因为有你在，
即使时间短暂，我得以维持自我活到现在。

eng: But this is where things end.
chn: 看来我的旅途到此为止了。

eng: I pause to even tell you, but...
chn: 对你实在很难启齿……

eng: I took out the needle myself.
chn: 我已经拔起那根针了。

eng: Tell whoever put you up to this.
chn: ……请你转告那恶意的源头──

eng: That if I am to flower into something other than myself,
chn: 要我化身为非我的存在，绽放成花，

eng: I would rather rot into nothingness as I am.
chn: 我宁可就此腐化。

eng: Please, let me pass alone.
chn: ……能让我独处吗？

eng: The scarlet rot writhes now, worse than ever.
chn: 猩红腐败蠕动得很厉害。

eng: Soon, I won't be more than a mound of flesh.
chn: 我就快要化成肉团，

eng: Curse-laden. Untouchable.
chn: 变成一般人不该接触的诅咒。

eng: I wouldn't want such a thing to bring you harm.
chn: ……我不希望你因此受到伤害。

eng: Ugh.
chn: 呜。

eng: Is there something wrong?
chn: ……这么突然，怎么了？

eng: Please, cease this at once.
chn: 住手吧，别再继续了。

eng: Why are you doing this?
chn: ……为什么？

eng: Now you've forced my hand.
chn: 为什么我们非得战斗……？

eng: I will not forget what you did for me.
chn: ……我很感谢你。

eng: But this day marks our farewell.
chn: 但是，就此别过了。

eng: I did not imagine it ending like this.
chn: 居然会这个时候迎向终点……

eng: But I will not forget what you have done.
chn: 即使如此，我还是很感谢你。

eng: Thank...you...
chn: 谢、谢……

eng: Ahh, how could you...
chn: ……啊，你、为什么……

eng: Is this your true heart?
chn: 你一直这么想的？

eng: Was I... was it all...for this?
chn: 你是为了这个时候、吗……？

eng: Oh, a pleasure to see you, a pleasure indeed.
chn: ……哦哦，恭候多时了。

eng: I am Gowry. A great sage, in my day, anyway.
chn:
我名叫格威。
在过去，人们称我为贤者。

eng: I'd hoped to ask a favour, when one of your ilk came along.
chn: ……有一事相求，请您务必答应。

eng: A strapping young Tarnished, able to cross the scarlet swamp of Aeonia.
chn:
这事只能请跨越艾奥尼亚的猩红沼泽之后，
依旧身强体健的褪色者帮忙。

eng: Don't fret, I'll provide fine recompense.
chn: 当然，我不会要您平白出力。

eng: Should you accept…
chn: 只要您答应我的请求……

eng: I will teach you the secret of Sellia, the town you see there.
chn:
我愿意告诉你──
那边那座的瑟利亚镇，到底隐藏了什么秘密。

eng: Ah, then you're willing to lend a hand, are you?
chn: 哦哦，您愿意帮忙啊。

eng: I need your help to heal a certain young girl.
chn: 老实说，我需要您帮忙治疗一个女孩。

eng: Her name is Millicent. You will find her beyond Sellia,
chn:
那女孩名叫米莉森，
她人在穿过那座瑟利亚镇之后，

eng: resting at the church atop the cliff, stricken by the rotting sickness.
chn:
一座山崖上的教堂里。
罹患了腐败病，在那卧病不起。

eng: The rotting sickness that afflicts Millicent has no cure.
chn: 米莉森的腐败病是不治之症。

eng: When the Erdtree flourished, even the demigods could not stave off its effects, despite their nigh godhood.
chn:
那病即使在黄金树最为辉煌的时期，
最接近神的半神也束手无策。

eng: But Millicent's suffering can be ameliorated.
chn: 虽说无法治愈它，但有办法抑制它。

eng: For this, you are to find a certain needle.
chn: ……我想请您去寻找用来抑制腐败病的针。

eng: Seek the deep scarlet swamp of Aeonia, outside Sellia's bounds.
chn:
在瑟利亚镇前方的那一大片
又红又深的艾奥尼亚沼泽之中，

eng: The needle, made from unalloyed gold, is lost somewhere there.
chn: 应该会有一根纯净金针。

eng: First, you must find the unalloyed gold needle.
chn: 请先前往又红又深的艾奥尼亚沼泽，

eng: It's hidden somewhere in the deep scarlet swamp of Aeonia.
chn: 到那沼泽寻找纯净金针。

eng: Then I will tell you, as promised.
chn: ……在达成之后，我一定会告诉您──

eng: The secret of the town of Sellia.
chn: 先前我们说好的，瑟利亚镇的秘密。

eng: Ah, my apologies. I rather got ahead of myself, didn't I.
chn: ……啊，非常抱歉，是我太过心急。

eng: Well, no matter. I'm accustomed to waiting.
chn: 不要紧的，我很习惯等待。

eng: But if you should decide to hear my offer, whenever that may be,
chn: 但如果，您愿意答应我的请求了，

eng: do come and speak with me again.
chn: 请再过来告诉我。

eng: I'll wait as long as it takes.
chn: 随时恭候您大驾光临。

eng: Ah, changed your mind, have you?
chn: 哦哦，您改变心意了吗？

eng: If you are willing to undertake my request,
chn: 只要您答应我的请求……

eng: I'll gladly share with you the secret of Sellia, the town yonder.
chn:
我愿意告诉你──
那边那座的瑟利亚镇，到底隐藏了什么秘密。

eng: Ohh, you've found the unalloyed gold needle.
chn: 哦哦，您找到了纯净金针。

eng: As promised, I've detailed the secret of Sellia right here.
chn: 先前说的瑟利亚镇的秘密，就写在这里头。

eng: Go on, it's yours.
chn: 请您收下。

eng: Now, let me have a look at the needle.
chn: 来，请让我仔细端详那根针。

eng: Hmm.
Hmmmm.
chn: 嗯。

eng: Well, well, this is a marvel indeed.
chn: 哎呀，这真是，作工真是精良。

eng: The work of a true artisan…a meticulous, bold craftsman who grasps the essence of life.
chn:
通晓何谓生命，既纤细却又无所畏惧……
是有这些特色的名匠制成的。

eng: Can you give me some time with this?
chn: ……那么，能请您稍待片刻吗？

eng: As well made as it is, it won't be much use snapped in half, will it.
chn:
因为再怎么精良的针，
断成两截也会落得无用武之地。

eng: I have awaited your return.
chn: 让您久等了。

eng: The needle is repaired. Now it will forestall the rotting sickness, I'm sure.
chn:
已经修理完成了。
这根针已经能抑制腐败病。

eng: Will you give it to the girl, Millicent?
chn: 能请您把针交给那女孩，米莉森吗？

eng: I will reward you in kind.
chn: 当然，我会支付相对的报酬。

eng: Millicent rests at the church atop the cliff, beyond Sellia, the town yonder.
chn:
米莉森在穿过瑟利亚镇之后，
一座山崖上的教堂里，卧病不起。

eng: Tended to by the witless pests who worship her, or rather, her rotting sickness, as a god.
chn:
一群无知的坏虫殷勤呵护她，把她……
不对，把她的腐败病当作神在奉养。

eng: A wretched fate, indeed. The poor girl, she never wished for any of this.
chn:
您不认为这件事太过荒唐吗？
那女孩毫无理由受这种对待。

eng: Do you find it peculiar?
chn: ……您认为不可思议吗？

eng: That I would show such concern for the girl.
chn: 为什么我会这么关心那女孩。

eng: Well, I'm the one that found her.
chn: ……米莉森是我捡来，抚养长大的孩子。

eng: A mere babe, in the swamp of Aeonia.
chn:
那女孩还在襁褓中的时候，
我在艾奥尼亚的沼泽捡到她。

eng: She is one of my dear daughters.
chn: 她是我其中一位可爱的女儿。

eng: But the rotting sickness erodes one's memory.
chn: ……只是腐败病会破坏记忆，

eng: I doubt that she remembers the first thing about me.
chn: 她已经不记得我了吧……

eng: Oh, I must be getting old. I didn't always worry so much.
chn:
……话说回来，人一老了，
自然就会变得爱管事啊。

eng: Ha ha ha...
chn: 呵呵。

eng: Can you give me some time with this?
chn: 能请您稍待片刻吗？

eng: As well made as it is, it won't be much use snapped in half, will it.
chn:
因为再怎么精良的针，
断成两截也会落得无用武之地。

eng: Now, all you need do is deliver the needle to Millicent.
chn: ……那根针能请您转交吗？

eng: She's convalescing in the church atop the cliff just beyond Sellia.
chn:
请交给米莉森。她在穿过瑟利亚镇之后，
一座山崖上的教堂里，卧病不起。

eng: Do so, and you shall receive handsome recompense, of course.
chn: 当然，我会支付相对的报酬。

eng: Thank you kindly.
chn: ……非常感谢您。

eng: For giving the needle to Millicent.
chn: 您把针交到米莉森手中了吧？

eng: Now she, too, can begin her journey.
chn: 嗯，这么一来，那女孩也能出门旅行了。

eng: And stare her fate straight in the eye.
chn: 能够面对自己真正的命运。

eng: You've been a saint, through and through.
chn: 受您这么多次帮助，不胜感激。

eng: As thanks, I vow to impart to you my knowledge
chn: 为了表示谢意，我愿意倾囊相授──

eng: of the lost sorceries of the Sellians, descendants of the Eternal.
chn: “永恒后裔”瑟利亚的失落魔法。

eng: Please make certain that little Millicent goes unharmed.
chn: ……請您從旁守護米莉森。

eng: Like her mother, she has the stuff to be a great warrior,
chn:
那女孩与她母亲的素质相似，
是块优秀剑士的璞玉。

eng: but commands only one arm, and is yet preciously young.
chn: 但无奈只有单臂，而且还很年幼。

eng: Oh, you noticed, did you?
chn: ……哦？原来您知情？

eng: Indeed, Millicent did visit this hovel of a home.
chn: 没错，米莉森来过这间破屋。

eng: It seems the memories eaten away by the rotting sickness yet remain, but faintly.
chn:
那理应被腐败病破坏的记忆，
也许还残留着那么一些。

eng: However, she has no need of me, any more.
chn: 不过，我不该再和那女孩见面。

eng: No, she must embark on her journey, and stare her fate in the eye. I mustn't impede.
chn:
她应该出门旅行。
必须面对自己真正的命运，而不是挂念我。

eng: As I've aged, I've found the best way to aid the young...
chn: ……人老了，就更该替年轻人着想。

eng: Is to be forgotten.
chn: 她不记得我，这对她最好。

eng: Ah, welcome, welcome. How may I help?
chn: 哦哦，欢迎您来。

eng: Do you...need me for something else?
chn: ……还有什么事情呢？

eng: So, you gave Millicent a golden arm replacement…
chn: ……哦，您將黃金義手給了她……

eng: This is a wonderful development.
chn: 這真是美事一樁。

eng: Thank you for your kindness.
chn: 非常感謝您。

eng: Now Millicent may fully realise her true warrior's potential.
chn:
在您的安排之下，
米莉森說不準會蛻變成劍士啊──

eng: Like her beautiful mother.
chn: 就像她美麗的母親一樣。

eng: The girl, Millicent. She is a bud.
chn: ……米莉森啊，那女孩是花蕾。

eng: Green and undeveloped, waiting to flower into magnificence.
chn:
目前含苞未放，不到盛開的時機……
但一綻放，肯定驚豔四方。

eng: What a wondrous day that will be.
chn: 令人引頸期盼，可不是嗎？

eng: In truth, before her, I'd never seen a bud of such superior quality.
chn: 那是我有生之年看過最上等的花蕾。

eng: She might very well outshine her sisters.
chn: 其他姊妹都相形失色……

eng: Do you have an interest in rot incantations?
chn: ……您对腐败祷告有兴趣啊。

eng: Then you might like to learn something of the history...
chn: 既然如此，我们可以聊一聊吗？

eng: of Malenia, goddess of scarlet rot.
chn: 关于猩红腐败的女神，玛莲妮亚大人。

eng: Queen Marika and her King Consort Radagon were blessed with twin demigods, and Malenia was one of them.
chn:
玛莲妮亚大人是玛莉卡女王
与王夫拉达冈生下的孪生半神。

eng: She was born an Empyrean, carrying the scarlet rot.
chn: 生为神人，身体与生俱来就寄宿着猩红腐败。

eng: An Empyrean...is no mere demigod.
chn: 神人与寻常的半神不同。

eng: In the age of the Elden Ring, and Queen Marika,
chn:
当艾尔登法环的时代──
也就是玛莉卡女王的时代走向终点，

eng: the precious Empyrean was born. A new god to forge a new Order.
chn:
尊贵的神人背负着必须成为神，
必须展现新律法的使命。

eng: Since Malenia fought Radahn, and the great scarlet flower blossomed in Aeonia, I have dedicated myself to her.
chn:
从玛莲妮亚大人与拉塔恩战斗，在艾奥尼亚
让猩红大花怒放那一天起，我的心就成了俘虏──

eng: And to the resplendence of the Order of Rot. The cycle of decay and rebirth.
chn:
我心系着玛莲妮亚大人、灿烂夺目的腐败律法。
也就是那盛极转衰的轮回法则……

eng: Oh, Millicent. Finding herself, is she?
chn: ……哦，原来。那女孩这么说了……

eng: The words of a true innocent, the dear girl.
chn:
米莉森果然还年幼，
说的话也一样不够成熟。

eng: Well, perhaps this is just as it should be.
chn: 但，又何妨呢？

eng: Little Millicent, following in the steps of her mother, no matter what.
chn:
只要那女孩挨近她的母亲──
玛莲妮亚大人，万事便圆满。

eng: This is their fate, after all.
chn: 那就是她们的命运。

eng: <sobbing>
chn: ……呜呜、呜呜呜……

eng: Oh, mm, I didn't notice you there.
chn: ……哦、哦哦，是您啊。

eng: Welcome. How may I help you?
chn: 欢迎您来。

eng: My apologies though, you hardly needed to see me like that.
chn: 非常抱歉，让您看到丢脸的一幕了。

eng: Oh, it's just…
chn: ……噢，那是因为……

eng: I realised that I'd soon be saying my goodbyes to Millicent, and…
chn: 一想到要和那女孩，米莉森分开了，

eng: My eyes began to well...
chn: 不知怎地，眼泪就扑簌簌地掉下来。

eng: She is to meet them very soon. Her sisters.
chn: ……那女孩就快见到她的其他姊妹──

eng: And when she does, she'll be defeated, surely, and begin to flower.
chn: 这么一来，她肯定会战败，幻化成花。

eng: Which is why...
chn: ……在这里，我想拜托您。

eng: If you happen to be present for the girl's fight with her sisters,
chn: 如果那女孩和其他姊妹战斗时，您恰巧在场，

eng: I ask that you side with the sisters and kill Millicent.
chn: 是否能请您加入姊妹的那一方，杀了米莉森？

eng: It must be done by your hand; no other.
chn: 不假他人，就由您亲自动手。

eng: Millicent trusts you, rather deeply in fact.
chn: ……因为米莉森似乎很信任您，

eng: Sever that trust. Nurtured by betrayal, her bud will flower most vividly.
chn:
受到背叛所产生的绝望，
正是让花蕾开成娇艳花朵的关键。

eng: When Malenia ascends to godhood, Millicent too shall be reborn.
chn: 而且当玛莲妮亚大人成为女神之际，她将会重生──

eng: As a scarlet valkyrie.
chn: 化为猩红女武神。

eng: Thus, I have a request of the utmost import.
chn: ……我想要郑重拜托您一件事。

eng: I beg you, kill Millicent.
chn: 在米莉森见到她的姊妹之前，

eng: Before the girl can meet her sisters.
chn: 请您动手杀了那女孩。

eng: There is no other way. It must be done by your hand alone.
chn: 不假他人，就由您亲自动手。

eng: You seem to have sown a seed in Millicent's heart.
chn: ……米莉森对您似乎抱有特殊情感。

eng: Which will flower most vividly, should she be plucked by you.
chn: 有您经手这事，想必花也能长得娇艳。

eng: Malenia will be a goddess. And once she is, Millicent will flower anew, as a scarlet valkyrie.
chn:
当玛莲妮亚大人成为女神之际，
她将会重生，化为猩红花的女武神。

eng: You can't tell me you don't wish to see it.
chn: ……难道您不想亲眼目睹？

eng: The superior bud that is Millicent, becoming the finest of flowers?
chn:
那女孩──最上等的花蕾，
绽放出最上等花朵的那景象？

eng: I beg of you, kill her. With your own two hands.
chn: ……请您杀了米莉森，亲手杀了她。

eng: Welcome, welcome. How may I help you?
chn: ……欢迎您来。

eng: Oh how I have counted the days. Millicent shall soon meet her sisters.
chn: 那女孩与其他姊妹相遇的那天，真叫人望穿秋水啊。

eng: When the time is ripe...
chn: ……如果那时机到来了，

eng: Do what you must to ensure Millicent dies.
chn: 请您杀了米莉森……

eng: <sigh>
Millicent, my daughter.
chn: ……米莉森啊，吾儿啊……

eng: Why would you take out the needle?
chn: ……为什么拔掉了针？

eng: You were so close. So very close. To becoming the fairest of all flowers.
chn: 再一会儿、就再一会儿……最上等的花就要绽放。

eng: Would you disown us too? As your Mother did?
chn:
……你也拒绝我们吗？
就像玛莲妮亚大人一样──

eng: We children of the scarlet rot?
chn: 拒绝接受我们猩红腐败之子。

eng: Millicent...
chn: ……米莉森……

eng: Malenia...
chn: ……玛莲妮亚大人……

eng: Do you detest us, so utterly?
chn: ……就如此厌恶我们吗……？

eng: Have you taken the lesson, now?
chn: ……这么一来，您明白了吗？

eng: Killing me is but an exercise in futility.
chn: 即使杀了我，也毫无意义可言。

eng: All is well, provided you understand.
chn: ……您明白了就好。

eng: Let's just pretend it never happened, shall we?
chn: 我们就当这件事没发生过吧。

eng: <sobbing>
chn: ……呜呜、呜呜呜……

eng: O Millicent, my daughter...
chn: 米莉森啊，吾儿啊。

eng: Who would prune your sapling flesh?
chn: 是谁，为了什么，攀折了花蕾？

eng: Such...such cruel and vulgar violence...
chn: 竟然、竟然做出如此暴行。

eng: <sobbing>
chn: 呜呜、呜呜呜……

eng: Oh, Millicent...
chn: ……唉，米莉森啊，

eng: My most promising little bud...
chn: 我们最上等的花蕾啊……

eng: <sobbing>
chn: ……呜呜呜……

eng: Well, well. What have we here?
chn: ……哦，原来如此。

eng: I-is this to toast the girl's departure?
chn: 是为了那女孩启程，准备的饯别酒吗？

eng: How very kind of you.
chn: ……实在是感激不尽。

eng: Well, well. What have we here?
chn: ……哦，原来如此。

eng: Is this to toast the girl's flowering?
chn: 是因为那女孩快要绽放，预祝用的酒吗？

eng: You've got a good head on your shoulders.
chn: ……您真是送进心坎儿里了，

eng: How very kind of you.
chn: 实在感激不尽。

eng: <sleeping>
Owgh!
chn: 呜。

eng: Please, enough.
chn: 请您停手。

eng: There is nothing to be gained by persevering.
chn: 这种行为对您没有任何好处。

eng: So, the lesson remains unlearned.
chn: ……您还不能明白啊。

eng: Perhaps you've taken one knock to the head too many.
chn: 我很遗憾，原来您的思考能力有极限。

eng: We shall meet again, you and I.
chn: ……我们会再次相见。

eng: There are countless pests to choose from.
chn: 毕竟有这么多，数也数不尽的虫子。

eng: We shall meet again.
chn: ……日后再见吧。

eng: As many times as it takes. For you to understand.
chn: 直到您完全明白为止……

eng: Oh, I see you've just arrived.
chn: 哦哦，您是第一次来到这里吧？

eng: Welcome to the Roundtable Hold. I'm Corhyn, a man of the cloth.
chn:
欢迎来到圆桌厅堂。
我是柯林，是圣职人员。

eng: I teach incantations, the strength granted us by the Two Fingers,
chn:
我负责教导如何祷告──
那双指大人赐予我们的力量，

eng: and explore the secrets of the Golden Order.
chn: 也同时在探索黄金律法。

eng: So that one day, if a Tarnished of the Roundtable Hold should become Elden Lord, I might counsel them,
chn:
当聚集到圆桌厅堂的人之中，
有人成为艾尔登之王时，我也会从旁辅佐，

eng: ensuring order regains its proper form, righting rule over men.
chn: 让律法正确地修复，让王的治理步上正轨。

eng: By the way, do you still see it? The guidance of grace.
chn: ……想请教您，请问您还看得见赐福的指引吗？

eng: You do! Wonderful news.
chn: 您还看得见啊！这是好事一件。

eng: Most Tarnished are blind to it these days.
chn: 嗯，因为最近遇到很多褪色者看不见指引，

eng: You are something of a rare breed.
chn: 和您的状况不一样。

eng: Well, what do you say? Care to learn an incantation of the Two Fingers?
chn: 那么，您要不要学习双指大人的祷告呢？

eng: Ah, well, that is unfortunate.
chn: 噢，竟然……真令人遗憾。

eng: But no cause for despair.
chn: 但请您千万别放弃。

eng: It's likely a temporary condition, I'm told. For whatever reason, it happens from time to time.
chn:
据说也有人是因为某种缘故，
才暂时看不见指引。

eng: Just keep your chin up, and stay the path.
chn: 所以请别气馁，继续踏上旅程吧。

eng: I pray the great guidance of grace returns to you.
chn: 愿赐福的美好指引，早日降临于您。

eng: What is it?
chn: ……有什么事呢？

eng: Has the guidance of grace returned to your vision?
chn: 难道说，您看得见赐福的指引了？

eng: Ah, I see.
chn: ……这样啊。

eng: Just keep your chin up, and stay the path.
chn: 请别气馁，继续踏上旅程吧。

eng: I pray the great guidance of grace returns to you.
chn: 愿赐福的美好指引，早日降临于您。

eng: Further study of incantations, is it?
chn: 您还想学习祷告吗？

eng: I can happily spare the time, and applaud your enthusiasm.
chn: 我当然愿意教导，热衷学习是件好事。

eng: Ah, you appear to be doing well. Very good.
chn: 哦哦，您平安无事啊，是好事一件。

eng: Well then. Would you like to learn an incantation?
chn: 那么，您要学习祷告吗？

eng: May the Golden Order shine through you.
chn: 愿黄金律法与您同在。

eng: There's something I should mention to you, as well.
chn: ……我想也应该和您说一声。

eng: I'm thinking of leaving the Roundtable Hold.
chn: 其实我正在考虑离开圆桌厅堂。

eng: Do you know of the noble Goldmask?
chn: ……您知道金面具先生吗？

eng: Though he was but a Tarnished, living outside the Lands Between,
chn:
他在过去作为褪色者，
人还在交界地之外的地方时，

eng: he was a great scholar, who foresaw the coming guidance of grace.
chn: 就能准确预测赐福的指引即将到来，是一名大学者。

eng: And now, I hear he has come to the Lands Between alone, to contemplate the Golden Order...
chn: 他现在身在交界地，独自探索黄金律法……

eng: I wish nothing more than to seek his instruction, and perhaps even help him in his research.
chn:
知道这件事之后，我就非常想向他讨教，
也很想帮忙探索黄金律法。

eng: Ah, I had been waiting for your return.
chn: 哦哦，等您很久了。

eng: I've decided to leave the Roundtable Hold after all.
chn: 我决定离开圆桌厅堂了，

eng: As I mentioned, I'm off in search of the noble Goldmask.
chn: 打算去寻找先前和您提过的金面具先生。

eng: We may not meet again for some time.
chn: 只是这么一来，就暂时无法和您见面。

eng: If there's any incantations you wish to learn, now's the moment.
chn: 如果有想学习的祷告，请把握机会。

eng: Ah, I had been waiting for your return.
chn: 哦哦，等您很久了。

eng: I've decided to leave the Roundtable Hold.
chn: 我决定离开圆桌厅堂了，

eng: I'm off in search of a noble scholar known as the Goldmask, to beg his instruction.
chn: 打算去寻找名叫金面具的大学者，向他讨教。

eng: We may not meet again for some time.
chn: 只是这么一来，就暂时无法和您见面。

eng: If there's any incantations you wish to learn, now's the moment.
chn: 如果有想学习的祷告，请把握机会。

eng: Ah, look who we have here.
chn: 哦哦，又遇见您了。

eng: How delightful, to meet a familiar face, even after departing the Roundtable Hold.
chn:
离开圆桌厅堂后，遇见故知……
令人感到无比雀跃啊。

eng: I've been doing some learning of my own since then, actually.
chn:
其实在启程之后，
我又学到了一些，有所收获。

eng: And will happily pass it along to you.
chn: 如果您愿意的话，请听我说。

eng: I'm yet to find the noble Goldmask.
chn: ……我还没有见到金面具先生。

eng: I suppose he'll be closer to the Erdtree.
chn: 可能他在更靠近黄金树的地方吧。

eng: The path ahead might be perilous, but tread it I shall.
chn:
那对我来说是条险峻的道路，
但我不打算轻易放弃。

eng: Since departing the Roundtable Hold, I've come to understand, in my solitude,
chn:
在离开圆桌厅堂，
独自一人旅行之后才明白，

eng: How little it is I truly know...
chn: 原来自己是这么地无知……

eng: Do...do you sport with me!?
chn: 咦！您是说真的吗！

eng: From your description, it can be no other than the Goldmask himself!
chn: 听外表的描述，那的确就是金面具先生。

eng: Of course, of course, I knew he would be close by.
chn: ……他真的在这个地方啊。

eng: Bless the Golden Order, and its benevolent rays.
chn: 黄金律法啊，感谢您与我同在。

eng: And to you too. My sincerest thanks.
chn:
我也该向您道谢，
真不知道该如何表达我的谢意。

eng: I will soon leave to join the noble Goldmask.
chn:
……我准备离开这里，
前往金面具先生的所在地。

eng: It is entirely thanks to you. You have my sincerest gratitude.
chn: 幸亏有您的帮助，真的非常谢谢您。

eng: Ah, we meet yet again.
chn: 哦哦，又遇见您了。

eng: Thanks to you, I have become acquainted with the noble Goldmask himself,
chn: 托您的福，我成功找到金面具先生了。

eng: and taken my place by his side, as you can see.
chn: 老师允许我跟在他的身边。

eng: Have no fear, I will still teach you incantations, as before.
chn: 而当然，我也在继续教导如何祷告。

eng: Though we must do so quietly, such that we not disturb the great master's cogitation.
chn:
只是为了避免干扰老师的思绪，
音量要压低，再麻烦了。

eng: Further study of incantations, is it?
chn: 您还想学习祷告吗？

eng: Indeed, I applaud your enthusiasm.
chn: 当然好，热衷学习是件好事。

eng: Ah, you appear to be doing well. Very good.
chn: 哦哦，您平安无事啊，是好事一件。

eng: Well then. Would you like to learn an incantation?
chn: 那么，您要学习祷告吗？

eng: May the Golden Order shine through you.
chn: 愿黄金律法与您同在。

eng: The master is always deep in contemplation.
chn: ……老师一直在专注思考之上。

eng: While I frantically attempt to record his wisdom; the movement of his finger.
chn: 我拚了命想赶上他的指头，记录表达的内容。

eng: And though I am yet to comprehend even the daintiest morsel of his wisdom...
chn: 而记录的内容，我只看得懂一小部分……

eng: I know that this, this is my life's calling.
chn: 但我马上明白，这是上天赋予我的天职──
